Reviews.Title: “Visually appealing but $15.95 for in room Internet - really??”
Reviews.Author: DJMADM
Reviews.Content: OK , I will admit that the facility is lovely, great rooms, nice grounds but be forewarned, it IS a resort property so nothing is a value proposition. The common rooms' including the restaurants are noisy when there is a convention going on and the "free" lobby Internet connection is slow. My pet peeve is any hotel which considers the Internet a profit segment, with no break for Marriott Rewards members. If you're traveling on vacation be sure to ask about the convention schedule as it will impact your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just as nice as Ritz”
Reviews.Author: wisgirl01
Reviews.Content: My conference was at the Ritz Carlton next door, but it was sold out, so I stayed here, and have no regrets. I stayed at the same Ritz a few months ago, and in my opinion, the two are very comparable. The service was impeccable, super fast check-in, extremely clean, very comfortable bed, quality amenities. My room did not feel small at all, but I did not have a balcony. My room overlooked the pool, which was nicer than the Ritz's, and I sure wish I had time to enjoy it. My bathroom had a separate tub and shower, which doesn't matter to me, but another poster commented their room did not, so maybe it was my room style?? Prior to arrival I was disappointed in not being able to stay at the conference venue, but the two hotels are connected through their respective conference centers, and while it was a bit of a walk to get to my conference, I really have no regrets and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Spring Break Trip”
Reviews.Author: Julglen
Reviews.Content: The family stayed for four nights during spring break. The grounds at this resort were immaculate and overall we would say the resort was incredibly beautiful. The golf course was perfect. The pool area/lazy river were as good as anywhere we've ever stayed, except maybe Atlantis. If you have kids or love a great pool, this hotel will not disappoint. The JW and Ritz (adjacent) share access, meaning you can stay and lounge at the Ritz pool even though you're staying at the JW and vice versa. The Ritz is the place to see and be seen, very posh. You may also opt for seclusion at the spa pool, but this can be a costly excursion at $25.00 pp, per day. The food, wine, and drinks were very good. We loved the poolside bar and servers and would have rated the JW at five stars but for the extra fees and expensive meals. We spent $7.00 each on floats for the lazy river ($35.00 total), $25.00 per half hour for pedal buggy cars, $25.00 per person for the breakfast buffet, and $4.50 for a coke at the bar. Oh and I spent $200 on a round of golf. I must say the pool was nice enough that we'll be going back again next year. I don't mind driving 5 minutes to eat out and I'm certainly not embarassed about bringing McDonalds back to the room for breakfast, which saved us about $100 a day, and kids play golf free with a paying adult. We recommend this hotel and hope to see you next April.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great.”
Reviews.Author: Mslaterk
Reviews.Content: My overall feeling on this place is...uhh...Good, I guess. Yeas, it's good, but it doesn't blow you away for what is supposed to be a "signature Marriott property". The hotel is nice and is definitely upscale, very clean from top to bottom, and has lots of grounds that it shares with the Ritz "next door". But it's missing that feeling of luxury or grandeur that I've come to expect in top tier hotels or near-top tier (4 Diamond) hotels. Check-In: First impressions are important and I was treated wonderfully upon my arrival. The front desk was accommodating to my requests, which were numerous - crib (pack-n-play), fridge, high-floor, balcony, view of Disney. We got everything on the list at no extra charge. They even offered Free Self-Parking for being Silver Elite, which saved me almost a $100 over my 5 days. Can't ask for more than that. Bell brought up our bags quick and was at our door in minutes when we checked out. 5 Stars Room: SMALL. I travel a lot on both business and fun and I can't remember the last time I had a room so small. Plus, it had a lot of furniture crammed into it before the fridge and pack-n-play arrived. There was a couch, coffee table, lounge chair, and a desk and office chair all stuffed together in addition to the king-size bed, end tables, and entertainment center with LCD TV. When we added the other two items we were packed in like sardines. Even the balcony was tiny with less than three feet of space out from the window. Everything was clean, which was most important to us, and the room itself was nice but nothing special. 2 Stars. Bathroom: Again clean and again small, and otherwise unremarkable. Old school shower-tub combo, which I see in most of my business hotels, but rarely anymore in resort style "signature" hotels. Good water pressure on the shower, but the tub and standing room are a little tight. No deal breakers. 3.0 Stars. Bed: Small pillows. I hate them personally, but I recognize that's just personal taste. Bed was firm and comfortable. No issues. Nice reading lamps on the headboard. 3 Stars. Parking: Self-park lot is a few hundred feet from the main entrance. Nothing radical. Would like to have seen a guard or someone on duty at night. Coming home from Disney after the fireworks show near midnight and I would rather not have my wife and kids walk from that lot. No incidents and standard fare really, but some hotel employee in sight would have been preferred. 3 Stars. Location: Essentially down the block from Sea World. It was a 15 minute drive to Universal and maybe 20 mins to Disney. 5 mins to International Drive and I4. We could see the Disney fireworks in the distance if out on our balcony. Solid location if you're not staying on a park property. 3.5 Stars. Pool: Lots of pool. We had no problems finding a spot with four lounge chairs any day we went. $7 floats on sale that everyone seems to buy. You write your name on them after paying and they'll store them in the clubhouse for you overnight. Lot of dead bugs in the pool late in the day. Yuck. Geckos running wild all over the pool property. We had no issues with it, but worth mentioning if it makes any of the ladies uncomfortable. 3.5 Stars. Food: We ate at the breakfast buffet the first morning. At the high end for prices for a breakfast buffet based on my experience. They made my daughter a pancake shaped like Mickey. Tasted so bad she took one bite and left the rest. I had a made-to-order omelet that I would classify as the worst tasting omelet I've ever had. In total I paid over $75 for a breakfast (2 adults, 1 child) that we hated. At lunch we ordered by the pool. Wife and I split a quesadilla that was good with chips & queso that were awful. Prices were as expected. After that day we had no interest in eating at the property for the remainder of the trip. 1 star. Overall: Some good. Some bad. All together unremarkable and less than what I expected for my money. Highlight for me was the service at the front desk at check-in. It was downhill from there. Would I recommend it to the average person? Sure. To any of my savvy travelling friends, probably not, unless they got a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent stay, but in 2012 you expect more”
Reviews.Author: Thomas K
Reviews.Content: Visited the JW Marriott in Grande Lakes in April 2012 for 11 nights. Overall the hotel is very nice, friendly staff, great pool area, nice breakfast. Yes, it is expensive, but you more or less get what you pay for. We travelled with our 2 and a half year old. The kids end of the pool was great, shallow and good space. Everything is fenced off which was good. Tubes, sunscreen and different toys are sold on site which was great. The food from the pool side restaurant was good in taste, but looked like it came from your local drive by. No effort in giving you the 4 or 5 star feeling. They also have a Nice playground next to the pool. The golf course was the best kept one i have played in Orlando (and i have played afew), but the price was a robbery. You end up paying close to 200 dollars which includes the expected 25 dollar tip per player to the caddie (which you have to use). The only real dissapointment about the hotel is the internet which we all are more and more dependent on. Today most people use wireless internet, and the signal didn't reach our room on the 18th floor. Got the signal if i went out in the corridor. Down in the resception area you would expect the signal to be very good, but it wasn't. On top of this they charge 16 dollars puls tax for 24 hours. In Europe, most hotels have free internet now. All in all, we had a fantastic stay, but will try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Facility”
Reviews.Author: MotoMoto2364
Reviews.Content: It is obvious this is a huge facility that caters to small conventions and the Disney Parks. With that being said, The JW and the attached Ritz are the best Orlando has to offer. The pools are awesome, the spa is great and the food was awesome. The golf course was in great shape and I really enjoyed having a forecaddie. Lunch on the patio looking at the 18th green was a nice and relaxing. We went two couples and had a great time...nice upscale place to take the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and grounds”
Reviews.Author: Denver_Lass
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were very impressed with this beautiful hotel and grounds. Our room had a stunning view of the pool and golf course. The swimming pool area is exquisite with huge pools and lazy rivers. All staff members were friendly and helpful. We only had a few minor issues none "show stoppers". There isn't a place to hang a hand towel by the sink, the shower door was hard to open, the soap dish in the shower had widely spaced drain bars which allowed things to drop straight through to the floor and the bed was just a bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: jchannell
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful and CLEAN hotel. The pool was absolutely amazing! The only issue I had during our 5 day stay....the bathroom is extremely small and if you'r even slightly large you'll never fit in the shower. If you are a female...good luck shaving your legs in the shower or applying any type of makeup in that room. Overall a nice place to stay but unfortunately for us...we'll be trying somewhere else the next time. One more note...the breakfast is by far the BEST I've ever had the pleasure of attending on a package!

Reviews.Title: “Resort”
Reviews.Author: grandmacani
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort for 3 nights . Very beautiful. The staff is very courteous and helpful. The resort was absolutely a dream. The pool and lazy river is such an added bonus for the grandkids and kept at a comfortable temp. We had a small balcony which gave us great views of the area. Very close to Seaworld and Universal. About 20 minutes from Disney. Nothing is very far if you have a car. I found the Valet parking staff to be extremely pleasant and helpful. I enjoyed my conversations with them as they brought my car around. Since the Valet staff was our first point of contact they set the tone for the wonderful service we received for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: PlasticsMan_70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after going on a Disney Cruise at spring break. Rooms were top notch and bed very comfortable. The grounds are fabulous and our kids (9, 11, 14, 17) loved the pool and lazy river. We wish we had more time there. Easy access to the local theme parks. I think it's much more worth your money to stay here as far as quality of the room and resort, than to spend more money at Disney hotel; unless, of course, you want the free transportation and the experience of being on the Disney property. We had a rental car so it didn't matter. The breakfast was excellent; ours came with our room package.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, beautiful and fun”
Reviews.Author: norwellgal
Reviews.Content: Travelled here for conference. Rooms were beautiful. My daughter had a large corner room that was perfect for a family with a baby. Plenty of room for all the baby apparatus. There was no balcony in that room. Again safe for children. Great views though. My room was centered right over the fountains and lazy river. I had a fantastic balcony. The view and sounds were spectacular. A person could go to Orlando and spend the entire time at jw and be very happy. We spent extra time I. Orlando do after the conference and did just that. There is so much beautiful open space and so much to do. The family loved the lazy river. Lots of space to relax. Many jacuzzis. Food available at pool side. Great food by the way at the conference. Beds very comfortable. Great showers and separate tubs. Price is high. But experience is lovely. We were even able to rent car right on site.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Papi411
Reviews.Content: We have visited the JW many times. The lazy river is a HUGE selling point for us, since we have 5 kids! Bring your own float or just buy one for a mere $7! The Ritz is next door and you can walk to its Spa or play golf on its beautiful course. I think all, if not most, of the rooms face the pool/golf course. I agree with the other reviewers, the JW is definitely KID FRIENDLY! From the pool, playground and even in the restaurants! This is a must stay, if you are in for a conference, want to go the the theme parks but away from all the congestions, or if you're from Florida and just want a quick and simple get-away! It's very close to all the major highways. A Starbucks is on premises, a bit pricey, but if you need your morning coffee, you'll pay anything! Ask for their current special. We got a room with a view, free self-parking ($18/day), and free breakfast ($25/adult) for two adults for each day we stayed and $25/day resort credit to spend! One last thing, since we traveled by car, we brought a cooler for the ride, filled with everything from food, to snacks, to alcohol. The bell-hop asked us if we wanted it in our room! They brought it up and we saved a lot of money and time!

Reviews.Title: “A considerable difference between this property at the Ritz next door”
Reviews.Author: travel141
Reviews.Content: I was under the impression that this was one of Marriott's flagship properties, and because the prices are almost in the same range as the Ritz next door (and now they are the same company even), I had higher expectations than I would for a typical Marriott. Unfortunately, that was my mistake. We were initially supposed to stay here for 1 night and then move to the Ritz for the remainder of our stay (the Ritz suites were fully booked for our first night). After having a terrible lunch at the JW and spending 3 hours at the do-it-all-yourself "fraternity party" pool, we called the Ritz again and basically begged them to find space for us, which they graciously did. This hotel needs serious work. Their prices indicate that they are only one step down from the Ritz next door, and yet the experience is several more steps down. We had requested early check-in, which I completely understand is not guaranteed. We arrive at 12:30 and planned to have lunch and swim if our room was not ready till regular check-in time. Well, not only were we unable to check in early, but 3:00 rolled around (regular check-in time) and our room STILL wasn't ready! And nobody was able to tell us when it would be. For what it's worth, we are Platinum Elite Marriott members and we had booked the room 2 months in advance. And on top of it, the staff was disengaged and fakely polite over the whole thing. At this point, we had already had a nauseating lunch with terrible service, and then spent the afternoon at the pool where there was no service at all and the atmosphere was more spring break than family friendly. We realized we did not want to stay here at all, not even one night, and we were extremely happy when we moved to the other hotel. On the positive side, our experience at the JW only made us love our time at the Ritz even more. Though I would think (hope) that the JW will work on these issues or charge rates that better reflect the experience. If the rate for suites was $300, I would have felt differently about the whole whole experience. But as it stands the rate is more than double that, and it left a really bad taste in our mouths.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: firenzebella
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed here in 2 years and we've been equally impressed both times. It's connected to the Ritz so as guests, your allowed access to their spa and fitness facilities which were outstanding. The pool is beautiful but I would recommend bringing your own float for the lazy river or else pay $7 there. In-room dining was great and bathroom very spacious. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “We had a positive experience”
Reviews.Author: pamperedPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: They are suprisingly tolerant of a 2 year old (well behaved 2 year old), but still not all upscale hotels are receptive the children. The desk clerk and hotel assistance were wonderful. We did not experience the on hold problems. Maybe because it was after spring break and they might not have been as busy. I did find the gentleman at the Concierge desk a bit cold. He told me to wait in line to print boarding passes but when a woman from the AAA convention being held there at the hotel came up he printed hers so she didn't have to wait in line. A hotel this size needs more thant one computer. This has always been a pet peeve of mine at all Marriotts. No computers. You have to PAY at Fed Ex by the minute. This seems extreme when you realize one star hotels give you free access to the computer. The food at their restaurants was quite good and the waiters excellent. I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Still great.”
Reviews.Author: bella2001
Reviews.Content: This was our third year staying here and our 2nd Easter here. The Easter festivities are awesome. They have a carnival and raffles, face painting, a DJ, it's really great. We brought our own tubes that I bought in Target but the ones there are only $7 which isn't bad. The lazy river keeps the kids entertained. The wait staff around the pool is fast and courteous. This is such an elegant hotel and yet there are kids everywhere. It's a great hotel for visitors that don't want to give up luxury just because it's Disney. Unfortunately, the valet brought our car one morning and I noticed a large chunk of the tire was hanging off. We pointed it out and it came down to there was nothing they could do. We had to have the tire replaced. I was disappointed with their lack of responsibility.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Customer Service Training”
Reviews.Author: Goose54
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property a number of times while in Orlando for business. They were short trips so really used the hotel for meetings, Starbucks and too sleep. My family the four of us were in Orlando for a few days and wanted a nice pool and a place that did not revolve around Disney so this was perfect. However, this is still first and foremost a business persons hotel The property, grounds and lobby are beautiful. The pool and lazy river perfect and you can spend the day there and has a pool resort feel. You can purchase a tube for $7.00 not bad and shocked they did not ask for at least $20. Though they should have an area for those who do not wnat to take them home maybe others can use a big waste. Despite the above I did have a number of issues with this hotel not the hotel itself but the prices and poor service. My room was on a low floor facing a parking lot, it had a motel feel when I asked to move and they did take care of this it took multilple calls and begging to get it done. When you do call for anything you are put on hold for minutes not one time did I get a live person which now I realize is why you text to get your car from valet NO ONE answers the phone. Oh and speaking of valet way pricey for a suburban hotel. Ridiclious to park and got tired of searcing for a tip every time we left. The pool restaurnat nice and lots of selections but way too slow and not equipped to handle a spring break crowd. Our server agreed. Breakfast restaurant way $$$$ The pool chairs were taken by seven am. I am not lying my son looked out at seven and 90% of the chairs were reserved with towels, tubes etc. We sat in a corner under a tree one chair for the four of us. The next two days I did the same and was not going to be shut out I took my chairs again not equipped to handle crowds. For some reason the employees do not share the same skills, friendliness as their sister property the Ritz. My daughter was wearing a pin she got at Disney saying Happy Birthday she is 8 not one emplyee said a word hi or happy birthday to a little kid. Likewise we visited friedns at another hotel nearby and everyone did. The beds are small and not comfortable. Maybe we got a bad one but the mattress was horrible sinking and uncomfortable. Like I said great for business but for a vacation not my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own raft and self park”
Reviews.Author: leondrataylor
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a wonderful stay but with a few snags. The property has three pool areas. The pool at the Ritz Carlton is accessible, but the one at the Spa has a $20 fee unless you're having services there. The pool at the JW has a lazy river and you can purchase round inner tubes for $7. I went to Walmart and bought a reclining raft with a cup holder which I enjoyed much better. The valet lost our car keys which delayed us two hours. Their solution was to offer us an additional nights stay for free or 35,000 points. We took the points instead and the manager was very apologetic. I'd stay here again but you need a rental car because there's not much in the area to eat and the hotel is expensive. They have a Starbuck's, Bodega, Poolside Bar & Grill, and Citron restaurant which isn't very good. They also have an Italian restaurant but we didn't eat there. I've stayed at the Renaissance SeaWorld and Marriott World Center but I prefer this hotel. We got a rate of $150 which was unbelievably cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel, great get away”
Reviews.Author: rm0894
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the JW Marriott, although a little pricey, overall it gave the resort feel. We enjoyed the fresh organic cooking offered in the restaurants as well as access to the Ritz Carolton Golf Club. The pool area was beautiful with a lazy river and there were activities throughout the day. I would definelty go again!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful visit!”
Reviews.Author: mm126Ny
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the JW and just like our first visit - we were very pleased. Hotel was crazy crowded on Easter but the crowd was gone by Monday which made finding sunny seats at the pool a snap! We enjoyed breakfast at Citrons and dinner at Primo. Meals are expensive but we knew that from our first stay. Highly recommend this hotel - not too far from the parks - but far enough to relax!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get away and be pampered.”
Reviews.Author: Francesca7035
Reviews.Content: Awesome pool with great poolside service staff. Beautiful hotel with a prompt staff to meet your needs. Nice places to walk and see wildlife. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a conference”
Reviews.Author: LouHarrison
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, in Orlando, but not very easy to get anywhere else w/o a car, so kinda captive audience. Nice spa at the Ritz next door, a little pricey, but you get to use the facilities all day. And on Tuesday & Wednesday they have a happy hour 25% off. Lobby bar was nice, haven't tried any restaurants yet. Catering for conference reception was tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, but why do I need to buy a lazy river tube”
Reviews.Author: travelmomandteens
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great pool area, great workout room, places to run, lots to do. Definitely for families with kids, if you want a romantice getaway, this is not it. Our only beef is why does everyone have to purchase rafts for the lazy river. It cost $30 to purchase 4 rafts for a family. Everyone puts their names on with a sharpie so no one takes your raft and most people end up leaving them if they are flying home. So all that plastic ends up in a landfill. Seems like a bad environmental social policy for Marriott. They just want to pocket a small profit on each raft. Trust me, they make enough money on poolside food and drinks! Hotel room price a good value, but they make up for it with high dining and service fees.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pichu78
Reviews.Content: This is the best Marriott ever! Thats all Im going to say!

Reviews.Title: “No Mickey Mouse service here!”
Reviews.Author: HenWeekender
Reviews.Content: I visited the Grande Lakes for a four day sales conference and was pleasantly surprised with the quality and facilities at this hotel. From the impressive drive, through to the grand entrance and the very large bathrooms this hotel ticked a lot of boxes. Positives of my stay: - very clean and all rooms very well appointed - swift and courteous check-in and check-out - business facilities good, can easily accommodate 2000 delegates - in-room dining to a high standard - Starbucks opening hours very welcoming, especially welcome during long conference days - front of house guys very accommodating, nice touch of offering me chilled water when waiting for my airport transfer. - turn- down service a nice touch Negatives of my stay: - Wi-fi $15+ per day and was regularly unreliable and flaky. Very frustrating. - average wait for room service was always 40 mins+. - business catering at breakfast was average. Powdery lukewarm scrambled eggs, hideous sausages and stewed coffee - walk to neighbouring Ritz-Carlton for breakfast and lunch irritating as it's a good 10 min walk - conference rooms varying temperatures. At times I was almost shivering, whereas other times I was sweating! - ripped sofas in entrance. - sanitary bags should be provided in the bathrooms as standard -shower head seen better days - tv emitted a very loud hissing noise which made watching tv tricky as the noise was distracting - bigger bath towels would have been nice - pillows of varying sizes made it a little uncomfortable to get a good nights sleep I didn't get a chance to experience all the amenities this hotel had to offer, but I would certainly consider returning for a personal holiday with my family.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is-Wow!”
Reviews.Author: nikki w
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a resort-style getaway, look no further. This hotel was exceptional. Clean, relaxing, all encounters with staff were pleasant. The pool is amazing, the food delightful. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: adnrn2006
Reviews.Content: I have visited this hotel quiet a few times, at various times of the the year. Rooms are fabulous, staff is impeccable and the hotels grounds are beautiful. Nice restaurants inside the hotel, can be a little pricey but food is good. We did notice a slight problem with water leaking at the shower door, we reported it and maintenance was promptly in our room to fix it. Beds are very comfortable and I really did not notice any noise ie people walking the halls or the rooms next door. Great stay overall and beautiful hotel. It is one of the select few hotels I stay when visiting Orlando. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Return trip just as relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Jason G
Reviews.Content: Having been to this resort before, I expected a nice, relaxing getaway, with an upscale feel. The resort did not dissapoint, and made me contiune to want to return to the JW. Arriving to the resort along the long driveway sets the tone for the elegance of the hotel. The lobby has a domed ceiling with a nice fountain in the middle. Makes you feel that this place is gonna be perfect to relax for the weekend. Reserved the room with the AAA resort package, which included parking, breakfast, and a $25 resort credit. The room, was perfect...Crisp, upscale design, with fluffy beds and modern furniture. Even a nice sound machine clock, perfect for putting you to sleep. Bathroom has a smallish tub in addition to a separate shower. Toiletries have changed since the last visit, and I miss the citrus and mint scents that used to be in the rooms. Turn down service attendant was super friendly and seemed to want to give me 10 of everything...little chocolates, towels, shampoos. Relaxing was easy here, with a great feature pool and several hammocks and adirondack chairs lining the pathway between the JW and the Ritz Carlton. Service by the pool was attentive and timely, with some pretty decent burgers and salads (although a little pricey as would be expected) Children were for the most part behaved, and seemed to be secluded to another part of the pool. Breakfast, which is a buffet, and included in the room package, is pretty standard. The french toast is "vanilla scented" and one of the better options. This place can get pretty busy, with lines for omlettes, french toast, and waffles, so either go earlier, or be prepared for a line. Location is great if you will be visiting several themeparks in the area, centrally located between Disney and Universal (About 15 mins without traffic), and right off the Parkway from SeaWorld (5 mins).

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, if it were not for the large "sales-group" meetings overwhelming the place.”
Reviews.Author: kstarrzzz
Reviews.Content: I really love the JW Marriott hotels, but the large groups they host can really ruin the atmosphere. They are typically sales groups as far as I can tell. Extremely loud, and overwhelm the public areas. Fortunately, they don't seem to frequent the on-site restaurants - which are terrific!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: 2kils
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Been there several times on business and I have zero, none, nada complaints. Service is great. Spacious and airy, you feel like you are on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!! Don't need to go to the parks!”
Reviews.Author: Norma G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grande Lakes Marriott on a whim because we cancelled our trip to the New York Marquis due to illness in the family. We could not have been happier. We are "locals" from West Palm but we feltl ike we were in another world. The pool is simply AMAZING!! with a Lazy River and secluded areas. We had no need to dine out side the hotel because the restaraunt staff at "The Citron" took great care of us, we ate breakfast and dinner there each day and the service was great and the food also (Fisher's Shrimp is the best I have ever had). This not what you think of when you think of Orlando. The Garcia's

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel During the Holidays”
Reviews.Author: Shoogi123
Reviews.Content: This property is absolutely beautiful! An amazing place for a family vacation or just for the weekend. During the Holidays like memorial day, fourth of July & Christmas there are many additional activities for the kids that are just magnificent including indoor bounce houses, water slides etc... You should call first to make sure of the agenda but its usually endless. You never have to leave the property... not to mention the fireworks at this hotel on the fourth of July are amazing! Also, there are several amazing pools and a lazy river!

Reviews.Title: “Next to The Ritz with all the same amenities and top level service.”
Reviews.Author: Debbie898
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property for a business meeting and wished that I had more time to relax and enjoy the resort. With shared amenities with The Ritz, this is the nicest Marriott that I've had the pleasure of visiting. I travel on business weekly and am a "hotel snob". Don't miss this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Look no other!!!! This is the hotel for you!!!”
Reviews.Author: CinK22
Reviews.Content: We discovered the JW Marriot Orlando a couple years ago.....we won't stay any where else!! We always have a GREAT experience when we stay at a JW. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: annie g
Reviews.Content: Who in their right mind would write a bad review for this spectacular hotel? Whoever does, is a spoiled brat used to the lap of luxury every waking moment. The grounds were amazing, they took my breath away. The environment was very luxury, yet comforting. There are so many activities for children and adults alike. You don't even have to leave to go to a theme park, this keeps you entertained. And the service was stellar. My mother lost her cell phone, and the staff did everything they could to find it. They even dug through the trash!!! The people at the front desk seemed experienced, and they treated us ethically. This was an imaculate hotel with comfortable rooms and 5 star food. Overall, this was a great experience. Haters, go to Hotel Carter in New York if you want a bad hotel experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Hannah G
Reviews.Content: Every year my dad has to go here for a AVID convention, so he gets a free room. My family takes advantage of this, so we stay for the week long convention. i loved everything about this hotel, the food was fantastic, it was very clean, and there was so much to do! I was never bored! the service was better than any other that i have experienced. my mother accidently dropped her phone in the garbage and the staff acctually DUG THROUGH THE GARBAGE TO FIND IT! Everyone there is so happy and cheerful. Anyone who would write a bad review about this place went to a different hotel than i did.

Reviews.Title: “No need to go anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: MTRTMom
Reviews.Content: Went for a family getaway. We had planned to go to one of the disney parks but had such a great time at the pools and lazy river we never left. There are a lot of activities for kids and families. We went over spring break and we had the place to ourselves several of the days. The service is superior and we plan to come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Used to love this resort, not so much anymore.”
Reviews.Author: LilMsFoodie
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Peabody and Saturday night at the JW. I always have felt the JW was a top tier resort, but this visit disappointed in many ways. Room decor is third rate and doesn't compare well with the Peabody. The room amenities are very much lacking. Boring lobby bar didn't compare well with the Peabody and the restaurant for breakfast was like a Denny's only you get to pay $25 for the privilege. Nice dinner at Norman's at the adjacent Ritz, but for $250 with no appetizers and one dessert, it should have been. Pool is nice at the Marriott but doesn't make up for the mediocrity elsewhere. Marriott isn't used to competition in Orlando. They had better up their game.

Reviews.Title: “Such a disappoint.”
Reviews.Author: Fabizuk
Reviews.Content: This JW has nothing to do with others one...The breakfast was so poor with a bad service.I choose take the breakfast at Starbucks on the ground floor. The bed was not comfortable. The best thing at this hotel is the lazy river and the swimming pool. One thing Im sure: I wont came back!

Reviews.Title: “$14 PB&J with Milk. Enough said.”
Reviews.Author: Rae2691
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I check into the hotel. The lobby is gorgeous; it has marble and a huge fountain. Felix at the front desk was very nice and was able to get us an early check in. Off to a great start and then we go to our room... The room is tiny with it's "king" bed. I own a king bed and wasn't convinced. The pillows are super tiny... It must be an effort to make the bed look bigger. I'm not a huge stickler, and didn't mind being so close to my boyfriend in our mini king. We just laughed it off. That afternoon we went to the pool. We decided to eat lunch at their pool restaurant. When we walked up, we had no idea if someone was supposed to seat us or not. A group of about 7 employees just stood over between the bar and what I guess was a service station. They were facing us, talking and cutting up but took about 10 minutes to even come over to us. We seated ourselves. Food was okay but the server wouldn't have known that because she took another 15 minutes to come back to our table once we got our food. So much for getting that side of ranch I decided I wanted... Later that day we went to a baseball game at the ESPN complex and decided to order something off the "overnight" menu when we got back. This is where realization set in that this hotel is a rip off... I ordered a PB&J off the kid's menu that included a side and a drink. $6. They asked if I was an adult. I assumed they'd add a couple of dollars... $14 later I have a PB&J with a glass of milk fit for a toddler. All in all... "mini" comfort and value... HUGE price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Platinum Member”
Reviews.Author: Bruce C
Reviews.Content: Why am I paying for parking at a suburban hotel? Not only am I paying for it, but it is a hike from self parking through the beautiful lobby to the elevators. It is not even convenient. 500 acres...don't charge. Apparently, in November 2011 they outsourced the parking according to the front desk, who were not particularly thrilled by the change. Citron restaurant very poor service, first time OK-manager handled delays nicely, 2nd time a problem...waited over 10 minutes at table without service in morning,flagged down hostess who sat us, hostess explains that waiter is "frazzled"....not my problem. Left restaurant and manager comped charge at Starbucks nice touch but comp was $31 versus a potential spend of $50+ in Citron. So far 2 out 2 visits to Citron and very poor service. Starbuck's is very efficient as ususal. Oddly small shower, wife says if you need to shave your legs good luck! PS, she's a slim. Vacation club sales representatives conveniently placed in lobby and outside of ground floor elevator are annoying and at times unprofessional. Sorry, but if I'm not interested don't hound me. Overall facility is very nice, well kept property. Kids thoroughly enjoyed the lazy river and pool. I've stayed at JW in Cancun and it was an Oasis, vibe here just another hotel, expected more. If trying to brand JW as a premium they have the prices here but not the service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Close to Disney yet Far Enough, Too.”
Reviews.Author: FLGirl17
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 3rd Trip to the JW Marriott Grande Lakes in Orlando. Although we have tried many other Orlando resorts, we have decided to stop going anywhere else as this hotel is remarkably consistent (unlike the World Marriott Property!). The hotel lobby and grounds are beautiful for both a couples trip or a family stay, the staff is friendly, the rooms are immaculately clean and there is easy access to all of the Orlando attractions. What we enjoy most is that you can actually relax here unlike feeling overwhelmed as is the case at many of the Disney on-property resorts. It is also nice to have great restaurants at both the JW & Ritz properties, as well as a Starbucks inside the Lobby. The downside is that I really don't understand why parking is $19+ dollars a day to self park when there is never an issue with space availability (Disney resorts are free - go figure), but we absolutely love it and are looking forward to booking another weekend this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a sales meeting / congress”
Reviews.Author: S J
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights in March for a sales meeting. Place is nice with great service. Nice pool (river pool with current). I would not recommend this hotel for vacation as most of the people are there for big meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Top Choice For Orlando”
Reviews.Author: TraveltogetherDallas
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific JW Marriott property adjacent to a Ritz-Carlton Hotel in the Grande Lakes development. The arrival experience is impressive--from drive-up through check-in. The hotel has a large, open, airy, and beautifully-decorated lobby, a terrific bar, and two very nice restaurant options. I ate at Primo (at the bar since I was traveling alone) and had a terrific experience. I like the citrus theme that runs through (including the citrus-infused water available near the front desk). The guestrooms are large, very well-maintained, clean, and the furnishings are high-end. The beds are very comfortable, and the bedding is just the right weight. The bathroom was large with a separate tub and shower and a two sink vanity. Plenty of nice towels. They do a turndown service that is first rate--picking up and replacing towels that might have been used during the day, emptying the trash, and replacing the bathroom amenities. And, the housekeeping staff is very friendly and helpful. The workout facility, which is shared with the Ritz-Carlton, is large and well-equipped. The staff is exceptional and very attentive to detail but not overbearing--subtle and sophisticated. This was the second time I've stayed at this hotel (the first time was 6+ years ago), and the overall experience has just gotten better with time. Terrific for business or conferences, and I can see that it would be a very nice experience for a family as well (especially with the lazy river). Definitely my first choice in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good option for Orlando....”
Reviews.Author: andrew_branham
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the JW Orlando! I used some points for a free night at the JW after spending 5 long days within Disney properties. I came here specifically for some R&R. I had the executive suite which was on the 16th floor - very open, very spacious, very clean and had a nice small balcony. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom had all the nice amenities. I spent most of my time at the very nice outdoor pool area. The pool is massive with a small lazy river. There are also two hot tubs. The service at the pool was very slow and it was not a busy day so I would not expect there best in this area. I was also disappointed in the lounge chairs (should be much nicer given the price of this hotel). Overall - it is a nice choice for Orlando. A few small improvements and it could be top notch. It just needs some better service (similar to the FS and Ritz). One example was trying to call the concierge a few different times for a restaurant recco and ended up just booking myself after being unable to reach anyone. The valet service was also very slow. Dined at Bice - at the Loews Portofino - very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Personal Service - Can't Wait to Visit Again!”
Reviews.Author: ShawnandMatt
Reviews.Content: This resort has the best personalized experience I have ever received. My friend and my daughter took a short trip to Orlando for a girls mini-vacation. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a very professional staff. Jessica at the front desk (elite check-in) was very excited for our trip and was quick to answer all of our questions. She put us on the 23rd floor and had our letter readily available for our pre-paid breakfast. She wished us well and directed us to our room. The grounds were absolutely stunning! Our room was clean, with an amazing view. I can't say enough about the facilities and all of the resort. To top it off, we received a wonderful gift bag from Jessica with snacks in it to add to our fun weekend! We didn't want to leave! We will make it a point to visit this resort regularly! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “A good base if visiting Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Virtualadvisor
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious and as expected for a four star hotel. The showers were rather feeble and the bathroom water did remind me of the smell of the sulphurous water in Iceland. The location is quiet but not too far from the usual attractions. The food was good although room service took quite a while so I recommend eating in the restaurants where possible. There is a Starbucks downstairs and a couple of gift shops. You can buy tickets for some attractions from the Concierge. I recommend booking your own transport though or using one of the cabs outside the hotel and not booking it via the hotel. Reasonable value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but rooms NOT JW quality”
Reviews.Author: momofrose
Reviews.Content: We took a trip to Orlando (husband and 6year old boy) from December 26th to January 1st and stayed at thisproperty - I have to admit we used point solely. Anyway - the property was lovely - pools and play areas gorgeous..lakes and golf course stunning. But the rooms? Well, let's just say that the room was that of "regular" Marriott but no where near JW quality..Our room was "worn" - decor was from that of the 90's. the bathroom was so tiny it was hard to have more than one person in it. Luckily our stay in Orland required travel and no so much room time, so it was not that big of a deal, however - the rooms definitely could use an overhaul. One great thing is that this property is connected to the Ritz and you can use that property as well - beautiful!!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Peter J
Reviews.Content: I have never been a big fan of Orlando but my visit here for a business conference was a real pleasure. The hotel is huge and quite grand in tis presentation. The room was large and very well appointed and equipped. I think there was a charge of about $15/day which does annoy some folks. There is a large central bar area and the upscale restaurant, Primo, is excellent. We ate there all 3 nights. Played a round of golf on the lovely course attached to the hotel. All the staff from reception to golf course were friendly ad helpful.. Prices seemed reasonable to a New Yorker.- and the weather was great.

Reviews.Title: “Could be perfect”
Reviews.Author: Chillmann
Reviews.Content: OK, this is an excellent hotel. I love the facility although you pay for what you get. What I don't like is paying $300 plus for a room and then having to pay ample parking fees in a suburban location. I understand paying for parking in a city...but not a place with tons of acreage. It's just a hassle and a hidden revenue source. Enough complaining...this is a lovely hotel. I've stayed there 4-5 times over the last few years. The rooms are very nice as are the views from the balconies. Beds are comfortable, tv's large, bathrooms have both tub and seperate shower and are very clean. There are lots of food options from a take-out bodega to fine dining. For golfers, the Ritz Carlton course is in perfect shape and winds its way through beautiful natural surroundings. I've seen alligators and a wide variety of birds on this course. I love the pool complex with its long, lazy river and a variety of seating areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel next door to the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: LandOfJuncoville
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip my husband had. It was a lovely hotel. Great service. The pool is very nice with a lazy river. Our kids had a good time. There's beach volleyball, bikes, golfing, etc.... Plus you get to enjoy the activities the Ritz has.check out Bocce ball inbetween the two properties . Make sure your kids roll down the hill at the Ritz. The property is wonderful for those who like to jog or walk. there is a nice trail along the lake. It was also a nice walk for kids, lots of birds and even saw an alligator. The hotel has an organic garden which we really appreciated. The restaurant Primo was excellent! We also attended a gala dinner in one of the ball rooms. The decor was very nice and the food was very good. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet in the hotel's restaurant. That was our breakfast and lunch. The property also has a Starbucks and small little market with take out items. Great place to stay in Orlando. Great place to host a business meeting.

Reviews.Title: “My high expectations were met!”
Reviews.Author: Tarheelchix80
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the newest JW in Indianapolis several months ago, I had high expectations for this JW, and they were met. Didn't I feel special, when I got to meet Mitt Romney, who was also staying at the JW, but then I always meet the most interesting people when staying with Marriott. From the signature scent in the lobby to the well appointed rooms with incredible views to the friendly, attentive staff, this hotel is first class all the way. Our waiter in The Citron, Alberto, was extremely attentive and helpful each morning at the bountiful breakfast buffet. He brought Chef Jeffrey out to personally attend to my food allergies. I definitely will stay here again on my next trip to Orlando, and I will be making every effort to stay with Marriott when I travel.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Points”
Reviews.Author: leeeds
Reviews.Content: One of the advantages of staying in hotels whilst working is collecting points and then using them in fabulous hotels such as this. What an amazing, luxurious hotel. Best American breakfast I've had. Went for a 6am run around the grounds which were amazing. Everything about this hotel is luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the rates....”
Reviews.Author: Keith W
Reviews.Content: For the rates of this hotel, you would think that guest could expect a warm shower. Two of the four mornings that we were there, the shower was ICE cold! The second morning I called the "At your service" line and was told that the cause was "because of a cold snap that had come through area". This was a new one.... I would hope that the facilities management of this facility would investigate the issue. Upon check out, the clerk never asked how our stay was. Beautiful hotel, just needs improvement on the service area.

Reviews.Title: “The Lazy River Keeps Me Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: DonnaSebastian
Reviews.Content: Okay, it's a Marriott resort hotel, so you expect the best, and that is what you get. But, the best of all is the Lazy River. This is where the swimming pools flows into a concrete "river" surrounded by lush gardens and waterfalls. Grab a swimming tube and a cocktail and float down the"river". There are many places along the "river" where you can get out and refresh your drink. It flows right back to where you started. We prefer to do this in the evening when the kids are in bed. This Marriott is connected via an enclosed walkway to the Ritz next door. I love just walking through the Ritz and looking at the antiques and artwork they have on display. The Ritz has a great martini bar, and a spa to die for. For a quiet lunch, go over to the restaurant at the golf course and sit out on the veranda.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quality, but most of all Service”
Reviews.Author: Patbeau
Reviews.Content: It really seems that Marriott is going the extra mile on customer service these days. We stayed at the JW for the weekend and enjoyed excellent customer from all aspects of the property. From the valet, to the bellman and our check-in was more than excellent! This is a great property, with great restaurants and overall a five star experience. I would strongly recommend considering this for any type of travel. Business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great upscale hotel with a small disapointment”
Reviews.Author: Klove007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February of 2012 on points for one night, paid a pretty penny on points (30,000 + 20,000 to upgrade to a suite) When we arrived at 1pm they said they had upgraded us to the presidential suite for being a gold Marriott member, but that our room wasn't ready. They asked us to go enjoy the resort and that they would call me phone when the room was ready. At around 3pm we received a call asking if we would like to get an original booked suite or wait for 30 minutes for them to finish the cleaning of the presidential suite. We chose to wait, who wouldn't? By 4:30 pm my wife and I were starting to get agitated as our kids had not napped yet and I wanted to shower and eat something. So we went to the front desk to complain. The room was still not ready. They apologized and after much complaining they sent us to the restaurant with a 75.00$ credit for us to eat and relax. During dinner they told us our room was ready and that after dinner someone from the front desk was going to escort us to our room. After dinner they greeted our kids with some free stuffed animals and rather large cookies for the kids to enjoy and brought us up to the suite on the 21st floor. They offered to extend out check in until 6pm the next day so we could at least enjoy ourselves before our flights out of Orlando. Valet Parking was 25.00$ a day as adverstised before hand and did not receive any free breakfast as part of Marriott's frequent guest programs. (resorts are excluded in the terms and conditions and this is a resort) Hotel was great, except for out little incident with check in. Grounds were well kept, lazy river/pool was fantastic. Staff all looked happy to be there overall was a great hotel, wished we stayed longer than 1 night. My first time staying at the upscape JW and will definately be staying again at others.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott - met expectation”
Reviews.Author: Tokoeka
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW M. for a week during our business meetings in Orlando. The hotel offers a wide range of activities including a great pool area. The pools are not very deep (3 to 4 ft) which is nice for kids but for someone who want to have some swimming exercise it is not sufficient. The huge conference area clearly shows the focus of this hotel and I'd expect times that the majority of the guests are attending a conference - for good and bad. The hotel rooms are well equipped and as mentioned in the headline, it is a JW M. and meets the expectations you have. The hotel itself is huge as well (and the Ritz-C. is right next as well) but it does not feel to be crowded (except the bar area here and there). There are a lot of rooms with a small balcony but non does offer chairs or table to sit outside. Be aware that some rooms just offer windows to open rather than sliding doors, which is much nicer at certain weather conditions to have the room opened. All in all there is nothing wrong to book the hotel, good service, great outside and public area and good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Pool”
Reviews.Author: Nick E
Reviews.Content: This property is very luxurious. Stayed here for one night and it was awesome. I'll start with the pool area. Simply amazing. Lazy river, was pretty cool and the whole outdoor area makes this hotel. Wait staff is very courteous and nice and always willing to help. Will even bring drinks to you while you're in the pool. The outside bar / restaurant has very good food. Definitely a great way to spend an afternoon. The rooms are very nice as well and comfortable. Bathrooms were awesome. The gym is located a good walk away in another building.

Reviews.Title: “This ain't your Grandmother's Marriott! Family Friendly & Posh all in one...”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_Cantrell
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to start. This is hands down the best Marriott property I've ever laid eyes on. Enter the lobby with marble galore and griffins representing the JW Brand. I've stayed at a lot of really great places, but this was jaw dropping. I had to double take and say..."this is a Marriott?" Note, this property is shared by the Ritz Carlton Hotel & Golf Club...so you'd expect it to be luxurious. The location of the hotel is very good. For my trips to Disney, I really prefer to be as close to the parks as possible. The property is about 10 minutes away from the gates, however it's worth every second of travel time. We used valet, they were nice and very quick. There is self parking somewhere, but I really didn't feel like tromping who knows how far back and forth. It's a nice hotel...treat yourself to some valet parking. As mentioned before - WOW...this place is downright amazing. Our room was great. Very good sized, nice accommodations, bedding was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was large and quite opulent. We had a pool view room with a real treat. If you are in a pool view, you also overlook the Ritz Carlton Members Only Golf Club. #1 FAVORITE at this hotel....THE POOL. Holy Cow! You've got at least 4 or 5 pools all of which are connected by a lazy river. I'm bald headed, so the following comment is really important to me....the river is almost completely covered in "jungle canopy". Very well shaded and the river actually moves at a good clip. Hop on your tubes and enjoy the ride. During peak seasons, like when we visited, they serve drinks to people in the river from the side. Some of the pools are for sports, one for babies, one quite and etc. Additionally, the group activities for kids was OUTSTANDING! We had a smore campfire, coloring activities poolside, lemonaides and frozen juices during the hot of the day. They did a bang up job and you didn't have to pay for every kids activity...some that included you walking away with a physical object like a painted coconut or something. We were there for Memorial Day and had no clue they did a special celebration in conjunction with the Ritz. WOW!! A fireworks display that was a least 15-20 minutes long and presented by the hotels for our private viewing. The entire weekend of this holiday was just remarkable. NOTE: We have already booked this hotel for Memorial Day 2012. Hands down this will be our family tradition for Memorial day.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: livlovlaf8
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful Site! I was there to speak at a conference last month and not only was the hotel beautifully decorated for Christmas, the staff was friendly and very professional! Every question I asked was answered and assistance freely given to make my stay a very pleasant one! Would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Kim B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott during the ACME Conference last week. My expectation, prior to arrival, was probably higher than it should have been, considering that this property is also attached to a Ritz Carlton. I've mixed some good with the bad for this review. The hotel is pretty remote to any other facilities, so I felt like I was trapped on an island. To get anywhere, you had to use their "Towne Cars" because they don't have normal taxi service. It was cost prohibitive to leave the property. But pretty cost prohibitive to stay on property as well. My first night, I chose to order room service, as I had just come from another week long business trip in Tampa. The room did not have a room service menu, so I called down to see if someone could bring one to my room. After a 1/2 hour, nobody showed up. I then got redressed and went down to the front desk to see if they had one or could have one sent up. They said they would have someone bring one up, but again it was a "no show." While I was downstairs, I inquired with the hostess at Primo if I could order something to go, I was told that they don't normally do that and if I really wanted to, she would check with the Chef. I thought this was pretty odd as most hotel restaurants would allow for this, without question. Upon returning to my room, I finally found a housekeeper, who was doing turn down service, who offered to bring a menu to my room. By this time, I was pretty hungry and very thankful that she came right back with a menu. The room service menu is not that desirable. I ordered a chicken sandwich and cup of soup for a grand total of $36+ (which normally I would have ordered for lunch, not dinner). I opted not to rent a vehicle while in Orlando, as the cost of parking did not include in & out privileges ... beware to those families that want to leave the property for a day at the park ... you'll be told "it's hotel policy." Upon arrival, the front desk staff was extremely friendly. The pool facilities were nice, however, there were way too many lounge chairs, some with cushions, some without, and most were shaded. The food and beverage outlets did a great job. I really enjoyed both dinners at Primo ... best part of the trip. Quench (pool bar & grill) was my daily lunch. The bartenders/servers were very friendly. The staff at Starbucks was very helpful ... only place you can get a cup of ice to go. The view from my hotel room (on 8th floor) was outstanding (golf course & pool view, even some fireworks at night). Beds in the room were not comfortable ... kind of hard and all of the pillows were too soft/feathery. Banquet staff was extremely nice, however, the food was very mediocre in the meeting space. This could have something to do with the conference organizers and their budget, but it definitely could have been much better. First day's boxed lunch had a huge bun with half of a half of chicken breast, super small bean salad and an apple ... definitely saving money there. Next day's boxed equally disappointing. Surprised me that there were no water stations or ice provided in the exhibit hall or available during our events, until the very last morning (which was only from 7a-10:30a). They finally brought in water containers, probably because so many people complained of dehydration. I'm not a soda drinker, so having to force myself to drink a Diet Coke with my lunch every day was less than satisfying. As expected from a high end property, I felt that everything was overpriced and that I was being nickle and dimed to death the entire 5 days. On the day of departure, I was told that the Towne Car service (only option for transportation) to the airport was $45, however, when I was dropped off at the airport, the cost was $48. You may want to inform the front desk of this change. Lastly, the Fed Ex shop in the hotel charged $25 as a "handling fee." A little extreme considering that I had my own packaging and label. The service person didn't have to "handle" anything. They just had to have the driver pick up my exhibit container. I hope this review is helpful to future travelers booking this property and for the property itself.

Reviews.Title: “JW is a step above a regular Marriott”
Reviews.Author: SpecialKNJ
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property for a conference and was quite impressed with the hotel, the grounds, the room, and the service. This property has beautiful landscaping and has a walking path along the lake setting. Staff were extremely helpful and polite. I was impressed with the level of service when my room service order was wrong. The server came back within 5 minutes with the adjustment and was extremely apologetic. I felt the staff made honest suggestions and tried to make you feel like home. I was even happier when they offered me free Internet because I was a silver elite. Rate was a little high but this was a trade for a beautiful property and great service. Much, much better than my stay at a regular Marriott a few weeks ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, fun lazy river for kids, near attractions”
Reviews.Author: leesh
Reviews.Content: We traveled for spring break and were thrilled with personal attention we received. Our room was upgraded and the staff was very attentive, especially the waitstaff at the pool. My 7 and 10 year loved the lazy river and could have stayed there for days away from the hustle and bustle of Disney. If you want to be near the action, but not so close , this is a good choice. The room was beautiful and the grounds felt very tropical. The Starbucks in the lobby was a hit too..

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for an Adult, Non-Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: WDWDolphinFan
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a three-night stay here in mid-January. The hotel itself is quite elegant, with nicely landscaped tropical-style grounds. The lazy river pool (which I had taken advantage of on a prior stay) is nice, wandering through the palm trees, under bridges, and past nice grounds. The breakfast buffet is extensive and quite good, with a nice variety of fruits. Although not reflected on the menu, a continental version of the buffet is available for $19, and I recommend it. Nice, expansive views are available from the lake-view rooms, including even some far-off Disney fireworks from the higher floors. (It’s definitely worth booking the lake-view rooms – views from the other side of the hotel would not be nearly as desirable). Rooms were nice and the beds comfy. S’mores by the outdoor fireplace were a nice touch. Don’t miss the Ritz Carlton spa next door (and connected to the Marriott). The spa is very nice, with good treatments, excellent facilities, and a lovely, children-free pool. I prefer to stay on Disney property, but would gladly return to JW Marriott on trips not focused on Disney. We visited the Waldorf Astoria and its neighboring Hilton this trip, and I much preferred the Marriott’s prettier and more tropical grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Tops for Business Meetings & Conferences; Good for Leisure too!”
Reviews.Author: ShotgunJohnny
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice, one week each time for business. Once I brought my family, and they thought it was terrific for relaxation, the swimming pools, and a perfect launching point to the entertainment throughout Orlando. There's no going wrong when staying at a JW Marriott. The dining and bar are way overpriced, but JW knows they got the business crowd and their expense accounts to count on paying those high prices. I recommend you go into town for a reasonably priced meal rather than the resort - unless you're wealthy. The rooms are very comfortable, the service excellent, and the atmosphere screams money - I like that, and I'm sure you will too!

Reviews.Title: “Great conference facility”
Reviews.Author: Cystokid
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel last week for a convention. The support of the meeting needs was very professional and enjoyable for me as an attendee. This property is moderately secluded. You cannot walk to other retail and restaurants. A car would help your mobility if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Resort...But”
Reviews.Author: Sky8211
Reviews.Content: Was here for work for about 5 Days. Very nice resort. spectacular service. gym was great. But food felt like by the 3 day was repeating itself and by 4th day we had to find other foods to entertain our pallet . the service was fast and sometimes to fast. before we even finish our food turn around the plates were gone! but whatever you request from the servers you were sure to get. it was about 20 mins away from the outlets and millennium mall over all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but way over priced”
Reviews.Author: CandidMom
Reviews.Content: Very pretty place, but did not like the front desk ("you can join us for Breakfast in the Citron for $24 dollars"), yes, she said that with a straight face. And she was much more interested in getting me to upgrade from $269/night (a discounted conference rate) to a discounted additional $100/night (normally an additional $200/night) for a suite. Internet is an additional $15.95/day...for something that costs them very little! They really take advantage of guests in this isolated location. I'm a very dedicated Marriott customer, but this place is over the top. Rooms are sort of small, nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Corporate Event - great service, nice rooms, great bar”
Reviews.Author: CTJwo
Reviews.Content: We recently held an event at the JWM. The rooms were very nice, the service by the event staff was fantastic and the fire pit at the bar was a popular spot! It's a nicely appointed hotel with very clean rooms - well designed. Meeting space was also clean, quiet and accessible. Convention staff was very attentive and friendly. Didn't use the pool - but it looked nice... I would give it a 4.5 - but I almost never hand out 5s!

Reviews.Title: “Our fav property in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: mydayjob
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott and Orlando junkies, so this is pretty much heaven for us! Close enough to attractions to make it there easily, but removed from the bustle of LBV. Upscale property with a few nice restaurants. Definitely need a car. We prefer the JW to the Ritz due to proximity to the pool area. The worst part of the resort is the pool bar/restaurant. The food (fish tacos) were just awfully bland and the cheeseburger was burnt. The service was even worse. We had to track down a server at the restaurant and then serve ourselves. Crazy!!! Come to think of it, our service during lunch in the Brasserrie was pretty bad, too. I think they count of most people doing the buffet. Anyway, we'll be back. As an aside, we were there with a huge convention this time and the convention center service was horrible. Lots of garbage cans overflowing and glasses and water not refilled.

Reviews.Title: “Wow.....amazing place”
Reviews.Author: BFMcLaughlin
Reviews.Content: So I just typed "wow, amazing place" and I mean every word ... so why am I giving it a 4 instead of a 5? Maybe because I'm cheap and I just like bigger rooms, because this was certainly an elite place. That's probably it. See, the lakeview/golfview room overlooking the pool -- well, that was just fantastic. Even though it was freezing outside, we couldn't stop standing on the balcony looking at that view. Just two things make it a 4 in my mind and not a 5 --- the price and the tiny size of the room, that's all. I slept GREAT there, the view was amazing, the service was, not surprisingly, second to none. Lots of great things about this place. I'll be checking out the deals during the slow seasons to see if we can slip into one of these rooms again -- just for less than 150ish and hopefully MUCH lower. We ended up paying 175 for the tiny room.

Reviews.Title: “Golf Weekend for the Boy's”
Reviews.Author: Alvin H
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend at the JW Marriott and I have to say they did a great job of serving up the service that is expected for the name Marriott. Smiles all around great service at the door and food was outstanding. We played golf off property at Hunters Creek Golf Club and had a great meal at a near by restaurant. I always choose Marriott because they give the service that is expected for the price you pay. I will go back soon to enjoy the pool area during the summer but not into swimming in the winter. Thanks Marriott for the great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Was here for business, GREAT place”
Reviews.Author: newflyer
Reviews.Content: Was here for a business meeting so I did not get to relax a lot on the property but I was very pleased with the hotel overall. The staff at check in and out was very courteous. The pool area was serene and clean and a nice place to sit in the sun or shade and take a break from my meeting. All of the meals were catered so I did not eat in any of the restaurants on property but the food I had was hot and served promptly at all of the catered events. My room was quiet and serviced in a timely manner each day. It was also quite large. This hotel is adjacent to the Ritz Carlton which I did not get a chance to visit while I was there. I would definitely stay at this hotel on my own if in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely escape...”
Reviews.Author: ValueseekerTampa
Reviews.Content: I attended a business meeting at the JW Marriott in Orlando. The setting was lush and sophisticted. The front desk staff followed a courteous efficient script that made me feel welcome. The room was well-appointed and functional. The bathroom was large and included a separate tub and shower. Temperature and fan control were good. The dinner meeting included excellent food and good wine. The business breakfast consisted of both hearty and healthy choices. The food service workers was attentive. The meeting room quality was good. I did not freeze. Lighting and sound were effective in the meeting hall. I dined in the bar. The sushi was good but quite expensive ($17.00 for one roll ) and soft drinks were $4.00. The waiter provided excellent service. There were TVs in the bar so that one could catch up on a game score or follow a news story, but the TVs were incidental to the room and did not dominate it in any way. I had dined in Primo's the full-service Italian restaurant previously. The food there was excellent. The hotel was busy but I never felt crowded. Our meeting was a large one but there were never long lines for the elevator. Quite a lovely design with an easy connection/communication with the Ritz-Carlton. The gift shops were standard. Advice for travelers that choose this hotel: 1. Ask for a room with a view. I did not and ended up looking at a thoroughfare. 2. Allow time to enjoy the pool and other resort options. I would recommend this venue for any business event.

Reviews.Title: “An really good place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_SP_2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel facilities is a movie thing. The pools, gym, restaurant are amazing. I loved to stay there. My customers loved too. It helped to close some business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent escape from the Disney and Universal madness”
Reviews.Author: futurewoman
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed on Disney property and enjoyed it, however this year we decided to use points and stay at the Marriott. The Hotel is very close to the parks, but offers a wonderful escape from all the crowds. The spa is a destination itself, as well as the grounds and the pool area. We have two teenagers and they enjoyed the hotel and did not have a problem with not staying in Disney or Universal. The Bodega Breakfast and Lunch place is very good with a wonderful staff. The rooms are very comfortable, with great maid service. Would go back and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel good conference rooms”
Reviews.Author: gillbhai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a business meeting. The hotel building was elegant and wonderful and the rooms were great. The hotel has a star bucks, FedEx Business Center and other shops that carry clothes and other shopping items. I didn't get the chance to try the restaurants, however the chefs did prepare a menu for the conference and based on those dishes the food was excellent. In one of the dinners the hotel chefs and kitchen staff prepared a food truck themed party which was out of this world. With foods like Tex-Mex, Korean BBQ, dessert truck, American food trucks it showed the culinary extent of some of the people working in the hotel. The conference rooms are spacious, clean and no AV problems. Overall the only thing that kept me from the five star rating was that all the things stated above I expect of a JW Marriott but comparing this JW Marriott to the one in San Antonio Hill Country I give the one in San Antonio the edge. However I would definitely come back to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable.”
Reviews.Author: elohelay
Reviews.Content: Though set apart from the theme park hub of town, the JW Marriott as one of the most enjoyable stays I've had. Spacious, double-bed rooms, stunning view of the pools and golf course, skyline of roller coasters, and nightly firework shows from the Magic Kingdom really enhanced my stay. Breakfast buffet at the downstairs Citron Bistro was superb, as was their a la carte dinner. Pools and lazy river were warm (stayed during Christmas), and best of all, it was quiet. Although it's definitely family-friendly, the sheer size of the property made it easy to find peace, whether it was outside near a smaller pool or inside the massive lobby and bar area. The valet crew was friendly and accommodating. Really have nothing terrible to say - I would totally stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice JW stay”
Reviews.Author: GMarginet
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW for five nights for a work conference. I really enjoyed the room, it was pretty roomy with a very comfortable bed. The gym, shared with the Ritz, had a great selection of machines and I believe they also offered some yoga and cardio classes. You gotta get down there early otherwise it gets packed. The staff was probably the highlight of the hotel. Everyone was very friendly and welcoming. The pool and lazy river looked like a lot of fun with a few people enjoying them. I must admit it was a bit chilly for me (living in Southern California) to get into the pool since the temps were in the low 70's. Great stay overall, will stay there next time I visit the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Family hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler838
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights using points. I am a Platinum Rewards member and this was my first stay here. My wife and two teenage daughters were with me. Beautiful hotel with a wonderful pool. The spa and exercise room adjoins the Ritz and is wonderful. This is a resort and therefore their is no concierge lounge but free wifi for rewards members was nice. Also because it is a resort...they have resort prices with gratuities included in most food and beverage. Compared to what others have written here, I really haven't noticed the employees being rude or unfriendly. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Orlando Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSP-HHI
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the JW Orlando several times while visiting Disney. The suites are fantastic and reasonably priced in comparison. We like it as it is a bit away from the craziness of the Disney and/or Universal areas, but a very short drive to the Parks. The breakfast is excellent. My only caution would be booking any of their packages. Other than the one that simply includes breakfast, we have had a hassle with the "family packages".

Reviews.Title: “Always elegant and first rate”
Reviews.Author: SammySki
Reviews.Content: I first got acquainted with the JW Grand Lakes on a business trip, but have gone back several times for romantic getaways. If you are doing all the tourist things, such as Disney and Universal, the JW is a nice, relaxing break, but less than 15 minutes from Disney, 5 minutes from Sea World and 10 minutes from Universal. The pool area is beautiful and lush, with landscaping that makes it more intimate and hides how big a pool complex it is. Frankly, it's less expensive than on-property Disney hotels, and you get a lot more. If you have a car, Seito sushi is one exit up the highway, and there is a wonderful Cuban place about 3 miles down John Young, which runs right in front of the hotel. Food choices inside the hotel are good as well, although not inexpensive. Citron, on the first floor, has a great breakfast buffet. At $20, it's a little pricey for the kids, but really nice for adults. Even the pool food quality is very good, with nice sandwiches and salads, and fruity drinks to have you happy in your chaise. Oh, by the way, the pool is always nice and warm. I can't stand cold hotel pools, and I've been here at four or five times across the year, and the pool is always 80. My only gripe is that the only workout facilities are at the connected Ritz, where you have to pay the spa rate to work out, which is ridiculous. That said, it is a first class gym set up. We just left yesterday, after spending Christmas there, so this is current as of 12/26/11. JW's are the top of Marriott's chain, so are all nice, but I think this one is one of their best.

Reviews.Title: “excellent breakfast and lazy river !”
