Reviews.Author: PawelBrussels
Reviews.Content: excellent breakfast great swimming pool with lazy river! not far from Disney and Universal parks

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love this place!”
Reviews.Author: kimamc16
Reviews.Content: So difficult to capture the awesomeness of this property. Where to start. Gorgeous lobby, welcoming and accommodating staff, beautiful rooms, comfortable beds with luxurious linens, clean, beautiful bathrooms, wonderful restaurants, amazing sushi at the lobby bar, lovely pool and relaxing lazy river. What more could anyone want?

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, great staff, fun pool”
Reviews.Author: opihiman
Reviews.Content: This is a 4 star property, but with great and friendly staff. We were there for huge dance competition and the hotel staff weathered it with grace and professionalism. The pool area is fun for the kids with nice places to eat on site. If you want to go off site, there are plenty of places within a 5 min drive. Advice: ask for a fridge in the room. The mini bar is too small if you have kids. Bring your own float for the lazy river like @pjw08 suggested. A few days before arriving, call Marriott Rewards and ask for the "taste of Gold" if your are not a Gold level rewards member. This gets you late checkout and other perks.

Reviews.Title: “TRULY GRAND!”
Reviews.Author: 0311ItsaBeautifulDay
Reviews.Content: The Christmas Decorations are exquisite! The Lobby just beautiful! The lazy river pool is so well done. An early am walk around the grounds across the bridge to the golf course is so pretty and peaceful. Enjoy. Plenty of dining options with the walk to neighbor being the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: SSISteve
Reviews.Content: Elegant hotel. Marriott exceeded all our expectations at this location. Highly recommended when in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: pjw08
Reviews.Content: I live in Orlando and so I am fortunate to have alot to choose from, that being said, I like to take my granddaughters to local hotels because for them it is all about the pools and activities. This Marriott has a wonderful lazy river, I would suggest bringing your own float instead of having to buy theirs. The breakfust buffet could use some improvement, not only with the food but with the service, there is no organization and children without parents would just cut into line plus when you finally was asked what you would like be it omelette or pancakes it was very slow in being fixed because they would still be taking other requests. I will still keep coming though, especially when they have great offers at various times of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but...losing ground.”
Reviews.Author: livingthegoodliezzz
Reviews.Content: I recently took my family to the JW for Thanksgiving. When we arrived we asked for an upgrade to a suite. However they were sold out. I jokingly asked for the presidential suite. They gave it to us at a very reasonable rate. The room was beautiful...room 26019. We arrived late and turned in for the night. We ordered a few burgers and fries from room service and they told us no fries after 10:00 PM. The meals arrived with fries...We were happy...lol. After we woke up I was looking forward to the breakfast buffet as it was included. The quality of the food has gone down a few notches. The french toast wasn't nearly as good. The yogurt was an off brand my kids wouldn't even eat.Seemed as though everything was downgraded a bit. Don't get me wrong..the buffet is very good just not stellar as it was just a few months ago. I am a business man so I inquired with a few people and they told me they hired a new service food manager recently and some of the other patrons were also inquiring. The pool was beautiful as always and the kiddos had a wonderful time. Drinks are overpriced so I would just grab you own.They have plenty of stores with in a mile or so. 12-15 dollars for a drink in a small plastic cup...plus automatic gratuity is absurd. The kids activities have gone from excellent to dismal. They had a make your own superhero cape activity and they only had three capes to color. They didn't have enough markers for the other decorating activities either. The giant chess set is broken. the foosball table is just gross. The rest of the grounds were superb and beautiful. The only other issue is the food service at lunch. They had some of the best pulled pork nachos I have ever had. Now you just get nachos with dipping sauce in a plastic tray. The food service is abysmal. The reason I rate this hotel very good is that it is just that...very good. The days of beyond great have passed. If I do stay here again I will inquire about the food service manager before I make the trek. The grounds and truly beautiful. The Hotel is gorgeous. For the prices they should include parking and internet. Thankfully the 4g on my phone worked well at the hotel. Great pools and amazing lazy river, immaculate grounds, poorly organized children's activities. I do like this hotel....but I am starting to doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: giogio58
Reviews.Content: In July 2011, I stayed at this hotel with my daughter beacause of a National Dance Competition. The grounds were beautiful. It was clean and modern with many great amentities. The pool are was fantastic. The area around the pool was great, lots of chairs, towels always available. The food wasn't inexpensive, but it wasn't absurd either. We requested a small fridge because we were there for a week and wanted to have some water and snacks on hand. It was amazing to have a Starbucks right there, without having to drive! I was able to use the gym which was clean and very well equipped. Location of the hotel was great for me because my main reason for being there was the dance competition which was on site. Walmart and other stores were a short drive away. As were the outlet malls which was a nice treat ! Most of the staff at the front desk were amazing, except for one girl who seemed in a perpetual bad mood. All in all, a great hotel. I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy S
Reviews.Content: This will be short and simple. If you stay here and don't love it then stay home and never travel again because this was just a piece of heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with spacious rooms...”
Reviews.Author: pamlvs2trvl
Reviews.Content: Very nice and elegant hotel. The grounds are well kept and all of the staff I interacted with was friendly. My room on the 4th floor was spacious and clean, overlooking the pool area. The turn-down service was great, it was nice to come back after dinner to a welcoming bed! The pool was large, (and warm) and nicely landscaped. Downsides: there are really no special amenities for Elite Members and parking was super confusing (at least to me). The wireless internet in the room was painfully slow. I got really frustrated a couple of times and just gave up. As with most resorts, you have to walk (what feels like) a mile to get anywhere, but at least it was visually pleasing! All in all, however, I enjoyed my stay and would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: thebarnmichigan
Reviews.Content: I will start off with the good news, but unfortunately this list is quite short. The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous including the grounds and the pool area. The Lazy River is fantastic and the overall maintenance of the facility is impeccable (except the outdoor chess and foosball set which is all broken up). However, the hotel “lacks personality” as the staff is bland and you certainly don’t feel like you are staying at the top end brand of the Marriott franchise. Although everyone was polite except one breakfast waitress, they certainly don’t convey any warmth. I travel almost weekly for business and I have had more courtesy and enthusiasm out of a Holiday Inn Express (as others have indicated in other posts). Upon arriving, we already had our luggage out of the car by the time the bell hops arrived and at that point they gave up on us and let us carry in our own luggage. Check in was fine, but again no warm welcome or extraordinary experience. As you can expect, everything here is expensive. The food, drinks, etc. are all pricey and nothing is for free except the pool towels. You pay for parking, the internet, inter-tubes for the lazy river, the kids’ activities, etc. The food itself is okay given normal standards, but given the expectation of a JW Marriot it comes short. There are really no local restaurant choices as the location is a bit off any of the main drag. We ate at a TGI Fridays one night and had better service than the entire stay at the JW. Although somewhat close to Universal, it is a bit further to the Disney Properties. Lastly, it was my wife’s birthday during our stay and I stopped by the front desk to arrange for a balloon to be delivered to our room. She indicated I must talk to the concierge (who was not open yet), but since we were leaving for the day I asked that she simply arrange to have one balloon delivered and charged to our room. She reluctantly agreed but needless to say, it never happened. This was our first stay at a JW and unfortunately our last. Given all my travel for work, I was looking forward to an exceptional experience for pleasure. Corporate culture is defined by the leadership of a company (or hotel for that matter) and frankly I feel this hotel has a huge management and corporate culture issue. The building and grounds are a special place, but the hotel lacks personality and makes you come away feeling underwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ohiotravelguru
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely stunning with the beautifully manicured grounds, fountains, pools, secluded hot tub sites, and even a small winding lazy river ride running in between the pools. Our room was lovely with the comforters and we had a garden view which was still nice. It is some distance from Walt Disney World though but we were having such a nice time that we decided to just stay at the hotel for two of the four nights. The staff was all pretty friendly. It's great for a romantic weekend getaway or even taking the kids. We didn't try the restaurants because it seemed a little too high. The parking fee of $18 was disappointing. Surely since your out nowhere near the main attractions, you shouldn't have to pay a fee.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect in a Marriott experience”
Reviews.Author: Danimals
Reviews.Content: Spent the bulk of last week at the JW Marriott Grand Lakes, Orlando while attending a work software conference. The stay was nice; the room, accommodations were terrific; but the dining leaves a bit to be desired. I went to the main dining room (which was supposed to be Italian dining) Primo by Melissa Kelly and I asked about the dishes on the menu. I was looking for a good red sauce/marinara a.k.a. chicken parmigiana type dish. She said; "Oh you're looking for mediterranean italian dishes", I said, well is there another kind of Italian? She said, why yes, the Melissa Kelly Italian; like I knew what that meant. The chicken dish w/pasta was as close to Chicken parmigiana but it really wasn't. I could not even eat half of it and had it taken away. Fortunately for me, the Manager removed the cost from my check. Not a good experience. The other dining option was Citron and while there they treated me w/kid gloves and rarely spoke to me other than to take my order. I very sterile experience. I'm more of a blue collar diner and not used to these types of intermmitent experiences w/staff that is expected to take care of you. Again, the hotel stay was supreme, but the dining left me w/options to look elsewhere. Also, very expensive....

Reviews.Title: “Works well for a convention but it's isolated”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: It's a couple of years since I last stayed here. This time I stayed 2 nights @ the conference rate of $215 per night plus tax. It is an imposing 5* hotel set by itself (along with the Ritz Carlton) on a golf course. The hotel itself is impressive with a great pool complex and grounds. The isolation means you must use the hotel facilities for food and drink and, as you'd expect, the food and drink is not the cheapest in town especially as every bill automatically has an 18% gratuity added (for your convenience – of course). There are a couple of outlets where you can sandwiches and coffee (one outlet is a Starbucks) but these are not cheap for what they offer and close about 6:00pm. But it works well as a convention venue. The internet is ~$18 per day when you include tax. The gym is well stocked, if a little crammed, with good modern well maintained kit. Room was standard 'full service Marriott'. The only negative thing I noticed is that some of the corridors could do with a clean. My interactions with the reception desk staff were all good but, remember, this is a 5* hotel and lacks that 'personal' element. I wouldn't stay here if it wasn't for the conference.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best off Disney hotels”
Reviews.Author: RalphDeCesare
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is adjacent to the Ritz Carlton, and they share a wonderful spa. But when you stay at the Marriott, you feel like you are at the Ritz-Carlton. The rooms are very well appointed, baths are large and marble, and the beds are very comfortable. Rooms are very clean and the thermostat works very well. I used a AAA discount and got free self parking, a daily $25 room credit and free breakfast buffett at Citron. The Buffett was one of the best, with an omelette/pancake station, muffins, meats, artisan breads and so on. We had a sushi dinner in the lobby lounge, which was actually very good. The lobby has a Starbucks, a healthy food store, nice gift shop and a few fashion stores. The spa is amazing, my second favorite (Bellagio, Las Vegas). Get a high floor room with a view of the pool, which also gives you a view of Sea World and In the distance, all of Disney.The pool itself is large and wonderful, with two bars and a restaurant, two hot tubs, and a lazy river, which is a bit overrated compared to Typhoon Lagoon. There is a large convention center here, so you will be amongst the name tag and blue blazer crowd more than the theme park group. But a very convenient location with easy access to the airport and Sea World. We drove to Universal in less than 20 minutes of rush hour traffic. Magic Kingdom parking lot took 30 minutes midday. Definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely conference hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cajonjon
Reviews.Content: Extrememly nice conference hotel. Very clean with good restaurants and attached by a long corridor to the Ritz-Carlton. The staff were most helpful and pleasant, especially one of the housekeepers on the ninth floor by the name of Gina. She was great! Check-in was quick and efficient. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute Vacation plan turns to be the best experience @ JW”
Reviews.Author: george-fam
Reviews.Content: Attended a business conference and took the family to enjoy orlando and the theme parks. It was a last minute decision for the family to join me but it ended up being their best vacation experience. JW is a wonderful & Fantastic gem for families. They have kids activities each day and being connected to the Ritz Carlton doubles the options that families have. The Lazy river is the best part of the fun for kids. A very decent and big size lazy river which is heated is excellent for the families. The pool/golf/lake side view is absolutely a beauty and the view is gorgeous. You can view the disney fireworks in the evenings but ofcourse from a distance. The Citron restaurant was terrific with the breakfast buffet. It is a bit pricey but if you can get a package as we did, this would be a great choice for your meals. The location is 5 to 7 minutes from seaworld and about 10/15 minutes from downtown disney. The complimentary shuttle is only for Seaworld & Universal, for WDW you need to have your own rental or cabs. Service was fantastic right from front desk, to room service and also in pool area. Their turn down service was much appreciated too. Our maid service person "Pora" was absolutely a pleasure to have. I requested her just once to have adequate room amenities including water etc since I have young kids, and she made sure that everything was stocked sufficiently for the family. All in all, I was say this was a fantastic business + vacation experience for the fam at the JW. Keep it up and kudos to the JW staff for going the extra mile to make sure their customers are happy. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Slept Like A Queen”
Reviews.Author: OneTuffMommy
Reviews.Content: The pictures on their website did not compliment the rooms at all. We, my husband, elder and grand daughter and I, stayed in the Presidential Suite. We were treated like royalty. Greeted from the valet to the housekeepers. The rooms were amazingly clean and well designed. Absolutely beautiful!! Check in was seamless and not one complaint!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: jojo1492
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Grande Lakes for a business conference. Hotel, staff and amenities were as expected for a JW property. Good location and fitness/spa privileges at sister property Ritz Carlton are a plus

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pool”
Reviews.Author: sparkdog
Reviews.Content: Everything is grand at this resort and the pool is by far the best. If you are going to Sea World or Discovery Cove they are minutes away. The property is beautiful and Norman's at the Ritz Carlton made my birthday dinner very personalized and special. We had a AAA package that had a guaranteed upgrade to a lakeview room and included the breakfast buffet, self parking and a nightly resort credit. Also our room was on the 22nd floor with a wonderful view and we were right by the elevator which was really convenient. The resort is very private and on a pretty lake with a golf course view.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort!”
Reviews.Author: bigmaffy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at Grande Lakes. It was a great resort and just lovely. Everyone we came across was very nice and helpful. One of the most quiet hotels we have stayed at in a long time. We were on the 22nd floor and had a beautiful view. Everything was very clean and well maintained. The breakfast buffet was pricey, but we had a military rate for our stay, so splurged on the buffet. Parking is expensive as well. Valet is just a few dollars more than self-parking, so we just used the valets and never waited more than 5 minutes for our car. The location is convenient to Sea World and Universal, with Disney just a few miles down I-4 or I-drive. It was too chilly to do any swimming, but the pool areas at both resorts (you can use the Ritz facilities too) were gorgeous. My husband used the gym and said it was great, too. Great stay at JW!!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: celenac
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The view from the balcony is lovely and we thoroughly enjoyed the pool area. There is a lot of food but very few healthy options. The service was disappointing and twice they forgot to follow up and order us cars. Nice but probably would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “"Beautiful top notch resort"”
Reviews.Author: floridatrvler
Reviews.Content: This resort is beyond amazing! There is not one thing I can complain about. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. It is located in a very quiet and safe area with a security gate.The lobby is grand and spectacular and had a wonderful citrus smell. Check in was quick and painless, the staff were all so nice. The room had modern decor and was a great size. Our bathroom was HUGE!!!! One of the nicest bathrooms I've ever seen in a hotel. Our room had a balcony and the view was breathtaking. I highly recommend getting a view of the pool and lake. Our room and bathroom was spotless and restocked everyday. The hotel had several restaurants, coffee shops, and really great boutique shops. The pools and lazy river was amazing, so much fun. The restaurants were great, food was delicious but was a bit pricey, but it's expected in a resort like this. Every single night when we returned to our room they turned down the beds and the best part was the alarm clock in the room had soothing nature sounds and each night they would turn on one of the sounds and put chocolates on our pillow. Everyone slept great, the beds were extremely comfortable. The outside of the hotel was just as great. Besides the pools, there was also a bar poolside, the lake was great and very quiet, they had chairs and benches right by the lake to just sit and relax. They also had walking trails and an herb garden. I highly recommend staying here, you will not regret it. You have the option of just relaxing or staying busy with all their great amenities. I can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A top of the line resort”
Reviews.Author: Vanderpool
Reviews.Content: We live in Sarasota and once or twice a year book in to a hotel in Orlando so we can spend the weekend shopping. Of all the hotels we have stayed at, this was the nicest. Mind you the Ritz is next door and shares resort property with the Marriot... (They are owned by the same company). I have stayed at the Ritz too and I prefer the Marriot. The hotel is "GRANDE" and has a huge lobby guilded in light marble with a fountain. Yet, for all its Grandeur, it is less pretentious than the Ritz. The rooms are kept new in appearance and the bathrooms are worthy of a four star hotel. Our room was on the 16th floor and overlooked the Orlando area which was spectacular albeit flat and largely undeveloped as is much of Florida. The highlight of the visit was the Breakfast (which was included in our room rate). The breakfast was conducted in a large room that was the spitting image of a Parisian Bistro. A buffet runs the length of the room and overlooks the garden. It was sumptuous and comprehensive. If you are a European, you will feel right at home. Beautifully prepared cold cuts, salmon, sliced onions, fresh fruit, muesli and fresh toasty pastries were presented. If you are American, you too will be taken care of. There was a pancake/waffle/crepe station, an omlette station, eggs benedict, bacon, toast, hot oatmeal, cold cereals... watermelon juice. And on. Service was friendly and professional. The grounds of the resort are extensive and are shared with the Ritz. So too is the weight room/Spa facility. There is a lake with an extensive exercise trail circling the entire resort and in between is a pool that is intersected by a "lazy river". While the resort is very Kid friendly, it did not seem overrun by the little creatures! If there are shortcomings or things one should be aware of here are a few: In contrast to the Ritz the Hotel is busy with conventions and the lobby/restaurant bar was packed and noisy when we were there (The Ritz tends to be a tad more intimate). The Main Dinner Restaurant "Primo" was nicely decorated and had excellent service but the food was not worth the high price. One last thing to be aware of: parking is an up charge and so is wifi. So get a package deal if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Conference in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: GHCAMPMAR
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the JW Marriott in late June of 2011. The hotel is beautiful and the service was wonderful. My room was very nice and was well taken care of. Even had a turn down service which was very nice. My only "complaint" was that the restaurants were very pricey as far as the food and drinks. For a conference, it was tolerable but I can't imagine bringing a family there and eating at their restaurants. The issue is that if you don't have a vehicle you need to take a cab to eat anyplace cheaper because the hotel is not within walking distance of anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: duddie043
Reviews.Content: Business or Leisure it's one of the best hotels in the Orlando area. We've held conferences here and had family vacations. It works for both. Great hotel, great staff, good food and comfortably rooms. Easy access to WDW.

Reviews.Title: “amazing 2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: juliafawcett
Reviews.Content: i used to live in bradenton florida and i come back to florida to visit friends and family every 5/6 months each time me and my best friend always book a couple night away last time it was at the marriot in tampa this time we stayed at this one. we had an amazing relaxing time. her partner is a reward member so he got us upgrades to an executive and wow .. the room was amazing , clean and just beautiful . the view from our window over looking the pool area and resort was great you could even see the fireworks at disney. plus side you cant even tell your in the hustle and bustle of orlando which was perfect. the lazy river was great we spent the whole 2 days just sat by the pool. overall a great experience and i would def. stay here again. i bought a inflatable chair from publix (5 min) drive away which was perfect to lounge in around the lazy river

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a family or couples”
Reviews.Author: reikate
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel last January with our teenage girls. It was perfect for our family. About a 15-20 minute drive to Harry Potter at Universal and ticket office on site. The service was execellent the lobby quite grand as it says in the name and my husband even met Nick Faldo in the lobby. Between that and Potterworld the vacation was a huge hit. Their is an excellent choice of restaurants and a walkway to even more at the Ritz Carlton next door. There was a great family New Years Eve event in the lobby bar as well.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Resort!”
Reviews.Author: VAPrgal
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference in Orlando a couple of weeks ago at the JW Marriott. What a gorgeous property, inside and out. Great rooms, attentive and helpful staff, lovely outdoor areas with plenty to do. My trip was quick, and I didn't have time to take advantage of everything, but it's definitely worth a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently one of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: MLUSA
Reviews.Content: What can I say.. Request an Ex suite and the rest will fall in place. In Orlando this is one of my favorites. Great food and presence not to mention a great pool . It is next to the Ritz...go to the Spa Pool at the Ritz WOW!!!!!!!! I am hooked.

Reviews.Title: “Pros Far Outweigh The Cons”
Reviews.Author: Familytravel1113
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the fifth time last week. Recommend you stay here if you want a large, clean room, with a noteworthy view; the view from the higher floors loverlooking the pool area, the golf course, and in the distance, Sea World and their nighly fireworks, is remarkable. With all the hotels in Orlando, we wouldn't have stayed here 5 times unless we really liked it, but we do agree with some of the issues noted in other reviews. Definitely agree with the pricey food comment; our pool-side lunch for two adults and a child was about $80 (did include 2 drinks) And, my biggest pet peeve is the pool chairs that really, really need to be refurbished. I use way too many towels trying to cover it completely as I'm pretty certain there is mold in those old cushions. Some reveiwers have mentioned noise, but we have been on several different floors from 3-19 and we've never heard anyone, so not sure how common that is. I have given the hotel 4 stars in the past, but everything went so smoothly this time and our room had such a nice view, I am bumping it up to 5.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, top notch customer service”
Reviews.Author: eyehearttravel
Reviews.Content: I visited the JW Marriott for a three-night conference. The property was surprisingly calm, beautiful and very relaxing. Lots of nooks and crannies to walk and find, nice spots to sit outside by the pond and great sunset views from the room. Hotel staff was simply perfect. I stayed on the fifth floor and the maid was so nice and sweet when I arrived to my room as she was cleaning. The room was spotless, everything was clean and new. The bathroom was enormous with a great shower. The food was very, very expensive but good. I was happily surprised with the Bodega Cafe, which offered organic snacks and local products for breakfast and lunch. This is the first hotel I've ever been too offering such a wide array of organic food at reasonable prices. The gym at the attached Ritz Hotel was great with fresh fruit, chilled water, free headphones and top of the line equipment. I would recommend staying here if you are in the Orlando area for a Disney visit. It feels very remote and away from the bustle, but still is a short ride from the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Mommy_Sara
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a 4-night stay during a conference held at this hotel and conference center. The room was very clean and spacious - spotless - and the beds and pillows were very comfortable - I actually hated to leave and go home to my own! Attention to detail by housekeeping staff was second to none. Work space in the room - with plenty of outlets - was a treat, and lighting was good. Everything I tried at the restaurant Brasserie Citron was simply excellent quality-wise and having staff members address you by "Mrs. X" or "Mr. X" was a pleasant extra. I particularly appreciated the breakfast buffet in the morning with lots of fresh fruit, eggs cooked to order and a full line of bakery items. Price was a bit high in the dining rooms, but no more so than at other conference-type facilities of this size. The conference facility can host a group of any size and it's very convenient to the hotel rooms. The grounds are lovely and well-kept and serve as a nice foray after dinner. Extra perks included free bottled water in the room each day, a paper outside the door in the morning and turn-down service with chocolates at night. One thing that stuck out to me was how quickly the elevators came once you touched the button. I would recommend this hotel, especially if you're fortunate enough to secure a reasonable conference rate.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing elegance”
Reviews.Author: ttraveler401
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my wife for a four-day conference. I've been to numerous conference hotels, and this was among the best. Our room was on the 24th floor with a balcony view. The room was gorgeous, with a king-size bed, ample plugs for computers, soft bathrobes, thick walls and a huge - and I mean as big as a small bedroom - marble bathroom. The room was spotless, with the housekeepers spend 20-30 minutes in each room and doing an excellent job. USA Today paper outside in the morning, free bottles of water left during the day, and turn-down service at night. For the conference room rate of $169 per night, it was well worth it. The pools, Lazy River and hot tubs are open until 11 p.m. each night, and even with the October weather were extremely relaxing. The conference facilities were fine for both the general and break-out sessions. The dining options were typical conference hotel expensive, but the food was fine, and the daily Internet access fee is also typical of such hotels. FYI: the drive-time to Disneyworld is 30 minutes door-to-door. My only complaint: check-out was 11 a.m. on the last day of the conference, and they wouldn't allow for a late check-out, even for Marriott Rewards members. It made for a rushed departure. Regardless, I would definitely recommend the hotel, especially at the conference price.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for conferences.”
Reviews.Author: diver26508
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed three nights at the JW Marriott Grande Lakes while attending a conference. The room was extremely clean and well maintained throughout my stay. The conference facility connects the JW Marriott to the Ritz Carlton - and for those that like to walk, there are lots of long corridors to explore, as well as nice walkways outside if weather permits. There are only two negatives I noted. First, this hotel is not near anything else and are quite removed from the highway (which doesn't have much to offer within walking distance). The second negative is that because of the remoteness of the property, the prices for food are exorbitant. Just the breakfast buffet will put you out $24. We did enjoy lunch in the restaurant at the Ritz which seemed to be (believe it or not) more reasonably priced than the restaurant at the JW Marriott (though still expensive - the filet sandwich was awesome). If you have a vehicle, be sure to get out of the hotel for dinner and venture over to International Drive where there are options for every taste. This property is located just down the road from SeaWorld - and not far from the other parks in the area. For folks on vacation, there are a couple outdoor pools and an appealing lazy river. But the costs might be high for families on a budget (of course, if you're in Orlando for the parks, everything is expensive). Would definitely enjoy returning for a future conference.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BandLM
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I went here for a date night and we very happy. All of the staff is very nice and the hotel & room are beautiful. The only problem we did have, and I'm not sure if it's an all over thing or just our room as we were on the 26th floor but the water pressure was horrible in both the bathroom sink and shower. So much so in the shower that mid way through me washing my hair, the water went down to a trinkle and I couldn't get all the soap out of my hair. Other than that, we would stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely”
Reviews.Author: ziltron
Reviews.Content: so why not 5 stars? as most of you folks in tripadvisor land know marriott hotels are very solid and very good .... and probably are not rated outstanding very often mainly because they are trying to appeal to a very wide audience. there were aspects of this hotel that were simply excellent. absolutely is their mantra. I just wanted 8 specs of sugar in my coffee? ....absolutely wouldve been the answer. The service really was excellent. even the maids walk with professional purpose. everybody work hard and clearly had pride in their jobs and did them very well . I was never able to eat in the fancy restaurant primo but I did eat in the kind of every day breakfast lunch dinner restaurant Citron. it was actually pretty good. breads baked fresh. Vegetables bought from local producers ...all fresh and tasty. Really it was very good. so what sucked a little? well first some more kudos. I had an executive suite and it was pretty sweet . it was roomy.. it was comfortable. the turn down service was very nice. Liked the chocolate. lobby and grounds were pretty. my 1 big complaint is that the walls and doors were made of paper machete. 3 out of the 5 nights I was there I could hear my next door neighbors and very clearly . some spoke loudly and some spoke softly. some snored softly and some snored loudly. pretty much everything and I mean everything people did loudly or softly I could hear very clearly. at your bedside they actually have some of those nice soft white noise machines with rolling brookson wind and stuff maybe that's what it's for..to block noise from the other room. there is no way they don't know this because they surely have had complaints ... maybe it was only my room on the 10th floor? okay I know I'm a beat beating a dead horse but once you pay near 400 dollars a night for room ..you expect quiet. Absolutely. in good conscience I could not recommend this place to a friend especially for what I paid. jw mariott you owe it to your great employees there to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Lazy River Pool”
Reviews.Author: Travelguru7076
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, and only left the property for dinner. We loved our room, which was on the 25th floor, with a view of the pool and river. The bathroom was great, and the bed was heavenly. We had a package that included breakfast every morning, a $25 resort credit, and free self-parking. It was the perfect resort to soak up the Florida sun, and completely relax. Although we planned to hit one of the parks, we could not tear ourselves away from the lazy river; undoubtedly one of the best pools we have ever been to. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Pool, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: jbaron02
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with a beautiful lobby and rooms. Great breakfast, supper was good but a bit overpriced and the service was just OK. The river like pool is outstanding. Good, convenient location in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brian d
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. Great staff, nice rooms and a fantastic pool for the kids. We were there as a family which was a little awkward when passing through in our bathing suits while the lobby was full of business people. Regardless, we will be sure to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott Orlando for Conference”
Reviews.Author: Spade05
Reviews.Content: Please keep in mind through this review that my stay was for business, so I did not get a chance to tour many of the vacation/leisure areas of the hotel.. Location: Overall, the location is very convenient. It is just off I-4 on the same side of Orlando as Disney. It is just down the street (same exit) from SeaWorld, so it would be very convenient if you plan on visiting there. Because the JW shares a massive tract of land with the Ritz-Carlton, it is somewhat of a quiet getaway, not situated in a bustling metro environment. This makes for very easy traffic and parking. Accommodations: Upon check-in, I was offered an upgrade to a presidential suite for an additional $135. Alas, I declined (staying on business) and went to my standard-king. In all, the rooms are very up to date, very clean and very comfortable. Separate shower and tub. Desk, couch and chair. Comfortable bed and flat panel tv. Property: The property is massive and was definitely built with conferences and conventions in mind. Though the JW and Ritz are nearly a quarter-mile apart, they are connected via hallways and hallways of conference space, creating an air-conditioned walkway between the two hotels. There are lots of nice public areas and restaurants to choose from, though at night can get crowded because of the convention crowds. Though I did not use them, there are also nice areas such as a lazy river, pool and gardens. In walking by, and having stayed at other hotels in the area, these are first class facilities that were not crowded and looked very private and nice. In all, I would welcome the opportunity to come back and stay again with family, as it is a beautiful, clean, safe resort choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: soxfanswife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 9/11 - 9/14 for a NAPEO Convention. This was a really nice hotel, clean and well staffed. The bar tenders at the pool lounge, lobby lounge, Bogega and Citron were very friendly and even though they were very busy because of the 4 conventions going on, they got all the orders right, were timely and cheerful. The Ritz hotel is attached to JW via a breezeway, the security was very prompt - we browsed the 'competitors' vendor booths one evening as my husband was unable to do so during the conference and 3 security personnel promptly showed up and hung around until we left, not that I minded, we were just looking and they left us alone. Was very happy with the restaurant Citron. I have specific diet restrictions and they were able to create a tasty dish that was not on the menu that fit all my restrictions. The pool area is very large and has lots of room to spread out. There are pool servers for food and drinks. It was interesting that they charged $8 for the rafts to float down the lazy river. You do get to keep it when you leave, but it would be nice to have a check out or rental option. This hotel was close to the Millennia Mall, Ikea and great restaurants. We ate at Cafe Tu Tu Tango one night - it was super fun. The cab ride was $20 each way. I think most rooms have a balcony with sliding doors which open wide.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay-Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: pfdjax
Reviews.Content: I had a beautiful weekend at this property. I found the staff very engaging. The hotel looked and smelled great. Such a pleasant fragrance in the hotel lobby. It was very refreshing. Had one of the most amazing meals in my life @ Primo's. The server Rebecca was so incredible and knowledgeable about every single detail on the menu and about the restaurant, and the SA Abigale was also very very kind. Loved the garden outside and the butterfly garden. The pool and lazy river area were immaculate. Loved just hanging out in the lobby bar, and had a great breakfast at Citron. JW Grande Lakes is a CLASS ACT! My guest room was very clean and had a great view. Don't waste your time or money staying anywhere else when visiting Orlando. I will go back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Lazy River awaits”
Reviews.Author: ddvbear
Reviews.Content: Being connected to the Ritz already leads you to believe this hotel will be well worth the price. And it truly was. Magnificant lobby area, very inviting bar, then comes the great Lazy River you can go tubbing down. The tubbing is fun for all ages! Service by the pool was a bit lacking and we had hoped for a bit more service with someone walking around. The rooms are very spacious and the beds are extremely comfortable. Only issue with housekeeping was the lack of towels which we had specially requested extras and the lack of clean cups and a new ice bag each day. Nice size bathroom. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very upscale and serene”
Reviews.Author: wellsdp
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Grande Lakes in both the JW Marriott and the Ritz-Carlton several times both for business and pleasure. It has consistently been a great experience. The meeting facilities are very nice. The Citron restuarant is great for both breakfast and lunch. The shrimp appetizer was just amazing. Primo is the dinner restuarant and it was fabulous. The most awesome feature of this hotel is the beautiful property including a walking/jogging trail and the lazy river pool. it is one of the nicest I have seen. My son also enjoyed all the kids activities they have on the lawn at various times of the day when he was with me on one of my stays. He got to try a form of scuba in the pool with a trained diver which was a highlight. Request a high room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: momofthree2215
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night as a stopover to Disney World, but we wished we could have stayed longer. The room was clean, comfortable, and the bathroom was a nice size. But the best part was the breakkfast...$5 extra to our room charge and our whole family of 5 had a great , hot breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia34
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at this hotel. The hotel and restaurant staff was exceptionally helpful and pleasant. The rooms were well decorated, maintained, and large. Whenever an issue arose the maintenance staff was immediately there, quickly fixing the sound system, air conditioning, lighting, etc. Not that these were constant problems, just tweaks to the systems to accommodate the group in that particular meeting room. The pool area is a mini water park with a lazy river. You did however have to purchase an inflatable inner tube. The Citron restaurant had a breakfast buffet that I thought was pricey at $24 for the limited selections of food. Although the made-to-order omelet and pancake (in shape of Mickey Mouse) bar was fun, and all the food delicious. However, dinner there one night was very slow service even though there was hardly any other diners. I also booked a massage at the last minute and had to ask about specials, they didn't offer them up front. Over all a great experience; would go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place for our almost five year old grandson!”
Reviews.Author: don4135
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this stunningly beautiful resort from the 12th thru the 14th. From the reception desk to checkout this was a top of the shelf experience. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was excellent. The lazy river was the perfect way to relax for a day. The entire pool area was beautiful and clean. We would highly recommend this hotel for anyone traveling with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but crowded pool”
Reviews.Author: butterpuff
Reviews.Content: We visited over July 4th weekend and loved the lazy river pool and activities offered for children. However, the pool area was extremely crowded and many adults were drinking alcohol in the pool and leaving their empty cups and bottles around. I was surprised by the number of rowdy adults and this trash that was allowed to sit around with no staff picking it up. We were happy with the room and onsite restaurants, but the rowdy, alcohol-focused atmosphere wasn't very family friendly. Since we were here with 2 small children, we walked over to the Ritz pool and were happier there, where it was a more calm atmosphere. We expected a higher-end experience from a JW Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Ryost44
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW Marriott in Orlando. It is gorgeous. It is very clean and the people who work there are wonderful and helpful. They go out of their way to help you. The bartenders at the pool area are friendly and nice. The rooms are lovely and the pool is fun. They have a lazy river pool so that you can float on a raft and have a drink. I would definitely stay here again. My only complaint is that they charge $15.00 for internet access, which I think is a rip-off. Most of the hotels that I have stayed at recently don't charge a fee for the internet. Otherwise, a great place to stay. They also charge for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Water Time”
Reviews.Author: GirlOnTheGo52
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with a "lazy river" to float on for hours as it meanders its way around the property with several pools. Great way to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Loved my stay there”
Reviews.Author: Shazia T
Reviews.Content: Its lovely hotel with great landscaping, very beautiful. It can picked for a family vacation, couple retreat, honeymoon or even crazy weekend with friend. Its just a few miles from Orlando Universal Studio, Sea world and other great attractions You can take up some fun water sports or indulge in Spa at the next door Ritz Carlton or just relax poolside and enjoy great views. Loved the buffet and its variety.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the lazy river!”
Reviews.Author: kellyspb
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful. Great location near Sea World and Universal. The pools/lazy river were so much fun. Also adjacent to the Ritz Carlton - and their spa is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: booktek
Reviews.Content: Stayed using reward points and had a lake front double room for a girl's weekend. Everything was very clean and new looking. The hotel vibe was elegant without being stuffy or fussy. Staff was very friendly and helpful. It is, however, worth the walk to the Ritz for breakfast. The food was ok on the breakfast buffet at the JW, but amazing at the Ritz..

Reviews.Title: “We gave the J-Dub a second chance. They made good on their name this time.”
Reviews.Author: todd_fix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW in September of 2010 and were sorely disappointed with the level of service. The management staff reached out to us and invited us back to give them a chance to show us that they are committed to service. We finally had the chance to allow this last month and stayed for two nights. Our room was nice and the facility's as nice as always. Being connected to the Ritz Carlton doesn't hurt, either. This time we notice an improved level of service. From the front desk, bell staff, and valet, to the servers at the J-Dub's restaurants (especially Cintron), the training seemed to up to the standards I would expect of the upscale Marriott property. This visit was truly what we expected of a fine four-star resort and we appreciated the invitation to help us change our minds. Thank you to the management for listening to their guests and obviously improving staff-training. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: KOWright
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW this past summer and it is just gorgeous! Everything is so clean and beautiful! Layed out at the pool at JW and it was very crowded but a lot of fun, the next day we went and layed out at the Ritz pool and it was much quieter and easier to find chairs. All around its an amazing resort!! If you want top of the line in Orlando stay here.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible Marriott property”
Reviews.Author: the_real_dp
Reviews.Content: I went to school in Orlando, and had seen this pink tower jutting up from the flat skyline forever. Never visited, but knew where it was. So when I came for business and stayed, I was floored at how nice it was. I'd never stayed in a JW Marriott before, but I knew it was their flagship luxury brand. It lived up to the hype. Secluded and gorgeous, it has a turn of the century Florida feel to it. Loads of walkways and gables across the property (it connects to the Ritz Carlton next door). There's a wonderful fountain in the middle of the lobby, and an attentive front desk staff ready to check you in (though they didn't acknowledge my membership status). My room was very nice, a bit larger than cozy, but not expansive. I didn't upgrade to the lakeside room, but overlooking John Young at night you can watch the planes land at MCO from your balcony. It's very pretty. I woke up the next morning and hit the gym (also exceptional... loads of cardio equipment, free weights, etc...) and when I came back to the room, the cleaning staff had made up my bed AND LAID OUT MY SUIT FOR WORK. It was really unbelievable. I was so impressed. Chocolates on the pillow at night, a great lobby bar. The only downside is that self parking is $18 a day. And it's still a good 250 yard walk to the hotel from the lot. Maybe those with status can get that comped next time :-)

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels!”
Reviews.Author: mgoes
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay here one night again recently and it was just as wonderful as I remembered it to be. We had a nice corner room on the 15th floor with a pretty view of the golf course. The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom is very spacious. But what I enjoy most about this property is the pool area and spa. I only had time to use the pool at night and the spa late afternoon, but these features are what makes this hotel special. Lushly landscaped and impeccably clean, the pool area with it's lazy river (fun for adults, too) is a nice escape. We also had breakfast in the restaurant, Citron, which had an excellent buffet with unusual offerings. My only complaint is that there is no concierge lounge at this hotel, nor do they seem to honor the free breakfast which is usually offered to Gold Elite members...so breakfast turned out to be a big expense ($60 for 2). I did get the opportunity to spend a few hours at the spa located in the Ritz Carlton (adjoining the Marriott). Had a great massage and enjoyed the relaxing rooms, steam and sauna. It's a really wonderful spa!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: jbfgator
Reviews.Content: Being a native Floridian, I am not a big Orlando fan. This hotel changed my mind. It's not in the middle of all the theme park mania, but it's close enough to be convenient. A spectacular property that shares space (and facilities) with the Ritz. And it's every bit as nice. Grand lobby, gorgeous facilities, top notch spa/workout equipment, very attentive staff - and the pool....a showpiece. Even at it's most crowded, it felt like you had plenty of space. I only had one meal on property - lunch at the poolside restaurant - and it was fabulous. In fact, it should open earlier than noon. My family golfed (I did not) and the course had just been aerated, but the staff gave them a great deal and they had a wonderful time. I will highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area - either for theme parking or just for a relaxing getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but be prepared for costly amenities”
Reviews.Author: MarylandMiranda
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a lovely hotel. The lobby was amazing, room was clean with upgraded bedding (very comfortable), and the lazy river was a neat attraction! I was able to get a really great deal online but was not prepared for the high cost of grabbing a soda or sandwich by the pool or eating in any of their restaurants. The best deal going was the breakfast sandwich in the shop next to Starbucks Bagel/Ham and Egg for $6.99. Make sure you request a refrigerator in your room. Evidently they are first come, first serve. This was not explained when making our reservation and I was disappointed not to have one in the room. As I said earlier, this is a lovely hotel. Just be prepared to pay extra to park and eat. Fortunately we drove to the hotel and were able to take advantage of local restaurants with much more reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Top 3 Hotels in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: WDWCM87
Reviews.Content: This is a luxury hotel. Restaurants are really enjoyable. Breakfast buffet is one of the best. Lobby is very well appointed. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. The pool is really awesome! In fact the only better pool in Orlando is Disney's Yacht & Beach Club (My fav Disney Hotel). The Bonnet Creek Hilton and the Hilton Orlando are also very nice. No Club level here Over all this is one of my favorite hotels in all of Orlando. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “My new standard for Florida hotels”
Reviews.Author: Flahdagal
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. This was an enjoyable, relaxing, pampering stay. The rooms were spacious, comfortable and clean. The lazy river and environs were inviting and fun. Our whole family had an excellent vacation, and we'll be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Donna C
Reviews.Content: This hotel was GREAT!! Check in was smooth, room was awesome!!!! The pool and lazy river...WOW!!!!! Only bad thing I have to say is I wished I could have stayed longer!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, go here!!!”
Reviews.Author: DebDMSR
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Orlando yesterday and jet lag has set in so i have decided that while i cannot sleep i might as well write a quick review! I was a bit nervous about picking this hotel because read some mixed reviews and after researching all hotels and also narrowing it down to this and the Ritz.. we decided to go with this. And we were not sorry. we had previously stayed on International drive, but took a chance this time. What an amazing hotel from the moment you walked in and were met by the fab marble lobby, center water fall, friendly staff and amazing grounds. Then of course we went to our room which was large with 2 double beds, nice clean bathroom with separate shower and marble counters. We got a view of the back of the hotel although we were offered an upgrade of 30USD a night for a view of the pool, not worth it as we were on the 18 floor and amazing view of the grounds anyway. Housekeeping was amazing and the turn down service each night a great touch! We are not rich by no means but when i go away i do like to stay in a nice hotel whereas my husband thinks its a place to lay our heads! The bar was quite expensive for nightly drinks in American standards (although 12usd for a nice glass of red or 6.50 for a bottle of beer not bad for Irish standards) so we didn't tend to stay there for more than one, the restaurants were also very expensive on site but the location of the hotel was so close to all restaurants we decided to eat out every morning/night elsewhere. The pool are was open to 11pm each night and my daughter spend a lot of time in the pool and lazy river.. i could go on and on but I highly recommend this hotel. My husband was a little disappointed with the Ritz golf course as it was very water logged, bless him :) We will be back, once we recover from this holiday!!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place for staycation”
Reviews.Author: nata257
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriot hotel is a really good hotel and a perfect place for staycation. At the moment you enter you are surrounded by beauty and convenience. The place has almost everything and the staff thought of every little detail. There are hand sanitizing dispensers and cold water coolers all over the place. The lobby and ground floor are beautiful. Comfortable rooms are great, including a very big bathroom. There are numbers of restaurants, bars and café places. Buffet breakfast is endless, and the hotel sometimes offers free breakfast as part of the package. You can spend a whole day at the lazy river pool. It is large, and you can buy some tubes to use in the pool or the lazy river. There is a bar and a place to eat food at the pool, so there is no need to leave. Hotel is located at the gorgeous golf course, gardens, and lakeside. It has a great path for a run or walk. The spa and fitness center offers many services and wellness classes. The JW Marriot connected to the Ritz-Carlton hotel, and it also has a nice pool and a few eateries. Both hotels offer activities for children at different times. There are events at evening, too, such as poolside moves. Surprisingly the game room was small compared to all of the greatness of the hotel. Overall, the JW Marriot is a great place to stay at. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently pleasurable.”
Reviews.Author: Reauxbear
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at this property and it gets better and better. The lobby is infused with a citrus scent that invites the guest. There are other guests that comment on the costs and the like...they are mostly correct. There are costs associated with lodging here, but the property is immaculate, service pleasurable, and there enough room deals to mitigate most costs. Stay here and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the JW - has everything you need”
Reviews.Author: lawdogs1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business, but will return for pleasure. This is a well maintained property, except for the rather ratty looking pool lounge cushions on the chairs, an issue that can easily be remedied and should be. This hotel is impressive on approach, with a marble floored lobby. There is a bar and restaurant on site, pool bars and a spa at the Ritz which is also on the same property. Service excellent. I dont golf, but the course appears well manicured. I enjoyed a large extremely clean room with a balcony overlooking the grounds and pool area. The pool is quite wonderful for a hotel pool, perfect for those traveling with kids as it has a mini lazy river. You do have to buy your own pool float, and they sell them right there (of course). Self park is $18.00. Valet is 28.00 (a little high for Florida in my view).The room is well appointed, hallways clean and brightly lit, bathrooms roomy with a glass enclosed shower - which I believe is a must for a hotel of this caliber. The bed was very comfortable with feather pillows. Turn down service a nice touch. We even watched the Disney fireworks from far away from the balcony. Sea World is right down the street. I would stay here again. It was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Okay property, good package deal.”
Reviews.Author: kimochii
Reviews.Content: We booked the marriott rewards package deal and got a $25 daily resort credit and breakfast for 2 at Citron. I give them five stars for check-in and room being available at 10 a.m. for check in. The rooms were nice and had a nice view of the pool and got to see the Disney and Sea World fireworks at night in the distance. The king bed was okay. We had some really loud kids on our floor especially late at night. Pool was extremely uncomfortably warm, It should be cooler especially in Floridas humid weather. Citron had a nice breakfast spread, they should change it up every other morning. Plus they should add chairs outside of Citron for all those people who are waiting to be seated. Valet needs to be a little faster and a little more organized. Front desk was friendly and helpful. I am still not a fan of hotels charging 22% gratuity and $3.00 service charge automatically on room service. Lazy river wasn't all that great, they need more flow to push people along, they should get pool tips from the Grand Wailea on Maui...I'm just sayin.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: STEVENR08
Reviews.Content: This was the greatest hotel experience,from the bellman,Eduardo to our sales rep Jessica Reupert,we felt we were in good hands.we had our Board of Directors meeting here as well as a small vacation. Both went off without a hitch.The physical plant was beautiful and all staff r to be commended. Yaneris,our waitress during breakfast,was reflective all that is good about this hotel. Thank you Jessica,eduardo and yaniris for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Venti coffee please!”
Reviews.Author: TheTraveling4_mrare
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying we are huge Starbucks fans. This property has a full size Starbucks in the hotel....awesome! We spent a week in Orlando with family and friends, our group consisted of 8 people. We planned on spending the weekend at the JW because it is a complete getaway from the Theme park atmosphere. This hotel is beautiful. The grounds are impressive. The pool area is really as nice as the pictures. Going down the lazy river you feel like you are in a jungle with all the bamboo trees and flowers, it is pretty well shaded so you don’t have to worry about sunburn. We had the best time on the sand volleyball court. You will notice the service level here is unlike most hotels, the staff is extremely polite and accommodating. The bar area is under a little construction right now, no big deal, they still serve. We actually played cards with our kids until 1am in the lounge because it was so comfortable, room service was nice enough to deliver us food right there as we played cards. You would think the employees wouldn’t want us in the lounge since we were not drinking but they made sure we felt welcome. The breakfast buffet was really nice, try to get a package which includes this because it is expensive, try to get the parking included too. Overall this hotel is perfect and "so fancy" as my daughter would say. I don’t know if I would spend a whole week here because it is pricey but the weekend was great. We will for sure be back! The only downside is that even being a platinum member, we did not get upgraded to a suite....but I will take the Starbucks over a suite anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm, not quite up to my last review...but I will still go back”
Reviews.Author: serenityseekerFL
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of the JW Marriott. As before, the lazy river was awesome and the spa experience was wonderful. I am amazed at how clean they keep the pool, despite the hoards of people that are in and out. As before, they offered a "Dive-In movie" for the kids on Saturday night, but again we had to call four times to get any information about it. Very annoying. The main reason that I am not as enthusiastic about our experience is that we found some weird ants (mites?) in our room (which was on a high floor). On the plus side, they immediately sent someone up to check and got us a new (and nicer) room within 30 minutes of our call. The negative is that they came in and without telling us, started spraying pesticide around the room (while my kid and stuff was all over the floor)...not good. They should have waited until we had packed up our stuff and moved our kids before blowing pesticides all over the room. Additionally, my parents came with me and were in the adjacent room (cool that they got us together), but one of the waitresses in the restaurant failed to give them $40 change for the $100 that they paid with and quite obviously knew (she was shaking and seemed very nervous when she brought their receipt back with only $18 back instead of the expected $58). We reported her...it will be interesting to see if she is still there the next time we go back. Anyway, we will still go back, but I am less "in love" with this place that I previously was.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 55870Marriott1
Reviews.Content: This resort seems to be about 1/2 business travelers and 1/2 famiies so the wonderful pool area is not crowded even at the peak of summer vacation. The lush lasy river winds through 4 large pool areas. The pool resturant/bar service is quick and delivers to your lounge chairs. The food was above average for a marriott. Full breakfast buffet was included saving our family of four about $60.00 a day. We have had seasons passes to Disney for years and usually stay at one of their luxury resort properties. However this trip was a combination of Universal, Disney and the Disney water parks. This hotel was a more central local for doing activities off the Disney property. If you don't mind the 20 minute drive to the Disney areas this hotel is as pretty as the Floridian. is cleaner, quiter and has much better service. The hotel and the parks always had taxi service available without a wait so there is no need to rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott - Orlando not worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: bond1968
Reviews.Content: 4th time staying at JW Orlando- lobby bar down for 3 weeks with no notice prior to checkin..roaches galore if you sit outside lobby bar...chair cushions around pool/lazy river have holes coming through and should have been replaced 2 yrs ago..room service expect 90 minutes + and substandard quality...won't come back and we loved the place on our first visit

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool and amenities”
Reviews.Author: mikeacfla
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night with the AAA stay for breakfast deal which was awesome (separate write-up for Cintron). We all loved the lazy river and spent hours in it. About the room... it was very nice with granite counter tops, a nice TV, and even a balcony overlooking the pool/golf course. There are many family friendly things to do such as root beer floats in the activity room, fish feeding next door at the Ritz, and other activities. One of the most important aspects of a hotel, since this is where you sleep is the beds. I'm not quite sure how a JW Marriott has double beds as opposed to queens. I almost give 4 stars because of this, but I did know about it prior to. The personnel were all super nice, from valet to front desk to the pool and activity center, etc. The place had the feel of a resort instead of just a hotel. They had issues with the complimentary water in the lobby both days, where it was frozen over and couldn't poured from the tap. Overall, we loved it and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Fancy Hotel with Awesome Pool but Horrible Beds”
Reviews.Author: JoyandPaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick overnight for my husband's birthday (to go to City Walk Universal). Overall we were impressed with the size and quality of the hotel. The pool area really is pretty awesome, although if you plan to stay the day there pack your own food and drinks since one beer will set you back about $7! We were a bit dismayed abotu having to pay for parking and then walking a long distance to the hotel (we didn't do the even more expensive valet) since the hotel is located on its own large property and there is no lack of parking. We are new parents, so we were really looking forward to a good night's sleep, but unfortunately the bed was incredibly uncomfortable. So much that I slept worse/less than I do at home with a two month old infant! I think the price was about the same at the Ritz next-door, and since the amenities are the same (the properties share) and the food was just as expensive at the JW I think we'd stay at the Ritz next time in the hope that the bed will be more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RitsaDem
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is very convinient, close to all theme parks, the shopping malls and the airport. The room was big, clean and very cosy. The service excellent both in the reception and in the restaurants. The breakfast was fantastic with lot of options. The view from the hotel is amazing. I would highly reccomend it

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: missjenna522
Reviews.Content: the hotel is beautiful. i stayed with my mother. i live in the area and she was staying there for business. i had always wanted to stay there, since the days i saw it being built, and my mom let me stay in her room with her for her two nights. the pool is gorgeous, its really cool. wish it had a water slide! we stayed on the 19th floor, my ears felt the pressure going up and down in the elevator. views up there are great. our balcony had a lot of wasps during most of the daytime. its $18/day to park, and the walk to the hotel from the parking lot was a hike. i declined housekeeping yet they came back later in the evening anyway, while i was gone. mom liked that, but it kinda ticked me off. the beds were comfortable, lots of pillows. big tv, tons of channels! bathroom is beautiful and spacious. hotel is far from main entrance off of central fla parkway, but you can turn in from john young southbound near the general parking lot. room service very expensive, everything there is! but if u got money to splurge, u will have a great time and enjoy a well-maintained beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Super nice”
Reviews.Author: gizmosmom
Reviews.Content: Just got home and have to say, that this is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. Definately a resort. We cashed in some Marriott points for the stay and were rewarded with a balcony room. The front desk staff was awesome. She comped our self parking because we are Marriott Silver members. Room was on the smaller side but very nice. The hotel is huge with super fast elevators, no waiting. We mainly stayed on premises as it was a Anniversary trip and not a Disney one. On our Anniversary we were treated to Champagne and Strawberrys in our room. Nice touch! The Conceirge was awesome, recommending a great restaurant for dinner called The Vines. Just great! People keep complaining that this place is expensive, really its a high end hotel what do yo expect!! The pool is huge and extremely busy. Great drinks by the pool every day. Only downside was that they are remodeling the bar area and the first day they were jackhammering the granite and it was loud. After that all was awesome. So go stay if your not looking for the Disney experience and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a wonderful pool”
Reviews.Author: GREG44NYC
Reviews.Content: The property is grand and beautifully manicured. It's a 5 minute drive from the main entrance to the hotel itself. The staff were very gracious and helpful from the moment we arrived. The pool was a great source of entertainment for our family. Our 18 month hold daughter loved the zero entry kid's section of the lazy river pool. She also loved the playground. Great towel service. Complimentary ice water poolside. The waiters were happy to bring drinks and food poolside. Excellent service. We stayed in a suite. The room was extraordinarily large and well-appointed. We had a balcony with a view over the property with Orlando in the distance (sea world, etc.). On site restaurants were fair quality. There was a casual food place open from about 8 until 5 (botega?), that was great. Room service was just as you'd expect from a high end hotel. Fair quality food, but promptly prepared and any reasonable requests fulfilled Really a fabulous place for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: zhq01
Reviews.Content: Resort is beautiful and pool is one of the best in the area, but you pay premium dollars for this resort. There are comparable resorts in Orlando tht offer much of the same but for less money...and I've never had to pay for parking to stay at a hotel in Orlando. Rooms are nice, grounds are lush and tropical, restaurants are good. Was here for business. Would I choose to stay here on a family vacation? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “So many pretty palm trees and flowers”
Reviews.Author: gfarmer668
Reviews.Content: Its a beautiful hotel with so many palm trees and pretty flowers by the pool. The Lazy river around the pools is awesome for children and us adults too. Beds were comfy and nice bathrooms. Thanks to all those who leave their tubes for others. For some reason our rooms were always the very last to be cleaned after 4 pm both days. Right during my afternoon nap!! Of course on check out day; it needed to be first. Food is pricey but portions are huge. Mudslide cocktail was the best ever. That's why I needed a nap. The staff were great and quick friendly service. Valet service is expensive but it is a long hot July walk to self park and there is a charge for that too so use valet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Jfeasel
Reviews.Content: My husband was there for a conference so I tagged along. This was our second stay at this resort, our first stay was July 2010 but this time we got to stay longer. The rooms are very nice and we never heard our neighbors on either side or across the hall. The bedding is my favorite with plenty of pillows and crips linens. The bathroom is the best with lots of room, ample towels and great shower. We had turn-down service every night which was much appreciated. We ate in all of the restaurants and the Citron buffet is fantastic but pricey. I was able to take advantage of the spa that has it's only quiet pool, 2 whirlpools, saunas, etc. Husband golfed and enjoyed the course. Grounds are beautiful and staff very attentive. Only downsides were lobby bar was under construction and nosy and the airconditioner in our room made a noise each time it kicked on. Other than that I'd highly recommend this and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with great grounds”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler01
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a great property which is shared with the Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes. The rooms are nicely decorated with ample room for 2 adults and 2 young children. The bathrooms are really nice, very high end. We had a golf course facing room with a very small terrace, enough to step one foot out and look down onto the amazing lazy river pool. We were there during the July 4th holiday and the fireworks display were amazing. Very expensive self-park and valet if you have a car. The restaurants are also on the upper end of the price scale. Citron was very good for breakfast and dinner although still a little pricey. There are plenty of dining options but are all a drive a away. This was our third trip to this hotel since they've opened and will no doubt be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Best pool in the area.”
Reviews.Author: setcarp
Reviews.Content: I was there with a group and we did not have personal vehicles and we were worried about being stuck at the hotel the whole time. Then we found the pool and had a wonderful day. There are several sections connected by a lazy river. They sell inter tubes for pretty cheap. Food is expensive since they have you trapped there. Avoid the sushi at the bar. Hop a cab for $14 to Oishi sushi. Sea world is right next to there too.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: LauderdaleByTheSea
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property 3 times. Great restaurants, awesome pool overall excellent hotel. Room size is good well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Comfortable Rooms, but a few irritants”
Reviews.Author: Rogerwny
Reviews.Content: Property is a short 15 minutes away from the airport and Disney and even shorter drive to International Drive. It is well-maintained with beautiful landscaping, great pools, and enjoyable to walk-around. Also, the golf courses are only a about a 5 minutes walk from the property. Good sized and comfortable lobby. A number of restaurant choices on site, including a full-service Starbuck's for the morning. My room was on the 19th floor, with balcony, and offered great view of the pool area and golf course. Room was well-maintained and clean. In the room was one sitting chair, HD flat-screen TV, work desk, two-person couch and King-bed. Bed made for a good night of sleeping. Bathroom was spacious with plenty of counter top and included both a shower and tub. The few things i found irritating were: $15.95 daily internet fee, my room not being serviced until 5:15PM, and the $17 a night parking for self-parking. However, what i found most irritating though was smoking pretty much anywhere outside as there were ash trays in a lot of outside spaces. I was sitting at a table in the very nice outside space behind the bar in AM working and many people stepped outside to smoke there. Also, smoking right outside the convention center. Guest should be allowed to smoke, but suggest the JW Marriott identify a few, select areas that would be separated from the non-smoking guests.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome choice for family vacay!”
Reviews.Author: rileysm0m
Reviews.Content: This place rocks because there is a lot to do; the hotel does a good job with offering many things to do right on the property. The valet area is quite comfy with patio furniture setup for you to use while you wait for your car (valet is steep though; i would use my money for something else) The lobby is pretty impressive as it a huge fountain and lots of marble detailing. Check in was fine but can get quite busy; stop off and pour yourself a refreshing, complementary glass of ice cold lemonade! The rooms are very comfortable although I would have benefited from a fridge; when are they going to start offering free wi-fi? I recommend getting a room overlooking the pool and the golf course; amazing. You get a small balcony; I think it's good for standing or storing your inner tube: TIP: bring your own floatie because the pool and lazy river rocks! This is where you will come to cool off after a day in the parks. There are plenty of chairs with umbrellas and for little ones a shallow entry area! I was leaving when the July fourth events were kicking off and they had jumpy jumps and lots activities available to guests--now that's awesome! This is a good homebase that is reasonable--there is a timeshare available and they will hit you up for it but they won't stalk you after you say no! The food is ok; get in your car and go to i-drive! I did try their buffet one day and it was above average (nice waffle/omelet bar). There is a nice golfcourse and alligators to be viewed (from a distance, of course) as you take a stroll. Really nice grounds. This place deserves it's JW status.

Reviews.Title: “Overall one of my favorite hotels ever! Have stayed there multiple times for business, pleasure and family events.”
Reviews.Author: Travelm25
Reviews.Content: As close to perfect as you can get. You feel like you are in a resort in the islands yet all the action is only minutes away. The exterior and lobby makes a grand impression.
