The staff is efficient. The rooms are wisper quiet. The pool and lake views are relaxing and the evening fireworks in the distance are an added bonus. The food is fantastic in the hotel and at the pool. The staff is gluten friendly and the management attentive to specific dietary needs. Ah . . . the lazy river-talk about relaxing. The health club is top rated and is shared by Ritz Carlton guest. Did I mention golfing? A tremendously beautiful and challenging course. So, it doesn't matter if you're away for the weekend or for the week-this is the place for you for business, pleasure, family and relaxation. Run to stay at this resort. When you look of the balcony from your room you'll see what I mean. PERFECTION.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: familyjournal
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Marriott in January, it was a great stay. This hotel was amazing, lots to do. The pool area is beautiful, and the resturants were very good. I would reccommed this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite resort for total relaxation, great food and outstanding service...”
Reviews.Author: RRaccoon72
Reviews.Content: This was our third family visit to Grande Lakes. We first visited it during the Fourth of July with some friends a few years ago. We were very impressed with the facilities and the fireworks display on the property. During our visit last year, we celebrated my birthday at the hotel. The staff did an amazing job of arranging a private party for the seven of us including a cake, gluten-free snacks for my wife, and drinks in a side area of the main lounge. The catering manager personally greeted us upon our return from a dinner and made sure we had everything we needed, including a waitress who was very attentive to us even though she was also taking care of other guests in the lounge. This level of service is one of the main reasons we look forward to returning to Grande Lakes. The daily breakfast buffet is outstanding. One morning I asked the chef making pancakes and waffles if I could have French toast. Without hesitation she replied that they do not routinely serve it, but she would make it for me. She immediately assembled the ingredients and made excellent French toast. One of many examples of superior service provided throughout the resort. Pool facilities, exercise room, spa, the grounds and other facilities are exceptional. We enjoyed the fireworks so much on our first visit that we made a point of returning again this year. An outstanding display that rivals municipal fireworks shows is shot from the lake area on the property. We watched from our room and thoroughly enjoyed it. Sometimes after vacationing at the same place a few times, the place loses its luster. We don't feel that way about Grande Lakes after three visits and look forward to returning again...

Reviews.Title: “Best pool ever!”
Reviews.Author: Markus_Dutchmen
Reviews.Content: If you wanna go to a luxury hotel in Orlando with kids, and not stay at the parks, this hotel is certainly one of the better choices. I pool fun is your deal, this hotel tops them all. You are served at the pool, and the pool restaurant, though a little steep priced, is actually ver decent. The rooms are not very big, but they are nicely appointed. We had a deal with breakfast for four included. Quality was outstanding, it is however not good that we had to wait at least 20 to 30 minutes before a table was available. It might be a good idea if you could call down to reserve a table and that the hotel staff would call the room 5 minutes prior to table availability. All in all however, very good hotel which easily meets it standards, and if you search well, available at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chon00
Reviews.Content: We visit Orlando each summer and have stayed at Disney Resorts (Carribean, Beach Club, Swan, etc) as well as at the JW Marriott. The JW is our choice; the size of the rooms and customer service is awesome. NeNe, at the front desk, was AWESOME! The pool area is nice; food is pricy but good (the burgers are huge)! My only complaint would be the bell service/valet guys upon arrival; they can be a bit rude about getting you in and out of their way if they are busy; we had driven for 12 hours and could go no faster as we were tired. The work out facility is incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraK10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding in the spring and loved it! The pool/lazy river is great and we had a great stay. My only complaint was that the concierge was a bit rude. Asked him a question about where we could catch a sports game and he seemed annoyed that we didn't ask anyone at the bar first.

Reviews.Title: “Still Good but not as Wow”
Reviews.Author: Familytravel1113
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of June and have stayed here three times before. Ditto the other reviews that praise the lazy river pool and the location away from the hustle and bustle. This time they required wrist-bands for the pool due to a problem with non-guests; it was a seamless process and pool is crowded enough so applaud them for that. The pool chairs are getting a little worn, but the pool area is lovely with shaded areas and even though a lot of kids this time, it was relaxing. Our room was clean but had a few issues; the key card reader was glitchy, the ac was impossible to regulate -- either cold or hot, really lumpy pillows, and the location was disappointing as we were on 3 with a concrete balcony, but guess we were spoiled from prior trips with better views. In the past, we have not eaten anything but lunch at the pool,but this time we had the breakfast buffet that is just okay if it' s in your room rate, but would not pay $24 a person -- good quality, but limited selection. We arrvived late and pool restaurant was closed; the Concierge said we could order food in the bar from the restaurant, but the waiter had heartburn about it cautioning us it would "take forever' and encouraging us to eat the Asian/sushi food on the bar menu. Finally, we said no we wanted to take our chances on the restaurant and then he was nice enough about it, but I could see others around then asking when they saw our "non-sushi" food. Really there are not many food choices, and later in the day that gets more limited. Would recommend the hotel, but caution you to plan your meals off-site as much as possible and defnitely request a higher room so you have the postcard worthy view that is possible here.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: sally1cat
Reviews.Content: Loved our two night stay to celebrate our anniversary. The buffet breakfast is wonderful, you will not need lunch, maybe some tea /light snack to tide you over in the afternoon until your dinner. The lobby has ice cold lemon water to refresh you after sightseeing, and the lazy river pool here is so pleasant. I appreciate the more relaxed ambience at the JW, not a frantic tourist feel, just a deluxe experience!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pools and great service”
Reviews.Author: missmins
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for a week and had a great time. The pools were amazing and the outside bar had hands-down one of the best drinks I ever had called "taste the rainbow". I still crave that drink! The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Overall we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to Love it, but didn't”
Reviews.Author: Charmagne88
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here because I was looking for a 5 star hotel in Orlando. I also liked the idea of the river pool. The first day we were there we headed down to the river pool. There are gates surrounding the river pool but no one checks your key so ANYONE can use this pool. They make their money off of the bar. There are 7 dollar inner tubes for purchase. There is a towel house and again you do not have to show a card just take as many as you want. The chairs by the pool are old and ratty. There is a bar near the pool. People can buy cold six packs and they are encouraged to drink in the pool. With so many drunk adults I did not like my kids floating around it alone. Plus the pool was heated to about 95 degrees when it was 102 outside. Not at all refreshing. We also saw a DRUNK married couple fist fighting in the pool and no one stopped it. Eventually her bikini top slipped down. It was awful! The parking was also difficult. Breakfast buffett was excellent. But it was NOT a 5 star property at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as long as you know the ropes”
Reviews.Author: livingthegoodliezzz
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The grounds are amazing and the pool is like a post card. The bad: They hose you for self parking and valet. They even charge you for internet. Solution: Book a package that includes parking. Use you phone for the net. Note to Hotel: Just raise you room rates. Several people I spoke with agreed that self parking should be free and the internet should be included in the price. Note to members: Get on the mailing list. The only time I will stay here is with a reconnect package. Discounted rate, free parking, free breakfast, free upgrade to lake view. Remember they need our money more than we need to stay there. We all have lots of choices. The bad: The drink and food prices in the hotel and at the pool are beyond absurd. 19.00 for a drink. Shame on you JW. I would have four or five drinks a day at $7.00-$9.00. I will pay for zero at ridiculous prices. Solution: There is a liqueur store about three miles down the road. We just make our own drinks in the room. Breakfast is free. We let them hose us on lunch and eat dinner somewhere fun in town. Stop at the store and stack up on snacks. Note to Hotel: We would love to eat and drink at your hotel. We don't mind paying a premium for something good....it's just your prices are ridiculous X five. Guys it's 2011. You need to have WiFi everywhere and it needs to be free. The good: The grounds are amazing. The rooms are clean. service is good....not what you might expect from a JW. but still good. It is in a great location close to everything. I am very fond of this hotel even though it has some issues. as long as you know the ropes you will have a wonderful time. Don't forget to bring a water bottle for your drinks unless you have money to burn. Definitely not perfect but truly a cool place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family Friendly Hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamily7778
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice, but the greatest thing about this hotel is the pool. They have a lazy river, great bars around the pool. It is a great hotel for family fun by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “If I had to pick a hotel to call my home away from home, this would be it.”
Reviews.Author: TallyBill
Reviews.Content: Consistently high quality stay. Frequently add on leisure time to my business trips when staying here. Especially good for conferences and other business meetings, as it is very easy to get from the event side of the hotel to the rooms and back again. This is a very well managed hotel/resort.

Reviews.Title: “Well, it isn't the Holiday Inn...”
Reviews.Author: mrcrassic
Reviews.Content: I stood here for five nights for a business conference at the Peabody Hotel nearby. My stay was excellent but definitely had its cons. The decor and setup of the lobby is incredible; all doubts about the rating of this place disappear upon entry. There are plenty of bus-boys waiting at the entrance to help you with luggage and make you feel well accommodated. Service at the front desk was pretty good and understanding as well. They have an indoor Starbucks! That's pretty exclusive to me. The rooms are wonderfully sized and well-stocked with useful furniture. It was nice to see that I didn't have to pay for the room locker; most other places charge for this. I LOVED the bathroom setup; it's about as big as the room itself and has a tub for soaking and a stand-up shower for bathing. Very relaxing! Rooms situated on the high floors have fantastic views of the campus; I'd get these if the option comes up. Unfortunately, not everything during my stay was comforting. The hotel, while connected to a Ritz on a HUGE campus, is, relatively, in the middle of nowhere. The nearest Walgreens was a hair over a mile away (the concierge told me it was "across the street" so I walked it in my sandals and shorts...not pleasant) and getting to any restaurants outside of the hotel is at least a 10 minute drive. There are plenty of taxis available to get to Universal Studios or Disney, though. One could rent a car (which can be surprisingly cheap here in Orlando), but $18/day self-parking makes it a somewhat expensive exercise. This is fine for resort getaways, business trips or personal time, but a complete bummer for those looking to explore the city (of which there apparently isn't much of). This might be obvious to some, but the food here is expensive. All of the dinner entrees were over $20, which can rack up quickly after drinks. The quality of the dishes were amazing (though I've had similar experiences for less here in NYC), but the service was surprisingly poor. On my second to last day here, I ordered a leek salmon bagel for breakfast but, impressively, got everything except salmon...after waiting 20 minutes for the meal and about 10 minutes before that for a server. I had to wait another 10 minutes after that to get my correct dish, and nothing was comped off the bill to boot (like other places would've done...how do you forget the salmon on a salmon bagel?) In another instance, my colleagues and I had to get a server ourselves to get any attention and waited another 10 minutes after that for our drinks. Surprisingly unacceptable for the prices we paid. Finally, I was even more surprised that wireless internet costs ~$16/day to use here. How is it that motels that cost significantly less have free wi-fi whereas a four-star hotel with a conference center does not? For the sake of completeness, the Peabody had a free, though slow, and paid wireless points for its patrons. While I enjoyed my stay here, there were too many little issues that I didn't get from sleeping at hotels of much "lower" caliber. If I had to come to Orlando for a conference, I'll probably opt to stay somewhere a little more active...and cheaper at that.

Reviews.Title: “Meh. The pool/lazy river was nice.”
Reviews.Author: davenlis
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, I'm a Marriott girl. But I was unimpressed here. Our first impression was not a good one, due to poor signage and difficulty with the parking areas (the gate(s) wouldn't work on more than one occasion, and apparently we weren't the only ones with issues, as they had obviously been rammed through by others!) That aside, the bellstaff was pleasant and welcoming. I went to the front desk area, where there were 4 or 5 ppl behind the desk; there was one other guest there, yet none of the other staff even looked up or acknowledged the fact that I was standing there. I'd say I stood there for about 3 minutes before someone acknowledged my presence. The public areas and rooms were beautifully decorated and clean. However, 2 DOUBLE beds instead of 2 queens?! At a JW???? Really? And not very comfortable double beds, at that. Even my kids complained about the bed size and comfort, and they never complain about beds. The pool/lazy river areas were absolutely gorgeous, though we arrived in the afternoon the first day, and there was quite a bit of trash and towels everywhere, with no one seeming to be around cleaning up. There were plenty of treed, shady areas, as well as sunny areas and umbrellas. This is a nice hotel, don't get me wrong...but it's not a "complete package". It didn't seem like a JW. The front desk staff didn't seem genuinely welcoming, nor did the girl at the pool bar. They kept screwing things up (charges that weren't ours, keys that wouldn't work for parking, etc). I was glad we were only there for 2 nights. Meh.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Pure perfection”
Reviews.Author: TheRanj
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel last fall for a conference and was probably one of the best stays we've ever had at a hotel. Everything about this hotel speaks elegance as soon as you walk in from the lobby, rooms, food, and other amenities. The pool at this hotel is probably the best I've ever been to outside of the private pools in Vegas...it was a little windy this time of year though but still warm and hit the pool during lunch/after our conference sessions. We switched hotels after the conference to be on-site at Universal, but would highly recommend this hotel although I'm sure it is quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations, polite staff”
Reviews.Author: minx1290
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights for a company meeting. The J.W. Marriot shares its grounds with the Ritz Carlton and is a huge compound. The place is quite beautiful with golf club, pool, spa, and a few restaurants. The rooms are a nice size and are comfortable. However, the walls are extremely thin and you can hear everything from the rooms next door and on top of you. Also, there is no ventilation in the bathroom, so if you take a "warm" shower and build up steam, its going to go straight into your room when you open the door leaving everything a bit damp. Just what you need in combination with Florida humidity. Good sushi bar in the lobby- though look for Gregory to be your waiter. The girls, while beautiful, don't get your order right. The italian restaurant is not quite Italian- its more new american.. The Ritz Golf Club house has a pretty good restaurant. If you want to venture off "campus" do NOT ask the staff for assistance with places to eat. A few of us wanted to get out for lunch and we asked for a nice place where we could eat and have a drink and our only recommendations were Friday's, Applebees, and Olive Garden, until a manager over heard the conversation and came over and suggested that we may want "pretty food" instead... Overall, a pretty place, beautiful grounds, full amenities. But I would have expected a little more considering it shares everything with a Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Marriott right next to the ritz”
Reviews.Author: ufrc75
Reviews.Content: I've had to go to this Marriott several times for company events. The last time I was there was for a girls weekend getaway. The location of this hotel is a little out there. This is on the fringe of some of the recent development so there is not a lot immediately around it. It is very convenient from the airport. I have stayed at the ritz next door and this hotel is much larger, but still has a lot too offer. They charge you for parking but if you stay at a 4 star+ resort that is typical. The ritz carlton spa is actually located in between the 2 properties. You take the long walkway where the convention area is. The ritz spa is fantastic. I would highly recommend. If you don't want to get a treatment you can pay for a day pass. The spa actually has it's own pool, which is very serene. You can order food and drinks there. The pool at the JW is a bit chaotic. The lazy river is fun, but the pool drink service is a bit slow and inconsistent. The rooms at the JW are some of the nicest I have experienced at a Marriott property. It is almost at a ritz level. The bathroom is very large and well appointed with a seperate shower and tub. We had a balcony overlooking the pool which was nice. In regards to food, normans at the ritz (again, you can get to the ritz by walking through the convention space) is excellent....expensive...but excellent. The lobby bar at the JW has a great sushi selection and was pretty good. We enjoyed having cocktails and eating sushi for dinner one night rather than going to one of the restaurants. This is a very nice property that has access to the ritz for some other dining and spa/recreational options. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will be going back!”
Reviews.Author: pookad
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The lazy river is amazing. The food and service is top notch. We will absolutely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced: I am self-sufficient, thank-you.”
Reviews.Author: NNSEJS
Reviews.Content: I am here, right now, along with my spouse who is attending an educational conference. First, let me say that Marriott needs an updated, user friendly entrance to Grande Lakes. If you are traveling late in the evening, the signs are difficult to see, and it is easy to make a wrong turn into the self-parking area....which will cost you $14.00 per day. Next, if you park at the door to check-in, be prepared to fight off the vultures that want to treat you as if you are severely handicapped....and that you have $$ to blow. We had one bag, and a kid at the door insisted he carry it to the room.....just for a few bucks. Third, the reservation we made months prior to the trip was incorrect. Even with the print-out, which included full-payment and the reservation number, we were told that the reservation was not in our name; it was keyed in as someone else's room. Therefore, we went from a Deluxe, two-bed queen room, looking over the lakes, to a Standard, king bed, looking at the entrance over-hang and the self-service parking lot. Let me continue....there are no vending machines.....anywhere. Only ice machines on each floor. The food at lunch today was over-priced: Caesar chicken salad: $14 and a Cuban sandwich $14. Wow......that's amost the price of a night at Carrabba's. Anyway, I digress......The rooms: Although the rooms look to be updated, they are over-crowded with furniture (king bed, two night stands, armoire (with TV and mini-bar), full-sized desk and rolling chair, a love seat and matching chair, and a coffee table.....all crammed in to 400 sq. ft. If you are looking for pretension, this is your place. However, if you are representive of 95% of the average citizen, find another hotel - one that is cheaper and allows you your own space. When my better half returns from the conference, he wants to go to the fitness room to get in the workout we missed yesterday. We'll surely have to stop at the ATM, first. Misersable.

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems for the money”
Reviews.Author: Jack_3B
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay here, only because it's where my meetings were held. The facility is beautiful, especially the grounds. But you have to deal with too many problems and too many extra fees. Parking is especially irritating. Although the hotel is in a middle-class suburb with no congested areas nearby, they charge everyone $16 to self-park. A colleague stayed elsewhere, but needed to park, then leave and return the same day. He was told he would be charged for each visit if he self-parked, but that he could go in and out if he paid extra for valet, which he did ($24). When he tried retrieved his car, he learned he'd been told wrong. He stood his ground, but was reprimanded and treated shabbily by each person he dealt with. I've noticed this pattern here: the people can be friendly, but quickly turn "tough" whenever they are challenged for any reason. Food here is quite variable. The breakfast buffet, though overpriced, is excellent. But dinner at the Citron restaurant was disappointing. I ordered fish and chips, and got a tasteless piece of fish that had been frozen too long, served with frozen chips. If you can stay downtown, the Grand Bohemian is a good alternative to this hotel, but there are many others in the Orlando area. If you have to stay at this one, be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Marriott!!”
Reviews.Author: Mstricey23
Reviews.Content: Visited Disney and stayed here. Great distance from park and what a lovely hotel. Breakfast was something out of a magazine. Loved the lazy river. Will stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Casual Elegance”
Reviews.Author: BobDoro
Reviews.Content: You'd have to search hard to find anything to complain about in this hotel. I was at a business conference and brought my family along, so it was both business and pleasure. Top notch service, well maintained, plenty of helpful friendly staff. Pool area is fantastic. On-site amenities are not cheap, but not out of line with a hotel of this caliber. Full service Starbucks on site is a plus, breakfast buffet very good. Self parking is a bit of a walk and there were no daily newspapers delivered to the room. Recommend valet unless you are going in and out a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities, great location”
Reviews.Author: KitchaMitcha
Reviews.Content: We visited Orlando for a family wedding, and afterward moved to the JW Marriott for 2 nights R&R with the hubby. We booked a AAA package that included self parking, breakfast, upgrade to lake view, and a $25 room credit per night. We used all of the above and our bill was exactly in order, everything subtracted just like it should be. I really liked this hotel. The room was okay, nothing bad (maybe questionable taste in decorating) but nothing amazing. The strong suit of the JW is its facilities. The pool with lazy river is one of the best I've seen in the US, maybe only behind Mandalay Bay in Vegas. It was fantastic how warm they heated it. There are 2 spa tubs (or maybe more I missed), ping pong, sand box for kiddos, extensive tropical gardens including their organic veggie patch, walking paths, fire pit, kayaking, volleyball, spa, Starbucks. The hotel was pretty full on Saturday night but even so we had no trouble finding pool loungers. The outdoor area is open till 11PM including the pool, a great feature. There are ample towels and no hassle of a towel card or anything like that, just take what you need. The gym in the Ritz is terrific, and no hassle using it if you are staying at the JW. You can also use the Ritz pool I understand, but why would you want to? This is a pricey hotel with extras, and I can't recommend strongly enough getting a package. The breakfast buffet is $24 PP. Our lunch was $45 (2 diet sodas & 2 wraps). I would guess parking would be in that range too. But that was all covered for us. Good deal. The location is right off International Drive with its restaurants, near to all things Disney, and Seaworld. Negatives: I'm a Rewards member with quite a few points under my belt and 7 Marriott nights JUST THIS MONTH, but they would only give me a late check out of 1PM after I explained I had an 8PM flight. That is pretty stingy and honestly the desk clerk was unpleasant about it, like I was bothering her by even asking. Yet the hotel was half empty, a quiet Monday. It would have cost them nothing to give me a few hours, and actually I probably would've purchased another of their $50 lunches. I walked away with a bad taste from that. Another negative: not enough pool umbrellas by far. Here's a great tip for you: you have to buy floatie tubes for the lazy river. But when families leave to check out they leave their tubes behind. Walk around the pool area just after dark when most everyone has left and you will see all kinds of abandoned floaties in the pool, on loungers, on tables, etc. Sunday night by 9 PM there were dozens of them.

Reviews.Title: “1 night was not enogh”
Reviews.Author: dannymartin1000
Reviews.Content: Had a flight out of MCO back to LAX and only had 1 night at this magnificent hotel. Ate at Primo on the lobby level, some of the BEST food i have ever eaten. The hotel is very nice as is the one connected the Ritz. I very much hope to someday return when i have a lot more time

Reviews.Title: “Super relaxing pool with lazy river”
Reviews.Author: FloridaZowie
Reviews.Content: One of the best big hotels near disney that you can really relax in. Next door to the Orlando Ritz with a great world class spa. JW has everything you want in a great hotel. Great big pool with river, golf, gourmet resturants and big rooms over looking a lake.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Gatordutch
Reviews.Content: Having become used to Concierge floor/lounge of most Marriott Hotels, imagine my surprise that this grand hotel does not offer these services. Used to steep room service etc prices, this one takes the cake with $25/valet parking (or a long hike from remote self parking), breakfast at or above $22.00 per person...the list goes on. As a gold member, I probably will continue to use Marriott Hotels but certainly NOT this over priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUG'S!!!!! WORST SERVICE I'VE EVER HAD FOR THE MONEY I PAID”
Reviews.Author: dj6787
Reviews.Content: I want to start off by saying that i stayed in this hotel because i looked at the past ratings and they looked good. Dont be fooled. Thed first day i arrived my room was not ready to be checked into. So i had to wait several hours after my 7 hour flight in the waiting room because there is nothing aroung. The next day my wife noticed she had alot of little bites oll over her body. I thought it might of been some kind of bug but i was wrong sure enough the next day i hade a bunch of bite marks in a certain pattern. of three bites in a row. i reserched it on google and i found out thats how bed bugs bit. there called breakfast, lunch and dinner bugs. i called and complained so they closed the room up and had a lab suppossidly inspect the room. i was so pissed of with the way they reponded telling me that every hotel deals with bed bugs and theres nothing they can do about it. bed bugs are disgusting... if u dont want to be bitten all overe your body or really itchy dont stay here..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: gpd219
Reviews.Content: Easy quick check in with very friendly service. Room was very nice as I expected it would be. Nice shopping and eating options in the lobby area. Pool was great. Lazy river was relaxing. Wife and I went at night from 8-11 and it wasn't busy at all. Excellent gym if you like to workout. Quick drive to Disney and Universal. I would recommend for business or family travel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort!”
Reviews.Author: bella2001
Reviews.Content: This was my families second time staying at the JW Marriott and it was just as good as I remembered. We reserved an executive suite which was the perfect size for my family of 5. Although we weren't in the room much. We spent most of our days at the pool. the lazy river is great for the kids, there is also a basketball hoop in the pool. The resort is about 15 minutes form Disney parks which can seem a bit long after a along day walking around. There is a cafe at the hotel next to Starbucks that has great breakfast and lunch sandwiches and pizza to go. We ate at Primo which was good. We had breakfast at Citron which was very good. I really like this hotel and would definitely stay again. We were there for Easter and they had a great egg hunt and an Easter carnival with games, cotton candy, face painting, hair braiding and giveaways.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - relaxing and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: sachia007
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - beautiful, huge lobby and lots of on-site dining options. (More options at the Ritz next door, if you wanted). Gift shop, Starbucks, pastry shop, sushi open air "restaurant" in lobby - It's a restaurant, but not enclosed like a traditional restaurant. Rooms are normal size and nothing spectacular - we had better and bigger at the basic room at the JW in Hawaii!! We are Marriott platinum members but there is no concierge lounge or breakfast credit that is offered since this Marriott is considered a "resort" - I found this pretty lame, but oh well! Pool is amazing. It's a very, very, VERY lazy river, but fun and relaxing all the same. The pool empties out into 4 pools. One pool has a basketball hoop, the other 2 have nothing and the last is a kiddie/wadding area. We had extra fun by taking our tubes and jumping up and down while in the "river" and creating our own waves... other people in the "river" loved it... everyone was laughing about it! You have to take your floaties up to your room at night (we stuck ours in the tub). If you leave them at the pool, the pool staff pops them. Our first night there the woman who was closing the pool told us to take them as she had to dispose of them - so we took a few. They cost $7.00 there, or you can buy some off-site and bring in. People were borrowing some at were laying around the pool (probably cause they thought the hotel owned them) and when I saw someone using ours, I was fine with it, but I guess other people could be mad about it. When you buy them, you write your name on it with permanent marker. People can smoke at the pool so be aware of this. There was also a lot of drinking going on as they have a "buy 4, get 2 beer free" deal. There was a lot of swearing going on as well ("f" word), which I was surprised at. I'm sure if I talked to a manager, they would have asked the customers to lower their voices or stop swearing. Tennis courts, golf, bikes and spa are available. Yes you pay for parking and self parking is not that far away - perhaps a 1 minute walk - we went during the NorthEast shool spring break and between that and a Rainbow Cleaner conference the hotel was sold out... and we still found parking super close to the hotel - I'd pass on the valet unless you really need it. Rent a car - a guy was trying to decide to go off site for dinner - a 5 min. taxi ride was going to cost him $40 each way!! There is nothing around this Marriott so it's eat in or taxi someplace. Prices are high of course because you're there and they got you. Menu at pool was basic, but good. Nachos ($12) can easily feed 2-3 people as a meal. Kids meals at the pool were great and $10. The Ritz's pool offers free bottles of water and free fresh whole fruit and their lobby has complimentary ice tea or lemonade. JW pool has big coolers and cups and lobby has water w/ lemon/orange rinds. We bought our Universal tickets in lobby - she is a rep. for Universal so you pay the same price as at the gate and it's only a 10 min. car ride to Universal down back streets so you're not on the interstate - NICE! We dined off-site every night - Benihana's, California Pizza Kitchen, PF Chang and Cheesecake Factory. We were here 5 nights and we only left for the day once to go to Universal. The kids loved the pool that much so we didn't do anything else! Ping pong table, tetherball, volleyball and special kids activities were available at the pool. We didn't do the fire pit at all and I thought there were hammocks on site, but we didn't see any at all (we walked the whole Ritz/JW property). Turn down service at night was nice with chocolates and a card that told you what the weather would be like the next day. Beautiful grounds. Great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Trip”
Reviews.Author: Lynne_Ilkley
Reviews.Content: fab hotel. had trouble with room not having a safe and view. We were moved next day. Front desk hit and miss ., The lady checking us out was a bit aloof but generally staff were very good. Lazy river was fun. Cant understand car park charge. As no one else would want to park near there. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property”
Reviews.Author: blingbling34
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Orlando for a Convention and stayed at this property. Took advantage and took my daughter with me. The property is in a great location, close to everything. My daughter enjoyed the Lazy River Pool, hair weaving and the Whoopie Cakes at the Starbucks. She ordered Room Service and they were fabulous. We dined out so cannot comment on the restaurants, but I am sure they were just as good as the rest of the property. While I was attending the conference, she was out by the pool and they check you in, give you a wrist band and check it every time you try to go back into the pool, this was great because I felt that she was "safer" since anyone from the street cannot come in to the property. The front desk at check in was very friendly and extremely helpful. I would love to come back with my family to enjoy more time at the property.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Property”
Reviews.Author: I_love_trips
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family after a Disney Cruise. We wanted a nice hotel with great pool and surroundings so the kids could just swim, swim, swim. We always do theme parks when in Orlando, but wanted to just relax this time. That is exactly what we did. The grounds were lovely...we all loved the lagoon style pool and lazy river. This JW was definitely a step above a regular Marriott and had lots of activities to offer. Pool servers were efficient and not intrusive. All five of us loved sharing the chicken nachos....there was enough in one order to feed a horse! I went for a run several times around this unique property and thoroughly enjoyed the scenary (after the nachos!). The Ritz is next door and all amenities are shared between the two hotels. Beautiful lake, golf course and even the Marriott Vacation Club next door looks very upscale. You are allowed to use Ritz pool, but not vacation club pool. The rooms are very clean and newly renovated. All staff members we encountered were delightful. We felt like we were away from the Orlando craziness, but in a short drive we could be in the thick of it. There is a huge convention hall between the two properties and they were setting up for a big show while we were there...wonder if things would have been different once all those attendees were there too. Our kids made lots of friends at the pool and we met many nice families This hotel was definitely pricier, we felt, for Orlando. Kids meals at the pool were $10! Restaurants were on the high end too. But no complaints on the service, quality and overall experience. We booked a package that gave us two rooms, breakfast and a few other amenities, and we loved that! We got a vacation that was exactly what we wanted, so worth every penny...would love to go back, but not if doing theme parks. Too nice of a hotel to spend all day at parks not fully enjoying the hotel amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property!!”
Reviews.Author: carybenn53
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days at the J.W. for a major conference. This place has a quiet elegance and intimacy that sets it apart from other places you might stay in Orlando. The staff was very helpful and always cheerful and pleasant! The room was spacious and very clean and comfortable. We were here for several days back in December, and for that trip, we had a room with a balcony overlooking the golf course. This trip, we had a view of the Vacation Club property and a small lake. The bathrooms are large and attractive with marble countertops and separate soaking tub and shower. The food is very good at all of the restaurants/eateries, though, frankly, poolside was our favorite!!! I especially love that there is a Starbucks cafe inside the hotel!! I was able to get my morning fix without having to go off property!!! In terms of recreation, if you are a golfer, the course looks like it would be great and very scenic! There is kayaking available on property and a kayak tour of Shingle Creek, which runs on the backside of the property. Shingle Creek is the headwaters of the Florida Everglades and a great place to see wildlife. Unfortunately, time did not permit me to do this. I hope that the next time we are here I will get to experience it! The fitness center is very good and well equipped with a friendly and helpful staff! They also have great hours!!! I did not have the opportunity to avail myself of the Spa, but, I did get to poke around in the Spa Store and picked up a CD. There is a Lazy River/pool that is absolutely delightful! The water is very warm, and for a gal who grew up in Miami with "bathtub warm" water, I was delighted to be able to get in and not be chilly!! The Lazy River and pools system is extensive, and the zero entry area for the little ones is great!! I think my little grandson would have loved it!! Overall, both stays here were excellent!!! Only had one complaint, and that was the service in the brasserie, "Citron". Twice we ate there and waited 10 or 15 minutes after we had been seated to even be acknowledged by a waiter. The food was good, but, the service left something to be desired. The convention facility was great and the organization holding the event was very pleased with their experience!! I'm crossing fingers that they will decide to come back again next year to the J.W. for this conference!!

Reviews.Title: “Lost And Found!”
Reviews.Author: xchf01
Reviews.Content: On my last visit to the JW, I left behind several golf shirts in the room closet..I thought for sure I would never see them again..After calling the property I was directed to housekeeping ,who not only found my shirts, but also sent them to me via Fedex...Thank you Miguel for a job well done!!...This is an example of the high level of service this property provides on a regular basis...JW Grande Lakes is and will always be the only property I would recommend in Orlando!!....Why stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Linder711
Reviews.Content: We went the first weekend and the place was dead - it was almost like having the pool to ourselves. The lack of folks didn't hinder the great service though. We had a fabulous time by the pool and the lazy river. Food was pricey but generous. We ended up splitting most meals after the first day because it was just too much food to eat solo. We'll definitely consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel for anyone traveling to Orlando, specifically with kids.”
Reviews.Author: KateL81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend stay at the JW Marrott Grand Lakes. I would DEFINITELY return to this hotel. Arrival and Check In: The front desk staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating. We arrived prior to their regular check in time. Our room was not ready yet so the staff took our cell phone numbers to call us when our room was ready and directed us to the bell hops (are they called that anymore?) to store our luggage until then. Pool and Pool Restaurant/Bar: The pool and lazy river, as you can see from my pictures is beyond words. The hotel could be at capacity and you'd still have room for more people at this pool. You can purchase very reasonably priced tubes and rafts for use in the pool and lazy river. The staff there will give you a marker to write your name on the tubes and rafts so you don't lose them and you can bring them up to your room at the end of the day for the next day (or to bring home, which I did). There are plenty of lounge chairs and towels available. They also had a hair braiding station for kids and a water basketball hoop set up. Obviously it was just my husband and I on this trip but you could certainly entertain a family on the property for a day or two as part of your Orlando experience. My favorite part of the hotel would have to be the pool bar staff. By the end of the day you feel like they are old friends. Our server, Amado, was fantastic. Incredibly kind and attentive. The manager, Geoff, even stopped by to make sure that we were having a good time. The portions of the food and drink were a good value. The Room: Our room was up on the fifteenth floor, overlooking the pool and the golf course. The view was breath taking. It was perfectly sized for two people and clearly had been re-done recently. The style was modern, with natural elements. I am kicking myself that I didn't write down the name of the artist of the painting in the room. It was a beautiful piece. My only complaint would be the shower heads and it was more my husband's complaint then mine, but it was kind of low and required taller folks (like us) to scrunch down. The Spa: I had some downtime on Saturday and popped into the spa to see if they had any availability for a massage and was thrilled to be able to book an appointment later in the day with miracle worker, Esteban. If you go, do yourself a favor and request him. I've been back to work now for a full day (and we all know how that can be, and I'm still feeling stress free). The check in staff was also incredibly helpful when I left behind some personal items after my massage. Everything was found and quickly returned to me.

Reviews.Title: “Oh no Not more Kids!”
Reviews.Author: westlakeh
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott/Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes When you stay, you have full priveldges and access at both. We were unaware that the Resort(s) would be overrun with tattoos, bling, implausible breast augmentations, and especially screeching overindulged, rude, offspring. People who allow teenage children to sit at dinner in a 5-star fine dining restaurant in tee shirts should be banned or worse. At the Ritz pool area, the floating foam mattresses were scarce and many were ripped in half or missing portions. Never thought a Ritz would scrimp on such easily replaced amenities. We wondered whether our misfortune was that we were there on a weekend or possible all-Long Island vacation week, or if the huge push on “RC Residences” or Marriott “Vacation Club” timeshares has undermined any hope of a serene couples vacation at these luxury properties. Staff is earnest and sincere, but JW feedbag atmosphere at Citron breakfast, lounging at both pool areas and the general atmosphere---is chaotic like being trapped on some hellish reality- TV cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Commonfund conferece”
Reviews.Author: wmdtjr
Reviews.Content: Great job in handling Commonfund conference. Facilities were perfect for multi-day conference. Quality A/V and spaces for breakouts and full conference presentations. Food was presented with class and quality throuhgout the meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing lazy river, great restaurants, spa, atmosphere, & wonderful valet parking & porters.”
Reviews.Author: kac442
Reviews.Content: Thanks to jonathan, porter for making us feel at home. Tim in valet was outstanding, too. Repeat stay at one of my favorite hotels. Love the lazy river pool, atmosphere, & restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Dine before arrival - Very poor host and wait staff”
Reviews.Author: ISail572
Reviews.Content: This is a very attractive property but the night I spent here was absent any management staff. Management must have taken the night off because Marriott is usually the hallmark of hospitality and trying to be served in three restaurants, I gave up and ordered room service (which was very well managed). The convention in most good eating establishments is to stop near the host or hostess station and wait to be recogniized and cared for. When I tried this in the lobby lounge, the staff ignored me and was miffed when I asked if they served food there. They said to sit anywhere but when I did, at a table next to the bar, they repeated the performance of ignoring me. A waitress stood at a table near me talking with the people there for almost 5 minutes and I gave up and went to the second option. Had she acknowledged that I was there and asked me to wait, I might have, but I was made to feel invisible. The second restaurant had a more attentive hostess station but when I asked to be seated for dinner, I was made to give them my name and wait while they looked up my profile in the computer, then while they printed a charge slip to put in the server's folio. There were less than five tables with diners in this place and the staff was congregated by the kitchen laughing and joking. I gave it another 5 minutes and left. No water, no menu, no service. My last attempt was in the Primo restaurant and when I walked in to the reception area, and was not acknowledged, I left rather than pay a lot for bad service. The service and food served by the room service staff was excellent so maybe that is where management was hiding. Of less aggravation was my arrival to check in. The signage from the self-parking lot is not clear about where reception is located. It's a good hike uphill. The line at the desk was very slow with the tourists but the few business travelers were very quick. There was no manager present and I went back twice to speak with one but the line continued to be slow and I gave up. Lovely property but pack your own lunch or pay the permium for room service. Very dissappointed in Marriott. Was in a Hilton the night before and made to feel like they welcomed my trade. I'm in hotels over 150 nights a year and this ranks as one of the top ten worst stays in the last 5 years.

Reviews.Title: “The Grown Up Side of Orlando”
Reviews.Author: cmitchb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and loved it. It is connected to the Ritz Carleton by a conference center, so you have access to the Ritz's golf club, spa and gym. The lobby is nice and expansive - plenty of room for private chats or group discussions. The sushi bar is wonderful and the service at time was overwhelmed due to the number of conventioneers, they were all great. The lobby does get loud, so if you want to slow things down a bit take the walk over to the bar at the Ritz. The room was very nice - fresh colors, lots of room, big closet. We were in a corner room, so that gave us the added space. The water pressure in the shower was fine, but the location of the lights relative to the mirror casts shadows, making shaving (and I imagine putting on makeup a pain. The views were fine as well. There were plenty of onsite dining options both at the JW and the Ritz. I was there for four nights and never felt the need to venture off site. The conference facilities were above average, and there are ample locations for outside receptions or other events. The grounds themselves were also nice and park like. There is a "lazy" river, and the pool and poolside bar looked wonderful (though I didn't get a chance to participate). This place is all about golf, and the facilities were top notch as well as the instructors. A great deal is the supervised practice on the driving range. Technically you pay about $45 for 20 minutes of help, but in reality I probably got 45-60 minutes, including tips from the top pro. I made it to the spa as well and had one of the best massages in a long time. There seemed to be a lot of activities available for guests of all ages. Since I was there for a conference I didn't try much, but I definitely plan on coming back with the whole family. I do have two knocks - when I arrived with my laptop, garment bag and golf clubs. I literally ended up rolling everything all the way to the receptionist who, after issuing my room key, casually referred me in the general direction of the two elevator banks without asking if I needed assistance. The second problem was with housekeeping. We ordered breakfast and were told it would be 30-45 minutes and ran downstairs for coffee from the Starbucks while we waited. When we returned 20 minutes later the housekeeper was in the room. We continued to wait another 20-30 minutes and called to see what was taking so long. Turns out the food made it to the room faster than they had anticipated and the housekeeper told the server we were one for the day. My bef is she never mentioned this to us when we returned! Room service was great and had our "new" order up in 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice alternative to a Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: Farzana770
Reviews.Content: Visited Magic Kingdom with the Family, Grande Lakes is a nice alternative to a Disney property. Yes, you will have to drive a little -- but the amenities are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be”
Reviews.Author: JayHTexas
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here while on business. Didn't get to see much of the hotel, other than the bar, the lobby and my room. All were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jsw702
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, great food, exercise room great. i would like to come back again and go fishing or play golf on the repsort. it looks very good.

Reviews.Title: “One of the top hotels in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGators
Reviews.Content: This really is a beautiful resort, and shares grounds with the Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes. The lobby is beautiful, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are as nice as you would expect from a JW Marriott. The pool area is huge, with a lazy river going through it. Looking at a map, it seems far from the attractions areas, but you really are not far at all. If you want to do Orlando but not stay at one of the theme parks hotels, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: CoasterWarrior
Reviews.Content: While the grounds are absolutely beautiful and the hotel common areas are excellent, we always put a premium on relaxation and a good night's sleep. We were shocked that we could hear everything going on in the hallway, our next door neighbors (with very vocal children), and what seemed to be every running sink, shower and toilet flush while we were trying to sleep. Also, I should have asked for firmer pillows, as every one of ours was mush. The employees were very nice, but the late evening service in the central bar area was average at best. We enjoy upscale hotels, but these types of experiences make us wonder what we are really paying for. There always seems to be significant extra charges for internet and parking which is irritating given the typical room rate and the fact that these things come free at almost all mid-level hotels now. We have now had multiple disappointments at Marriott properties of varying types. Hopefully this is not a trend. As a frequent traveler, I always felt I could count on them.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: carribeandreams
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference here and was later joined by the family to visit Disney World. The resort is beautiful, the rooms were quiet and the business center was good. The staff were amazing as well. The spa was large and very relaxing. The resort is about a 15-20 minute ride to disney (depending on traffic).

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel in Orlando near everything and away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: karolinakev
Reviews.Content: Beautiful large convention oriented hotel that has everything one needs plus access to the Ritz Carlton Spa--I spent just a night but bought a room package for $200 which included lunch at the spa and a treatment. Great value for such a wonderful combination. Rooms are large and the hotel is immaculate--large surroundings with impressive pool area. The gym is filled with nice equipment but the AV system is lousy and does not offer very many channels. No free coffee, no concierge floor. Parking is extra and a bit annoying given that there is no option but to pay. Very close to Disney and other attractions--so much better than the Marriott World Center. Agreat option for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon hotel!”
Reviews.Author: resabug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon at the end of November. We had a fabulous experience. I should note, however, that our travel agent arranged for us to have free parking and free internet -- try to do this if you can, it totally helps with the cost. Otherwise it's $16/day for parking and another $16/day for the internet. Adds up! The Outside Beautiful grounds, very well maintained; great for walks. The pool/lazy river is pretty great. They keep the water heated to 84 degrees, so it's nice to swim in even when it gets a bit cold. It is a shallow pool though, never deeper than 5 feet. Service Lobby was beautiful. Check-in was quick with a friendly and informative staff member. Housekeeping was pretty spot-on every day, and the turn-down service at night was a really nice touch. They even gave us a complimentary wine and snack cart to help us kick off our honeymoon. Chocolate covered blueberries are my new favorite. Room We had a King Lake View room. The bed was PHENOMENAL. Tons of soft cushy pillows, and an amazing featherbed under you. I slept like a rock. Bathroom was huge, and the shower water pressure was nice. Restaurants Delicious food, but it definitely costs you. We ate at Citron a few times, but we never went to Primo because we couldn't justify the expense. I would probably recommend just going out for your meals. Overall we had a really good experience and would go back again, provided we could still finagle the free parking and internet out of the hotel. Otherwise it would just be too pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and exceptional location”
Reviews.Author: dcg86
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, upscale hotel - large, well manicured grounds and great pool area. We stayed in the suite, which was very roomy. Convenient location: 10 minute drive on the backroads to Universal and to SeaWorld. Had to get on the highway for Disney, which was about 15 minutes away. Delicious restaurants. The last time we visited Orlando, we stayed in the WorldCenter Marriott, which wasn't nearly as nice as this...We'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - But just a bit nicer than a normal Marriott”
Reviews.Author: xy223yz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. Very clean, very up to date, very nice and also very, very big. However, having stayed at a number of Marriott and Hilton properties, I didn't see anything that blew me away considering this was a JW Marriott. It comes across as a very nice Marriott. Enjoyed my stay (business trip), but I guess I expected a little more. Finally, having to pay for parking is a bit of a turn off. This seems to be pretty standard for Marriott properties in Orlando. But considering the JW is not around any of the big attractions, this seems a pretty crummy way of generating revenue.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Karen_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel and probably the best hotel campus in the area. Check-in, valet and bell services were quick, courteous and professional and the lounge bar was a great place to unwind after the drive. Rooms were luxurious and well appointed and the area - JWM, Ritz, Convention Ctr and golf course were scenic and a great place to walk. I would make this a first choice for another Orlando trip.

Reviews.Title: “So not your usual Disney World Orlando”
Reviews.Author: sylvitilli
Reviews.Content: This time my husband was traveling for business and the kids and I went along for the quick vacation. We have done Disney Orlando many times and we were looking for something more relaxing and just different. This hotel was perfect. The grounds, especially the lazy river pool, were more than enough diversion and fun for the kids - and I was able to catch up on some back issues of magazines while relaxing poolside! From a putting green, to Frisbie on the thick green grassy areas, to simply walking the extensive grounds (which are shared w/Ritz Carlton) - my kids and I had more than enough to do without leaving the resort. The resort had a very adult, luxury feel while still appealing to the kids. We didn't even have to leave the pool area for lunch - great, convenient outdoor cafe type area with foods my kids really enjoyed. Gave a rating of 4 out of 5 for a few things, such as service, because it is so big that it does feel a little impersonal. While I loved the location, it is a bit of a drive into and out of the property if you are visiting Orlando tourist destinations. I will return when, inevitably, we return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Suite stay at the JW Grande Lakes”
Reviews.Author: MoToBride
Reviews.Content: Checkin Our GPS sent us into the resort the long way so we had a view of the beautiful and extensive grounds before arriving at the impressive lobby. Checkin service was topnotch. I inquired about an upgrade to a suite as we were travelling with an infant and was offered one for $150 per night, after a moment's hesistation on our part, the checkin girl offered to speak with the manager to see if this could be reduced. And lo and behold we ended up in Suite 25007 for $100 extra per night beyond the $200ish original room price that was booked through my husband's conference. The bell hop immediately took our bags up, with me, not 30min after I arrived in the room like in some large hotels! Another employee brought up the crib and highchair and a cute little package for our little one with a big rubber duckie, washcloth, brush and baby shampoo. The only downside was the 2 packages I had sent to the hotel were not noted in the file on arrival (usually I forget I sent anything and the checkin is a pleasant surprise). It took a while to find them but they were located in the end (this has happened to me at other large hotels, they always seem to find them!) The Room As you enter the large suite, there is a lobby area with a huge walkin closet that leads into the living area which has its own balcony, pull-out sofabed, desk, flat-screen tv, minibar & safe. Through french doors with curtains you end up in the bedroom, which has another small balcony (no chairs as balcony is too small, balconies at the Ritz next door do all seem to have chairs). Master bedroom has deliciously comfy king bed, an empty bar size fridge, another flatscreen and a comfy chair. The blackout blinds allowed us (and baby) to nap during the day as if it was nightime. The view from the room over the beatiful pools and golf course beyond is very calming. Individual a/c units for BR and LR which is fantastic and they worked great! Service was always prompt, I lost my key and they brought one up within 5min. I called down to ask the room to be made up in a 1h window and it was. I don't think the hotel was full but my husband's conference had 900 delegates and it was not the only one so they place certainly wasn't empty. In room wifi is $15 per day + unlimited domestic long distance, the standard Marriott deal, and it worked VERY well the whole time we were there. The suite also had about 4 phones including a wireless which was very handy. Grounds, pool etc. The hotel inside is beautiful and huge. The lobby has complimentary lemon water, nice & refreshing. There is also a full service starbucks (not one of those inside another store that only has filtered coffee). There is also a bodega with pizza and sandwiches and what looked like chips, snacks, softdrinks. Prices at Starbucks were par for the course, $4 for a tall gingerbread latte (yum!). The grounds are kept immaculate and are quite lush. I saw 3 different herons on a walk by the lake at 10am and a cardinal in the bushes near the pool as well as lizards. There is a play area for kids with slides and a sandbox and a zero-entry pool for them as well. All pools are connected by a 3ft deep lazy river that will propel you around in a circuit if you purchase an inner tube. They also sell beachballs and floaties for kids & have free swim diapers. There is a poolside cafe and seems to be poolside drink service although didn't see any servers but I was only there in the mornings. The pool area is shaded in the AM and gets full sun in the afternoon. Towels are abundant. Location You really need a car if you are here as even the walk from the hotel out of the grounds would be pretty far and there is nothing much nearby. If you have a car, you are a short drive from the Florida Mall and also the Premium Outlets, as well as many fastfood chains. Bring your GPS! Yes, it is a bit of a walk to self-serve parking (maybe 3min?) but nothing worth complaining about.

Reviews.Title: “two words - Lazy River!”
Reviews.Author: fun-happy-traveller
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the Lazy River. I'm not really a big pool person. But the Lazy River swayed me. It is so relaxing. I wish the tubes were free - keep your tube for the duration of your hotel stay in your room so you don't have to pay $7 each time. I am also not an Orlando person. This hotel would make me want to visit Orlando again. Impeccable service from the staff - really, they go above and beyond. Clean, modern rooms. Great sushi at the hotel lobby bar - try the dragon eel. Primo Restaurant is excellent and definitely a memorable dining experience (hello, pumpkin cheesecake! just eat it!). Fitness center at the Ritz is much better than your typical hotel gym. Price is a little bit high, but it's certainly worth it if you don't want to have your standard commercialized Orlando resort experience with bad food, cheap quality, and minimal service.

Reviews.Title: “Lavish accomodations, great service but too far away from the parks”
Reviews.Author: mfg2006
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four (mom and dad 44 and 41, kids 10 and 14) and were excited to spend a few days in luxury in Orlando before heading out on a cruise to the Bahamas. Since we were only staying for a couple of nights, we decided to splurge and stay at the JW. The grounds are Ah-May-Zing. The whole facility is beautiful and service fantastic. The room was gorgeous as expected. Our package included breakfast which was a great deal. The one thing we did not count on was that the hotel is really far away from the Disney parks and is served by Lincoln Town cars instead of regular taxis. We did not rent a car so we spent $42 each way to get to the parks! The lazy river was lots of fun and both kids 10 and 14 really enjoyed it even though the pool was completely jammed with people. There were lots of lounge chairs. You pay for the inflatable rings poolside I think $7 per tube but the entertainment for all 4 of us was totally worth it. There is also a small playground and sand pit area. My kids are a bit too old for this, but we saw lots of smaller children playing there. The grounds are well gated to keep small children from accidentally wandering into the pool area without a parent. Dining. The hotel has the top Zagat rated restaurant in the Orlando area Primo which we were tempted to try, but the prices were a little over the top ($40+ for entrees) and we are used to overpaying for dinner since we live just outside the DC area. We tried a some other Zagat rated restaurants near the hotel but still had to pay $15 each way to get there. If you are going to stay here, definitely rent a car or know you are going to spend a small fortune on Lincoln Town Car transport which by the way was top notch, just a bit pricey. We did dine at the restaurant poolside. The food was delicious. Blackened grouper sandwhiches and angus beef burgers. Delicious sauces and sides. Not your typical tenders and fries. The servers were a mixed bag. The hotel needs to work on their training a bit because the service quality by the pool was inconsisent. There is a very nice Starbucks off the lobby which provided some quiet time for the grown ups. Pleasant aromas, lit candles and lemon infused water in the lobby made the wait for our rental car very pleasant. There were some very nice boutiques in case you needed a nice outfit to wear which is always nice if you run out of clean clothes. We rented a car to head out to our cruise and the Hertz staff on site again were top notch. They fitted us with a very comfortable Camry with navigation at no additional cost even though we asked for a small car just to get ourselves out to Port Canaveral. Finally, we went in August. Plan to get rained on with very little notice. We spent most of the time soaking wet either because we were in the pool or because the skies opened up without much warning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort property...very quiet”
Reviews.Author: dru37
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently for 2 nights attending a business conference, and the property seems to have it all. World-class conference facilities, golf, tennis, fitness, pool, restaurants, etc. My room was very nice, and the whole place has a very upscale feel (it is connected to the Ritz-Carlton). The property is well off the beaten track, and it had a very quiet feel (I was there during the week). Pool areas were sparsely populated, and I didn't see a lot of golfers. Bottom line...this is a real nice resort property, great for a business conference.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise for a large conference center in Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: Wilmettetraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott Orlando in early October 2010 as part of a firm retreat for approximately 300 lawyers. I was not expecting to like being in Orlando during hurricane season and my kids have passed the age where a trip to Disney World is good times. Arrival was a bit rocky as our room was not ready; however, the staff quickly found an alternative which was quite nice. We had a lovely view of the pool and grounds. It was quiet, the bed was wonderfully comfortable, and the amenities were terrific. The weather cooperated and we had time for a kayak trip located just a short distance from the golf course. Our guides were delightful young men who made it an enjoyable experience. The resort also set up a very nice cocktail party outdoors with activities, including laser skeet shooting and a golf match. On our last night, they set up a wonderful indoor sports bar complete with pool and ping pong, basketball, foose ball, and a dance floor where we danced to our own in-firm band. The food was surprisingly good and all in all, a good time was had. The pool was nice and although crowded with lots of kids, was still pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to relax away from the crowds!”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel616
Reviews.Content: Totally relaxing vacation away from the theme park crowds and craziness. Service was excellent, rooms were clean and comfortable, lazy river and walks within the property (shared with Ritz Carlton) were beautiful and relaxing in the early AM hours. On-site restaurants were very pricey, so we opted to go off-site, having rented a car for the week. I would recommend doing that, both to be able to eat elsewhere, as well as do things during the day off-site and return back to the hotel to float until the pool closes. Ultimate relaxation. Parking was expensive (both valet and self-park) and there are no other options if you've got a car. Also, Internet access was also expensive, but we decided to bite the bullet so that we could check in with work, etc. Fortunately, the service was indeed fast and we had no problems with connections all week. Needing to print anything other than boarding passes is also very expensive and you must use their business center. No favors from front desk or concierge were offered to us to print a needed piece of work-related paper. Sadly, don't bother with the eco-tour kayak trip offered through the hotel. Shingle Creek was pretty to paddle, but we saw nothing in the way of wildlife, with the exception of a few common birds, and it was rushed (we had to hurry the kayaks back for another outgoing group) and it was again, very expensive. All in all, a great destination for complete relaxation away from the normal insanity of the theme parks (but close enough to them to enjoy if that's where you want to be). Be prepared to be in the "vacation" mindset when it comes to spending and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip”
Reviews.Author: holidaygirl01
Reviews.Content: We’ve just returned from 14 nights at this hotel, and I’ve already booked to go back next year. From arrival to check out all the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. I had a couple of requests at check in which were accommodated without any problems. Although, I would add that I have a feather allergy and it would be a lot nicer if the hotel could provide a hypo-allergenic comforter rather than a heavy cotton blanket. Our room had everything we needed and was very clean and comfortable. I requested a fridge when we checked in and it was delivered to our room very quickly. Our bathroom also has a separate shower and tub which was very handy. The best feature of this hotel is the lazy river, we spent a lot of time by the pool which has lots of shady areas and umbrellas. We never had a problem getting a lounger and the pool was only busy at the weekend, during the week it was very quiet and at times it seemed like we had it to ourselves. The only inconvenience during our stay was that the Starbucks in the hotel changed its hours when a conference was not taking place. Whilst I appreciate that most of their business will come from the conference attendees, it’s worth remembering that the hotel has other guests as well who like to use the facilities available. We were disappointed a couple of times and it would have been useful if a notice or revised hours were available on the door.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly, for those accustomed to service, "JW" no longer walks the talk.”
Reviews.Author: todd_fix
Reviews.Content: Disappointed. Firstly, let me say that this property is beautiful. The amenities offered are excellent. The food was very good. The room and public areas very clean and beautiful. The pool area is one of the finest. Here’s the "but.." I have come to expect a certain level of service when selecting brands such as "J.W. Marriott." There were so many shortcomings that it negatively impacted our anniversary weekend. The front desk staff was indifferent. When there were small problems (such as double charging me for a single day internet access) the response from the front desk clerk Angelika was "well, it shows on the computer that you ordered internet service twice," then a blank stare, with no offers to research or fix the problem. Only when I pressed the issue, was I then offered a "comp" for one evening's $17 parking fee. Honestly, I was offended at her comment as we were not the "budget" traveller who used the facilities and left. We ate at the restaurants, payed for a special Luau dinner show, patronized the pool restaurants, and even shopped in the clothing boutiques. I felt like asking her if she believed we were going to try to shirk a $16 internet bill. When upgrading to a lake-side view for the second half of our stay (and rightfully paying the upgrade fee) the room was not ready on 3 seperate visits to the desk. First is was to be ready at noon, then one, then two, then three o’clock. Finally, Angelika asked "was there 'any special' reason you wanted to upgrade?" Again, an oddly blank stare. I am not a snob, but this was NOT the type of customer service I expect from the luxury line of Marriott. There was no offer to assist us with our luggage during room changes and no apologies for the several mishaps during our stay. Many will find this resort fantastic, but I honestly cannot say that I would stay again. When so many can offer amenities, it’s service that I turn to. Let's face it, many resorts offer fantastic facilities...it's the service that makes the difference to the traveller. Not much of this at the JW Marriott Orlando. The service was comparable to what I would expect at a Holiday or LaQuinta Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler16Fl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW for our daughter's 8th birthday this past weekend. We booked a Discovery Cove Package (Swim with the Dolphins, tickets to Sea World, a room for 2 nights, breakfast at the cafe each morning and complimentary valet parking). We couldn't have been more pleased with our experience! From the moment we arrived we were accommodated in every possible way. One of the valet staff, upon hearing it was our daughter's birthday, gifted her with a bag of tokens to use in the arcade and a stuffed toy "shamu". The front desk staff was knowledgeable and very helpful; moving us to a room with a balcony upon our request. The concierge staff worked diligently to assist us with reservations and special requests. The bellhop ordered up a fridge for our room (a key component in traveling with young children) and room service had a cheese and fruit tray (previously ordered ) up to our room within 10 minutes of check-in. They also brought 2 large bags of goodies for the kids to munch on with a "Happy Birthday" note written for my daughter. Sweet. The lazy river at the hotel was a nice feature and the Bistro Cafe made incredible breakfasts every morning. My 6 year old son woke up each day asking to go to the breakfast buffet! The dining highlight of our trip was Primo Restaurant at the hotel. Again, the staff and chef's couldn't have been nicer. The food was incredible! The restaurant uses organic produce from it's own garden and the flavor really comes though. Each and every dish, appetizer to dessert was a treat to my gastronomic soul. My only disappointment was the pricing of the wine list - while it did offer variety, many of the wines were overpriced. I would highly recommend Primo. You won't be disappointed. The next time I'm in Orlando, I will make it point to dine again at this fabulous restaurant! To sum it up, the JW is a lovely hotel with a professional and truly accommodating staff. They made us feel like Rock Stars, but most of all, they made my 8 year old daughter feel very special for her getaway birthday weekend and for that I am very grateful :).

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: Jfeasel
Reviews.Content: Husband was there for business, I was there for pleasure and wish I could have stayed longer. This resort is on the same property as a Ritz Carlton and a Marriott vacation club facility. Our hotel room was very clean and the bedding was the best I've ever slept on. The bathroom was also the largest hotel bathroom I've ever seen and we had just a regular room. I took advantage of the pool with the lazy river while my husband was in meetings. There were plenty of chairs around the pool area as well as several hot tubs and a very nice outdoor restaurant. I did do some shopping in the stores on site and found them to have a nice variety of merchandise. I also liked the walking bath that connected the JW Marriott, Ritz, golf course and vacation condos. This hotel is off the beaten path in the Orlando area so it's not as busy as those around Disney and Universal. Very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: olrac5252
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, from the Citrus water in the lobby to the lazy river pool it was a great experience. House keeping went above and beyond with cleaning the room and also making up yhe cot and sofa bed every night. Will visit again as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “A large hotel with luxury tag!”
Reviews.Author: InsaneNirvana
Reviews.Content: I was in JW Marriott Grande Lakes hotel during July. This property is pretty large with many amenities and a few restaurants. My whole experience at this property was just so-so. The property felt over crowded even though it was huge. Rooms looked and felt a lot cramped, but had a nice view. Water was awful. This probably was an Orlando thing, but water that ran in the bathroom left a bad odor in the rooms. I had someone knocking on the door a couple of times while sleeping which left me a little groggy. Few positives: Quality of food was good. Service was overall very decent. The pool and the beach volleyball area was fun. Airport was just a short ride from the hotel. This maybe a good place to visit for families with kids as they may enjoy it. I don't think I will ever go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMommy31
Reviews.Content: We arrived at JW Marriott Grande Lakes after spending almost a week on Disney property. From the second we walked in, we were impressed by the luxury and service offered at this hotel. One example- my daughter needs to have a medicine refrigerated and the hotel brought us up a refrigerator for no cost. Also, since I am a Marriott Elite member, we had a choice of either free parking or free internet for our stay.
