While we are not able to spend tons of $$ at a property like this, we found it to be within our budget with the huge special offers that they had during our stay. The restaurants were pretty pricey, so we opted to drive off property to eat. We also saved some cash by buying a gallon of milk and just eating cereal each morning before we started off on our day. We all LOVED the lazy river and the children's activities that were offered.throughout our stay. Regarding the lazy river, of course it is not as big as one that you would find at a water park like Disney has, but it was quite long and it never felt crowded. We chose to not buy the tubes, and had just as much fun as people with them. We noticed that many people bought tubes from off property and were able to use them with no problems. The lifeguards and pool staff made for an enjoyable experience, as well. I only wish we could have stayed longer....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Pool, Small Room with fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: mikemasella
Reviews.Content: Valet very friendly..............Front desk GREAT !!! Lobby Gorgeous !!! Room was such a bummer !!! Super small and not comfortable at all. Pillows surprisingly small and well useless !!! Bathroom was really good, Nice Shower !!! Great Balcony Great View !!!! Uhm Lazy river was really good just not as great as I was expecting. Tubes $7 The hotel DOES NOT CARE IF YOU BRING YOUR OWN TUBES !!!! Restaurant WAY TO EXPENSIVE !!!! I would def return , Although I want to check out The World Village 1st !!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: MacDee1010
Reviews.Content: Me and my son who is 6 stayed for 5 nights @ the JW Marriott. It was very clean, grounds beautiful, food was very good especially the Sushi bar, best Sushi I ever had (surf and turf roll was the best!) and the pool with the lazy river was great, clean and lots of fun. There was the outside bar/restaurant which had made me the "poolside paradise" drink, real good. Also had lunch outside on our chairs and the waiter was great, the shrimp ceaser salad so fresh and delicious. Also outside (large pieces) chess/checker board. pool table, ping pong and fooseball table by the pool was good when we needed to dry off a bit. You have to purchase the tubes for the pool, $7.00 or bring your own. They supply towels, as many as you need. You can rent bikes by the lake, we didn't get around to that. The have a Ritz Kids Club that for $20 an hour you can drop off your children to play, swim and have many games including Wii and X-box. Being I was only with my son I let him stay for an hour while I walked around the resorts and checked out where everything was the first night and caught a quick glass of wine. I did not rent a car , but the shuttle times and conveinent and was fine for us, there is no additional charge to take shuttles. We did take a taxi once from Aquatica and it was only $12.00. We ate at the Bistro and in my package my son got one free meal a day, usually dinner so that worked out for us, food was good. We ate at Primo (Italian, higher end) and had the veal saltimbocca and it was fantastic! Our room had a balcony overlooking pool and lake and we loved it. Got to see fireworks from Disney/Seaworld at night. The beds were GREAT! I don't sleep well, and it was the best 5 nights of sleep I had in years. Yes it was somewhat pricey, but you get what you pay for and I was very happy with the hotel. Looking forward to staying there again next year. Denise M

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but quite nice”
Reviews.Author: SunnyinDothan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights in July to attend a wedding that was next door at the Ritz. The lobby is beautiful, with a giant fountain in the middle. There's a bar and some really expensive restaurants we avoided. Not much of a selection for sandwiches/quick snacks. And you're sort of in the middle of nowhere when it comes to Orlando. It's a very nice resort though. There's a huge lazy river and they have activities for children, but it's mostly a conference center. The rooms were very pretty and the bathroom was huge. It has a separate shower and tub with double sinks. We chose to stay here instead of next door at the Ritz (the rooms are identical except for the decor by the way) and it was still quite a budget-buster if you're used to more of a Holiday Inn/regular old Marriott. The staff here was very, very helpful and friendly. I was surprised they charged so much for you to park the car yourself. It's in the middle of nowhere. And parking is quite a walk. If you leave something in the car, it's a pain to hike out there and get it yourself. Another bummer: you have to pay for internet access. I think it was $15 a day? Pretty steep for my pocket. Grossest part of the experience: A dirty coffee maker with a coffee cup full of mold/objects. I almost threw up when I went to make coffee one morning and discovered the leftovers from another tenant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Choice Away from the Amusement Parks”
Reviews.Author: JLTP
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 4 nights at the Marriott Grande Lakes to attend a wedding nearby and for some vacation time. While probably not a great option if you plan to spend a lot of time at Disney or Universal (neither is very close by), this hotel was a terrific choice for us. The hotel is quite luxurious and not much of a comedown from the adjoining Ritz Carlton. The lobby is impressive and the service throughout the hotel was very good. In particular, we thoroughly enjoyed both the food and service at the Citron restaurant, particularly the breakfast buffet. The service staff in the restaurant are very personable and really bent over backwards to ensure your satisfaction. We had adjoining standard rooms. We were offerered an upgrade for $40/night per room upon check-in that we passed on. As it was off-season, the proposed upcharge was disappointing since we were taking two rooms and have accumulated many Marriott points over the years. The rooms were a reasonable size (not huge) and are very tastefully decorated. The view was nothing special. The offseason rate (through the Marriott website) was very reasonable and included a $50 dinner credit and free in-room movie per night, making it a fantastic bargain. If such a deal is available and you plan on eating a few dinners at the hotel (they have two restaurants), I suggest you take advantage. The exercise facility (shared with the Ritz Carlton) was impressive. The spa looked nice, but no one in my family used it. My son and I played golf at the on site Ritz Carlton golf course and enjoyed it very much. It was reasonably challenging, and the reasonable mid-July (i.e., very hot weather) rate included a forecaddie's services. All in all, this was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in a lovely setting and good location.”
Reviews.Author: AmhlaoibhMc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks in early July. Lobby is very impressive - pictures on hotel website don't do it justice. We got a good deal on the family package through our travel agent so didn't find the $15 a day charge for parking a big deal. Huge hotel with large conference centre so no surprise that there were a number of car parks but we usually got parking in the one closest to the main entrance. Hotel shares grounds with the Ritz Carlton which is top class. Grounds are lovely and well maintained. There's a smashing lakeside walk with views across to the golf course. Shame to see some litter in some of the reed beds - appreciate the hotel management can't do anything about the idiots that dump stuff but they should have the litter picked up. Plenty of wildlife - fish, birds, turtles and a few small gators. My daughter and I went fishing one morning. Our guide Mike brought us around in a buggy to fish a number of the lakes. Fishing was quiet but we caught a bass each and also fished Shingle Creek which was very peaceful. We stayed in a deluxe room with 2 double beds - not huge but beautifully finished. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Pool area is large with plenty of sun loungers. Breakfast buffet was good and we lunched at the pool bar most days. We did Disney and Universal on previous Orlando trips so visited Seaworld and Aquatica this time and enjoyed them both. The women in my family insisted on shopping every evening so we saw Mall at Millenia a lot - ate in the Cheesecake Factory 6 or 7 nights - great food and service. Thought the location was very good - only 15 mins drive from airport, Universal, Mall at Millenia, Florida Mall and Disney. Hotel is on John Young Parkway which is a good route for getting about and has less traffic than I-Drive or I4.

Reviews.Title: “Awful prison with the illusion of luxury”
Reviews.Author: AndyReeves1117
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five days at the JW Marriot on a national education conference with the AVID program. On the surface, it looks great. The pool and lazy river are nice. If you stay at JW Marriot, be prepared to pay through the nose. They charge for parking. They charge for WiFi. The restaurants are nice, if you like paying $16 for a chicken sandwich. The walls are so thin that we could hear people's televisions for two rooms in all directions. The incompetent staff couldn't even refer us to an appropriate off site restaurant or even get us the number to order a pizza. There are only elevators on one end, so if you need to leave your room to get somewhere on time, be prepared to leave 20-30 minutes early so that you can walk the vast expanse of hallways and rip-off tourist traps. In addition, the elevators have a tendency to get stuck, creak, bang, and once stopped to abruptly that I was thrown to the floor. There is no parking garage, so you have to walk across the hotel, courtyard, conference center, and dozens of parking lots if you wish to leave. If you have a physical limitation, don't count on the bell hops or golf carts to give you a hand with your bags unless you park three feet away from the lobby door. If you want a shower, you'd be better off to get in the pool because the bathrooms have almost no water pressure and only five minutes of hot water to ensure that you do not consume too much. I have never been so glad to be home!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great room”
Reviews.Author: gcupi80
Reviews.Content: Going to Orlando with no kids and no plans for trips for Disney, I wasn't sure what to expect. Had to go for a convention, but also brought my husband for a little R&R. The hotel was beautiful and the service was very good. Great pool and great location in the middle of it all. Plenty of great golfing close by.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place Compared to others”
Reviews.Author: GloriasTravels
Reviews.Content: You don't know what you have until you stay somewhere else. We had a wonderful time at this Marriott. The location was great for quick access to Aquatica and SeaWorld. All other's reviews on bedding and pool are accurate. We checked out and went to Loews Universal Studios Royal Pacific Hotel to go to Isalnds of Adventure and Universal Studios. What a mistake. Other than the early pass into Harry Potter, which is over-rated, our experience was not nice. So enjoy this hotel and maybe stay at another Marriott close to the other attractions, but not in the park.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel with great pool”
Reviews.Author: EllicottCity_MDMoose
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and very pleasant staff. Restaurants were pricey but food was good. Only complaint is that they charge $13/day for internet. Most hotels provide free wifi. Seems a bit much to charge for this in an expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort”
Reviews.Author: nygator79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an extended weekend and it was fabulous. The hotel, grounds, and pool and gorgeous. Yes, everything is expensive there including food and alcohol. They do nickel and dime you with parking and tube purchases for the lazy river but I knew this before going so it was not an issue for me. Rooms are nicely appointed and clean. They are your standard size but the bathrooms are larger with a seperate tub and shower. The only negative is upon checking out, I realized that someone tried to bill things to my room that I did not purchase. The front desk was very friendly and handled this appropriately but it did take time to sort it all out. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel only if you are comfortable with spending a little more than usual on resort food and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular accomodation, Good resturants.”
Reviews.Author: stevemcl10
Reviews.Content: I traveled here with my work for a conference, it seems these hotels are used extensively for these sort of things. The entrance is very grand with a marble fountain in the middle leading to the main bar area and restaurants ahead. I had a standard room, modern design, extremely clean, very comfortable double bed, 42" flat screen with 40 channels, huge bathroom with separate shower and bath and of course nice toiletries and bathrobes! Absolutely no problems - very friendly staff. Breakfast was varied with loads to choose from and I had the buffet, but I didn't think it was that great, even for $25 a time (many American hotels don't include breaky). I also ate in the bar and the food was mediocre and have eaten on the pool restaurant which was actually quite nice. The hotel has several shops inside inducing a Deli and a Starbucks which I found unusual, but very handy ;-) I used the gym and both pools and I found these to be really good. The gym was huge, modern and clean with every type of machine and fresh fruit and flavored water :-) The pool next to the gym is tranquil and mainly for adult and carries $25 supplement but go down before 7am and you can use it free (btw I was still in UK time so it wasn't a problem!). The JW's pool has a river rapid flow thingy, but I hated this pool - it was 3 foot deep everywhere - far too shallow!! Car rental was approx $70 which i found expensive and this was me talking the girl into a discount! Overall, I'd recommend this hotel, but be warned it is on the pricey side.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cakegirl2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The employees we encountered from housekeeping, front desk, bell service, restaurant were very friendly and helpful. Was disappointed to be charged $15.95 per day for internet access. The lazy river pool is awesome. We also visited the spa which is located at the adjoining Ritz Carlton. We were very disappointed. The spa is dirty, missing hardwear on doors, feathers coming out of the pillows...not what we expected from this hotel. Would definitely recommend this hotel...just don't go to the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely; Great for Kids - Adults only? stay next door at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: BizM0m
Reviews.Content: Stayed for my husband's business conference. Lovely hotel - super clean and great service. Stayed here because my husband's conference was here - if going to Orlando for Disney, I wouldn't choose this hotel because of the distance. If I were here without my son, I'd stay at the Ritz Carlton next door. This hotel is great for kids for the pool activites and scheduled activities like Wii competitions and s'mores cook outs. All facilities are shared between the Ritz and the Marriott. The kids entertainment schedule should be posted online and not so difficult to find. I agree with other posters that the charge for the room's Internet connection is ridiculous, and should be complimentary. It's like charging for electricity.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed hotel, great pool”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler11594
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Amelia Island, FL for a five days and drove to Orlando to do Disney/Universal (specifically the new Harry Potter Wizarding World) for five days. We knew we wanted an off-park hotel that allowed us to chill out and forget the parks at night. We looked at the Ritz Carlton Orlando and saw that they shared the Grande Lakes property with the JW Marriott. We decided on the Marriott. Why? We knew we would be at the parks more than we would be in the room, and when we were at the hotel we would most likely be at the pool. These properties share access so either pool can be used by guests at either hotel, but the kids were really into the lazy river pool. In the end we just thought it would be easier to run back and forth to the room if necessary. This hotel is about 15-20 minutes away from the Disney parks, and 10-15 from Universal. It is closest to Sea World. We did not have any trouble or traffic driving from the hotels to the parks and we enjoyed having the car with us. Pros: *Our package included breakfast for us and our two children each morning which was nice. *Bell/valet service is EXCELLENT. I have to say they were probably the best valet/bellman I have ever had at any hotel, ever. That is saying something. I would like to particularly recognize Teddy. He hung out with our kids during check in-showed them the special kid's check in area and registration book, showed us around, arranged for a refrigerator to be delivered ASAP, and pointed out all of the sights from our 20th floor room. He was delivering wonderful service, but did so very enthusiastically and with a great smile and enthusiastic attitude. Each time we retrieved our car the valets referred to us by name (this hotel has 1000 rooms), ran to open our doors and offered chilled bottled water. *Service was great. Boarding passes were cheerfully printed, restaurant staff friendly, pool staff available and friendly, etc.. We sent out some laundry when we arrived (about 2:30 in the afternoon) and it was delivered back to our room by the time we returned from the park/dinner. I also had two packages delivered to the hotel. I was notified when they arrived and called down to the front desk. I didn't need to go down--they sent someone up with them. Immediately, not 20 minutes later. Each and every request was cheefully and quickly handled. *Facilities were well kept, spotlessly clean and very updated. Our room looked brand new. We liked the decor in the rooms very much--new and very updated. Great bathrooms. *Enjoyed the lazy river pool very much. Cons: *I don't mind paying for things I need or want to have. I (like most people these days) need internet service. This was truly our biggest issue. It is not complimentary. Fine--we accepted this. We paid the $15.95 charge per day. When I say the service was slow I am not exaggerating. It was slower than the old dial up. I waited over 5 minutes for the Disney website to load. It was extremely frusturating. I ended up using my iPhone instead, but this wasn't great for viewing the Disney Photopass pictures or Disney dining reservations. This happened with multiple websites. If I were there on business and this happened I would have been very upset. In fact, if I were there on business and the interenet were that slow I don't think I could have stayed. For $15.95 per day it should work properly. Overall I think this is a great hotel. It is remote (from Disney at least) but it is quiet and lovely. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but expensive and isolated”
Reviews.Author: OaklandJeff
Reviews.Content: Came here for a business conference. The facility, including the conference center, is attractive and well-maintained. The staff was uniformly competent and friendly. The food (brasserie, room service, and conference center) was excellent. But, the place feels like it is in the middle of nowhere -- certainly I couldn't see anything of interest within walking distance. And it is expensive. My rate through the conference organizer was $180/night for a standard room. Restaurant and room service prices are what you'd expect for a first-class hotel -- i.e., expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Business and Leisure Visit”
Reviews.Author: JamesBrett
Reviews.Content: Came to a trade show at this hotel with my partner and we arrived a few days early. Great pool with lazy river, two bars, and plenty of sun bathing areas. Awesome gym that is shared with the Ritz. In my opinion a lousy location, far from everything so the car service bills were high. If you are going to Orlando for a family vacation, I would not recommend this property, if you are a Marriott person, maybe check out the World Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for all ages!”
Reviews.Author: sunset777
Reviews.Content: Just came home from a great 3 nights at the JW. Really had a great time. Traveled with my daughter- in-law and three grandchildren, ages 2, 5 and 10. The 1st evening our husbands were there but because of their work schedules only stayed one night. We live in Sarasota, Fl. so it is an easy drive to this hotel. We had a ton of plans to go do different things but the hotel was so nice we didn't do many of them and just enjoyed the beautiful resort. Yes, at first the food does seen expensive but the portions are really big and can easily be shared. We were on a family pkg. and having done pkgs. many times the biggest problem is usually everything gets messed up. I almost always find charges on my bill for included items, not at the JW everything was perfect. This resort really did exceed our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Better hotels in a city full of choices”
Reviews.Author: Empire-City-Lover
Reviews.Content: Our stay was over a weekend in June. Friends also had a room at this same hotel. First time here, but not the last. Check in was professional and efficient. All reservation requests were included. Lobby was spacious and luxurious. We booked a king room with a rollaway for our teenager. The room was well appointed/furnished, on the 22nd floor overlooking the pool area. Not the largest room we have seen, but comfortable and very clean. The usual items....two bedside tables, work desk & chair, clock radio, side chair, flat panel TV, safe with a plug inside to allow charging your laptop while storing, coffee maker & comfortable bedding. Granite tops to furnishings & bathroom. Closet had iron, ironing board & two robes. Great led reading lights mounted to the headboard. Nice touch. We were close to the elevator & did not hear a peep in the room at night. Separate elevator banks serving the upper & lower floors. Never had to wait long for an elevator. Grounds of the hotel were very well maintained. This is a resort hotel with substantial meeting facilities attached. Plenty of eating choices including places at the adjacent Ritz-Carton. For a resort hotel some things seemed to close early. Shops including the Bodega & Starbucks closed by 9:00. Sushi served in the lobby bar only until 10:00PM. We ate breakfast on property at Citron two mornings, poolside food & pizza from the Bodega. All were good, not fantastic, but good. Pool, especially the Lazy River was a big favorite of our group. Never had trouble finding a place to sit. Plenty of shady & sunny spots to choose from. Could use more poolside wait staff. On Saturday evening they showed a movie outside in the pool area. We will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the JW Grande Lakes”
Reviews.Author: 888Main
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the JW Marriott Grande Lakes, and they did not disappoint. Our $179/night rate included breakfast buffet for two, free parking, and a $25 resort credit for each day (which went towards our lunches at the pool). I have to say that the hotel food is very good. Try the chicken nachos at Quench Grill. The lazy river was great. The pool area was not too crowded during our stay, so it gave us the opportunity to relax. The rooms are very clean, and the beds are very comfortable. Also, the level of service is exceptional. The hotel staff was extremely helpful during our stay, including restaurant staff and maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay! Can't wait to go back...”
Reviews.Author: FLMOMOF1
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at his hotel with our toddler son & we had a wonderful time. The hotel is beautiful, clean, & the service is great! All the staff we encountered were so friendly & helpful, and there were alot of amenities as well. On the lobby floor were shops including a Starbucks which was very convenient. The pool area was beautiful & the lazy river pool was perfect for entertaining our son. We enjoyed the pool very much as well. The food by the pool was great & there were always plenty of clean towels available for the guests to take. There spa & room service were also top-notch. Overall great time. Will definitely come back again & again!

Reviews.Title: “Fly Fishing”
Reviews.Author: rbrobbi
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Fly Fishing lessons were a total ripoff. 2.5 hours for $550 and 20 minutes of actual pond side fishing.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service in a beautiful setting.”
Reviews.Author: InfrequentFlyer315
Reviews.Content: Travelling with children is always exciting, and on a business trip to the JW Marriott Grande Lakes the last week of April, my 4 year old daughter became ill on the second day. The staff brought beverages and stuffed animals to both children, and checked on my daughter no less than 3 times during the remaining 2 nights of our stay. The grounds are beautiful - including a pool and surprisingly long and relaxing lazy river that does not seem to end. It shares the grounds with the Ritz Carlton, where a full service spa and yoga are offered. I only dined from catered meals at my conference, so no review of the couple of restaurants on site. It is in a pretty secluded area of Orlando - requires a car or arranged travel, but I could not have asked for more from the grounds or the staff.

Reviews.Title: “top notch class”
Reviews.Author: evon2010
Reviews.Content: Wewill return to the jw marriot in september, everything about this hotel is classy. My husband and i cant stop talking about this hotel. great sleep.great food,excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pools and gardens”
Reviews.Author: theresamk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at JW Marriott for one night. We were allowed an early check in with no questions asked,which after driving 7 hours was very nice. We stayed at the pools all day and had wonderful tropical drinks delivered by the wait staff. My Daughter age 11found friend and played in the lazy river until we had to drag her out. Food and drinks are somewhat pricey, but the ambience couldn't be beat. The hotels lobby was so lovely we took family pictures there.

Reviews.Title: “BRING YOUR OWN TUBES AND DRINKS”
Reviews.Author: wareagle540
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed a the JW last weekend for my niece's first trip to Disneyworld. I had stayed here before on business but never enjoyed the grounds. To say the least, I was shocked to find out that the tubes for the lazy river were not provided by the hotel. These cost $7 each and were a real pain to carry up and down from the room every day. The hotel should at least be a little eco-friendly and rent these to their guest so that they can be re-used and not have to be dumped after you check out. The only reason we paid the $250 p/n charge was to enjoy the lazy river and the pool but after all the charges, it make more sence to stay at a cheaper 4* hotel and use the savings to visit Typhoon Lagoon or Blizzard Beach. That way you wont have to buy the tubes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: VassarJean
Reviews.Content: My husband was at a conference and I tagged along. As with other reviewers, we found the service and amenities top-notch. A tip for people who complained about the tubes for the lazy river and the cost of the breakfast buffet - if you have a car, ask for a refrigerator for your room (no extra cost) and go to either one of the grocery stores or Walmart that are within 3 miles of the hotel and buy your beverages, breakfast food and pool rings for a lot less than they charge at the hotel (I usually only eat yogurt and a breakfast bar anyway). Also, the self-parking was not as far away as some indicated. I was in and out several times a day and found that the self-parking was much more convenient than valet. It was a short walk thru the convention area to the hotel. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next trip to Orlando. The pool area was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: MooneyPilot
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great complex. The service is first class. The check in was efficient and the room was nice as well. I have stayed at both the Ritz Carlton and the JW and not much difference in the rooms. The JW side of the complex is a bit busier and louder than the RC side. Both offer very nice rooms and amenities. The Restaurant, Primo, is first class with great cuisine. Also, on the RC side, Normans is wonderful. All in all. This is a great place to stay as long as you don't want to visit anything else in Orlando. If you do, the location is somewhat of a pain and the fact that the hotel is not near much else, means lots of driving to I Drive or Disney area.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: angienik
Reviews.Content: This will be our 7th year staying at the JW Marriott. This hotel is brilliant. We love staying here as its set in beautiful grounds which are lovely to have a walk around after breakfast. The lazy river swimming pool, again is amazing. This is the perfect hotel to escape the hustle and bustle of the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort stay for a trip to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: HulaAli
Reviews.Content: This is a huge hotel and not for the traveller who prefers an intimate boutique stlye hotel. If you like to have all the amenities that a resort brings then this has much to offer. We were made very welcome by all staff and they went out of their way to ensure we got a good room that met our requirements. As with all large hotels there is a lot of variety in terms of the views from rooms on different sides of the building. It's worth getting a lake / pool view if you want to feel like you're in a resort. As it is attatched to the Ritz Carlton there are lots of food options within the hotel - food is quite expensive on the whole but what you'd expect from this type of hotel. The only food place which disappointed us was the Citron brasserie - breakfast was fine but dinner here was not up to the standard expected. We made full use of the fantastic Lazy River pool with our 4 year old. It was well heated and always clean during our stay. A great base for exploring the theme parks if you like the freedom of getting away from them too! It only takes 20 minutes to drive to Disney and the others are even closer. We liked it so much that we returned for an extra week after we were stranded by the volcano in Iceland!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Bother Asking For A King Bed, Everyone Gets Twins”
Reviews.Author: Mozza47
Reviews.Content: Why is it that every time I stay in Orlando (a dozen times now) I get told "but your booking is for twin beds sir" - I NEVER book twins. But I always seem to get them in Central Florida! Is it because the great unwashed multitudes want to jam whole families into 300 square foot hotel rooms with too much oversized (American-sized) furniture when they visit the plastic entertainment capital? Or is it my continuing bad luck with this place? Nice (for America) hotel. Good WiFi. Good staff, nice friendly smiley people. The valet parking guys are great. And they get tipped accordingly! It works! The hotel sharing a few thousand acres of isloation with it's sister Ritz hotel is a bit remote. You need a car if you want to buy a bottle of water, or anything else. The in-hotel shops where you would otherwise buy that necessary bottle of water - seem to have pretty odd trading hours. Overall an enjoyable week. Too Expensive by far.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, not towels, hair in shower, $16 per day parking fee”
Reviews.Author: UInhappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be wonderful - expensive and new. But...rooms were small. Not enough towels - you think they were made out of gold. Staff was lovely - very kind. The shower was full of hair. If you are a member of the Marriot Frequent stay club - ask for free internet. Then...they charge $16 per day for parking in the middle of nowhere!. Stay someplace else- ask for the square footage of the room. Although new, this hotel needs help. Too much space for the loby, not enough for the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely FANTASTIC!!! :D”
Reviews.Author: visionaire20
Reviews.Content: This is a review for anyone who is sitting on the fence about staying here. Honestly, it is the best hotel that i have ever stayed in! the staff were amazing, especially the maids ( when she brought in the room service there was music playing and she did a little dance haha). The surroundings are pure lush, the rooms are lovely and the bathrooms leave nothing to be desired. All in all this hotel is pure amazing. I have actually just booked another vacation here for 2 weeks in july becuase i loved it so much. I cant imagine going to orlando now without staying here. Seriously, if you are looking for a luxury stay at great prices then stay here. I was here in August 2008 also and the hotel was just as good then as it is now. There was never any issues at the poolside regarding securing a lounger and that was in peak season, so im not too sure what some people are complaining about. I have had some of the best vacations here and i hope after reading this that you all will too :D

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Meriontulips
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surpised by the hotel. The lazy river pool was a big hit with my son and we both spent hours in the pool. Yes, it is true that you pay $7 for an innertube, but I found it was wirth every lovely minute in the pool. My only complaint about the pool was that it was hard to find two empty lounge chairs together, although we were there on one of the busiest weeks, the week before Easter. The rooms were very nicely appointed and the lobby was beautiful and spacious. As for the food, I would agree with other reviewers that it was wildly expensive, and some of it was not very good. The sushi and pizza in the lobby lounge is very good. The poolside food was very good. I would NOT recommend the downstairs restaurant, however. They have a buffet that is grossly overpriced and the food was yucky. A hidden gem is the bistro next to the Starbucks in the hotel; they have fabulous freshly baked croissants and sugared waffles. The hotel is 15 minutes from the airport and about 5 minutes from Discovery Cove and Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “not what it seems”
Reviews.Author: bschroeder
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok if you want to just stay the night and aren't interested in lounging by the pool or looking to have food and drinks by the pool. Plan on going to the pool by 8:00 a,m, to throw a towel on the chair, but that doesn't even guarantee you will get one. Two days out of our 4 night stay we didn't even get to enjoy the pool and on the last day some kid threw up in the pool and it took the staff hours to get it cleaned! We also waited at least 1 1/2 hours to get a salad for lunch and the room service food is horrid, and of course, very expensive. Make sure you plan ahead for your excursion/vacation plans because if you plan on using the hotels staff plan on waiting a long time in line. Oh yeah, and the pictures show a lazy river, you will need to pay $7 for a $1 inertube to enjoy the lazy river. This hotel is like paying for the steak but getting the hamburger. I have stayed at many JW Marriotts and this is by far the worst!

Reviews.Title: “We love it, will keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: MiamiManacas
Reviews.Content: One of the most complete Hotels in orlando. Best restaurants, amenities, children activities, elegant, very well trained staff and a lazy river to die for. We have stayed at this hotel several times and plan on coming back many more times. Just a lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “We love the J Dub in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: PineRidgePlayers
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Thurs through Sun in late March (first weekend of NCAA tournament). We have stayed here 3X in the past and once at the Ritz next door. For easy access to the lazy river, we like the JW better. The breakfast at the hotel restaurant on the lower floor is great. They custom prepare whatever you want: pancakes, french toast, waffles, etc. in addition to a large spread of fresh fruit, several breads, eggs and so on. Our breakfast was included in room rate - be sure you get this deal - it's a great breakfast and it's on site. The lazy river and its many pools are the real draw. If you have young kids, they will absolutely love it. I'm writing this review 2 weeks after our visit and the kids were talking about our visit this afternoon - they want to go back now. The rooms are very clean and anything above 6 will provide nice views of Orlando and Sea World. The grounds are beautiful. We went to Disney on two different days and trip is only about 15 minutes. Sea World is only 5 minutes. Wal-Mart and Publix are under 5 minutes. Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property”
Reviews.Author: ShariM
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. Rooms were very nice with huge bathrooms. The pool area was beautifully landscaped and had a wonderful huge lazy river pool. The water was nice and warm. Lots of kids activities and very nice staff. We had a birthday cake for our 5 year old's birthday and we didn't know if they would let us have it by the pool area but as soon as we walked in the pool area a staff member noticed the cake and said we were more than welcome to use a table by the pool for his party. It was wonderful. We've stayed at many Marriott resorts and this was right up there at the top. It only took us about 15-20 min to get to Disney. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: bella2001
Reviews.Content: From the minute you drive up to the resort you feel its luxury. The rooms are extremely clean. We stayed in an executive suite and the there was lots of room for 5 of us. The pool grounds are beautiful, plenty of chairs around the pool. You wont have to walk around it 3 or 4 times to get chairs. Wait staff around pool serving drinks and food were extremely courteous. Have to buy floats for lazy river, but were only $7. Didn't eat at any restaurants in the hotel but we did eat in the hotel lounge 2 times it was fast and delicious. They had pizza for the kids and sushi for adults, perfect. There is a path that goes around the Ritz and Marriot (they call it a nature walk). It is a really nice walk and they have information all around the path about the flowers, wildlife, etc. The gym is connected with the spa. The gym was really nice with very new equipment. After staying here, I don't think we will have to search any longer about where to stay. We all loved it!

Reviews.Title: “spectacular grounds, landscaping and pools”
Reviews.Author: traveler5125
Reviews.Content: This hotel is connected to the Ritz right next door and I have stayed at this place 3 times and enjoyed it every time. I have to say this hotel has the MOST beautifully kept property and grounds. The gardens are gorgeous the court yards are picturesque. If you just want to do nothing except enjoy your time around the hotel this is the place for you. It's great for taking walks around it. The pools are extensive and long. There is even an herb garden in the back and a lake to enjoy. It's also pretty nice if you are having a work event or conference there and you want to take your wife - because they can laze around and take in the sights. I agree that its pricey and like most pricey hotels you have to have to pay an exorbitant amount for every little thing (not like they come with free breakfast!); but that's just how it is. The entrance, foyer and public areas are quite jazzy too. I would not say this is the ideal place for small kids, because the pool is pretty extensive (goes around like a moat) and you'd have to watch them pretty closely. All in all a great hotel though and I would go back any time. PS. I saw Michael Jordan there with his entourage in the Ritz bar area. So who knows you may run into?

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel. Service was great...”
Reviews.Author: shelb333
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Service was great. The pool and lazy river were great. We got a few perks with our package, free breakfast for adults at citron restaurant and free parking. The food was exellent! We loved starting everyday with a healthy meal! Very kid friendly. My only negative comment was the noise in the evenings echoing from the outdoor seating firepit area located on the lakeside, obviously a party that was drinking a lot until 2 am!!! We had to call the front desk. Besides that the view was great and the location was very central to theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter20016
Reviews.Content: The past few years that we've visited the Orlando we've stayed at Disney's Grand Floridian and the Beach Club. We wanted to try Universal Studios this time and wanted to try another resort. This is by far the nicest Marriott I've ever stayed at. The rooms were spacious, clean, and modern. We had a couple great meals at Citron in the hotel and had a great time with the New Years celebrations (and fireworks!) that were on property. Although Marriott customer service via phone is horrible (agents are incredibly rude), I was pleasantly surprised to see how nice the staff was at this resort. The proximity to the Ritz next store is great as well, as we took advantage of the spa. Would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Landmark hotel that won't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: s0607427
Reviews.Content: It took some digging to find this hotel on our family's recent trip to Florida, but we were very, very impressed with almost every aspect of the JW Marriott. I've traveled all over the world and this hotel is one of the nicest hotels I've ever been to. The JW is very luxurious, and this is evident when you walk into the lobby with the huge fountain and the marble work. The property itself is intimating due to its sheer size and is located a few blocks from Sea World but removed from the chaos of Disney and Universal (which can be a positive or negative depending on how you look at it), and having the shops and a starbucks is definitely a plus. The rooms are spotless, seem brand new, and the beds are very comfy. The hotel has a very impressive pool complex, even compared with some island hotels i've seen...it includes a lazy river if you want to buy a tube. the staff was very friendly to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations-- and 10 tips on getting the most from your stay!”
Reviews.Author: mamakin2
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for the pool and the property and I wasn't disappointed (except by the weather!) The surprising part was this hotel's service team and how hard they worked to provide whatever was requested. It seemed like they'd all recently attended a 'can do' employee motivation workshop or something. I was called in advance of my stay by the concierge to ask if they could arrange anything for me. I arranged a cake to be delivered to my room and a spa appointment. Now, some tips on enjoying the resort! 1. This hotel is connected to a Ritz Carlton. The use of the Ritz gym is complimentary for Ritz AND JW Marriott Grande Lakes guests, so check it out. It opens really early, like at 5 or 6 a.m. The gym is great: spotlessly clean, friendly trainers, fresh fruit, infused waters, towels, headphones, and incredible equipment, many treadmills and other machines with their own TV. Trainers offered what upcoming classes they had that we might like to join. 2. The spa is also great! Wear or take a bathing suit so you can enjoy big hot tubs inside, the steam room, and the sauna. You can use the spa facilities all day when you have a scheduled appointment, I think. I took a book about an hour before my appointment and put on my spa robe, relaxed by a large hot tub, had a cup of tea, etc. before my lovely massage. Afterwards, I used the steam room and sauna and took my time getting dressed. You can shower there, and there's also a private spa pool you can use if you have an appointment. I think 20% gratuity is added to the bill already. The spa was busy when I was there, but my therapist was great and I really felt that I got my money's worth. 3. The hotel property itself is just lovely to explore and walk around. There's a rose garden, the pool complex is great, the lazy river was incredibly beautiful and relaxing, and poolside service was pretty good. We're not golfers but golfing is right across the bridge on a Greg Norman designed course. Plenty of towels for the pool and pool chairs- they charge for rafts, unless you bring your own. I gave mine away when I was done using it. 4. You can eat at any restaurant on the JW Marriott side or the Ritz side and bill it to your room, same with the spa and pools. 5. Internet is an unsecured network and it's like 15.95 a day....other Marriott properties offer free internet on the same iBahn network so this seems a little silly. 6. Parking is also not free, but self park in the lot and walk in any entrance to enter the hotel complex. 7. There is a Starbucks that opens early (6 a.m.,and many hotel Starbucks don't open until 7 and even then sometimes it's hit and miss) between the Marriott and the Ritz, in the connector strip. It is great to have good coffee whenever basically whenever you want, on the premises. 8. There's a safe and a small fridge in the room. The minibar isn't weighted, as some now are, so you can move the stuff inside around and put your own Diet Coke or snacks in there. There's a Whole Foods nearby and we stopped for hummus and pita, milk and cereal. 9. We found the staff very eager to accommodate any request that we had. They went out of their way to do things like offer an umbrella for the day when it rained, deliver my cake earlier than I had originally asked when I decided I wanted it earlier, and anything else we asked them to do. Housekeeping was good and they do offer turndown service in the late afternoon. 10. Finally, this hotel is about 10 mins. from Disney theme parks and less from Universal. We don't have kids so this was very convenient for us, and we felt this hotel was luxurious, quiet, and highly enjoyable. I would definitely return to this hotel to enjoy the pools, the great service, and the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mini vacation”
Reviews.Author: mamiled
Reviews.Content: Traveled here based on the reviews and the fact we weren't going to Disney. Also I got a phenomal rate of $125 compared to the rack rate of $325. I had my 60 year old mom and 7 year old son. I will start by saying my son loved the pool and couldn't talk about anything else. Due to the weather the pool was a little cold by my standards. The lifeguard said it usually is around 83, but due to the below average temps it was running about 78. Which to anyone over the age of 14 is cold! We arrived early at 1pm and were checked right in. Thanks to my moms Mariott reward staus we were offered free parking or free internet. Which was a $15 savings! Also, we called one night ahead and asked for a mini-fridge (you can do this and if they are availabel they will deliver) and it was delivered to our room about 20 minutes after we checked in. This saved ALOT of money on drinks etc. Example: Soda will run you 5 (they include gratuity in the bill automcatically at the pool bar) and a non-alcoholic Pina Colada is $9. The room was extrememly clean. The grounds and pool were immaculate. The staff very friendly. Very convienently located near International Drive (10 min). We had our own car, so getting out and about was easy. However, if you are not driving, I would plan on some high food and beverage bills. The beds were comfy with plenty of pillows. The nightly turn down service was a nice touch. And surprisingly for Orlando, our room was always cleaned by 1pm. I have no complaints and would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “A little far from Disney”
Reviews.Author: tgiddybuff
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel is definitely top notch although the front desk clerk upon check in was slightly condescending as we were on an Orbitz package. We were there school vacation week so this experience might not be typical for the rest of the year, but car rental prices were astronomical, so we took a Town Car back and forth to Disney every day. First class service but at $45 each way, ate our budget pretty fast. If you are traveling primarily to the Theme Parks, I would suggest a Disney property as all of the transportation/hotel transfers etc are included and you really don't spend that much time at the hotel. This hotel is more of a resort location and top notch for sure if that's what your vacation goals are.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced, Over Rated!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lindasue
Reviews.Content: Disappointed...5 star price, 3 star hotel. Geared for corporate travel only. Everything is so over priced. Told when we arrived internet would be 19.95 plus tax in room, or avail in the lobby and common areas. Failed to mention cost of 15.00 to use the internet in the lobby..really!!.. Super small rooms, very Hampton Inn at best. Pool area awesome.. however $5.00 for a tube to use the lazy river..crazy. Great hotel if you have deep pockets or your company is picking up the tab.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: heartwarmweather
Reviews.Content: I have traveled here a few times, with my husband, parents, and in-laws. I would highly recommend the JW, it is a beautiful resort. I love the entire ambience of the hotel, especially the pools and the lazy river. The pool area is one of the best I have seen, and everytime I have been it has never been too crowded. With plenty of chairs and space to spread out. It is a great place for kids and adults. Many kids activities to keep them entertained. We are family that loves Disney, however it is nice to get away from all the hustle and bustle of the parks and this is a perfect place to do it. The entire property is so peaceful and relaxing, with beautiful decor and well maintained grounds. With both my parents and in-laws buying timeshare weeks at the new Lakeshore Reserve, that is currently under construction next door to the JW, we will be attending this property for many years to come....and we can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: geicheydan
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here quite a few times we travling through Florida. The hotel has a silent charm to it. The property is quite spacious, your not bumping into other guest during your stay. The staff does a great job taking care of the guest. There no other place for me and my family to stay when in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis in orlando”
Reviews.Author: lngwlksnbdwthr
Reviews.Content: I could stay at this hotel for days and never leave. It's hard to believe you're in the city when you're at this hotel because of the lake and the golf course. I loved lazy river at the hotel as well as the running path along the lake. There was also an organic garden, a bocce ball court, and a butterfly garden (my favorite). It was a great place to relax. I even saw a crane and an armadillo on the premises of the hotel! The hotel lobby is impressive. There are also gift shops and a few eateries in the hotel where you can grab a sandwich or have a nice sit-down dinner. oh, and I don't know if this is a seasonal thing, but the fresh fruit offerings here are delicious. Especially the grapefruit!!!! I came here for business so I don't really know how easy it is to get to/from the local theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: GT M
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott Grande Lakes Orlando Well this review is a bit old. We visited for a few days over Valentines Weekend 2009. I am a new member to Trip Advisor so here it is. We live in Florida and visit Orlando area regularly. It was our first time to the JW Marriott Grande Lakes which is on the same property as the Orlando Ritz. I understand the two companies are owned by the same parent company. This JW Marriott is on par with any Ritz Carlton and is probably the most prestigious in the Orlando Area. My favorite is still the Marriott World Center in Orlando but this Resort is better in many ways. There is a cost savings over the attached Ritz Carlton and I thought the property was nicer. The hotel is designed in an old world/ old Florida type style. It located in close proximity to the Orlando area attractions. The two resorts are not attached but are separated by a world class Ritz Spa. Not many of the Ritz Carltons have a separate spa facility but this one does and shares it with the Marriott. The charges can be billed to the room. There are three pools on the property one at the Marriott, one at Ritz, and a adult pool at the spa (reserved for Spa patrons only). The ritz pool is adult themed (but children are welcome) and the spa pool is adult patrons only. The best pool by far is the lazy river themes pool located at the Marriott. There are a few outdoor pool restaurants. There are a lot of seating for hanging out at the pool. We mostly hung out at the Marriot pool (all three were heated in February) as we liked the foliage and shady areas, kind of more like a beach scene. The outdoor restaurants were nice, for pool food (burgers and drinks). I again felt that the Marriott’s outdoor grill was geared for this outdoor type food as the Ritz pool restaurant was more higher scale island themed food. The pool at the Ritz had rentable cabanas accompanied with large LCD TV’s and a small drink fridge/ bar. It may even include butler/ waiter service, but I am not sure. The property is beautiful and surrounded by golf courses. The inside restaurants are nice and serve great food (better than what you would expect from a Resort chain). We ate at the restaurant in the lobby of the Ritz and found the food to be a great romantic high end option. Good service and good food. We didn’t eat at the Marriott’s restaurant but the food looks decent. We did have Morning breakfast buffet at the Marriott and must say its better it’s a great option and a decent value. All of the food located on the breakfast menu is available in the buffet. I did sneak downstairs to the lobby bar for a drink and some sushi that they prepare right in front of you at the bar. In the Orlando area there are a lot of dinning options but the two resprts provide some decent dining if you are staying in. I do recommend the restaurant at the Ritz. Our room was the basic small room that overlooks the front/ side parking lot. Here was a lot of construction (Feb 2009) I think it was new Marriott timeshare buildings and golf center. I didn’t find anything special about the room. We did request and get a small fridge in the room. I must repeat the rooms were much cheaper at the Marriott for the same property. I would recomemd this hotel anytime. My girlfriend and I have noticed this Marriott resort on the Wheel of Fortune Show as a prize during most of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding facilities.. very good for big conferences”
Reviews.Author: yyzzaku
Reviews.Content: My firm held a senior manager training at the hotel from Nov 30 to Dec 3. About 550 people attended the conference. All the conference rooms (large or small) were well utilized and the facility made for a great conference. The food was okay, but i didn't expect too much as they are the typical hotel food. My room was great and the washroom is sizeable and very clean. The lobby was very grand and the staff was helpful and friendly. If i ever go back to Orlando, i will definately stay there again. In-room internet is pricey however, at about $16 USD per day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel159549
Reviews.Content: This JW Marriott is very nice. The lobby is impressive, and the rooms were spacious and clean. The location is fairly secluded, though it is less than ten minutes (driving) from Sea World. The hotel is built for conferences (it is massive), so one should expect to see large groups of people (who can tie up the elevators at certain times). The hotel had a very nice fitness center (large and with many different types of equipment and weights). It also had tennis courts, golf, outdoor pools, and incredible landscaping. The only downside was a large cockroach that I killed as it walked across the bathroom floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: SAlife
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my husband on a convention which was actually at the Ritz. We sure were glad we stayed at the JWM. The hotel is the largest one i have ever seen or stayed at, so we were a bit worried, but everyone was wonderful. the room had an awesome view, was clean and fresh. The lazy river was so relaxing, and the bar tender made most excellent drinks. We did bring our own float and were glad. the tubes there are more kid sized, but if you deflate them a bit, they work for adults. Many people just leave them there after their stay, so there were plenty around to use if you needed one. The river and pools were quiet and nice this time of year. We also sat outside by the torches one night and had some great sushi and wine. We had a rental car and went to universal, which was very close by as all the attractions. We did Disney last year and stayed on property, but if we ever do go back, I am staying at the JWM and happy to drive as this hotel is worth that. Food was great too, there wasnt anything lacking during our stay. there is a nice walking path around the "lake" and the spa looked very nice. The grounds are lovely too. I highly recommend JWM if going to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated; Sterile and boring”
Reviews.Author: JATB
Reviews.Content: I spent four days at the JW Marriott. The rooms were clean, comfortable and identical to all the other Marriotts in the world. My room featured stunning views of the parking lot and massive construction zone! The resort has a wonderful pool, but it was cold. I guess, my main issue is that this place didn’t really have a personality. The hotel catered our corporate meeting. Overall, the food was pretty good. However, one night about 50 of us got sick – I think we all had the mac & cheese, so you might want to stay away from that. They do have a great lobby bar. It lacks personality. It's over-rated. More on the trip: http://justanothertravelblog.blogspot.com/2009/11/business-in-orlando-florida.html

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachelrosy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to celebrate our 3rd Anniversary. The service from the moment we arrived was top notch. The smell in the lobby is amazing! We were upgraded to a room overlooking the lake/pool, and were surprised with champagne and strawberries in our room for our anniversary. Everyone went out of their way to make us feel special. The pool area was large and not crowded. They come around often to ask if you want drinks/food. We ordered lunch by the pool one day and it was very good. We also enjoyed having a drink by the fire outside the hotel lounge each night. We highly recommend this hotel and would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Pool!”
Reviews.Author: lane2004
Reviews.Content: I was at the Grande Lakes resort for a business conference. The conference rooms were very nice and appropriate for the size. The restaurants are pricey, but the food was good. I splurged one morning for room service - which was delicious, I recommend the omelet and potatoes, definitely a worth while treat. The hotel is attached to the Ritz by a large corridor that eventually leads you outside. The spa and fitness rooms are on the Ritz side, but not far away. The fitness room was also very nice for a hotel, lots of cardio machines and a very large weight area. There are several nice sitting areas outside for reading or enjoying the beautiful landscaping. The room was ok, the bathroom was very nice and my balcony was great. I somehow ended up in a corner unit on the 3rd or 4th floor, the balcony was very large and had a view of the golf course. The best part of the hotel though, is the pool, we made a point to float down the lazy river everynight (closed at 11pm). The float was inexpensive and easier to buy than pack. In summary, if in Orlando for a personal trip I would look at Grande Lakes, but the $ would probably be more than I would be willling to spend on my own dime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but expensive and isolated - 2nd stay”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights @ the conference rate of $199 per night plus tax. It is an imposing 5* hotel set by itself (along with the Ritz Carlton) on a golf course. The hotel itself is impressive with a great pool complex and grounds. However, the isolation means you must use the hotel facilities for food and drink - this is not cheap. There is nothing within reasonable walking distance. It cost me over $30 for a burger and (large) beer by the pool one evening. They automatically add an 18% gratuity (for your convenience – of course). There are a couple of outlets where you can sandwiches and coffee (one outlet is a Starbucks) but these are not cheap for what they offer and close about 6:00pm. I was there for a convention and it worked well for that. The internet is ~$18 per day when you include tax. There didn’t appear to be a option to log-in using a roaming account (which a lot of the full service Marriotts, which don’t have free internet, offer). I ended up using mobile broadband having learnt my lesson from my last stay. As I checked in I was offered a choice of free internet or 1,000 bonus points or something else (may apply to Marriott Rewards members only). Last time I chose the free internet and then found the internet charge added to the bill. Turned out the lady at check-in had neglected to mention that the free internet was for one night only. This omission in effect cost me $50! This time I chose the points. The gym is well stocked, if a little crammed, with good modern well maintained kit. Room was nice enough overlooking the pool and golf course - but then its a 5* hotel and should be. My interactions with the reception desk staff were all good but, remember, this is a 5* hotel and lacks that 'personal' element. I wouldn't stay here if it wasn't for the conference.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: dm1313
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - lovely lobby and the rooms where fantastic. Lovely pools and grounds around the place. Only gripes are... Self parking $15, cost of a tube to go into the lazy river $5, and also the restuarants are pricey! They offer a buffet but its not great - best buffet around is in the Gaylord Palms Hotel Villa de Flora restaurant which is close by. Would definitly stay again - rooms and hotel whre spotless and staff very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Ludicrous”
Reviews.Author: sueplanner
Reviews.Content: The pool was freezing and unkempt, there was a charge of over $21 per day for valet or about $16 per day for self parking and an internet charge of about $16 per day whether you used your computer in your hotel room or in the lobby. It's beautiful with good food, but I'd never recommend it given all the other wonderful properties around Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “You need a car...and a lot of money”
Reviews.Author: Snorkelr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a couple of times for business (conferences). The service is very good. The first night I arrived I called down to get a refrigerator and they brought one right up. Unfortunately it didn't work (the delivery guy didn't hang around to find out whether it worked) but when I called up again they brought another one right up. There was a lot of food and drink outside my room on my arrival, from the previous business conference that had been staying there. I did ask for it to be removed so they wouldn't come in the middle of the night and make loads of noise. They didn't remove it until, guess when? The middle of the night when it woke me up. Those bits aside, the service really is very good. The bed is very comfortable. The shower lost water pressure each day during my shower but it did come back each time. Eating here is very expensive and there is nothing within walking distance except for the Ritz Carlton. Parking is expensive as well, as is internet service. So it is certainly not a place to stay on a budget. I don't like to be overcharged for basics so I wouldn't personally choose to stay here. If travelling with a family I highly recommend Floridays Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Losing its luster”
Reviews.Author: Chon00
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times before and it is not being well-maintained. Our room looked dated, was not very clean, and the towels were not soft; all of these things used to be top-notch! Some of the staff acted as if we were a burden to them. I used to feel I got my money's worth as the hotel is quite expensive, but I will definitely not return. Instead, I plan to stay at the Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “A great Oasis and Launch pad for Universal Studio Parks”
Reviews.Author: pyrguy
Reviews.Content: Just had a second great stay at JW Marriot grande lakes. They are busy building a marriott time share/vacation property adjacent to teh hotel, but dont sweat it, construction noise and dust wont bother you. Magnificent multi sensory experience as you enter the marble lobby with running fountain, candles and a distinctive signature scent (Front desk staff calls it vermillion sunset and its supposed to be available as a spray soon in the gift shop.. apparently form their response Im not the only one who asks!) Great lazy river pool, and reciprocal use of adjacent Ritz Carlton guarantees something for everyone. Hotel staff cannot do enough for you, starting with David at front desk who displayed an amazing "can do " attitude when we arrived and he noted that southwest vacations had not booked our room, despite the voucher to teh contrary. David apologized and minutes later handed me the room key. No 1-800 calls needed, no arguing about how the property will get paid. He indicated around 10% rooms happen that way and not to waorry. Amazingly easy.. I cannot imagine the hassle that would have happened elsewhere under similar circumstance. Jeremy the Bell man was careful with the luggage and a real character. Not stiff and wooden, but not overly familiar either, a perfect balance. He expitied getting our roll away sen t up for one of the kids and grabbed us some extra spring water. Beds were crisp and clean and overall cleanliness of the room was great. Upscale bathroom products, 2 robes, coffe maker stored in closet and Disney XD channel on the flat panel TV made for a happy family. Front desk staff were warm and always greeted us as we passed through, valet was prompt and accurate, we loved the breakfast buffet at Citreon restaurant daily to start the day. In short another fantastic annual stay at this property... Looking forward ot next year... Keep up the GREAT work Guys! we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Orlando hotel with nice lazy river pool!”
Reviews.Author: mama2Atlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: Great location to go to any of the amusement parks. Also, a great destination in itself. My children are 9 and 5 and they both enjoyed the lazy river and hotel activities as an alternative to the amusement parks. Request a room with fireworks view to see a nightly show while in your PJs instead of a crowded theme park! Overnight parking can get expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Upscale Family Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine1229
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed @ the JW Marriott Orlando. After numerous trips to Disney we decided to stay onsite in Disney for the 1st week and end our vacation with a few days at a more "upscale" atmosphere. We expected a quiet relaxing stay and explained to the children that this was probably not a lot for them to do at this hotel except for the pool. Boy were we surprised at the amount of activities for young children. Everyday the hotel hosts numerous complimentary (or with a small fee) activities such as Kite making, painting, games. My kids (ages 7 & 9) could not wait to see what was going on each day. The hotel itself boasts a "lazy river" which is gorgeous. I was a little taken back with having to purchase the tubes for the lazy river. Kind of gets you with that one. Obviously you are going to buy their tubes with the lazy river sitting right in front of you. (to be completely fair - it was not that much to purchase them) The hotel has an amazing fire pit and they make samores a few times a week. In addition , they have movie night and activities at night. We actually rushed home for a great restaurant .. just so the kids could roast marshmellows. I think the proof lies with the kids --- we were scheduled to do Universal Studios one day and when I told them .. they began protesting stating that "they just wanted to stay at the hotel " . ... so we did ! Amazing - kids giving up an amusement park to stay at a resort. I can go on and on .. the hotel is amazing .. the beds are to die for (very spacious with comfortable beds). We did do the brunch one more and as amazing as it was -- it was not worth the amount. I think we paid about $100 for all 4 of us to eat there. Worth it - maybe however if it was less expensive we would have eaten there every morning. Just a bit too pricey for us. They do have a starbucks as well downstairs. The golf course is beautiful but we were unable to find time to play. Next time. We loved the location of the hotel. It was about 10-15 minutes from disney and about 5 from Seaworld however you would never have known it. Very quiet and resort like. A great place to get away from all the touristy craziness of Disney. Overall - amazing hotel and would stay there again in a heartbeat !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jek242
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel - - especially the fantastic lazy river and adjacent Ritz Carlton Spa and facilitiies. Primo restaurant is also oustanding.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: elisaNorway
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for business and got a good rate. Room was poorly laid out and looked crowded but was clean and in good condition. Nothing negative to add, just rather uninteresting...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skyleFlorida
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with my fiance for a company Christmas party and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Only 5 Star Hotel In Orlando!!”
Reviews.Author: xchf01
Reviews.Content: I've just completed my 20th stay at the JW Marriott..Each and every stay has been absolutely perfect. I've read some negative reviews on this site and can say from experience I have not ever experienced any dissatisfaction. I am not a Marriott employee, nor am I affiliated with them in any way. I am a satisfied repeat customer who really enjoys this property. Some people say it is overpriced. Resorts generally charge more for amenities than other hotels. You get what you pay for. The staff are professional and have made each of my stays enjoyable. This is a great resort to relax or play golf at. The lazy river pool is a big hit with kids and adults. I would not stay anywhere else in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place!”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict67
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we had the wonderful opportunity to stay at JW Marriott. If you are going to spend most of your theme park time at Sea World/Aquatica and Discovery Cove- those parks are less than 2 miles from the resort. Of course, the staff at both JW Marriott and The Ritz Carlton, which shares the property are top notch. We booked a package that included breakfast at the buffet which was fantastic- BUT- most would say not worth the $25 that they charge for those going without a breakfast package, so it's worth it to add it on. The pool is absolutely FUN. For kids and adults! It's pretty much a mini-waterpark with a lazy river. Bring a tube unless you want to shell out $7 each for tubes at the Marriott! YES- bring your wallet- everything is EXTREMELY EXPENSIVE at this resort! ($16 for parking; $170 for LUNCH for 5 at BLU poolside cafe at the Ritz; The sushi bar in the lobby at JW was GREAT but also extremely expensive- $110 for 3; margaritas poolside at either resort are $14; etc). The entire resort is very clean and neat and rooms have extremely comfy "Marriott" signature bedding. At JW- all rooms have a "balcony" but you can't sit out there as it is extremely small. Poolside rooms have views of ALL theme park fireworks shows , which is neat to watch from your balcony! Bathrooms are gorgeous- shower and tub, but no spa jets or anything like that. Rooms have a mini-bar but no fridge. Plenty of closet and drawer space. HINT: ALWAYS check what convention is in town before you book here! You can tell by the name of the convention if it's going to be people you want to spend your vacation with! We were there with a VERY loud group of convention-goers that were bothersome at the pool and in the lobby area, but it wasn't too bad. We didn't use the golf course, but the gym was nice and the walking paths around the resort are great - lots of water birds , etc to view. All food we had (at the breakfast buffet, poolside cafe's at both resorts and the sushi bar was wonderful, but WAY overpriced! Service, of course was superb. No shuttles to theme parks, but driving is easy - all signage is clear around central Florida!

Reviews.Title: “Fiasco with shuttle but still a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jm852
Reviews.Content: Nicest hotel in the area. Beautiful, clean, and comfy. Check-in took less than a minute. I went from friday to tuesday. Apparently prices for food are doubled on weekends so lucky us. A personal pizza, cheeseburger, ice tea, and lemonade cost us $63. All of the food was great, just extremely expensive but this is a JW Marriot so I had already prepared myself for it. Breakfast buffet is the best I've ever seen. Definately worth the money. Beer beware.. Walgreens, about a quarter mile or so away, sells cases of all sorts of beer alot cheaper than the hotel. The hotel beer went to $5 a beer so we stocked our mini fridge with beer we bought from walgreens. The pool is AMAZING. We don;t have any kids but we did spend a lot of time in the pool ourselves anyway. Perfect for if you have kids. Just make sure you buy a raft before you get to the hotel or they will charge $7 for it. We had fun without a raft anyway but I know kids love those things. The Discovery Cove Nightmare.... My boyfriend and I went to Discovery Cove. The night we checked in, I checked with the hotel that they transported to and from Discovery Cove. They said yes and told me that it leaves at 8:30 or so and returns at 5:20. Since we had to check-in at 8 or so at Discovery Cove she suggested we take a cab or towncar there and then the shuttle back for free. The morning we left, I stopped in again to double check I had the times right and to make sure we could get a shuttle back if we took a towncar over. Once again the man working confirmed this. At 5pm, we went outside to where they said they would pick us up. Since it was pouring raining at that point we expected the shuttle would be a little late so when it was 10 minutes late we didn't think too much about it. 30 minutes late, 45 minutes late, almost an hour later I called the hotel to see if everything was ok. I was then told that no shuttle existed and I was not told this. My boyfriend witnessed them telling me this. The person I was on the phone with argued it wasn;t possible and that if I wanted a ride home I should get the shuttle from SeaWorld to the hotel that left at 5:55. This is at 5:53 and I was at Discovery Cove NOT Seaworld. They then basically said oh well get a cab and I told them I refused to pay for this when they lied. I demanded to talk to the manager. Frustrated beyond belief I hand the phone to my boyfriend to deal with. Toward the end of the conversation the manager agreed that we get a receipt from the cab and the hotel would pay us back. By that time the workers at Discovery Cove noticed we were waiting for an hour and had called a personal driver of their's to take us to the hotel free of charge. Unsure if the hotel would actually stand true to the offer, we accepted the free ride. They were so sweet the driver wouldn't even accept a tip. To sum things up the hotel manager appologized for what happened and said she would "get to the bottom of this". Yeah ok...I wouldn;t have cared if they said they didn;t have a shuttle, it's the fact they lied and we sat outside when it was raining for an hour, wasting all that time. Anyway, I doubt any of this would happen to anyone again. The place was beautiful inside and out so I would recommend. Definately a beautiful conference area.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME lazy river”
Reviews.Author: hoteldivaFl
Reviews.Content: Awesome time at the JW marriott. I would suggest getting the romance package. For fifty dollars more you have valet included ($21) and breakfast for two in the Citron ($50), later checkout (until 2) and champagne and strawberries. So definitely worth it for us. Watch your floats ($7 each plus tax) as they can get picked up by people. The food was pretty expensive so bring snacks to your room (I wish I had thought ahead). i was there for labor day and they had an awesome fireworks show! very nice, very classy. Great weekend hotel but get ready to spend an arm and a leg on food and drinks (two shots at the pool bar were $28 !!!!).

Reviews.Title: “5 Star all the way!”
Reviews.Author: james5171
Reviews.Content: Stayed that the JW for 2 nights beginning 9/3. From the time we checked in, to the time we left, everything was great. No trouble checking in. We had called to see about an early check-in. They told us to stop in, and if they had a room, they would hold it for us. The room was updated and overlooked the pool. The property is awesome, especially the pool. Just a couple of complaints. 1) Just have some tubes by the pool for the lazy river. It's a resort with a lazy river, and they don't provide guests with tubes to float on. 2) When we first arrived, we had a terrible time trying to find where to park. All the reviews about the parking would be true. Self-parking is quite a "hike" from the hotel. The $15 per day charge is unnecessary as well. 3) This is the second JW I've been to this year that doesn't provide free internext access. Why can I get that at any Marriott Courtyard or Fairfield Inn, but not at a JW resort?! Still, would recommend a stay to anybody..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort, Pool, Food and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter12377
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Orlando Grande Lakes was a fantastic resort for families trying to escape the hustle and bustle of the theme parks! We spent some of our days at Disney and after a long hot day at the parks, an evening on the JW’s Lazy River pool was very relaxing. The service at the Bellstand, Front Desk and Concierge was very personable and warm. Our room was very clean and the housekeeper was so friendly- they even made a special effort to arrange our kids stuffed animals on the beds after preparing the room.
