Also, they left extra chocolates upon turndown for our kids- they loved it!!!!! The food was high priced, however the convenience, selection and quality was totally worth it. My favorite was Primo (the pork saltimbocca- yummy!). We also loved how “Green” the hotel was with their organic garden outside of the main restaurant- our kids thought the garden was amazing! Next to the organic garden was a butterfly garden which was also a hit- there was even a ladybug release at the Ritz Carlton that is next door during our stay. The only drawback that we found was that you had to pay for pool floats at the pool. However, I suppose the silver lining in this fact is that you always get a new pool float and you do not have to use a float that someone else laid on with their oily sunscreen. All in all, it was an amazing resort, tons of things to do and see for everyone and the staff was very friendly, personable and created a wonderful experience. We are planning our next trip for 2010!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great!”
Reviews.Author: suzy_and_bob02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are used to great spas and retreats but we stay mostly on the West Coast. We were visiting a friend in Orlando and also celebrating our wedding anniversary so we decided to stay at the JW Marriott in Orlando (it is connected to a Ritz Carlton, I have never seen two hotels connected to each other before.) Anyway we were amazed by the beauty and service. First of all the spa is world class ( we did a couples rosepetal bath) but the best was the pool, the bar, and Primo. The pool has an amazing Lazy River and great food. The sushi at the main bar was out of this world (we love sushi) and the bartenders were very knowledgable and funny. The fireplace outside went perfectly with our Mojitos. When we wanted to have a nice meal the bar manager suggested we go to Primo he said that even though he worked at the hotel that it was his favorite restaurant (instantly we were skeptical) but he could not have been more right. The atmosphere and staff's wine knowledge were nice touches but the food was amazing. You have to have their signature Pork entree. The only (and this is a small criticism)thing is that it is not located near alot of great night-spots away from the hotel(nightclubs,etc.) We had to take a taxi about 15-20 minutes for those. The little time time we spent in our room was great (we had a great view of the pool---it's huge by the way). We plan on a return visit soon and may make this our east coast getaway!!

Reviews.Title: “5* All the Way - Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MellieC
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have EVER stayed in The reception Hall is huge . The rooms, views, golf, lazy river, pool area is 5* all the way. The restaurant is to die for and the breakfast buffet bar is perfect. We couldnt get enough of this place. Only tried it for 2 days and wished we were there for a week. We paid £125 per night and what a bargain! I'd booked it as a surprise for my husband and 2 children aged 15 and 11. They were blown away. Only thing that is a pain and totally un necessary is the $15 per day parking fee. The Marriott should lose this charge as having read a few reviews this seems to be a bone of contention for alot of guests. This is the only hotel I would stay at, much better than its sister hotel next door the Ritz. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, one of the best in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: favargas
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of hotels (I' am a gold elite with Marriott and a Diamond VIP with Hilton) This is one of the best hotels in Orlando and will recommend for both families and business travelers, I have always been treated very politely and upgraded. I always recomend this hotel to my coworkers if going to Orlando and use it for romantic evenings the hotel pool is great!!! one of the best ones, they have fireworks during major holidays and is a great thing to see if you happen to have a room with a balcony. overall a great property. (No concierge floor though, as an elite member you will receive 1000 extra points though)

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the JW! treat yourself to an executive suite!!”
Reviews.Author: joquendo
Reviews.Content: Im surprised to see reviews of long lines at reception and bad service. I did not experience that at all. In fact, they went above and beyond. Upon check in, I requested a pool view and was given it with no problem. I am an elite member so used Marriott points to stay here. Was also given a choice of free internet, parking, or points for the duration of the stay which as nice. Check in was friendly and quick. Room was decent, not fabulous, but nice. pool view beautiful. Elevators are incredibly speedy! Room was very clean but housekeeping was a bit off. Not as tidy as i am used to with Mariott (and I always tip the housekeepers daily) However, we did decide to extend our stay and splurge on an exectutive suite the last 2 days which was completely FABULOUS and housekeeping was perfect. It was a corner room with a huge king bed and a separate sitting area with a pull out couch which my 11 year old loved. Bathroom MUCH bigger and better. I LOVED that room! I think it was room 12058. We only ate at the pool side restaurant. Service at your pool chair or table service. Great service, great food, good drinks but EXPENSIVE!!! Although I have to say I have come to expect this on vacation. Starbucks in the lobby was so nice to have. The lobby is just beautiful. Marble, fountains, huge, great lobby bar with very nice staff and bartenders. My son loved the sushi there. Again, food was pricey but very good. The hotel is attached to the Ritz via the 2 conference centers. The fitness center is completely awesome. I loved working out there. Great, brand new equptment. lots of it. You can use all the amenities at either hotel. My son loved the Ritz Carlton pool even better than the JW. The provide free rafts too. The JW charges for their tubes. We had brought ours from a previous stay there. Better label your tube or it will "dissappear". The pool side service is much friendler and attentive at the JW pool. The lazy river at the JW is spectacular, very relaxing and fun and long too. They do charge for parking which gets expensive. The hotel is not within walking distance to anything else so that may bother some people. They are currently buidling a new Marriott timeshare next store, construction noise was a non issue and it looks like its going to be beautiful. Would I stay again? probably not only because I travel to Orlando frequently and like to try other hotels but I would reccomment this hotel. your kids will love it.

Reviews.Title: “What a total letdown ... YUCK”
Reviews.Author: KarenandScott
Reviews.Content: The air conditioner broke in our Orlando home. It was the weekend. The repair company could not get us a new part until Monday. My husband who is a physician was on call. I used my government employee ID to secure a quick reservation at this Marriott which was the closest to our home. We arrived and the parking was discombobulated. Went to the desk, showed my ID and was told it was not a "real" government ID ... I explained it was and demonsrated why and was told NO. But I could get a room at the regular rate. I asked if there was anyone else to speak to and was told no. So we left. On the way home I called customer service, they assured me the people at the hotel were wrong. The manager called us and told us to come back to the hotel and he would give us an upgraded room. We did. We arrived and once more they took my ID and this time photocopied it (I feel uncomfortable with this because it has my employee number) ... The manager escorted us to the elevator and gave me a lame excuse (and a different excuse) as to why my ID did not seem like a government ID. We went to the "upgraded" room which was yuck a crammed sofa into a small bed (they said a king which I highly doubt). There was no remote control 3 phone calls to the front desk and an hour later it was replaced. I went out on the balcony and there was a cup with cigarettes and matches strewn all over it (lovely the maid's I guess do not go out there). The pool was okay but it was crowded and dirty ... come to think of it the halls were pretty dirty as was the outdoor patio areas of the place ... the food was overpriced and kind of uninspired. But, the pools were so crowded and dirty that we went through the maze and used the spa pool to swim (empty and much nicer). Even the sheets were not that clean or great ... I went home and got some top sheets ... It was a huge disappointment on so many levels. A suggestion: if they are going to make a nonsmoking policy please get ashtrays for the outside areas ... the place was awash with butts ...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but avoid the restaurants”
Reviews.Author: sld0923
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at the JW Marriott. The hotel was beautiful and the service from the hotel staff was fantastic. I had a wonderful view of the pools from the balcony of my 12th floor room; however, I found the room to be a little small. My travel companion and I tried to avoid the hotel restaurants because they are are very expensive, but we did choose to eat breakfast one morning in Citron. We opted to order off the menu rather than the buffet, and the service was terrible. We waited approximately 15 minutes for our waiter to come and take our order, then another 30-45 minutes for our food and fresh coffee. The food itself was nothing spectacular despite the $13 I paid for 2 scrambled eggs, toast, bacon and potatoes. Overall I enjoyed my stay and will recommend this resort to anyone traveling to Orlando for business.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond Oasis”
Reviews.Author: acruiser
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 enjoyed 5 nights at the JW Marriott. in mid-July. This hotel is absolutely beautiful and the service was 5 star! I'm a stickler for cleanliness and this hotel was very clean. Every staff member that we encountered greeted us day and night and were willing to assist in any way needed. Our requests were met with speed and accuracy. This is a great hotel situated on 6 lush acres away from the theme park traffic and madness. It's a quick 10 minute drive to Sea Word and 15 minute drive to Universal. To reach Disney it' about a 15 -20 minute drive using the tollway to avoid traffic. We found nearby local restaurants with good and reasonably priced meals (e.g. $10 for a one pound snow crab drinner) within a 7 minute drive of the hotel and with immediate seating. Having read previous reviews regarding the $7 charge for lazy river tubes, we opted to bring our own tubes which were much better than what the hotel offered and our cost was $7 per tube. You really don't need a tube for the lazy river so just enjoy a swim in it. We enjoy water sports so we will definitely get much use out of our tubes. The lush landscaping surrounding the pools gives the feel of an island getaway, definitely not Orlando. I must agree with other reviewers that the daily parking charge is too much given the location of the hotel. Charging guests $15 daily for self-parking on a 6 acre property is truely outrageous! An urban downtown setting is acceptable for such parking charges, but at this location it speaks of utter greed. We had friends traveling with us who opted to stay elsewhere because of the unreasonable parking charges added to the room rates. I can say that being away from the hustle and horrible traffic jams around the theme parks is a great advantage of this hotel. Being from a major metropolitan area we face traffic jams daily and had NO problems with the location of the JW. The hotel was booked to capacity with a convention during our stay, but we never felt that the hotel was crowded and the pool area had plenty of seating and was never overcrowded. Whether at full capacity or not the JW provides the perfect getaway for its guests. We thoroughly enjoyed the JW and will return in the future. Give it a try. It's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service - not a typical JW”
Reviews.Author: RPKTexas
Reviews.Content: Service was really poor, especially the restaurants. Apparently they have contracted out their services which explains why the service was so bad. I would really suggest against staying here. We complained to Marriott, still waiting to hear back.

Reviews.Title: “J W Marriott Orlando Terrific Property”
Reviews.Author: njnetsfan
Reviews.Content: I have just read some negative experiences for the JW Marriott in Orlando and I must respond. My family and I have stayed (and will stay again this year) at the property and it is exceptional. The rooms, furnishings and service are terrific. The pool is an attraction itself and the property includes a Ritz Carlton. I have more than 30 years of experience staying in hotels for both business and pleasure. In addition I am a Marriott Platinum member for the past 25 years which means that I stay at least 75 nights a year in marriott properties and this is one of the better locations (JW in Las Vegas is the best JW in the US). Is the hotel large, in comparison to other Orlando Hotels it is comparable. there are multiple restaurants on location in all price ranges. Don't know if the other reviewers who were not favorable to this location were familiar with resort hotels but found this hotel the right size with the right features

Reviews.Title: “Losing a little of the first class touch”
Reviews.Author: monbri9931
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott the weekend of July 17, 2009. This marked my sixth stay bouncing back and forth between the JW and the Ritz since they share the same property. I brought my parents as part of their birthday present. I will jump to the chase of this review. The JW is still in a class of its own, but I think it is starting to show some cracks in their service and rooms. The rooms are still very spacious with great views and large lcd television. But our showers (we had two rooms) had mold in the grout and the drain cap had gunk on top of it and underneath. Clearly had not been cleaned in a long time. That was about enough to make me sick. The carpets are starting to show their wear and will soon need to be replaced. The other issue I had was the valet. It was not that busy at the hotel but the valet was off their game. I had called for our car to be brought up and waited 35 minutes. Then when they brought the car up I walked over to it only to have the valet run to get another care with my keys. I had to wait another 10 minutes to be able to leave. An honest mistake but these kinks should have been worked out by now. Other than these issues the JW is a fine hotel and will be able to cater to anything you ask. I just think they need to brush up on some of the issues in this review.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok, service-terrible”
Reviews.Author: srqflorida
Reviews.Content: We visited this property last weekend with our 3 children and another family with young children. Our purpose was to visit Sea World and Discovery Cove. The grounds and buildings are absolutely massive like most things in Orlando. While I knew what I was getting myself into, some things were really annoying and most of these things had a service component. Luckily we had a corporate rate or it would have been worse! Pros: * Clean * decent room * decent pool area * great breakfast buffet Cons: * double beds * terrible restaurant service (with the exception of the bkfast cooks who were great) * skeleton crew at the front desk with very long lines * Had to pay for float at lazy river (which wouldn't have been a big deal except that we had to cart them around and trip over them in our room) Finally, our room key did not work on three separate occasions and no one ever came to fix it. We had to keep walking the 1/4 mile down to the desk, stand in line, and have them reprogram our keys!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel. We're coming back!”
Reviews.Author: PLRamirez
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott was the site of our Corporate Conference so as you imagine, it's a large property. This was an incredible place and offered very luxurious rooms and every amenity. In fact, we have already rebooked this hotel for June 2010. The hotel has a plush spa and shares that amenity with the Ritz Carlton. You are a bit further away from Walt Disney World, but that's not a bad thing. This is also a good family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about JW Grand Lakes”
Reviews.Author: bigteacher
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW for five nights with extended family last June. The Hotel has many pluses. We got a terrific AAA rate. The pool is absolutely terrific. You can use the pool at the Ritz, but the Lazy River Pool is awesome. The hotel is fairly new and clean. The rooms are a decent size with huge bathrooms. On the negative side, you get charged for everything! There are no options for eating or shopping within walking distance of the hotel. The parking was also pricey at $15/day for self park. The food was quite good at the restaurants, but again quite pricey. Worst of all, the service was quite spotty. At Citron the dinner service was nothing short of a disaster the two nights we dined there. While servers tried to be accommodating and helpful, food was late getting to tables and orders often misunderstood. Service at the front desk was also, to say the least, JV. The people who checked you in did not seem to be at all empowered to help guests resolve any problem beyond replacing a room key. For instance, a woman in front of me in line was leaving for the airport and needed to make a quick call home to North Carolina to arrange a ride. No one at the desk was sympathetic or helpful, so I let her use my cell phone. The worst example was on the last day we were there, we could not extend the stay for my parents without paying a much higher rate ($330), even though my mother had been told that she could earlier in the day at the $150 rate we were paying. The manager on duty was unavailable all afternoon to resolve this issue. While he did explain they were fully booked after we waited to see him for five hours, he implied that my mother was not being truthful when she said that she had been told that she could extend at the lower rate. So much for good manners. Also if they were fully booked, why was a room available for $330? Fully booked usually means you're looking for another hotel. So we checked out of the JW and went over to the Ritz at the other end of the property, which charged us $249 for the last night with free buffet breakfast and free valet parking under a reconnect package. We made these arrangements with no help from the enlightened staff at the JW. The Ritz at $249 with the parking and breakfast is not cheap, but is a much better value considering the shabby treatment we got at the JW.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property!”
Reviews.Author: IrishFan-80
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here for a week on vacation and had a great time! The property is terrific....spectacular lobby, well appointed rooms, fantastic pool, nice spa, super breakfast buffet!! We found it easy to get around from here--to Sea World, International Drive's restaurants and Universal. Disney is close too. As a frequent rewards traveler the front desk waived the wireless internet fee (it should be standard everywhere!!) but would not waive the parking--a stupid charge for self parking on a huge property. Fortunately the system malfunctioned so much they did not charge us anyway. The highlights were the daily breakfast buffet--get the package that includes it, and the day at the pool. The food prices are twice what they should be but the lunches at all venues-pool, spa, golf club, & Ritz pool were very good. Service everywhere was with a smile. Yes we would return but we had so much rain it will be awhile.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: snoop75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property from June 14th – June 20th and were really happy we stayed here. It was our first vacation with our 17-month-old toddler so we were looking for a family friendly location and were not disappointed. The Room: Was a bit small. There was hardly any space for our little one to spread her wings. The bathroom however was great, a bathtub and shower and to be honest almost half the size of the room. It was clean and we had nightly turndown service, which was nice. It was wonderful to come back after dinner and have a refreshed room. We also received a free refrigerator to accommodate milk, etc. for our toddler. The Pool: Single handedly made the money we paid for this facility worth every penny! The lazy river was AMAZING. It was great to get on an inner tube and just let the river do the work. Yes, it is slow, but it’s called a lazy river and what’s the rush? My daughter loved going around time and time again on her floaty. Tip: If you are planning to go to this property with a little one buy a shaded floaty or toddler/infant friendly floaty from home. The hotel doesn’t have much variety. And the shade was really helpful due to the sun. The Food: We tried not to eat much at the hotel, as the prices are very high. We were there six nights so definitely had to pick and choose where we wanted to splurge. Breakfast was included with our package so we ate at Citron every morning. It is a buffet style with made to order omelet, pancake and French toast station. On our last day, Saturday, I did see them also making eggs benedict at the station too, however it might just be a Saturday thing, as I did not see it any other day. They also had sausage, bacon, potatoes, scrambled eggs, as well as a large variety of fresh fruits and pastries/breads, etc. It was all very good; my only complaint would be that it was EXACTLY the same everyday. Just a little variety would have been nice. We also ate dinner at Citron one night and the food was excellent! Specifically the Half Chicken my husband ordered. It was amazing! The pool bar, Quench I believe, also had good food. The drinks were also very yummy but not that strong. For $14, I was expecting a drink with a decent punch, and there was none. The only other place we ate would be the lobby lounge. I ordered sushi there one night and it was TERRIBLE! I have had subpar sushi before, but the rolls I had there were inedible. I was SO disappointed and more so because I paid $35 for 2 rolls! The Service: I was really impressed with the staff. Everyone was really friendly, accommodating. Basically all smiles and very welcoming. They were all so nice to my little one. Overall I would really recommend this hotel for families and maybe a girlfriend getaway. It’s more for relaxing, not much for nightlife, etc.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to spend the 4th of July holiday!! Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: angelinaaatlanta
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children (11yr & 7 yr) spend the 4th of July holiday at the JW Marriott Grande Lakes. What an amazing property from the entrance and beyond. We pulled to the front at about 12:30pm and went in expecting to be told to come back at 3pm to check in, but they had our room ready, a bellman waiting and unloading our car and offering to valet the vehicle. As soon as you arrive they are working hard to please you and they continue that same approach throughout your stay. I arrived and they gave they made sure that both my children received the welcome give even though they should have only received one. Since I was a Platinum Rewards member they send us room service with a small bottle of wine and Ben & Jerry's ice cream for the kids. What a nice touch! The hotel sits between the Ritz Cartlon Hotel and the Ritz Carlton Spa. Behind both properties is a view of a lake with bicycle/golf cart travels and the golf course. The resort that their own fireworks on the golf course/lake area. It was SPECTACULAR and so wonderful to be standing on a private resort with a cocktail and watch the fireworkks in a nice crowd of people. From the 25th floor poolside you can see the nightly fireworks all seaworld, epcot, magic kingdom...it was like seeing 4-5 of the best celebrations from the comfort of your own hotel window...what a perk! At the JW, resort personnel passed out glow sticks and glow watches for the kids during the celebration. There was something there for everyone. Even a surprise on last evening there, turn down service while we were at the firework celebration by the pool/lake with mints. Such attention to detail is given to all from couples and families. I can't say anything negative about this property it was an amazing holiday vacation. I would like to offer a couple helpful tips to parents: you have to purchase the lazy river tubes ($7/each) bring or know that you will need to buy one when you get there, parking was a little expensive ($16/per day - self parking). Those aren't negative just things to remember as you planning to stay at this absolutely amazing resort. I would definitely stay there. We just arrived home today and I truely miss being there.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel - go there”
Reviews.Author: Tugwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights, using it as a base to visit the theme parks. From the second you turn into the manicured driveway, you know you are goingto be in the lap of luxury. We would definitely go back. The room was fantastic, large, with a great view over the pools and golf course, with the addition of the Seaworld firework spectacular every evening. The staff were friendly and very helpful - especially Phil, who brought our bags to our room. We did have a small problem with a blocked loo but within 5 minutes of alerting reception, the maintenance guy had been to our room and fixed it. The buffet breakfast was very good - some people might consider it pricey at $24 (approx. £15), but when you think what you pay for breakfast in some London hotels, it is an absolute bargain. You can have as much as you want - fruit, pastries, bacon, etc, with Chef Oscar making fresh pancakes, omelettes, waffles and more, upon request. The serving staff were attentive without being over-bearing. Other than breakfast, we didn't eat in the 'formal' hotel restaurants, although we had a great burger at the poolside bar, 'Quench'. I am trying to think of something negative to say about this hotel, but I can't. My only regret is that we couldn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Lazy River, Awesome Service... a Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: dfrishe
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed here for two nights while my husband was in Orlando on business. We got an amazing rate of $109 per night which is an incredible deal for a hotel of this category. The grounds are immaculate, especially the lazy river and pools! My daughter had the best time in the lazy river although there's not much of a flow to keep you moving without some work on your part. My husband visited the driving range one evening. $20 for unlimited balls, top of the line loaner clubs at no charge, and personalized attention that puts our club back home to shame. We will definitely bring our own clubs and plan time to play golf next time. The hotel is convenient to the parks. Sea World and Universal are closest but we were only 20 minutes from Disney (take John Young right out of the parking lot to Osceola Parkway which is a straight shot to WDW). Lots of restaurants and shopping close by. The rooms were plush and the bathrooms were huge. We had a small balcony, albeit not large enough for any chairs. But it did afford us a wonderful view of the grounds below, the lazy river, pools, golf course, and nearby fireworks of several parks. The service from the bellmen, Teddy on arrival and Chad on departure was exceptional. Front desk service was friendly as well. We did not eat at any of the on site restaurants as they are the most overpriced I've seen -- and we are not cheapskates at all. I would highly recommend this hotel to almost anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place for families...”
Reviews.Author: Poohh66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW a few weeks ago and totally enjoyed it, we were with a 12 yr. old and a 21 yr. old, the room are small but very comfortable, the staff was very helpful and very cordial. The breakfast buffet is you happen to get a rate that includes it is amazing, a bit pricey $24/pp but has an enormous variety of delicious breakfast foods. The lazy river and pool area are great, very relaxing, we hardly get to enjoy the pool at hotels because of our outside activities but this time we decided to just enjoy the hotel and we enjoyed every minute of it. My husband played golf at the Ritz and he enjoyed the course. Just walking around was a treat, and the lake view from our room was beautiful. We would highly recommend this hotel and it has become our favorite place to stay at in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels!!”
Reviews.Author: Sagandang
Reviews.Content: I loved the JW Marriott. It was so awesome, the service, dinning, everything. The room was very clean and large. It was nice to have room for my two-yr old to move around. It far exceeded my expectations and I look forward to returning. We ordered room service and it was nice to get your food on an actual table that expanded and that you can sit at. It was great to go to a hotel where the room was clean even by my picky standards. Great location for sea world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Property”
Reviews.Author: pterbd
Reviews.Content: I breought my wife to a work convention so we had two differing experiences but both were good. the only negative we had was the phone in our room would not work. We called for service twice but it did not get straight so we just toughed it out. Also the air conditioner never did get the room cool, to comfortable and the humidity made leaving the slider open a poor choice. we stayed on the 23rd floor. The grounds are absolutley beautiful. My wife used the spa and I was in a good share of the conference center through the week. The people were terrific and helpful, i even found the room attendants to be playful and talkative (an oddity in most hotels). I am a Marriott fan and the quality in my stay was obvious here. The room was all that I expected and more. My wife and I agree we would stay here again with our family.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: McLean4
Reviews.Content: All the whiners complaining on this site about being nickeled and dimed at this resort need to get a life. This is a resort property, with beautiful grounds, nice amenites, multiple dining options, a great pool, etc. If you want free wi-fi, there are lots of Fairfield lnns and Hampton Inns to stay at. And if you don't want kids running around the pool, don't come to Orlando and stay at a hotel with a pool. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay with our two teenagers. Rooms were very nice. Pool was beautiful. And the staff was great. We took one day of the Memorial Day Weekend to go to Disney, but the rest of the weekend was spent relaxing, shopping and hanging out. Would definitely stay at the JW again.

Reviews.Title: “Isloated...in the middle of everthing”
Reviews.Author: oldensign
Reviews.Content: The JW is top notch. Clearly one of the finest hotels in the area. The setting is spectacular. The lobby is amazing. The staff excellent and the rooms spotless. The pools are end less. There is a nice lake with walking trails. The gym is first class and there are lots of options. There is even a full Starbucks in the shopping arcade. But overall I didn’t like the place. First it is isolated the ground are so big that it is a 10 minute drive just to get off the property. Then it is a drive to find any thing. More over it will cost you 15 dollars to park daily. I a lot that is a hike from the entrance. More over there is a $15 a day charge for wireless internet in the room. Add to that six dollar beers in the lobby. And $20 to use the lap pool! The main pools are free but to use the lap pool it 20 bucks outrageous! It seems I was getting nickeled and dime here for everything. I will admit the free fruit waters in the lobby are OUTSTANDING! Just don’t get caught like I did filling up a water bottle.....

Reviews.Title: “the Third Best Marriott (don't forget to bring those nickels and dimes!)”
Reviews.Author: eustexas
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit in as many months, and I am writing this as a follow-up to confirm that it is everything it was on first impression: Physical environment: Top notch. This property is in great condition. Car attendants: smooth and polished for only $21.30 a day Front Desk: Marriott slips (actually this is every Marriott recently - the front desks are all understaffed and overworked, in every city) Rooms: Nearly perfect. Mine tonight, curiously, has the only slightly broken Speakman showerhead in the world. Those things NEVER break!) Telephone/internet: Works fine, again, for only $15.95 a day you can check your email. (Hmm I' m here for six nights again that means let's see... for $100 Marriott will let me check my messages! It's my lucky day!) You know what? I' only staying here, at the end of the day, because it's close to the job. But next time, I'm staying somewhere where I don't get nickled and dimed for (what's included gratis at other hotels).

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Resorts in Florida”
Reviews.Author: sally11122
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 3 days April 22-24 with my husband and 2 children (4years, & 6). We had an amazing time! First of all the moment you walk into the lobby you are surrounded by complete luxury! Everything is the very best, the granite flooring, the furniture, and even the wonderful smell! Check in was easy and we were upgraded to a room with a beautiful view on the 16th floor. From our room we could see Sea World, downtown Orlando, the breath taking pools, the golf course, and a great sunset. The room was on the smaller side, but comfortable with beautiful furnishings. The bathroom was large and very luxurious. The complementary bottled water and smores at night for the children is a nice touch. The childrens activities were also great (and free). My boys enjoyed making play dough with the staff while I relaxed. The service from the staff was 5 star through out! The best pool in Orlando The pools were amazing! There is so much beautiful landscaping here that you feel like you are on a tropical island! The lazy river is very long (but slow). You are right next to the Ritz Carlton (they connect through the convention area, 3 minute walk). The JW shares all facilities with the Ritz including pools,spa/fitness and golf. So, you can enjoy both resorts and charge everything to your room The fitness center is wonderful. It has the highest quality equipment with your own personal TV screen on each machine. Complementary fresh fruit is provided and flavored waters. The Food We loved the food here! We ate at Quench (the poolside cafe) twice and it was great! Their Angus Burgers are out of this world. The food is not cheap, but you get what you pay for. The Burgers were very large and high in quality and came with fruit or salad. When we first saw the childrens menu we were surprised to see most items for $9 and $10. But, again the food they brought the children was high in quality. For $10, my son got a Angus Burger that was slighly smaller than mine (yet the standard adult size at most other restaurants), my son's meal also included a beautiful bowl of fruit and a drink. So, the food was worth the money. We also loved the food at Citron. We did not like the sushi in the Lounge restaurant. Golf Golfing here was pricey, but kids play for free and they do give a discount for twilight golf. So it was worth while for us. We really enjoyed the course. We also, enjoyed a morning of just using the practice range. That is a good deal ($20 for the whole day and they will let you borrow top of the line clubs). Overall Overall we loved this resort!!! We are planning a return trip for next year. As a side note our vacation was in two segments, the first 3 days at JW and the next 5 at The Grand Floridian. When we saw the GF and our room we were so disapointed! It was such a step down from the JW. What you get at the GF is a close location to Magic Kingdom for a very high price. But, we won't be going back to Magic Kingdom or The GF (Magic Kingdom is best suited for kids under 5). It is unbelievable that Trip Advisor rates The GF 5 stars and the JW 4 stars. The JW and Ritz Carlton are the real 5 star hotels in Orlando. The GF needs are serious remodel (I would currently rate it a 3 star).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel.com!”
Reviews.Author: jblue212
Reviews.Content: Hotel was incredible... loved the lazy pool... right next to the Ritz Carlton... surprisingly JW was a larger property than the Ritz, the golf course in back is definitely 5 stars! Distance to Theme parks is bad to ok... Hotel is situated in the middle of nowhere... If you're a convention attendee, could be a good location, but it still takes 15 minutes depending on traffic on International Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Wow......what a superb hotel for my entire family!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ItsTheTruth
Reviews.Content: We booked through SeaWorlds buy 3 and get 2 free. This place was superior in every category. The grounds were immaculate and the pools & lazy river were tucked away in an incredibly well maintained oasis. The staff was courteous and well trained on how to respond to every inquiry and request. We asked for a roll-out bed.....they gave it. We asked for a fridge.....they provided it. We asked for turn down service each night......they provided it. We asked for more towels......they gave us a big stack of 4 extras each day. What's great is that we never saw a room service cart. They staff was seemingly invisible but provided the best room service ever. The beds were made each day, and each night. We gave tips each night, and the housekeeping would make the beds and place our kids stuffed animals on the pillows.......our kids enjoyed it. They bell stand was Johnny-on-the-spot each time we asked for our car to be pulled around. The day we departed, they ported was up to our room within 2 minutes with a cart. Again, I've stayed at some nice hotels such as the (The Ritz-Carlton in San Fran, The Breakers in West Palm, The Pheonician in Scottsdale) and the "Service" at this hotel beat all of them. The outdoor Oasis was incredible. This hotel sits on a huge piece of real estate, so I was able to walk the 1-1.5 mile paved walking path each evening. I don't think you will be disappointed weather you are hosting a wedding, business incentive trip, important client meetings, or trying to impress that special someone.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time at the JW Marriott - and we didn't even leave the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aseidenfrau
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 days at the JW Marriott Grande Lakes and it was amazing! We had lots of kids activities, an amazing pool, gorgeous gym and beautiful grounds. We didn't go to any parks on this trip and loved every minute at the hotel. And, the restaurants were all wonderful - and kid friendly!! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: PrairieWoman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the J.W. Marriott (Grande Lakes) for a quick business meeting. While I didn't have a lot of time outside of my business meetings to explore, I thought the property was very nice and well maintained. The front desk clerk was really wonderful, and upgraded my room to one with a balcony overlooking the pool and courtyard area. The room itself was very comfortable and clean. The bedding was very comfortable. Overall, a very nice property with a very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations - Whole Family Enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: Robbie_Vorhaus
Reviews.Content: Someone in charge knows how to inspire their staff, because everyone, from the room maid, to the busboys; front desk staff to the concierge, treated us like VIPs, which we are not. We left a small tip every day for the maid and got a sweet handwritten note. The buffet is by far one of the best and varied spread we've ever seen; and this is good food! The gym is free, the spa is beautiful, and if you ask you can get a great rate w/ some package. This may be a convention hotel, but it's clearly acting like a resort and we sure felt delighted we chose the J.W. Marriott. I wish they offered free internet (they don't, it's $15 per day w/ tax), and I also wish they didn't charge for self parking, another $15. Still, we would come back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Just as amazing as I remembered.”
Reviews.Author: hotelmaven75
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the JW. It's clean, the staff bends over backwards to help you and is friendly and sincere while they do it. The lazy river pool is great for kids and adults. Spa services are easily accessible at the hotel next door. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: Neldam
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay in Orlando's JW Marriott, and I can't write enough about the outstanding service we received. Every employee we encountered was polite, addressed us with a smile & was there for our every need. The main attraction for us was the lazy river pool, which was perfectly heated for our March stay. Our young teenager was in his glory feeling his independence at this very secure facility. There is poolside wait service & they are always there anticipating your every need. Another nice touch was the lobby Starbucks which quite often came in very handy. Staying at the JW also allowed you to use the facilities of the attached Ritz Carlton. Although from our experience, we recieved better pool side wait service at the JW than at the Ritz Carlton. Still, it was nice to have the option to use both facilities. There were many children's activities offered by both JW & The Ritz, which was very nice; they seemed to cater to families as well as business people; doing both very well. Our room was spacious, clean, with a balcony overlooking the lazy river pool & the lake across from the hotel. Our view was perfect. The bathroom was also very clean, spacious and had a stand alone shower and a separate bathtub. I would also like to add that the beds were very comfortable. There is a beautiful spa on premise also, at the adjoining Ritz Carlton Hotel where service was impeccable. The guests of the spa have privilages at the adults only spa pool which was very serene & peaceful. There is a very nice golf course should you want to play golf. This resort is the closest to the Universal Studios & Seaworld attractions. It is not to say that all this came cheap, in fact, there wasn't much of anything that could be considered that. But, it was all worth it, particularely if you are looking for service. FYI : Most cab rides to & from the airport or Disney cost from $40-$50 Another point, the resort charges for parking daily ($16/day) I would definitely recommend this resort, & we definitely plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort- we already booked another stay and will return!”
Reviews.Author: lucymoosey
Reviews.Content: First let me say that we managed to book this hotel using priceline.com's name your own price for $155 per night! We wanted a full-service resort since we were travelling with our 2 year old son and weren't that concerned with being so close to the parks since we only planned to go to 2 parks during our week in Florida. The grounds are absolutely gorgeous- I felt like I was in Hawaii when I was laying outside by the pool. The lazy river was a great feature- we didn't rent the inner tubes because our son is only 2 years old and wants to be held in the pool anyway. It's great that you get the JW Marriott's facilities plus the Ritz Carlton's- we checked out both. Both hotels have their own kiddie pools (JW has 2- one a zero entry kiddie pool, the other one a small "mini" kiddie pool with a alligator in it the kids can climb on, etc- with only a few inches of water- no risk of them falling and getting in over their heads, etc). When you check in, pick up a brochure which lists the daily (and nightly) activities offered at the hotel- they do s'mores by the campfire every other night, and hot cocoa on the opposite nights- there was a lot of cute things to do if you bring a child who's a little older than our son- they did make your own tote bags, things for St. Patrick's day- you can feed the fish at the Ritz Carlton at 1pm every day in the river that runs behind both hotels- these are really family oriented hotels. Yes, there were conferences going on, but it didn't really interfere with our stay. As far as the room- we had a standard room with 1 king sized bed- room was kind of small considering the retail price of the rooms, but again- we only paid $155 per night. It has a french (step out) balcony, not a true balcony. We got "city view"- they said they only had the 2 double bedded rooms left on the "pool view" side- but it was fine with us because we didn't spend much time in the room and our son loved seeing the construction going on anyway! They do turn down service every night, which was a nice touch. We didn't eat at the restaurants- just the 2 poolside cafe's; Quench at the JW, and Bleu at the Ritz Carlton. I noticed that the room service prices were ridiculous, so we did not do room service based on that. We were able to request (and quickly receive) a small refridgerator and pack and play for our son to sleep in- we wound up putting him in the small hallway outside the bathroom so we could cattycorner the doors to the bathroom and closet so it was kind of his own "room" so we could watch TV after he went to sleep. The pool area at the JW was great- it has 2 hot tubs, PLENTY of lounge chairs in the sun and shade- you don't need to get too crazy "reserving" your lounge chairs at the crack of dawn like at other hotels I've stayed at. They had cold water cooler type things outside you could get free cold water (great for filling up sippy cups, etc)- yes the parking charge is ridiculous ($15 a day for self parking, $20 for valet)- we opted for the valet since it was only $5 per day more and plus the self parking was pretty far away to lug a 2 year old (plus a stoller, etc) every day. We found all of the staff very helpful- yes, they are hawking the timeshare/vacation club they are building- but they wound up leaving us a message on our room phone, offering us a return trip of 5 days/4 nights for $400 plus a $100 resort credit (provided you pay for it up front, and attend a 90 minute timeshare spiel)- needless to say we loved this hotel so much that we jumped on it! We don't plan to buy the timeshare, but couldn't pass up the great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but very expensive room service!”
Reviews.Author: gr8adman1
Reviews.Content: We had a standard sized, double bedded room (Revive beds) for $207 a night and my Èlite gift was free WIFI in the room (normally $16 a night). Flat 42`` TV with some HD channels was very nice with a special box to plug in your camcorder, etc. – I hooked up my blu-ray drive laptop with my HDMI cable and watched a blu-ray movie on it – quite spectacular in 1080p. Lots of channels – with 15 of them HD. Bathroom quite nice with separate shower and tub. Towels not as `thirsty` as I had on other Marriotts. We had a balcony room, which was really nothing more than a standing balcony with not enough room for a chair….we didn`t get sun on it due to facing northwest. Last year we had an exec suite in the Ritz Carlton which had two good sized balconies, but a higher price too ($560 a night incl breakfast and $225 in resort money – for spas, dining, etc.). No drink machines so you have to order soft drinks from room service, use the mini bar or go to the gift shop store that closes at 8 pm…where a coke was $2.70. Room Service very expensive: Get your wallet out for room service breakfast and we found them a rip-off … All American is $25 plus 21% service charge and $3 per person. Continental breakfast was $20. Breakfast sandwich is $21 – we ordered it and it’s large enough to split between two people…but breakfast cost us (2 people) $65! Other items: Oatmeal with fruit & coffee was $22. Corn flakes was $7. Room service dinners were outrageous too: soup $10; Iceberg wedge salad $12; Hamburger with chips $20; Pasta of the day $20; roast chicken $25; back ribs $27; NY Strip steak $41. Desserts - $12 each for Oreo cheese Cake, lemon tart, berries & cream, or dessert sampler – Haagen-Daz or Ben&Jerry pint $8. Does have a mini bar in the room but didn't use it. Our first day (Feb 19) was only 50 degrees and windy – very cold and a frost forecast. I think we had the best view – on the 10th floor facing northwest so we could see the nearby Ritz Carlton also part of the Grande Lakes complex and what looked like a dozen pools including a lazy river – all not being used due to the temp. Pool lovers in warmer weather will love this place. Dinner: The JW is a big hotel like this only has 2 dining rooms with the main one Italian called Primo. They have a less formal one called Citron too. The Ritz has a gourmet restaurant called Norman`s which was quite nice – you can charge back to your JW room and earn Marriott Reward points. The front desk told us it was a 5 minute walk from the JW to the Ritz – it was more like 15 minutes and bitterly cold…ask for a shuttle which is not readily available. Dinner in Primo was superb. We started sharing a crab cake appetizer which was crispy delicious. Ricotta stuffed chicken breast ($31) was very good and the porcini rubbed bistro new york steak was terrific ($43) seared on the outside and med/rare inside, and very large. Desserts were wonderful. Can’t wait to go back to this restaurant. Called for reservations at 7 pm and told we couldn’t get in until at least 9 pm and the gal even suggested we go somewhere else - like the Ritz. So we just went downstairs and said we were guests in the hotel and they seated us right away .. and we noticed there were several empty seats, although busy overall. Strange. It looked like a good golf course (Greg Norman). A day at the course package was $779 a person (incl 18 hole play, 18 hole playing lesson, cart, fees, tips, lunch, rental clubs). The Spa is near the conference centre and between the hotels. The setting at Grande Lakes is beautiful ... and they've started building new Timeshare units already, next to the JW.

Reviews.Title: “The lazy river brought us there, but the spa will keep us coming back”
Reviews.Author: serenityseekerFL
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review: Plus: Service was outstanding ranging from quick check-in, upgraded view was provided at check-in, great service in restaurants and from room-service, lazy river was awesome, all your pool needs (toys, floats, food) are met by the poolside restaurant and shop. The spa service (massage) was amazing. The spa pool is reserved for adults and is very nice and is a nice perk for the adults. There are multiple restaurants and shops on site and in the neighboring Ritz so you don't even need to leave the grounds. Negatives: Standard rooms are a bit small if bringing a child so I will upgrade to larger room next time. I am a big fan of room service, but their room service prices were VERY expensive compared to most hotels in their class (or above). The minibar did not have many non-alcoholic drinks. The balcony door is hard to block from being opened by children. The staff could stand to know a bit more details about hotel events (i.e. it took us 4 calls to find out details about the "Dive-In Movie" that they offer on Saturday nights by the pool.) One final thing to the hotel...I hate to be marketed to when I am on vacation. Enough about your "Vacation Club"...we all know that it is a time share!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: EdgartownBaby
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night while visiting SeaWorld. Arrived around 4:30, the grounds are lovely, a very nice break from the more busy I-Drive area, but only about 5 minutes from SeaWorld. Check in was easy, we used Marriott Rewards points, but were offered an upgrade to an executive suite for $119 and gladly took it. With two small children (4 and 6 months) we were tired and wanted as much space as possible! The room was fabulous. The living room had a pull-out couch and large flat screen TV, french doors opened on the bedroom with a king size bed and another large flat screen. Huge bathroom with tub and stand up shower. Two balconies. We ate at the pool bar and the food and service were perfect. My husband and son enjoyed a quick swim in the pool and gave it a 10. The lobby and main areas were all very nice. Highly recommend this Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Have A Conference!”
Reviews.Author: MI_TravelFreq
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, we weren't there for a conference ... It was clear from the outset that the real purpose of the hotel is to serve the high-end convention and conference crowd, and perhaps the occasional wedding. Folks with expense account meal allowances, and their spouses and families who came along for the ride. The rooms are on the small side for a JW Marriott. Because of my Platinum Premier status, I was upgraded to a (slightly) larger room. The bathroom was very large and well appointed, but the bedroom didn't seem much larger than a typical Marriott. I was also a bit surprised to find two double beds instead of two queen size beds. Again, just a little bit less than one would expect of a JW. The location of the hotel puts it close to Sea World and not far from Universal -- if you can get there. Traffic around the "Bee Line", International Drive and I-4 is ridiculous, (if you're from D.C., think "Beltway at rush hour"; if you're from NYC, think LIE at 5:00 PM on a Friday). If you're driving anywhere, plan on extra time to get where you're going. My family tends to hate eating in hotel restaurants. The restaurants in this hotel are very good, and not bad a bad value. When we vacation, though, we prefer the "local joints" - and no chain restaurants. Unfortunately, and it may be due to the hotel's location at the corner of John Young and Central Florida Parkways, (meaning not far from the attractions) you don't get many restaurants at all, and what you do find, tend to be chains. That's nothing to do with the hotel, (and I'm sure they'd prefer their guests eating in the hotel) but if you're into exploring the local area, bring a picnic lunch. Fortunately, there is a bodega inside the hotel (next to the Starbucks) that offers some excellent selections from breakfast and lunch. Beware, however, that it closes by the middle of the afternoon. Overall, this is a very nice property. The lazy river pool complex, long walking path, surreys, and wild life make it as relaxing an area as can be had in central Florida. But, if your idea of vacation is to relax in some peace and quiet, you won't find it here -- on the other hand, the Orlando area probably wouldn't be your first choice anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: steady
Reviews.Content: My family of five just stayed here for 3 days over Presidents' Week. We had a rate of $239 for one night, $159 for the other two nights. Fabulous time. Because of our wonderful rate, we didn't mind the $21 charge for the valet. Impressive lobby, clean and comfy room, fabulous pool area. The lazy river pool was great and we managed to get free tubes from other families that were checking out. Very close to Sea World. The complimentary s'mores on Sunday night were memorable. I would stay here again and would recommend this place to anyone. I cannot give it a perfect score of 5 because of the double-sized beds. The room was a bit small and couldn't fit 2 queens and therefore we were a bit squished at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great trip”
Reviews.Author: Swezfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW Orlando from Feb 12 thru 16, 2009. We loved everthing about this hotel. In fact, it is almost like the JW and the Ritz (the sister property) are switched. The JW seemed to have the better facilities as opposed to the Ritz. The lazy river is great, very tropical (yes, the tubes run $7, but you can bring your own). We had room 3057, which was standard room with two double beds, but had the largest balcony at the hotel (on the corner). The Citron restaurant had excellent burgers. The Citron also had a great outside dining area - was surprised to see not many people elected to eat outside - it was ideal. The restaurants do get pricy, so we decided to order pizza the last day. My son got sick and the hotel brought up soda and crackers at 3 AM for free. Everybody was very polite and there to serve. Transportation to Disney/Universal is not great as it is a little further than the other hotels, but that adds to the quality of the hotel. It is in a quiet, seculed location, and on a huge plot of land with Shingle Creek running thru the property. Thus, once you get to the resort, we had no need to leave other than to go to the parks. We did decid to ditch the rental car and take the bus/van service to Disney/Universal. The round trip to Disney is $18 per person per day. It is a small van, so it was actually pretty quick. Universal is free, but this is a big bus and serves 4 or 5 other hotels (the JW was the first to drop off and last to pick up on the day we took the bus, so it worked ok for us. Some of the other riders on the bus commented to me that it took them almost 1 hour to get to Universal from their hotel, so that is definately not the way to go for them). Overall, I would definately stay at this hotel during a return trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel forever”
Reviews.Author: travelchics
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed at the J W Marriott for 14 days in Sept 08. On our initial arrival we were given a room overlooking the city but we had booked a room overlooking the lakes, this was immediately rectified by the very helpful check in staff. The room we were given was very spacious, clean and extremely comfortable. I loved the little touches for example housekeeping would turn the bed down in the evening and leave a guide for the next days weather and a chocolate each. During our stay our every whim was catered for by very attentive staff. We had buffet breakfast every morning in the restaurant, the choice was beyond compare and very tasty, especially the freshly made pancakes at your request by the more than lovely chef. My husband and I felt very special at this hotel. The common areas of the hotel were also well maintained and very clean which is great for a first impression. There was one down side, the hotel charged us for parking and I think when you pay for 14 nights accommodation they should really throw this in for free, however my husband and I would definately return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but Pricey-Jan 2009”
Reviews.Author: babette50
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights - very lovely property and facilties - good room rate on line (AAA) - but everything else was pricey: valet parking, resort fee, dining - we ate at citron, the casual restaurant - it was just OK. on-site starbucks was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, our second time back confirmed it”
Reviews.Author: wrightdda
Reviews.Content: This was our second time here...and we confirmed this is one of our favorite hotels for just plain relaxation - with great restaurants, food and several wonderful pools on site. Why leave? We don't enjoy Disney World (rip-off), but this hotel is literally two miles to the entrance of Epcot. It is quiet, well managed, with a great pool, good golf course and easy access to the airport and other attractions. Check the pictures, the pools are pretty spectacular. The Solara restaurant is one of of our all time favorite hotel restaurants, healthy, well made food, reasonably priced. It has the best breakfast buffet of any hotel we have even been in (and that's a lot of hotels). Some might be put off by the fact that it's a Conference Center - so it can get busy. But, when there is no conference, you get all the amenities of a big hotel for a great price. One trick we learned this time, you can park in the back. Parking here is somewhat far from the hotel, so it can be a pain if you don't valet park. There is a parking lot behind the north tower, if you can find it, you can use it.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: Rob1233
Reviews.Content: A truly amazing experience. Everything about this hotel is fantastic - the staff, the pools, the food - everything. More importantly, we had a couple of irritations during our stay (such as the neighbouring room playing loud music at 2.00 in the morning), which were dealt with extremely impressively by the hotel (i.e. Security coming up immediatly and - in no uncertain terms - telling them that they had one chance to be quiet!). We will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: LikesToTravel_99
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here Dec. 22nd thru 27th and had a great time. We booked on-line with AAA and secured a really great rate. We had a pool view room and I must say that it is the way to go. We were on the 19th floor and could also see Disney and Seaworld fireworks.....which was a treat. The breakfast buffet had a wide selection of foods and I enjoyed watching the cook make Mickey Mouse shaped pancakes for the kids while waiting for my omelet and waffle at the grill station. My family enjoyed the meals bought at the resort. They were expensive but we were able to offset the cost by having pizza delivered and eating offsite too. We also brought soft drinks to the room which worked fine b/c I paid $4 for a diet coke poolside. We also visited the Ritz and I liked their toddler area better b/c the pirate play ship and splash pool feature were in one spot which is better for the parents. Their lobby had a really neat gingerbread village and a fully functional train. I had a mani and pedi at the spa and enjoyed it. One family highlight was having S'mores at the fire pit which was complimentary. That was worthwhile. They also offered Santa tuck-ins which was nice, but our son is too old for that...........although he did peek into the hallway to watch Santa and his elf visit a guest on our floor. All in all ....... it was a really great time and a memorable Christmas holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Visit at the J.W. Marriott Grande Lakes”
Reviews.Author: m3rlind0g
Reviews.Content: My wife and two teenagers stayed at the J.W. Marriott Grande Lakes Dec 2 - 6 2008. We booked a king size bed suite with a adjoining room to a room with two queens beds and that is exactly what we got. I have experienced through out the years where your reservation states one thing but when you arrive, you get something else (not always better) We have never had a bad visit at the J.W. From the moment we pulled up, the staff bend over backwards to make you happy. From the Car Valets (yes you can grumble that there is no free parking and the price difference between self parking and valet is about $4 a day but when you stay at hotel in this class you should not expect to receive anything for free even though I agree there should be free parking and free internet ) to the Front Desk Staff to the House Keeping Staff - everybody has a "how can I help you" attitude. Check In was a breeze and the hotel splits the elevators between the ground and 12th floor and then from the 12th to 24th floor. I never had to wait for more than one minute for a elevator The J.W. is not a cheap hotel but I feel that the hotel is worth the money (even with the charge for parking or the internet) If you like a hotel where service means something then a stay at this J.W. won't be a bad choice. The suite was large and there was a separate area with a 2nd tv and a pull out couch. The bathroom was big, no bumping into your spouse in there. The J.W. Grande Lakes has a beautiful pool area that has a wonderful lazy man river where you can float along (of course you have to buy the floating tire to float) for hours and even at night the hot tubs were hot. The J.W. shares the grounds with the Ritz Carlton and there is a golf course also (not sure if 9 or 18 holes) My only complaint is that for hotel of this class and price range, why they have to charge for internet when so many other 2 or 3 star hotels don't. If these other hotels don't charge, it just makes the fancy hotels look greedy. I enjoy staying at the J.W. but I don't know if I would recommend the hotel for people who are solely in Orlando to do Disney and Universal. While Universal is not too far from the J.W. , Disney is farther away and pending on traffic tie ups, after along day with tired kids it can seem forever to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but bring your money as everything seems to be extra.”
Reviews.Author: FloridagirlP-cola
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott Orlando Grande Lakes for a regional dance competition. The hotel was decorated so beautifully that we took tons of pictures from the entry lobby to the fabulous pool grounds. I was very impressed with the room and the bathroom was very nicely laid out. I am very picky about everything being clean and the entire stay the hotel did a great job.The room was very quiet and the A/C cycles quietly. I expected it to be expensive to eat or shop in the hotel but was surprised at HOW expensive it was. They seemed to add a charge for everything. The grounds were large but they had an additional $15 per day self parking charge. To use the internet in your room was an extra $16.95 per day and to check you email downstairs in the business center was something like 70 cents a minute. Don't try and call for food delivery on the hotel phone or you incur another $16.95 per day. Their beautiful gym and spa also charge an extra fee to walk in the door and just get on the treadmill. I think the thing that put me over the top was after a long stressful day, I decided to go and float the lazy river. Doing that in December seemed so neat. The lazy river winds throughout the back of the hotel pool area and was lushly landscaped. I was stunned to find out you had to BUY a float for $5 or you could walk in the water for free. Sorry, but that was just too much. I feel sorry for the people that have lots of kids. Even the pool isn't going to be free. I think they should have a $5 deposit that is returned went you return the float. My only other complaint is that we went for a dance competition and it started early. We were dealing with a time change. I tried to set the alarm clock in the room but it was the stupidest piece of confusing junk that I have ever tried to program. (I was not alone in this complaint after talking to other parents) I called the wake-up call number and was told no one was "attending the room" and directed to call the front desk. I called the front desk and left a wake -up call for 5 am which was never done. If we had overslept the entire visit would have been a waste . I always do two alarms so thank goodness for my daughter's cell phone waking us up. When I complained to the front desk I was given a "so sorry" look but not even an apology. I would say go and stay if you have lots of extra spending money or your business is footing the bill.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Resort Experiences Ever!”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoResortsFan
Reviews.Content: This is about as good as it gets in terms of a family-friendly resort. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “over priced”
Reviews.Author: Canadahoneymooners
Reviews.Content: A very posh hotel, extremely clean, staff are very professional, overly ornate.Due to the location,extremely expensive to travel to and from hotel via taxi or bus shuttles to major attractions in the orlando area .Hotel restaurants and bar are overly priced.Gift shop prices are totally off the scale.The 24 hr concierge office closes whenever it feels like.Nothing is included during your stay at this hotel. If you have your own transportation and money is no object, enjoy, other than that i do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a convention, not necessarily child friendly”
Reviews.Author: moogie14a
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a conference and had a good stay. I was with my wife and kids. I did find the room a bit small for the four of us. We had two double beds and a pack and play. With our luggage and stroller there wasn't a lot of walking space in the room. The room does have a flat panel t.v., I believe it is plasma and the service is H.D. I find that most hotels are starting to carry H.D. tv's without the H.D. service which is a waste. It was nice to watch H.D. tv in the room when I could. The bathroom is very nice with tile through out and lots of sundry items for the stay. The beds are comfotable. We had a room on the 14th floor overlooking the pool and golf course. Nice view, we did have one of the few rooms without a terrace, I would have liked the terrace, not enough to ask for one after checking in. Upon arriving to the hotel we did find a friendly bellhop that assisted us with our luggage and checking in. We were with kids and required a frig to store milk. The mini-bar frig is full with mini-bar type of stuff, the bellhop got someone from "At your Service" to bring up a college/dorm size fridge which was nice to have. However, that took up more space, underneath the desk. The grounds are huge, we spent our first nice exploring it looking at the animals, lake, hotel grounds, etc. The ritz is next door and is nice as well. I did stop at their play area with the kids. I was looking for water and I didn't find a fountain in the vicinity. One of the spa folks immediately got us three glasses of water. What a nice touch. We valet parked, $20 a night plus tips. They do have in & out privledges. I don't know there is a charge for parking, seems a bit unnecessary to me. I didn't purchase any meals while there, I did purchase drinks at the bar, which was reasonably priced for a hotel bar. I did have hotel food from the convention which was o.k. It is a close drive to Seaworld, and about 30 minutes away from Disney, specifically Magic Kingdom. I would stay here again, perhaps not for the "normal" rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ridcroft
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here while visiting Seaworld. The hotel is larger than I would usually choose. But, for one night I thought I would make do and is only five minutes from the entrance to Seaworld. I need not have worried the staff here are exceptional, as other have commented and really set this hotel apart from other large hotels I have stayed in. They go out of their way to accommodate and nothing appears to be too much trouble. The room was large with a good sized bathroom including separate walk-in shower. All was spotlessly clean. The bed was very comfortable and the air conditioning quiet. We did not use room service but the staff in the Brasserie were friendly and very helpful. The food was not over-priced and portions were huge. Be warned if you want to sample the freshly made desserts (and I suggest you do) then skip the appetizers! Breakfast also served in the brasserie was either buffet or a la carte. The latter dishes are again huge in size, the buffet is very good with a wide range and excellent omelette station. All things considered I would stay here again, it is very close to seaworld and is welcoming and very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katladyunc
Reviews.Content: The JW is a beautiful property and am very impressed with the grounds and decor. Our company had a conference at the JW and we were in awe when we set foot in the property. The lobby is very ornate and the hallways echo the same elegant style and lavish taste. The food during the banquet events was outstanding and the wait staff very professional and friendly. The view from the room was of the lush and green surrounding golf courses. The hotel is a bit remote so you will need a car to explore Orlando and the parks. I did not use the gym but colleagues said the gym at the Ritz Carlton for JW guests was in the top 10% they have ever worked out in.

Reviews.Title: “5-star property - 6-star people!!”
Reviews.Author: davefromflorida
Reviews.Content: The property was outstanding, the facilities were excellent. The high point, however, was that for the first time ever in travel, EVERYONE -100% of the people that we interacted with at this hotel provided totally customer focused service!! Examples: My daughter ordered a kid's Mac-n-cheese for dinner that did not fit her taste. There was nothing wrong with the dish, but the waiter brought out TWO rapid replacement choices (at no extra charge) to ensure that she would have at least one satisfactory dinner!! My son's 8th birthday will be in two days, and this getaway was one of his gifts. Bell staff let someone know this fact and my son had extra chocolates with a "Happy Birthday" note on his bed that night!! These are things that could have easily happened at a 1-star or 5-star property, but occurred due to staff initiative WITHOUT OUR PROMPTING at this JW Marriott hotel. There may be better restaurants and golf courses elsewhere in the world but after 30 years of travel, these little things were done incredibly well- better than anywhere else I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “First-Timer in Orlando and at a JW”
Reviews.Author: adamola
Reviews.Content: This review is based on other stays at top-shelf hotels. Overall the hotel and grounds are very nice. The lobby is huge and very impressive as you walk in. Checking in was quick and easy. I also found out that the requests I made for a King and a balcony were granted, It was very muggy the first night so we requested a fan and they brought one right up. The staff is very friendly and acommodating. The room which was $289 was fairly small but enough for 2 people. The room and bathroom were fairly average for a nicer hotel, flat screen, granite counter tops and such but not anything to write home about. There was some nice touches that were missing in the room that you get from other hotels for this kind of money. Location was great, in a quiet area in between the airport and convention center (just minutes away). Be prepared to drop a load of money on room service. Eating for 2 was very expensive, not a big deal when staying at a nice hotel but the food was not very impressive and made us feel bad for spending $70-$80 in quick breakfasts and lunches. A burger and strip steak with coffee and water for room service one night ran us $100. The wireless signal was horrible and totally unreliable. I mentioned it to the front desk and asked for a refund, after a little back and forth we settled at them taking off one day's charge. They have a starbucks and kinko's which was nice and 3 places to eat. Very nice restaurant environments, Primo has a nice dinner menu and service was outstanding. There were even some nice boutiques for shopping. Overall, a really nice hotel and layout in a great area, great staff, but be ready to shell out for dining. If you're looking for top-of the line, check out the ritz right next door. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. When traveling for business, its always nice to have 24 hour room service and the LW has it, many other hotels and resorts didnt here in Orando.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel away from Orlando, but not to far”
Reviews.Author: Chargers_rule
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, Very nice pool with lazy river. Hotel charges 5.00 per raft . Room was basiclly a standard Marriott room. Hotel charges for parking unless you ard a Marriott club member of at least gold status.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok - not a 5 star hotel - try the Ritz next door instead”
Reviews.Author: DonFTL
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the JW Marriott in Orlando. I have stayed at the sister Ritz Carlton property several times and it's well worth 50 bucks more a night. Essentially, the JW is a decent 4 star hotel. If you are expecting five star service spend about 40-50 more per night and switch your reservation over to the Ritz Carlton next door. Because the two properties share amenities I'm comparing to the Ritz. The JW Marriott is very much a high-end convention hotel. Families won't feel totally out of sorts but there are often many business-types here on property. PROS: - The standard rooms at the JW Marriott are decent, clean and well appointed. The bathroom, although very nice, has a combined shower/tub as opposed to separate shower/tub at the Ritz. - Quality of Food was very good. The main restaurant was very good for lunch. - Valet was very responsive (at 20 bucks a night it should be) - Pool was very nice - actually much better and larger than the pool at the Ritz next door. CONS - This is a BIG hotel. You may get (like I did) a room which is a real hike away from the single run of elevators. I had to walk by 22 rooms to get to my door. - Overpriced food servce. Food seemed high even for a 4/5 star otel. - No turndown service. Not sure if they just missed me but I never got turndown (no big deal - but I would have expected it at this level of hotel). - Breakfast menu was very limited. No omlettes which I would have thought were standard fare. So dont' get me wrong, all in all this is a nice place- but although this place could be 5 stars it's really more of a 4 star place. Considering it's Orlando, I woudln't spend over $250 per night here. If you are a family doing Disney I would recommend one of the on-site Disney hotels for the money. If you want true 5 star luxury in Orlando, I would stay at the neighboring Ritz Carlton for 50 bucks more a night.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience of My Life”
Reviews.Author: ccrew88
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a relaxing vacation with my husband. We have stayed here multiple times before, the hotel grounds are lovely, and the pool area is very nice. HOWEVER, we will NEVER stay at this hotel again. On the very first day of our vacation we went to the pool and spent the day laying out. My husband was working on his computer, as they offer free wifi in the pool area. We had eaten lunch and had some drinks, served by the same pool waiter all day. At the end of the day before we headed up to our room we walk 3 FEET to the pools edge and jumped in the water to cool off. When we turned back around literally a minute later ALL of our things had been STOLEN!! EVERYTHING!!!!! Wallets, phones, ipods, computer bag with thousands of dollars worth of items. I'm going to make a VERY long story short for all of you. The hotel did ABSOLUTELY NOTHING!! They treated us as if we were vermin. They wanted nothing to do with us, they wanted to take no blame at all in the situation. It was very clearly an inside job, as our waiter who was there ALL day was instantly gone. The hotel didn't review security tapes, they didn't question employees, they truly were not interested in figuring out what had happened. The front desk managers were all 24 yr old imbeciles who had no idea what they were doing. They were rude and unhelpful at every turn. We did hear from multiple people who worked there that theft and robbery is a common problem at this location, and that is why the managers and staff have become accustom to acting so rudely.
