All they want to do is send you to the Marriott Claims department which is a corporate 800 number. And from there they refuse ALL claims. This was truly the WORST vacation I have ever had. The hotel did absolutely nothing for us. Not that this should matter, but some of you will be interested to know that my husband is also a Platinum Marriott Rewards member, and they still couldn't have cared less. I am the type of person that although this was a horrific experience, if the hotel had stepped it up and really amazed me with their wonderful customer service this instead would be a post about "Yes this bad thing happened, but the AMAZING hotel responded in this truly OUTSTANDING manner!" Unfortunately, that did not even come close to happening. The management of this hotel should all be fired. They are all worthless and rude. I am truly unaware of what their job role is, as they obviously can't handle basic customer service types of situations. ABOMINABLE SERVICE!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome oasis!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelerAustin
Reviews.Content: This place is top of the line. I can't think of one bad thing to say. The service, the facilities, the rooms, the food, the pool, the fitness center, even the little gift shops were fantastic. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. My room was beautiful and quiet, with top of the line amenities. The bathroom was luxurious with separate bath/shower, deluxe robes, soft towels. The elevators were super speedy, never a wait, even though the hotel was full. The service was phenomenal. The internet access was fast. I ate at Citron and at Primo and both were exceptional. All I can say is, I hope I can come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Around - Wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling4Three
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend at the JW Marriott. The hotel is beautiful and the service is excellent. We wanted a hotel where we had enough to do poolside because we had no intent on going to Disney. This hotel exceeded our expectations! I was nervous about security and pool chairs given other reviews. We found none of those issues previously reported. There were plenty of chairs poolside. We could find seating everywhere. The pool was pretty empty despite the weather being above 90 degrees everyday! There were plenty of hotel staff available and the poolside service was excellent. Unlike other reviews, we didn't find "locals" hanging out at the pool. The pools were lovely and the lazy river was a great! Our room was excellent and housekeeping visited three times a day; morning (newspaper and weather report were a nice touch), afternoon (to tidy the room again and they left chocolates which were a nice touch) and evening (bed turn-down service and again, chocolates were a nice touch). We stayed on the 10th floor facing the pool. It was perfect because Sea World has a fireworks show nightly that we could see from our patio. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in. It was a nice mix of a luxury stay with family activities that will bring us back again soon! RECOMMENDATIONS: Get a room facing the pool so you can see the fireworks. If you're traveling with a child, there are rooms you can request that have a king and sleeper-sofa that sleeps 1-2 small children.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: Bfulk
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel. The rooms are tastefully decorated, the bathroom was huge with a separate tub and shower. The bed was incredibly comfortable. We ordered room service. The steak was medium rare, perfect, hot and delicious! Prompt service as well. We only had time to stay one night, so we didn't have the opportunity to peruse the rest of the property. I can only say everything was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “stay away unless you're a convention attendee”
Reviews.Author: travelsalot38
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay online with Marriott at a discounted rate which the hotel refused to honor upon our arrival, despite our presenting a written confirmation from the hotel showing the discounted rate. After arguing with management for the four days we were there, we were finally given a rate that was still $30/day over the reservation price. The management there is not concerned about customer service, unless you are a convention guest, of which there were literally hundreds while we were there. (One of the convention goers told me that several members of her party got food poisoning from the sushi.) This hotel is pretty, but definitely not the place to stay for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation away from the kiddos!”
Reviews.Author: n8tvetraveler
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I spent four nights here beginning Labor day. Wonderful room, absolutely spotless. The turndown service was great and the housekeeper always gave us a big pile of chocolates! Maybe it was due to our tip but I know my husband appreciated it. The fragrance in the lobby is very relaxing and immediately put me in a "vacation" state of mind, though other guests might find it too strong. The staff were quick, efficient and professional without being too pushy or "in your face". The prices at the restaurants are pretty outrageous, but it's a resort so I was prepared. For example, two wrap sandwiches, one margarita and two beers at the pool bar ran $75. It was the best grilled shrimp wrap I've ever had, though! Well worth it. The pina colada was wonderful and I made sure to indulge everyday! Primo was AWESOME. Dinner with a good bottle of wine ran $150 and I didn't regret a cent. My husband and I LOVED the lazy river. The pool shop (where the innertubes can be purchased for $5) was closed when we first arrived, so we just hopped in and swam around. We discovered it was such good exercise to do it this way that we never even bought the floaties! Late in the week, I made a comment to my husband that I kind of felt like floating, but as we only had one day left I wouldn't bother purchasing one. My husband said, "They aren't free? So this whole time, everyone just thinks we're being cheap?" We got a good laugh about that. It was a slow week so my husband and I never had any problem getting chairs or service. The only annoyance I had was when a got a cut at the pool and ran up to the front desk to see if they had a band-aid. They were a little too efficient and made a call to security to bring me a band-aid before I could say "don't worry about it". Unfortunately, since I had just trotted up from the pool, I didn't have a cent on me and the security person had his hand out for a tip. Awkward moment that I usually avoid by keeping tip money handy, but oh well! We also loved loved loved the fitness center. We work out at a pretty nice club and let me tell you--it doesn't have anything on the Ritz fitness center. Absolutely first class, perfect temp, water bottles handy, immaculate equipment, you name it. I read reviews on TA obsessively before choosing a hotel and I can't remember ever being too disappointed. I am pretty picky about things, but I also have the ability to have fun and just let things GO. You can find fault with any place, but I was hard pressed to find anything to complain about. Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lazy River at the Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: ngoodric
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott in Orlando over Labor Day weekend and absolutely loved it. The rooms and lobby were very nice. Our favorite part was the lazy river pool - it was so tropical! Also - the Marriott did have security at the pool entrance over the weekend verifying that everyone entering the pool area was a hotel guest. So we did not have any trouble with over crowding at the pool and there were plenty of pool chairs! Overall - a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: topresorts
Reviews.Content: This place on the surface is beautiful but the service experience is awful. The kids activities were very lame and the property does not have a water silde, only a temporary blow up kind of slide. The people organizing the kids club were confused and always started late. On Labor Day weekend, they had a Pinata that was a really dangerous situation and an accident waiting to happen. The food prices at pool side for a Hamburger were nuts-- $16!! There were not enough sun umbrellas and the staff does nothing when guests put a towel on their umbrella in the morning and disappear to "own" their spot for the whole day even if they do not use it. What is worse is that they are building a time share and the time share guests will have access to all hotel facilities which means that it will be even more crowded with more people using the same resources. The hotel obviously has a strategy of cutting back on staff to save money. As an example, we had to wait 30 minutes for a table at breakfast. Stay away from this place for now--definitely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: MCVCambridge_MA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott Orlando Grade Lakes for four days in March. The pool complex, complete with the largest lazy river I have ever seen, was fantastic for adults and children alike. We spent hours there with our daugther. The jacuzzis in the pool area were secluded and relaxing; one even featured a waterfall overflowing from an open, giant 'clamshell.' The staff were extremely attentive, and the breakfast buffet in the restaurant was gorgeously delicious. I would go back in a New York minute!

Reviews.Title: “nice J-dub”
Reviews.Author: arthanial
Reviews.Content: the only complaint I really have is that we got to the hotel early and they couldn't get us into a room. so instead we went straight to the pool which was great. the lazy river was fun. the only reason I marked the rating down was because of the poolside restaurant. the food is going to be pricey that isn't my problem. But when the service at the restaurant was disappointing. they took upwards of 45 mins to make burgers and our waiter checked on us only twice. not exactly worth paying for. everything else about the hotel was excellent. the staff was very generous. they swiftly handled our special requests without problems. our room had a wonderful view of orlando. all in all everything was excellent except for the poolside restaurant. this was a wonderful hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “My honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: seharmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three days right after we got married and it made our honeymoon wonderful. It has a great golf course, good room service and is clean and comfortable. Highly recommended to anyone visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Theft at lazy river again!”
Reviews.Author: Papucha
Reviews.Content: Ok-first the good -- great pools! Wow! Lazy river goes all over the place. Place is beautiful and you can use the Ritz. However, our teens wanted to run back to JW .. definitely nicer pools. Lunch about $15 wrap/burger..$7 smoothies (non-alcohol). Expensive but convenient if you are at poolside. Now, after reading previous reviews about the theft. We were there on 8/6 and a family got their valuables stolen by the lazy river. The other reviewer was absolutely correct -- there is no security to get in to the pools. Marriott security -- wisen up!! Just make sure to leave your valuables in the safe. Resort overall was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, relaxing enjoyable resort”
Reviews.Author: 5cookies
Reviews.Content: The resort is great overall. We stayed for 4 nights and 5 days (7/6 to 7/10) with a group of 4 adults and 4 kids (including 2 toddlers) and a good time was had by all. This was our third visit to this property and it is still absolutely beautiful. The pool is delightfully warm with a lazy river that you could spend all day in. Having the Ritz on the same property is is a good perk, we went to the spa, which was fantastic. The staff was pleasant, housekeeping was very efficient. Property was immaculate. The on-site late night eating is limited to room service, but that wasn't a major issue as room service was reasonably priced. I agree with a couple previous posts that the game room could be a litle more exciting for the older kids (15 and 11) but they also enjoyed the resort and even preferred to stay at the resort rather than to go to the theme parks (which were ridiculously crowded). We had a poolview room which was superb. We didn't want to leave. We'll definitely be back and most likely stay longer on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pound for Pound, why would you stay elsewhere?”
Reviews.Author: pkhanna
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this Hotel within 6months. My stay before that was at the Ritz Carlton next door. The JW Marriott is not only equal in value/service, it is OUTSTANDING as a family resort. Stay at the Ritz if you want a smaller/refined/no kids vacation. But go to the JW if you and your family want to have fun. The rooms were very spacious, all the views were great, and the service top notch. My kids (aged 8,6, and 3) had a blast and loved this hotel. The lobby is a little too large/impersonal for my liking, but that was the only drawback. Some may believe the hotel is geared towards large conferences and such, but the upside is that there is a full-fledged Starbucks in the lobby. Bonus. My recommendation, stay here - especially if you have Marriott status. Also - the price is right during low season. You simply cannot get better value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Crime at the Lazy River”
Reviews.Author: flipflopgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton which is attached to the JW Marriott. We were traveling with a toddler so we spent more time on the JW Marriott property because it was much more kid-friendly. Things to note: There is NO security anywhere and local Floridians come and use the facilities. We have stayed at many Ritz Carltons before and they usually require a room key to access the pool area. No such thing here. The lazy river is a really nice treat but it is set up for the PERFECT CRIME and we were victims. We left our stuff unattended in a baby stroller and went into the lazy river for one lap. When we came out, my wallet was gone. My credit cards were used in Kissimee. Clearly, not someone staying at the JW Marriott. Possibly an employee or a local who had wandered onto the property. We were clearly being watched because they knew to reach down into the basket of the stroller and dig for it. The wallet was not clearly visible. I later found out that night that the same thing had happened to another family at the lazy river that afternoon. Be careful. Either an employee has sticky fingers or someone is wandering onto the property and watching people get into the lazy river giving them about 10 minutes where your valuables will be unattended. I hope they catch this person.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharPalmCity
Reviews.Content: Dear future guests: My family travels quite a bit. This hotel was exquisite. We went as a family. The children wanted to stay another day at the pool vs. a theme park. Children loved the lazy river and activities. The lobby was beautiful. The rooms were immaculate and the bathrooms were extremely spacious. Room service was twice a day. We ate breakfast with a package deal and was so well worth it. The food was delicious. We did have dinner late one evening as well. All the help throughout the hotel were very nice. Would reccommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: bonmor
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in Orlando, and needless to say, I was not impressed with the JW. The grounds are beautiful, it smells pleasant upon entry (candles are nice), and the staff is pleasant. That is it.....the room we were in smelled and was humid each time we were gone from the room and returned. Not something you really want to return to after being in the sun and humidity all day long at the parks. The room service was slow and was easily the worst room service meal I have ever tried to eat! We were really tired from being out in the sun all day, that we opted to stay in and relax with a room service meal-big mistake!! If you take nothing from this review but this-do not order from room service-overpriced garbage-$90 to be exact! I don't mind paying alot for good food, but paying alot for horrible food is just too much to swallow (no pun intended). My next item-the pool. I was surprised that we did actually find a place to sit after reading the reviews on the hotel. The pool was huge....and dirty. Floating debris all over-which included every sort of bug known to Florida. My daughter found a few in her hair after our day at the pool-not what you would expect for JW or the Ritz, for that matter. So what did my family learn from this little adventure: Stay closer to the parks-The Marriott World resort is centrally located, takes fewer reward points (if you are a Marriott rewards member and we are), larger rooms, a huge, clean pool with slides for the kids, and much better service and food! We will not be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, expensive parking, crowded pool”
Reviews.Author: turquoisebuyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week with my adult daughter. The property is beautiful with an exceptional pool (lazy river) which was overcrowded and needed cleaning. Our room 3051 was rather small but very nice with comfortable beds and great TV. Our bathroom, however, smelled bad the entire time , had peeling wallpaper and a leaky shower that flooded the floor. I left a note for the maid but nothing was done except a thick rug was placed in front of the shower door. The staff was very nice and professional. I didn't care for the Citron Restaurant because it was very large, crowded and noisy. The quality of the food was very good, especially in the outdoor restaurant in the pool area. I did not like paying $15.00 to park the car and I thought it should be free considering it was pretty far from the hotel and you had to take a shuttle to get there. We opted for valet parking ($20) but with tips it became expensive as we used the car 3 or 4 times a day. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant”
Reviews.Author: MierGen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous, from the impeccably appointed lobby to the comfy bedding and bathrobes. Check-in was fast and simple, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The ONLY complaint that I would have about this hotel is that the smell of sandalwood is very overwhelming in the lobby. It smells very nice, but it could have been turned down a couple of notches.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but agree with other reviews about the pool chairs”
Reviews.Author: popopo888
Reviews.Content: We love the hotel and have stayed there for holiday weekends for the past 3 years. We live in Orlando and booked 2 rooms for our family. We saw many locals by the pool that we recognized either from the kids schools or the neighborhood. The vast majority of them were visiting for the day. Some had friends staying at the hotel and others did not. It is a shame that the hotel does not discourage the day trippers more. We were told there were 1000 chairs by the pool but if one is not there by 730 am to reserve them,you are out of luck. We really like the hotel and fireworks but the pool chair situation is the biggest turnoff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Swimming Pool”
Reviews.Author: fortune5
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed here in June 2006 (if I remember the month right). We enjoyed our stay here because the kids LOVED the pool (lazy river). It meanders through the entire resort. We stayed in a large room that overlooked the pool. Pool staff and lifeguards were nice and helpful. Timeshare salesmen were persistent in the lobby but we just kept saying 'no thank you'. The resort is not convenient to the theme parks of Orlando. It is quite far. We had to take a taxi to Universal and Disney which is about $50 each way. But the pool was great. We stayed in the resort as much as we can and the kids didn't seem to mind not visiting the theme parks everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Over run with local non guests!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cam7488
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 4 - 7th... I could have written the last review and can concur with everything that was said about the lack of security and the free-loaders who came onto the property each day for a free vacation!! I am Marriott elite member and have stayed throughout the Marriott chain including plenty of other Orlando properties and have never seen another hotel that has allowed so many non-hotel guests to come onto the property to utilize the facilities while the paying guests are left without services. This was our 3rd time at this hotel and will be our LAST! There are plenty of other hotels in the area that cater to their paying guests much better than this hotel, the complaints fell on deaf ears, they just do not seem to care... Don't get me wrong the hotel is still spectacular and the rooms are nice, beds great, etc... But my business travel and especially my vacation time is too valuable to be wasted fighting thru the non-paying crowds... What a shame !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun 4th Weekend”
Reviews.Author: TravelerJJ2854
Reviews.Content: Just returned for our first of many to come visits to JW Marriott Grand Lakes. We won't go again on Holiday Weekend, but considering the amount of people we had a good time. Sunday the 6th was much less crowded. We loved going along the Lazy River without so many people. We are considering taking the grand kids for a few days. This shares a property with the Ritz Carlton and the guests from both Hotels can use the Lazy River Pool. The breakfast was excellent. Many choices. Take the breakfast package, as it is 23.95 per person. Parking is 14 per day. I think this is unfair as you are already paying considerable to stay. All and all will definitely be back. For the 4th Weekend they had extended activities for the children. Great Fireworks too!

Reviews.Title: “Not the planned romantic get away we expected......”
Reviews.Author: wnbamiamisol
Reviews.Content: Maybe I was expecting too much for July 4th weekend? My boyfriend and I wanted a romantic 3 night stay at a top Orlando hotel. I have previously stayed at the Hard Rock, Portofino Bay, Orlando Downtown Marriott, World Center Marriott and a bunch of other, lesser hotels in Orlando. I had a difficult time deciding between the Ritz and the Marriott at Grande Lakes and chose a package at the JW Marriott that included breakfast. I am not sure if our stay would have been any better across the lawn at the Ritz. First, let me say the staff is extremely nice and very professional. The rooms are small but very nice (we had a king bed with desk, chair, sleeper sofa and that 37" LG LCD tv), The beds have feather top mattresses and a feather duvet and you melt down in. The bath has a beautiful marble and glass shower and a separate tub. Now, the not-so-great part was that no where did I read this hotel caters primarily to large families with young children. Children were running in the marble lobby, through the elegant lobby bar, in the room hall ways, and in the areas surrounding the pool. Children were crying and whining in the Citron Restaurant. Children were helping themselves using little hands to grab items on the buffet. Children were literally EVERYWHERE. Great if you have children. Not so great for romance. The pool with the lazy river was FULL as was every lounge chair by 10am, when we had finished our breakfast. We strolled over to the Ritz and again, their pool and every lounge chair was FULL at 10:15am. Screaming children were running everywhere. This was July 4th morning. We gave up and went shopping. At 5pm, every lounger was STILL FULL at both pools. This was our experience for 3 DAYS. On our last day, we succumbed and spent $40 to enjoy the pool at the Ritz Carlton Spa, where no one under 16 years old is allowed. It was the best $40 we could have spent and we had a wonderful relaxing afternoon. It was the only positive of our romantic getaway at this property. Let me say also, that the entire property has a problem with unregistered guests flocking to the property's pools. I think many children may be from unregistered guests. When we returned from shopping and were walking to the hotel, two guys in front of us were chatting about how they spend every weekend here at the pool (for free) because there is no security. The guys had a cooler and a pizza box! Yesterday, we watched a large family of 6 unload from a van with pool toys, coolers and floats and go directly through the hotel to the pool. The van had stickers on it and local license plates, so it was not a tourist rental. These were locals who had used the pool before. I went to the front desk and asked what was being done to stop the unregistered guests and they said "carry your key-card as you will be asked throughout the property to insure only guests are here. We have special security." We were not asked once for our room key-card. Last evening as we were sitting in the lobby bar, we watched this SAME FAMILY heading to the parking lot, wearing Marriott pool towels!!! Not only had they spent a FREE DAY at the pool, but they were stealing the JW Marriott towels. And, our entire stay we were unable even once to get an empty lounger at the pool! At check out, I asked the front desk clerk for the name of the General Manager, as I plan to write a detailed letter to him about our most unromantic stay ever. The clerk returned with the name of the pool manager and suggested I bring the problem to her attention. This could have been a great vacation had the JW Marriott / Ritz Carlton had some system to ensure that ONLY registered guests use their facilities. I think they are overwhelmed by the numbers of unregistered guests at their pool and don't see an easy way of preventing it. It is sad because I am generally a fan of both Marriott and Ritz Carlton Hotels and the first to recommend them for a nice vacation. This will not be the case with the JW Marriott Grande Lakes or the Ritz Carlton Grande Lakes.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriot @ Grand Lakes - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeresaHouston
Reviews.Content: Wonderful in every way, would recommend to everyone if you have the money to splurge a little. The decor is first class, the service was excellent. the grounds are absolutely gorgeous, the lazy river and pool set among the luscious landscaping was unbelievably beautiful - you can order and drink your frozen cocktails without ever leaving the pool. Food was excellent (a bit pricey, even for this place) but having a Starbuck's just inside the lobby was so very nice. One of the best things about this hotel is that it is connected to the Ritz Carlton, so I sprang for a pedicure at their fabulous spa, which granted me use of the spa facilities for the day. Tthe spa pool is incredbile, with non-stop relaxation music to help set the mood -I was one of only three guests the entire 3 hours I was in the pool - it seemed as though they read my mind while I enjoyed the pool because next the spa resterant delivered frozen drinks to us poolside, and I also tried a spa lunch which was so very good! I can't really think of anything I didn't like about this place other than they could stand to enlarge their gift shop.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel - Sub Par Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: mikelan6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in late June. This is a huge hotel complex built for business conferences and not really geared toward the theme park visitor like myself. Check in was very easy and parking was a short stroll away through the convention facilities. The hotel even features some nice shops and a Starbucks, which was very popular in the morning. Our room was very nice, with one Queen bed (not a king), a sofa bed, desk, chair and a gorgeous 37 inch LG LCD TV. The bathroom was beautiful. We did not use the pool or lazy river, but it looked fantastic. The landscaping was beautiful as was the setting. They also had bikes for rent and many other activities. We had dinner at the Citron restaurant on the lower level and were not happy. We were told there would be a 20 minute wait to get a table only to find that the place was 80% empty. We ordered from the menu, only to be told that some items - including meatloaf - were sold out. How they could be sold out on a busy weekend - I don't know. The prices were sky high - $42 for a filet and $25 for a Caesar salad with very little chicken and 4 croutons. Our drinks were not refilled and the server seemed to busy to wait on us. We were so dissatisfied that we skipped dessert. I would probably return to the hotel, but not if I'm going to the theme parks - I'd rather stay on-site if I could.

Reviews.Title: “By far the nicest in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: sshamby
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest hotel we have ever stayed at in Orlando. From the moment the bellmen opens your car door, the staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. We were upgraded to a suite and it was just wonderful. It was very clean and the maid staff made sure you had everything you needed. The pool and lazy river (which is only 3.5ft very good for little kids) were a blast. We would stay here everytime we visit Orlando if we could! Only negative was that we ate lunch at the pool (p'nut butter and jelly, two chicken wraps and a cheesburger with soda) and it cost $75 - I almost fell out of my chair.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: budinct
Reviews.Content: A terrific hotel with a great pool. Clean, modern and a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Pricey with Some Issues”
Reviews.Author: JPinJupiter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a the J.W. Marriott for a combination buisness/pleasure stay. The property shares some facilities with the Ritz-Carlton Grande Lakes. Pros: 1. We received a decent rate compared to other 4/5 star hotels in the area. 2. The hotel's architecture and facilities are nice. I would strongly recommend the "lazy river" pool for families or for couples. 3. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Cons: 1. I found a cockroach in the shower. It's not that the bathroom was dirty in anyway--in fact, both the bedroom and bathroom appeared to be very clean and smelled fresh. However, finding a roach is unacceptable at a hotel of the J.W.'s caliber--even if it is Florida. 2. The hotel food was average with above average prices. 3. My wife used the spa at the Ritz-Carlton for a massage and the masseuse spent a good deal of time talking about how she had wasn't feeling well and might be sick. That doesn't exactly create a "relaxing" environment that you would expect from a Ritz. 4. The in-room guest guide says that hotel offers movies by the pool in the evening. When I called to find out what the movie was going to be, I learned that this activity was no longer offered, but would instead be replaced by "cookie-decorating". Recommendations: I wasn't sure whether to give this property 3 or 4 stars, because it really depends what you want from a hotel. f you're a couple looking for a romantic getaway, you'd be better off staying at the Ritz. If you have kids, the J.W. Marriott is a very nice upscale hotel with amenities and services geared toward children. If you are staying with a family, I'd strongly recommend eating off-property to get quality food at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “nicest hotel we ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Dewey.Hoyt
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. People friendly, service impeccable and the lazy river is so much fun. My 5 year old son, wife and I did not want to go back to the Parks, that is how much fun we had in the lazy river. The food in the hotel is good but a bit pricey. We ate 1 dinner there and it was $120. We ate lunch at the pool which was a lot more reasonable. The rooms were super clean. The price was $219 per night plus $14 per day to park with taxes it came to about $250 per night. If you stay here, yuo will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Suberb hotel - an Orlando oasis !”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuy26
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 children and myself stayed at the JW Marriott Orlando Grande Lakes on vacation for 10 days. The huge grounds of the Grande Lake estate were a welcome break from the hustle and bustle of the Orlando theme parks and it provides you with a real sense of escape. Whilst the majority of hotels seem to sit on International Drive (and therefore closer to Disney World), we felt it looked too crowded and busy (just a row of hotels one after the other, plus the constant traffic on International Drive itself). The JW Marriott by comparison sits conveniently between Disney and Orlando International Airport (about 20mins drive from each) and Seaworld is about 5-10mins up the road. Once you access the hotel entrance from the main road, the hotel itself is set well back on the Grande Lakes estate, with no noise disruption from traffic. We found the hotel to be very convenient, but realistically you will need a car to get to/from the various attractions. This isn't a problem, but if you only want to spend time at Disney World and don't want to drive, then you may want to stay on International Drive (but you won't have the tranquility of the JW Marriott). We reserved a deluxe room but were upgraded to a lake-view room that overlooks the lake, golf course and lazy-river pool area (definitely recommended). The photos on the hotel website really do not do any justice to the lazy-river - it is possibly one of the best pool areas I've come across in a chain hotel. The hotel is exceptionally well maintained both inside and out, rooms are of a good size (all four of us managed comfortably in one room) and bathrooms especially are larger than your average hotel (including a separate bath and shower). The JW is adjacent to the Ritz-Carlton and guests of both are able to use the Ritz's spa facilities. Despite the size of the hotel and its conference facilities, this hotel is great for families. There is an arts & crafts table in the Citron restaurant at breakfast time, inflatables for hire/purchase for use in the pool, volley ball court, table football and tennis court. You can also high 4-wheel 'bikes' (more like pedal cars), to cycle around the path adjacent to the lake. If you are considering booking - check Expedia. We found that although Marriott claim to offer the lowest publicly available prices on their website - we were able to book an Expedia 'escape package' at a 40% discount to the lowest rate on Marriott.com (including breakfast for the the 4 of us). Restaurant prices are typically higher than you would expect to pay outside the hotel (c.$20 for a burger / club sandwich), but the food is very good and worth trying. If you are on vacation and visiting the various parks though - you'll probably find Disney prices to be not that far off, plus you'll likely have to content with long wait times for a table in the restaurants. Consequently, you'll probably find dining at the hotel a much more relaxing experience if nothing else ! The hotel states on its website it charges $10 per day for parking, but we didn't have any parking charges on our bill and the card-swipe machine for the car-park showed a rate of $1 per night - therefore probably worth checking before you travel. Overall the hotel is excellent. Beautiful grounds, a grand building, great location, plenty of parking and very friendly staff. Definitely recommended for families wanting a good quality hotel, couples, and business travellers (given its proximity to the airport and the size of the conference facilities).

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Trip to the JW”
Reviews.Author: Rum2Drink
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our 5th stay at the Jw Marriott. They really went out of their way for a great Memorial Day Weekend. In addition to the normal great features they offer, they had a waterslide, bounce house, games, free cotton candy, and snow cones for kids. The fireworks display was great also. The lazy river was a blast and the drink service along the river was a nice touch. It is nice to feel like you actually got what you paid for. Our room was exceptionally clean and service throughout the hotel was great. Glad to see it is still free to use the gym as other hotels in the area have started to charge (Swan/Dolphin). I did hear a few people talking about the valet fee of $20 and high drink prices, but when you add everything up with the great service, cleanliness, and the lazy river.... you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laen27
Reviews.Content: The J.W. Marriott on the Lake is truely a beautiful hotel. The rooms are clean, modern and the pool view is breath-taking. All amenities are upscale, therefore they are expensive. The pool area is large and great for all ages. I would definitely stay at this hotel again as the hotel and cuisine were exceptioanlly good. If you are looking for a budget hoetl, this is not one to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Has the potential to be number one in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: JinORF
Reviews.Content: I had been to this property on business and thought enough of it to return with my family in tow for vacation. The pool/lazy river and staff/service at the pool side restaurant Quench were great (be sure to try the Grouper). The children's activities could have been much better managed by the staff. While the scheduled activities are good there was not much interest in getting children involved or engaging the children among the staff. The rooms are typical hotel rooms so it can get tight for a family of four if you only book one room. The only issue we had with our room was that there was a dead bud smashed on the ceiling upon arrival. It bothered my wife a lot more than it bothered me. The proximity to Sea World was decent. The shuttle over in the morning only runs twice and there is only one return around 6 pm, so if you have little ones and stay here you would still need a rental car. The Renassanice shares a parking lot with Sea World and might be a better option if that is your main park destination. We enjoyed the ammenities of the hotel greatly. There are also many new restaurant choices close by, just take a right out of the hotel on John Young PKWY and go about 2 miles. We really did enjoy our stay and will return. If the service provided by most of the hotel staff had been as five star as the hotel and the hotel ammenities (the exception is the staff at Quench - Bravo!) this would have been an amazing family vacation hotel. I still give this hotel four out five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gdavan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. I stayed here on business for a few nights and really enjoyed the hotel and pool area. I got room service a couple times and can't say I was crazy about the menu. The room was nice, with a good size bathroom. The pool was really nice with plenty of pool chairs and lots of sun. I wish I had stayed here for personal reasons instead of on business, I would have been able to enjoy the resort more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Function Location”
Reviews.Author: shebuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott Grande Lakes for a business function in March 2008. The grounds are meticulously cared for, the pool was fantastic, and the room was very comfortable. I highly recommend the sushi bar though the drinks are rather expensive. Their conference service team did an excellent job in executing each meal and break - I should know, my husband is in the business! Though I didn't have an opportunity to go to the common Orlando attractions during my stay, I can imagine that it would be difficult to leave the property to do so!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week for a conference, and I had a terrific experience overall. Lobby is very nice, central bar, a few restaurant choices, and there is a covered path to the Ritz if you want an even more upscale experience. Accomodations were nice (including comfortable beds), food was good, conference meeting rooms were great, and the gift shops were cute. Water with orange slices in the lobby is a nice touch too. Overall an upscale experience and I would definitely consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: pnutsdad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott for a business trip and it was a wonderful hotel for business. As you drive up with the JW Marriott on one side and the Ritz Carlton on the other, you know you have arrived at a fine hotel. The check in process was quick and easy. The staff was very helpful and the layout was very open and comfortable. The rooms were a nice size and clean. The bed was very comfortable with a chocolate on the pillow each night before you turned in. I had a standard room so it had a king bed, couch, desk and lounge chair. Some rooms had small balconies. The golf course was challenging; however, golfers from all skill levels will have a good time. The staff at the pro shop and 19th hole was extremely helpful and friendly. This was the first course where I saw alligators (2) in the water near the course and it was quite interesting to see alligators in the wild. The hotel has several pools and a lazy river that looked nice; I did not get time to enjoy them however. This is a great hotel for business travel, but not sure I would stay with family. While the food was good at the onsite restaurants, it was expensive. The bar in the lobbywas very expensive. I had a Chopin Vodka on the rocks and while it was a nice size drink, it was not worth the $28.00 I was charged. Overall, a very nice place to stay, but if you come with the family, I would recommend a car so you can get to other places for more modest pricing on food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dolphin5026
Reviews.Content: You walk into this hotel and you know you are staying somewhere really wonderful, a breathtaking entrance with beautiful marble tiling, a fountain, scented candles, warm apple cider or chilled water on arrival and very helpful staff. Coming back to the hotel after theme parks and shopping malls is like escaping from it all. The drive up to the hotel and the manicured grounds are lovely. It is a huge hotel but every area is well laid out and its size means you can bring children there and not be concerned about them disturbing other guests. We had our three year old with us and he could run down wide carpeted corridors without meeting another guest - it is that big!! The pool area is wonderful - with lots of seperate areas, a lazy river, a toddlers pool with resident crocodile :) a play area and the water was nice and warm for december. Our suite was huge, on the 18th floor with amazing views. Really comfy beds, a large bathroom and lots of space for all the shopping you are sure to accumulate, and we didn't feel on top of each other no matter how long we stayed in the room. The food at the hotel is excellent, a great buffet every morning offering everything you could imagine in a huge airy dining room with seperate booths, and colouring books, stickers and crayons for the kids - so child friendly. The spa is located next door in the Ritz, a short walk through the gardens and beside the pool. It is a Ritz standard spa so the treatments are wonderful and a great place to escape to. The Marriott has all the charm, excellence of service and wonderful atmosphere of the Ritz without any of the snobbery.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: cheer_girl101
Reviews.Content: Me and my familly stay here all the time because it is one of the cleanest hotels i have ever seen. the breakfast is fantastic and the view is great expecially if your room has a view of the pool. i even brought my friend with me when school was over in june, and im bringing my friend this time to in june and if it is enything like is was last time i know i will injoy it. this is a great place for teens and kids and even older people it a place that you can feel safe even if your on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Not a military friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Beagles4Me
Reviews.Content: We have reservations for March 22, 2008 and I just felt that anyone with a military ID will not be welcome there, unless you have orders. My husband is a retired Marine, and our son is attending culinary school in Orlando. We wanted to spend Easter with him, so we were looking around for different prices at hotels near my son's apartment. When we saw the military rate, we noticed there's a note that you only get this rate with orders and that it's not good for leisure. We've never had this experience before, so my husband called the central reservations number for Marriott and it was confirmed that normally all you need is a valid military ID, but to call the hotel directly since each hotel is individually owned. My husband called and was first told that it's a state law in Florida that you can only get military rates with orders. This is something we've never heard of since we're Florida residents. My husband did receive an e-mail from someone at Marriott showing their policy regarding military reservations, but it said nothing about it being a Florida law. After talking to the hotel manager, we were told to go ahead and reserve a room and we'd be given the military rate. Today my husband gets a call from the hotel manager saying that we are allowed to stay this one time only and that's it. The manager said she called other hotels to see what their policy was on military rates and the only thing she told my husband was what we already knew.. you have to show your ID card at check in. An ID card is NOT orders and there's never been a restriction on leisure travel. I feel this kind of service is a slap in the face for anyone who served our country and am now debating whether or not we'll keep our reservation or stick with our original hotel plan... Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a JW Marriott?”
Reviews.Author: xoxx
Reviews.Content: Don't be mislead to believe this is a luxury hotel. Although the public areas are attractive, once you get up to your room you realize that this is a just a mediocre convention hotel. Room furnishings look like a dated Marriott. Our room had scruffed walls and paint gauges on the doors. Bathroom had little storage for your belongings. Ours had a rug that was torn and dirty soap dish. At turn down service, no towels were replaced, no trash emptied. No safe in your room either. Food and drink prices were high for the quality. Internet should be complementary. This property should be re-evaluated and downgraded to the Marriott brand. It is not JW Marriott quality. Stay next door at the Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: rangeley
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here the weekend of Feb. 22nd - This is a very nice upscale property for Orlando. The organic restaurant Primo was fantastic, there are a few fun shops on property and a starbucks. The spa (which is actually in the Ritz) was very tranquil and upscale - and very pricey! The walking aound the property was a bit limited considering how much space the resort takes up. Overall, great spot if you are in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: Tanjaworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott for 2 nights. Although the hotel has some very nice features like the golf course, the gym and the pool area I agree with the reviews who say that it's not anything special. The hotel doesn't offer a big choice of restaurants or shops. Also the hotel has some issues with cleanliness. Even though they do your bed nicely for the night with some chocolate, the housekeeping really should improve their elaborateness. The tooth brush holder was stained with dried toothpaste from guests before, which makes you wonder about the all in all cleanliness of the room. On the first morning we ordered breakfast to our room and headed then out for shopping. When we came back they had cleaned the tooth brush holder (after we complained at the front desk) and the bed was also done, but they did not clean the milk stains from our breakfast on the table. So this was very strange and we did not feel comfortable afterwards. There was also quite some dust on the lamps, what should not be the case for a 4-5 star hotel. What we also didn't like is that the hotel has a lot of additional fees. For example parking was $14/night and wireless internet was $16/from noon to noon and movies were at least $14 each or even $20. Most of the normal TV channels are not available, which makes you order movies automatically. So your stay at this hotel may get quite expensive if you add all these things up. I know other 5 star hotels whose prices are more reasonable. So I consider the JW as a solid property, but for my next stay I would definitely chose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay, Wonderful Property”
Reviews.Author: susiebar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW in January 07 and was thrilled with everything. This property beats the Ritz, which is on the same grounds. Attentive staff and wonderful accommodations. Though the hotel is large, and mostly a convention hotel, it is excellent for resort guests as well. Sprawling pool with lazy river (it was too cold when we were there) but I am sure during the warmer months it is great. The views from the rooms are exquisite and the rooms are very comfortable and quite elegant- comfortable beds! My boyfriend had arrived with a bouquet of roses for me and we quickly had to go out that evening for a show, but when we got back, our beds were turned down, and the roses were beautifully arranged in a gorgeous vase, and they lasted the whole trip! The restaurants are excellent. Primo is outstanding and even if you are not staying at the hotel, it is a MUST! The lobby bar is really nice also, we enjoyed drinks and found it to be very elegant and relaxing. Concierge staff is very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel, is has so much going for it, as do all of the JW Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Average high-end hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisny2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a satisfactory high-end hotel. But to me, it is on par with general Hyatts or Hiltons. Overall, I liked some elements of the hotel; the lobby and pool area are beautiful; but I felt that overall it was nothing special. We requested a rollaway bed in advance and again at check-in. I finally had to call again at midnight to let the hotel know that they still hadn't put a rollaway bed in the room. The beds were quite comfortable and I enjoyed the shower stall and bath tub. The bath products were small and were of average quality. The room did not contain mouthwash, a toothbrush, or anything special. Parking was expensive, as was the lobby bar. The service didn't really match up. A doorman never offered to help with our bags upon arrival. One nice point: even though the hotel was very full, check-in and check-out were quick and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Alex”
Reviews.Author: UsaAlex
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, primo is good restaurant for get nice dinner, the pool bar have good snacks and nice frozen drinks, but Citron the main restaurants is the worse place that I ever been, the people working there is TOO MIND the servers think that they are super stars, and THEY THINK THAT THE SERVERS ASSISTENTS WORKING FOR THEM ARE SLAVES , When I been there I fell so sorry for. The server Susan that smell RUN and look like drunk Im very sure that she was IS Pathetic! the worse one!. Even the food was all right I couldn’t enjoy bcz the nasty atmosphere. I had a plan for expend there 2 week in JW,but after 1 night there I moved to the Ritz Carlton, and helphully, I had good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hardware - Service doesn't match-up”
Reviews.Author: KurtBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: Always enjoy staying at this hotel when travelling on business. Beautiful and spacious lobby area, very nice rooms and love the gym and spa. Grounds are beautiful too. Only problem with hotel is there is no place to dine nearby and while Citron's has great food - the service is consistently bad (Waitress Susan is downright awful) and so overpriced. Housekeeping is below average as well. With so many good hotels to choose from in Orlando, it's too bad they can't get the service right. Especially considering the beautiful infrastructure and their affiliation with the Ritz next door....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Holiday Stay”
Reviews.Author: justalady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriot after Christmas thru the 4th of January and we loved it. We have a 8 month old who is a big crawler so we requested no balcony and actually got a little bigger room with a couch, chair, and table. The pool was awesome and the lazy river is nice. The breakfast buffet was included in our package and it was really good. In general, the food in all the restaurants was good. The only negative was the valet. They pretty much were worthless. The took forever to get your vehicle and really didn't care much. We still used it b/c we were lazy and because of all the "baby baggage" that we always seem to have but it really stunk. Oh, and one more negative: The business center is expensive and unknowledgable. You pay $3/page to fax and have to tell the attendant how to run the fax machine. Also, wireless is $15/day. Thankfully I was on vacation and only had to do some work once while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: jazzsmin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just beautiful. It was pretty cold when we arrived so we could not use the pool, but it was just lovely in everyway. Room service is super fast and the service is A+. I highly recommend this property especially to parents with kids, and even for a romantic get away. Things are a little pricy but to be expected, so no complaits here. Room was VERY CLEAN too.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Holiday Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sid111
Reviews.Content: This "resort" is awesome! It is adjacent to the Ritz-Carlton and surrounded by lakes, as well as, a Greg Norman signature golf course. Both hotels are beautiful and provide a large variety of amenities that can be utilized by guests from both hotels. Service, courtesy and respect are top priorities at this resort! Utilize hotel provided vacation planner services prior to your stay. One call is all you need to make reservations on or off property. The standard rooms are nicely appointed and have a large bathroom with separate shower and bath tub. All restaurants have excellent dining experiences. The entree selections are superb. Room Service provides a nice selection of entrees from each of the restaurants within both hotels. Wonderful family outing on golf course. Yes, children are able to play after 1-2pm with complimentary greens fees and equipment rental. The pools are beautiful. There are pool bars surrounding the area with pool side food and drink service provided. Sand court volleyball and bocce courts are near the pool area. Ritz Kids is available to guests staying at Ritz-Carlton and J.W. Marriott. Many activities and events are included with camp costs. There is a gameroom for older children with video games and two pool tables. If you are staying New Year's Eve request a room with a lakeside view. You will see fireworks from Disney, Universal, and Sea World, all while watching the hotel's own fireworks. Ask for breakfast package included with room rate. Buffet at Citron is $21 for adults. It is well worth the cost, but can add up over the course of your stay. I have read several reviews that complained about transporation from the Grande Lakes properties. A complimentary shuttle is provided to Sea World and Universal. There are scheduled departure times from the hotels in the morning and scheduled return times in the evening. Town Car Service is available at the front of each hotel. Flat Rate Fees as of 1/3/08 are as follows: $25 one way to Universal and Mall at Millenia, $15 one way to Sea World or Discovery Cove. This makes your trip completely hassle free, no traffic (drivers are aware of traffic congestion and take an alternate route), no parking fees, no long walks to your rental car after a long day. If you are looking to get away from parks after a long day, or you want a wonderful place to stay that you don't want to leave, this is the oasis you have been hoping for. Men's and Women's apparrel, jewelry store, general items, Starbuck's and Spa are all located with in the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Year's Eve; Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: fsufan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 12/30/07 - 1/2/08 for 3 nights with my boyfriend. We live nearby in Tampa and wanted to get away for a few nights for New Year's Eve and celebrate our anniversary (we met at Christmas 2 yrs ago). My boyfriend secretly called ahead the morning of our arrival and told them it was our anniversary. We were able to check-in at 1pm which was great as I could see that several people were checking in that day. The bellman even told us that we were lucky our room was ready as about 250 guests were checking out and 250 guests were checking in that day. When we entered our room there was a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries with a note saying Happy Anniversary. I thought it was a very nice touch! I thought the resort was gorgeous! We had a king bed room with a balcony overlooking the pool, lakes and golf course. It was great, as the hotel had fireworks at midnight on New Year's Eve and we were able to watch them from our balcony. You could also see 3 or 4 other fireworks displays going on in other parts of Orlando at the same time! They also had a party going on in the lobby for New Year's Eve with a DJ and a band. We danced down there until about 11pm, then headed up to our room and ordered room service and watched the fireworks display. We walked next door to the Ritz Carlton to compare the hotels. To be honest, I'm not sure that the Ritz is worth the extra money in this case, as the JW Marriott is that nice! I have stayed at other Ritz Carltons in the past (but not the one in Orlando). Probably the major difference is the bathroom is a bit smaller at the JW Marriott compared to other Ritz properties I've stayed at. There is no separate room for the toilet and a single sink instead of double sink. The bathroom was still VERY nice, with a separate tub and shower and granite counter top. I guess the furnishings are a bit more traditional and country club like at the Ritz compared to the JW Marriott. However, you are able to use the Ritz facilities and still charge to your room. We ate at the Vineyard Grill at the Ritz for dinner one night and it was excellent! My favorite part of the JW Marriott was the Lazy River. As others have said it is SLOW, but is still a nice, relaxing pool. It's heated, so not too cold for a Floridian in December :) I've stayed at Atlantis in the Bahamas and it's similar to their lazy river, but a bit slower. There was a man playing guitar and singing by the pool which was nice. The pool was definitely not too crowded (maybe everyone was at the theme parks?) and we easily found chairs to lounge on. As stated in other reviews, you have to buy the tubes for the lazy river for $5/each. We at at Quench by the pool and had DELICIOUS cheeseburgers. Although I did not use the fitness center I did take a look. It's located at the spa between the Ritz and JW Marriott and is free for guests of either hotel. It looked to be very nice with TVs at each treadmill. There is also a jogging path outside by the lakes where you can also rent the surrey bikes. Valet parking is $20/day, which is a bit high and food prices are on the high side, but can be expected at a resort. They have in-room movies for about $15, but include movies that are still in the theaters. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely return if I found a decent rate. If you have any questions, feel free to message me!

Reviews.Title: “Over 15 Crucial Tips about JW Marriott Grande Lakes Orlando Florida”
Reviews.Author: cooldoctor1
Reviews.Content: The Smythe family of 2 adults, 2 teens from Urbana, IL stayed at the JW Marriott (JWM), 4040 Central Florida Parkway, Grande Lakes Orlando from Dec 2007-Jan 2008. It is, as others have stated, a palatial property with the best pool I have ever seen at a Marriott, including the Camelback Inn, Eden Roc, and Ko Olina/Ihilani HI. It features a snaking lazy river, the first I’ve ever known where you’re not required to use a float tube (float tube rentals $5/week—but you can find them poolside easily or buy a $1.99 tube at Target as staff allows you to bring your own); the JWM allows you to body surf and swim the entire lazy river without a tube; you can stand up 3-4 feet deep and swim wherever you’d like. The “river” connects at least five separate grotto-like pools, including one gradual depth pool for tykes. There are plenty of blue cushioned lounge chairs, the best of which face the lake, but they are all gone by 11AM by towel throwers that may or may not ever show up again. The water is all heated and the landscaping is lush with coconut trees and fruit palms. Two hot tubs are small for a pool this size. Few lifeguards during daytime, and none at evening, but the lighted pool open until 9PM is steamy fun after dark with underwater LEDs and backlit trees. Agree with prior reviewers about the pool being unkempt by evening, with soiled towels and lip-sticked drink cups everywhere. And if some kid gets sucked into the vacuum drain like those hapless stories on Dateline NBC, there will be no hero lifeguards. I saw none past 5PM. So, like your neighborhood swimming hole, pick up your own towel and swim at your own risk. But it is a pool with plenty of rocky hidden nooks and crannies for hours of fun (but sadly, no slide). Love that the wait drones unobtrusively walk around the pool but do not bother “Drink? Drink?” as they would, for example, on a Carnival cruise. My biggest knock to the pool: even though this is a non-smoking property, management allows smoking at all the pools. I was lounging poolside with a fresh beer, just getting to the good part in J.D. Salinger’s A Perfect Day for Bananafish—you know, when Seymour Glass pops his own noggin—when I am overtaken by the stench of a White Owl blunt. Some endomorphic, cardiac-bypass candidate was chomping a lit stogie behind us. I asked him to put it out, and he informed me that smoking is allowed; a quick trip to the manager confirmed that the putrid, belching smokers in Bill Marriott’s world are welcome to puff it up at the family pools at the JWM. The pool manager offered to move us—not the smoker! Sorry to see it as there were Virginia Slims puffing Magdas—the haggardly 95 lb ladies with cow leather skin and a voice like Jack Palance—at several areas around the pool surrounded by dozens of gasping parents and children. Regrettably, I deduct a point for this antiquated smoking policy, plus the generally unguarded and unclean pool area. The pool itself, though, is “killer”. Beyond the comments of the other respected reviewers on tripadvisor, I’d like to give you some “true tips” to this recommended 2003-built luxury behemoth hotel. (1)Location: JWM is 9 miles from Disney and Universal, 4 miles from Sea World and Gatorland; it’s a straight drive to each of those locations. It is 8 miles from the airport and is conveniently only four miles off I-4. It’s on Central FL Parkway, which, along with Orange Blossom Trail running perpendicular to it, has every single conceivable restaurant and shopping venue (and I mean every one—at least a couple hundred; if you name one not on this strip, I will eat my hat). You name the chain, it’s here, all less than five miles from this hotel. The key is that you remember not only to drive up and down Central Florida Parkway (the street the JWM is on), but also Orange Blossom Parkway (one main street over), which has dozens more eateries; ask the helpful concierge. You will find the driving easy for directions, but traffic, as it is in all of Orlando, is treacherous due to car volume and lost tourists cutting lanes like Richard Petty at the Daytona 500. Check with your car insurance carrier before your trip to see if you are covered for accidents on your personal insurance without paying the freakishly high auto rental surcharge. But, fear not eating and shopping if you stay at JWM. It’s all—and I mean all—only five minutes down the street. Please also note that the Premium Outlet Shops, including high end retailers (so, no great bargains, frankly) are about 15 minute drive from the hotel. (2)Hotel food: didn’t even eat it except burgers at the pool restaurant Quench; too costly ($75 for four burgers and fries, Cokes and a single beer), and too many tasty options just down the street. Beer tip, though: Buy the domestic beer (e.g. Budweiser) once in a giant 23 ounce plastic souvenir cup for $10 at Quench by the pool, and then every 23 ounce beer refill in that plastic cup during your entire stay is only $5. See menu or bartender for details. Not bad. (3)Season: we are here Xmas to New Years and although most things open including eating places even on Xmas, the volume of traffic and people would suggest coming some other time of the year if you can. Busy as a one-legged man in a butt kicking contest around here on the holidays. We’re told that Jan-Feb and Sept-October are the slower, more desirable months. (4)Kissimmee/St Cloud: advertised on TV as a cheaper alternative to Orlando, it is 11 miles from the JWM, and it’s an absolute hole. Vagrants, cheap hotels, littered streets, homies playing dominos on porches, pawn shops and pit bulls are some of the sights in Kissimmee. Skip it. (5)Amusement Parks: Go early and beat the crowds. Run to the very back of the park and work your way to the front, and do your rides counterclockwise. Everyone else will start at the front and work counterclockwise, too; it’s behavioral science and as a sociology professor myself, this advice works to help you stay ahead of the crowd. Always, also, get in the leftmost line as it is less frequented. By the way, I thought Gatorland would be “old school” Florida kitschy fun. It was, instead, a boring money pit with lifeless, fenced alligators. Avoid. (6)The Ritz-Carlton: The only other property at Grande Lakes with JWM, it is a much smaller appearing hotel and tiny warm pool, but I did not go inside. I think it not worth the price (double the JWM) based on what I see, as the JWM is very posh. It is, however, more secluded and boutique-like. The Ritz pool is one large tiled traditional pool and is quite bland. (7)Room: we had a standard lake view room, which is 425 sq feet, and the rooms not facing the lake overlook the expansive greenery of the front of the hotel, well off the main road on this 500 acre estate. I value an interesting view, and after staying here, I think you’d be fine with a regular, cheaper “resort” view, and perhaps get a free upgrade to the lake view if you’re lucky. All views look good as I studied them from the side windows. If you have to watch your kids in the pool, then ask for a low floor pool view. Our room had two full beds, but with growing boys, we asked for a rollaway bed. It was a nice sturdy framed bed with real single mattress that was made up by the chambermaid daily; not like the rollaways of Boy Scout days. Recommended. The bathroom is granite, small but elegant, and clean. All doors are heavy and solid, and the room is very quiet. I, a lifelong insomniac, sat in the bathtub at 4AM while the family slept—you know, wondering if I have a special purpose in life or if I am simply a waste of oxygen-carrying red corpuscles—when I noticed the framed over sink mirror, the wall art, the heavy-glass shower with chromed silver fixtures and the gentle recessed lighting; a premier 11’x9’ bathroom, indeed. Makes me feel good, even if the tub is hard on my rump after sitting for two hours in it. The bedroom is cheery yellow with crown molding, a desk, and floor to ceiling windows covered with plush, room-darkening shades. Suites were all full when we were at JWM so we did not reserve or even see one. The AAA rate saved $25 daily, so I signed up on-line for AAA for $50 annually a few days prior to this trip and got the JWM AAA preferred rate and got back the membership fee in the first two nights alone. And yes, they did require us to show the active AAA membership number when we checked in. AAA card saves you at every amusement park also. Plus, if I cop a flat tire, some lackie will show up three hours later roadside to fix it. The American Automobile Association ain’t just for Grandpa’s anymore, I guess. Most JWM Grande Lake rooms have balconies, about 25% do not have balconies; ask for a balcony. We were on 11th floor out of 26 floors total; it was still high enough and quiet. In-room electronic safe and clothes iron standard; no hair dryer, although they do have one of those wall-mounted magnifying mirrors where you can spot every hairy mole on your face quite easily. Sink in bathroom only. Locked fridge with $5 Fiji water and $3 KitKat bars. Marriott super sleeper beds are quilty comfy (but do they ever wash the duvet?). (8)Laundry: 3rd floor, $2 wash, $2 dry, $1 Tide, only 3 washers and 3 dryers for 1000 rooms; you do the math. Oddly, no dollar bill change machines. (9)Television: Not LCD, not HDTV, but with pay in-room movies. Unlike at some Marriott hotels, TVs accept RCA cables for your video games, video cameras and PlugNPlays. (10)Parking: self parking daily charge of $10 automatically to your card, typical Marriott nickel and dime job, and is about 1/8 mile from hotel entrance. But you can drop off Grandma and your bags at front entrance first, then park. Key card access to parking grounds. Valet available, but they park in same lot as self-parkers. Plenty of empty spaces, easy. You need a rental car. Taxi from Int’l Airport is $50 each way. “Feel the burn, baby”. A Chevy Equinox with 18k miles from a national rental agency for the 7-day week including all taxes and fees with the AAA discount (I’m liking this AAA thing) was $407, cars only $320 from Orlando Airport. Most major auto rentals (Hertz, National, Alamo, et cetera) have cars right at the Orlando airport, not some off site shuttle location. Check on this when you rent as it is very convenient to do the paperwork at the luggage carousel and simply walk across the street to the parking garage and get in your vehicle. (11)Lobby: impressive, immaculate, marbled and rich, and a great meeting spot. Next door is the conference center. Halls are long, but security cameras every 20 feet. Concierge helpful, esp. for directions, and separate theme park attendant that’ll sell you tickets (remember to show AAA card). The JWM is connected via indoor hallways to the Ritz-Carlton, too. (12)Golf: right outside the door and across a walking bridge (no need to drive), the course looks fairly flat with plenty of water (i.e. lost balls) and few trees. There was a mention of $179 greens fee—could this be? Driving range on-site with $5 bucket of balls, too. (13)Activities: free tetherball a la Napoleon Dynamite, huge lawn chess and checkers set (makes you appreciate sitting at a table to play), nice running paved trail along lake but only 1.5 mile total, hula hoops, foosball, bocce ball, all free. Best is free sand volleyball court; suggest buying your own ball at Target store on Orange Blossom for the week. Fun, free. Three lighted tennis courts, unknown fee but seem free. Rental beach bikes, but no place much to ride them. Saw no one access the swampy lake, but it’s pretty at night and no known crocs. Lame basketball net by the tennis court with flat balls and cannot play if anyone playing tennis. (14)Service: housekeeping exceptional, even lined up our shoes and toiletries. Turn-down and chocolates at night. Really nice attendants, always a “Hello, Mister and Missus”. We tipped $5 daily and they seemed to appreciate it with extra clean services, but did a fabulous job anyhow. We did not use room service food, but the Marriott “fine print” on menu states that they add 21% surcharge plus a flat $3 to each order making it cost prohibitive. Beware. (15)Internet: Can be ordered in your room for a large fee, or through the teensy Business Center on the first floor using JWM computers. How much? An Aussie guest left his bill next to the computer: 47 minutes internet, $26.75. Guess my email can wait. (16)Sundries: Starbucks on ground floor 6AM-6PM daily, and a sundry shop (think aspirin, magazines and such) next to a couple high end stores selling baubles for the glitterati set. Walgreens ¼ mile down the street for the rest of us. We’re told that this hotel caters to mostly business travelers because of the conference centers at the Ritz-Carlton next door and here at JWM, but I assure you that it’s every bit elegant for families, is convenient to everything without being on the honky tonk roads, and is a Hawaii-like oasis of green on 500 acres in Orlando. It does not feel “businessy” at all like, for instance, a Marriott Courtyard. Highly recommended, I’d stay here again, and would recommend it to my own extended family. I hope you found this review and photos helpful; I tried hard to answer detailed questions that many of you might have and to give useful tips. If it was a help, click below, as my only reward—like Pavlov’s salivating dog and the dinner bell—is your approval click. Thank you and happy vacationing, my fellow tripadvisor fanatics headed to Mouseland, Florida. Enjoy and be safe and please, most of all, have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Love the JW....nice relaxing getaway!”
Reviews.Author: napatree
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the JW Marriott in Orlando. First was in 2005. Both our visits were quick get aways in the midst of family visits. The hotel is beautiful,the staff wonderful! Our room and bathroom couldn't have been more comfy! We had a view out to the golf course and Sea World beyond! We had one dinner both times at Primo,in the hotel. The food was delicious and the service was above reproach! I was looking for an oasis and I found it. The pool area is huge,plenty of chairs. We had no intentions of leaving the resort and we didn't!! It is connected to the Ritz Carlton and you are allowed to use all pools there. We had booked a package including golf,but the weather,while sunny,was not warm,so we decided not to play. Instead I had a nice manicure and pedicure in the spa. Great service! I have read here before that this hotel can get busy with conventions,but that hasn't been the case on our visits. It is also out a ways from all the attractions. I don't believe they offer any shuttles to Disney etc....So I would check that out. I just love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bwaughesq
Reviews.Content: We had just left the Sandpearl Resort on Clearwater Beach which is brand new and simply stunning. We though we were spoiled there and the stay at the Grand Lakes JW was going to be average in comparison. We were wrong! The lobby and grounds were equally impressive, but on a much larger scale. This is a huge hotel and is connected to the Ritz which is big too. Everything was wonderful. The pool and kids activities are fantastic. It is a convention hotel and we were there on a week (Thanksgiving) where there was not much going on convention wise. It felt like you had the place to your self walking around. Wait staff and service was good, and the room was clean and nice. No bad things to say. The food and beverage prices are typical for Orlando and the room rate was a good deal. We are experienced Orlando travelers and you do not feel "off the beaten path" here. If you have a rental car its easily in reach of Dinsey, etc. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Work/Play Hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: travelerguy23
Reviews.Content: This is a large, high end Marriott property. It is relatively new, and feels that way. Everything is spotless and high gloss. I was there for business, but there was a large family representation which seemed like families accompanying people attending the attached conference facility. The hotel is a high rise, a bit off the beaten path from the bustle of the parks and attractions, but a short drive from everything. The rooms are nicely sized, with great bathrooms that include tubs and separate shower stalls. All very well appointed. The pool area is large, heavily landscaped, and like a winding carribean resort pool with many small lagoons that make each section much more private, even when busy. If my kids were with me, they would have loved it. Sushi at the bar area was outstanding, but the lack of TVs was a big drawback for business travelers just looking to have a beer and watch a game. Breakfast was a good buffet, typical Marriott execution. The service was some of the best I have ever had a Marriott, and much better than other JWs I have stayed in. They seem overstaffed with tons of people to help, but all with a very ernest attitude. They really won me over when an early breakfast was not added to my bill the morning of checkout, but instead of making me late for my plane, they comped the meal with great apologies for the delay. I thought that was pretty good service, and it was done without a manager involved which showed me that they really empowered the staff to satisfy the customer. That one gesture ensured my return in the future. Pricing is not cheap, but expect normal high end prices for meals, drinks, water and parking. Overall a great hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaL81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriot for a work conference the last week of October. The hotel is magnificent. Everything from the entrance to the pools to the lush greenery is gorgeous. They ahve a lot of amenities like activities for children, a lazy river, tons of pool options, volleyball, a life size chess/checker board, a fire pit to cozy up to at night, etc. I did not eat in the restauarnts because we had conference food but the hotel food was outstanding. Also, I found the service to be amazing. From the minute we pulled up there were ten people there to help you with your bags and a ton of people to help you check in. I even noticed once when a line started to form at the front desk that employees came running form the other side of the lobby to accomdate guests. Everything went very smoothly. The hotel is attached to the Ritz and shares their spa and fitness center. The fitness center was also great and the spa looked nice even though I did not have time to use it. There were not a ton of children but the ones that were here seemed to be having a great time. The hotel is somewhat isolated, but I prefer to stay at a hotel that is not part of a strip of hotels. I did not like having to pay extra for wireless internet but I said something to the manager and she rmeoved the charges from my bill. All in all, this is a great hotel and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Spend Easter Break”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl1265
Reviews.Content: Last April, my two children (ages 8 and 10) spent five days at the JW Marriott Orlando Grand Lakes resort. As a single mom who travels alone with my children, I love a place that is not only safe and clean, but also a great vacation experience for all three of us.
