This resort fullfilled every and all expectations. As it shares the property with the Ritz-Carlton, you are able to enjoy and use both hotels' pools and services. The lobby is beautiful, the rooms updated and fresh and the pool/grounds are very well maintained. The restaurants are fantastic. We stayed over Easter Break and both hotels had many activities to choose from to celebrate/enjoy the holiday. One day we had Tea with the Easter Bunny at the Ritz-Carlton and then smores over a fire, followed by a "dive-in" movie at the JW Marriott. There was a Church service on the grounds on Easter Sunday which we attended followed by an Easter Egg Hunt and then an amazing Easter Brunch at the Marriott. I was also able to enjoy a wonderful spa experience while my children were happily entertained at the Kids" Club. The staff at both properties were kind and gracious. We had a spectacular time.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Valet & Services”
Reviews.Author: BlakBroo
Reviews.Content: This resort messed up orders, overcharged for items. Valet dented our truck. They backed it up into a palm tree. Valet said that they were at fault, I have pictures to prove with residue on our bumper from palm tree. Just got a statement from their insurance company denying us for payment. I would highly recommend that you stay at another resort. The Ginn resort or Gaylord has better amenities and services. STAY AWAY from JW Marriott...........

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway - Orlando without the hassle”
Reviews.Author: VTing
Reviews.Content: Great Resort like experience right in Orlando. The Grand Lakes resort is a joint venture with a D.W. Marriott and the a Rtitz. sharing the same grounds. Beautiful landscaped grounds, excellent spa, great golf, good restaurants, two wonderful swimming pools, and very quiet. The only negative feature is that these resorts cater to large groups and conventions, so know what is going on at the hotel before you book your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Service Below Expectations”
Reviews.Author: vlkm
Reviews.Content: While we enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and found the property to be beautiful, the service was below our expectations. The valets were hard to find, even at non-peak times, and the bell staff was rude. Room service, even at non-peak times, took over an hour (25-35 minutes was promised.) For a hotel with premium pricing, the service falls short. The bottom line is that a hotel can't charge $13 for drinks at the pool and at the same time operate at half staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: MDFreqTvlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week and overall it was a good stay but not quite to the level of the great stay I expect from a JW Marriott. On the plus side, the rooms are outstanding as are the restaurants and recreational activities. Of particular note, the fitness center (shared with the Ritz) is one of the best in the country. For the most part the service was good, particularly front desk and housekeeping. The valet service left something to be desired, it was slow and the valets either inexperienced or condesending. It was annoying that despite the large amount of space to work with, that the self parking wasn't convenient or complementary.

Reviews.Title: “This Is Your Place to Stay For an Extended Visit to DIsney/Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Frqflier
Reviews.Content: If you’re reading this review you’re probably wondering "will this hotel make a good base for my Disney/Universal vacation?" The answer is absolutely “yes.” It’s about a half-hour trip to the theme parks from the hotel; Sea World is probably a 10 minute trip. (If Sea World is the EXCLUSIVE focus of your Orlando trip then stay at the Rennaissance. You come out of the hotel and walk in to the Sea World parking lot. Click on my name above and you can read my review of that hotel.) If you read previous reviews you’ll get a very good sense about this hotel. Virtually all of the positive reviews are accurate, I didn’t dwell on the negative reviews because they are often single-issue, guest-specific complaints. It's a gorgeous property that really is two properties because the Ritz Carlton is next door so the overall size of the place is huge. Which brings me to an earlier review on here called “The Pros and Cons of Self Contained Resorts.” And the writer makes a number of great points. You will definitely need a car to get to this place. There is nothing immediately nearby except for a drugstore which is quite a walk. If you are willing to drive 3 ½ miles you will find a large number of malls offering a variety of dining. It's self-contained for better or worse and that means they have you by the... As others have stated the ‘Lazy River” was a tad lazy. But hey, they aren’t promising an “Energetic River.” It really is the high point of the resort and if you’ve got kids, you’ll be spending more time than you bargained floating in the “Lazy River” making an early day at Disney virtually impossible. Definitely book the breakfast rate through Marriott. It’s only a few dollars more and worth the additional expense. Speaking of which it IS an expensive place to stay but in line with other extensive resorts: they charge you a lot for parking, they charge you a lot for internet access and they charge you a lot to eat. In short there are no bargains at this place but again the price I paid was definitely worth it (although make sure that you and your family will be spending enough at the hotel to really enjoy all of the amenities It will not be a value proposition if you’re basically using the hotel as a place to stay.) Overall the grounds are exquisite and the hotel itself is in great shape. . My wife took a lot of great pictures and they’ll give you a very good sense of what this property is all about Signage could use some improvement. You’ll see what I mean when you try to find the entrance to the hotel from either of the highways. Sure it’s a big building in the middle of a lush green area that says “Marriott” on the side but you’ll have to keep your eyes peeled to find it. And when you check in you’ll see what looks like a check-in counter but there is no identifying signage to confirm that is where you’re supposed to go. Finally this hotel represents the perfect reason to either buy or short Marriott stock: It was a huge beautiful property that seemed more empty than full. If you believe Marriott is a company that is going somewhere then you can say they’re planning for the future with plenty of room for growth. And if you believe Marriott has too many rooms and not enough people to fill them then this property will bolster that argument! Enjoy your Disney/Orlando vacation. You are making a great choice if you’re spending more than 2 nights in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: kb239
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel, but there were a couple problems. As another reviewer wrote, the rooms are very humid--at least ours was. The food is pretty expensive also. I also thought the rooms were a little small. Considering some of the other hotels in the area, this Marriott isn't great.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel for Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: wfluke001
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an overnight stay at the JW Marriott Grande Lakes. While we live here in Orlando, we cashed in some of my Rewards points and took the family out for Labor day fun. Spent most of our time at the extraordinary swimming pool/ lazy river . If you haven't been or seen it, it is worth the trip on its own. Safe to let my 7 & 9 year old venture about on their own while Mom & Dad got into their books/ napped. Staff at the property are extemely polite and helpful. Ate at Citron ( American Restaurant ) and found that food good , though menu is a bit limited . Room was clean and upscale with a great view of the lake and the evening fireworks ( for Labor day). If you have your own float , pack it, otherwise it is something the hotel makes out quite well on through a $5 per inntertube fee, but my kids got their $5 worth in the 24 hours we were there and we left it behind for the next family to enjoy. I would guess that Sunday's large crowd was partly due to locals "crashing" the hotel since they do not make it hard to use the pool without room key, but trust this is intentional since it is $10 to park ( $19 valet) and if the "crashers" were ordering food and drink poolside, the hotel is making them pay for their stay. Even with the Sunday crowd , the pool and lazy river were quite enjoyable. Overall a thumbs -esp with the free stay on Rewards points, but would even give it value if I had to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: stu1675
Reviews.Content: This was not the worst hotel I have stayed at, but seeing as JW Marriott is Marriott's top of the line brand, I guess I expected a little more. Our first morning, the alarm clock in our room went off at 6:48 AM - apparently it was left set from the previous occupants. Normally not such a big deal, but with an 8 month infant in the room, it became one. We booked this hotel for its pool and lazy river. In pictures it seemed quite nice, but in person, the pool area and pool/river itself was filthy. There was trash, bottles, cans, cups all over the pool area and floating in the pool. While not necessarily the hotel's fault, on two separate occasions we have to leave the pool because someone had an "accident" in the pool. After the 2nd time, we left fairly disgusted and went over to the Ritz Carlton pool, which was much less crowded and MUCH cleaner. As far as service is concerend the JW Marriott's service was not so great. There were a couple of days in which house keeping did not make up our room. On one occasion we called down asking for more tissues. I asked how long, because we were getting ready to put the baby to sleep and a knock at the door would have woken her. We were told 20 mins. One hour later still no tissues. After calling several times, I had to tell them to leave the tissues by our door. The same thing occured when we called asking for more towels (since we have no clean towels due to the room not being cleaned). My last major complaint was the 21% service charge added to all room service charges - the 21% service charge is in addition to a $3.00 delivery charge. In my opinion the 21% is ridiculous!!! They even have a line on the room service check to add a gratuity - as if the 21% isnt enough. Parking also cost $12.00 a night, which seems a little pricey, considering other hotels do not charge. Would I stay here again? Probably not

Reviews.Title: “No real complaints, overall a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karch72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW for a conference. Overall, a pleasant experience. It's a modern hotel with nice amenities and good customer service. Pros: Free use of the exercise room; Starbucks on site; good food at Citron; nicely decorated rooms; huge pool; comfy beds Cons: The air conditioning in the room was not good; humidity in the room was horrible (everything from my clothes to the linens seemed damp to the touch); somewhat expensive food prices; quite a distance from many of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the JW”
Reviews.Author: Need2fly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW in June for an early summer vacation. The service was top notch and the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome, including a welcome toy for our 2 year old. The lazy river pool is very relaxing and we had no trouble finding chairs each day. The resort is beautiful and is attached to the Ritz Carlton. It is not within walking distance of anything so if you intend to eat off property you will need a car. Upgrading to the pool/lake view room is worthwhile as you are also able to catch the nightly fireworks at Sea World (nearby) and Epcot (a bit further away). WDW is about 20 minutes away and I found it to be an easy drive. I would stay here again for any trip in Orlando and highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “My First Stay In Prison”
Reviews.Author: Wobbie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott Orlando Grande Lakes for 4 days a conference, not by choice. I hope you don't get bored here, because there is nothing else near this resort. Zip. Zilch. Obviously, Marriott found some cheap land far, far away from anything in Orlando, and stamped out this cookie-cutter of a resort. I didn't have a car (took a shuttle from the airport) so my dinner choices were the 3 restaurants on-site ($11 side salad, anyone?) or walking the mile to the Walgreens up the road for triscuits and cokes. Also, as is common at these sorts of resorts, the offerings for vegetarians left much to be desired. Taxes and "communications package" (Internet and phone) added 23% to my room rate. Save your money and don't bother with the Internet access in-room: it was amazingly flaky, and not in a delicious pie-crust sort of way. The front desk staff, while obsequious, wasn't very knowledgeable about the resort and its amenities. For example, I got 4 different answers from 4 different staffers about the availability of lap swimming (the 5th answer, a blank stare, didn't make it into this count). I found the quickest way to get a splitting headache in Florida was to go outside into the afternoon heat and humidity, then come back inside into the amazingly over-air-conditioned resort. Let's see, it's hot outside, run the air conditioner, use electricity, contribute to global warming, which makes it hot outside, so run the air conditioner more... My 4-year-old daughter might have enjoyed the pool for a day had she accompanied me, but the remaining 3 days would have been a waste. The resort had no shuttles, as far as I could tell, so don't stay here on a Disney trip unless you like staying 15 miles away from the park. I'll admit that I am not the target audience for this sort of resort: I don't play golf, don't enjoy roasting my skin to the consistency of a walnut shell poolside, and especially don't get a thrill from spending money just to prove that I have it.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eireann12
Reviews.Content: We love love the JW Marriott! Its our favorite hotel by far and make return visits all the time. The drive up to the hotel is a joy...golf fairways and well manicured lawns with beautiful flower beds. The entrance lobby is spacious with high ceilings, a fountain and smells like a day spa! We love swimming around the lazy river ..day or night....and there's always a quiet spot if you want to read. Breakfast buffet is fantastic....every food you can think of ...We've had dinner in the restaurant, the food was really delicious but portions were very small! . There is a walkway by the lake which leads to the Ritz which makes for a lovely evening stroll. I agree with one reviewer about the parking fee being steep. Every time we leave the Marriott we pretty much plan the next vacation back. Given a choice between the Marriott and the Ritz we opt for the Marriott every time..!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler013
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel--great pool, great service! We stayed here for a wedding and really enjoyed it!! This is a nice hotel to stay at with young kids!

Reviews.Title: “7th stay at the JW”
Reviews.Author: lvgiants10
Reviews.Content: This was my 7th stay at this property and although there are many problems, the pool has us coming back over and over again. Yes, it's far from everything except Sea World, but you know that before you book so it can't be complained about. Yes, it's a little bit expensive, but it is a gorgeous resort and well worth the money you spend on the nightly rate. Pool bar service was good and the bartenders were wonderful. Food was also good. I found the employees to be very courteous and helpful. Overall, this is one of my favorite resorts in Orlando, but on this trip several things bothered me. To charge $12.00 per night for self parking is insane as you are already paying $200 plus per night for the room. We needed to use our laptop the first day we were there for about an hour for business purposes. We never used it again after that and yet we were charged 13.00 for each day we were there (6). We didn't even bother trying to work it out with the front desk because they stilled owed us $104.00 credit from the last time we were there. When we questioned them about that (and yes, we had our receipt from our last stay) they told us to call accounting. After explaining to them that we had been trying to reach accounting for many months, they gave us the credit. The resort itself is outstanding, but they do have some service issues that could be improved. Would I return? Definitely...love that pool!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway at JW Marriott Orlando”
Reviews.Author: name_screen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights for a couples-getaway trip in Aug 2007. JW Marriott Orlando is an upscale hotel on a large beautiful property. JW Marriott and Ritz are shared on same property; guests can use both facilities and charge to their room for purchases. Pros: * Primo restaurant on JW side was fabulous. Excellent dinner (duck and lamb were superb), great wine. * Citron cafe for breakfast/lunch. A little on the pricey side but fresh and tasty. * Lobby bar is spacious & casual for cocktails. * Huge pool and winding river, hot tubs, pool towels, and plenty of lounge chairs. * Norman's restaurant at Ritz was also very good. Primo was our favorite. * Athletic facility was good, plenty of cardio, weights, waters/towels. * Beautiful landscaping, flowers, palm trees, etc. * Comfortable beds, in room safe, hair dryer, iron, nice bath products, bath robes, & spacious bathrooms. * Short car ride to Sea World (5 min or less); 15 min to Magic Kingdom. Cons: * Raining when we arrived; 2-3 foot radius of wet carpet near sliding glass doors in room. * TV did not work for 3 days; would not power on and was not resolved by front desk. * Shower curtain brackets very loose and in need of repair. One good wobble, and it would have come down. Overall, room was elegant, but in need of some repairs.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Not The Charm”
Reviews.Author: CLHughes
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this property. Both times were for business purposes and our hotel choice was predetermined by our meeting schedule. The first time, although our stay was pleasant, our experience was marred by poor valet parking procedures. Upon check-in, they" temporarily" parked our car and misplaced it for several hours. Later, at check-out, with the car in full view of the valet desk, they lost our keys. After much frustration, the keys were found right where they were supposed to be-at the valet desk! This time, we dropped our luggage off, and parked the car ourselves. For check-in, we were told we could park ahead near the curb, and then relocate to the parking area. Once again, I was "ordered" to surrender my keys for "safety". I explained our past valet history and was told "you have 5 minutes to move that car". Slow check-in prompted repeat visits and warnings from the valet. Our rooms had been booked 6 months in advance, with specific requests-none of which were acknowledged. Our room, was not what we requested, and was not cleaned as well. A trip back to the front desk resulted in a satisfactory change. Our new room was clean, well maintained, and the bed extremely comfortable. The A/C,however, never seemed to keep the room cool. Internet access,while quick, was expensive at $12.95 per day. All public areas are beautiful and well maintained. Other than the rude valet, all service personel were helpful and friendly. A note about the food-all of the food served at the property, including our convention lunches, were extremely tasty and well prepared. In fact, on our last visit, our opening cocktail reception was one of the best functions of it's type ever attended. It is very hard to write negative things about such a beautiful property. With a few service upgrades, this hotel could go from "Good" to "Great"!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Weak Service”
Reviews.Author: frequentrvlr
Reviews.Content: Lovely landscaping, design and decoration. The service I would rate a 2 out of 5. But that can be hit or miss at any place, especially Orlando. Would highly reccommend this place to anyone who would not like to stay on the beaten path and anyone who desires luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: lillycat62
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice now for an extended weekend after business in Orlando was completed. And both experiences were absolutely top notch. The JW Marriott Grand Lakes and Ritz Carlton Grand Lakes share the same fabulous property with an absolutely fabulous spa complex w/ adult pool between the two that both guests have access too (w/ spa appt booking). The hotel itself is gorgeous, restaurants are fabulous...never had a bad meal. The "lazy river" heated pool outside the JW was wonderful. I was here with my boyfriend and we're both in our early 40's and even WE couldn't resist spending the entire day renting tubes and meandering around that pool. The pool area was so huge, it was easy to find a secluded area away from other guests if you chose. The King room we reserved was a corner room and it was gigantic, very comfortable bed. Bedding was gorgeous, room was gorgeous, flat screen tv's . The bathroom was also gigantic......wonderful bath products. The staff was very accommodating and very sweet....I asked our maid if she would mind leaving additional bath products since there were 2 of us sharing them, and every day I would find 4 shampoos, conditioners, lotions, soaps....4 of each thing left for us...along with extra big, fluffy towels. She was a sweetheart.... We scheduled massages at the Ritz Carlton spa and they were fabulous. It was wonderful to retreat to the adult pool at the spa after our massages, if you are looking to get away from the children/families at the Lazy River pool. And the spa itself was top notch, expensive, but top notch so be prepared. I had scheduled a nail appt in the salon for a pink/white fill while I was there....very expensive and not up to par with my usual manicurist, (my manicurist was of course appalled...."they charged you how much?? For this??? lol!! ) loved the pedicure though. One thing I didn't care for was the big push after your massage to sell you the products that were used in your massage. Don't comment to your masseuse that you like anything....because you will find a bag full of everything you mentioned at the front desk ready to ring up with your massage (they certainly aren't giving it to you for free...) I thought it might be a fluke the first time, (maybe I DID tell her I was interested? Didn't recall saying anything) and sure enough...on the 2nd stay, same thing. another bag waiting for me at checkout...... Be sure and ASK how much that bag costs before you squeel with excitement and say "Yes!"......do your credit card a favor and politely refuse. All in all though, that wouldn't keep me from coming back to either hotel...this is one of the nicest hotel complex's in Orlando by far....it's a wonderful break from the tourist trap areas and Disney/Universal hoopla. You feel like your on your own little oasis in the middle of Orlando.....you'll love it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite Place”
Reviews.Author: nixmum64
Reviews.Content: What a great place. The staff was beyond courteous, the property was gorgeous, and the beds were amazingly comfortable. Stayed for a weekend, but we've definitely found our new Orlando headquarters! The only drawback to our stay was being charged for wi-fi...in this day and age it should be included in the price of the room!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: LHF
Reviews.Content: The best hotel we've stayed in. Going back in a few months time. Spotless, gorgeous, staff wonderful, brilliant situation, great food and drink. The hotel caters for large conferences but they still do well for family vacations. It's next door to the Ritz Carlton which caters more for couples than families though visitors to either hotel can use facilities in both. The spa and gym is great. The golf course is well maintained and is a good challenge to any standard of golfer. Previous reviews complained of queues for breakfast. We only experienced that once in 16 days but queues can be avoided by phoning the restaurant as soon as you wake and booking a table at a time convenient to yourself. The pool is fantastic - there's nothing better than floating round the lazy river with a cocktail in your floating drinks holder. Quench bar at the pool serves wonderful drinks and serves great food, all at reasonable prices. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful . Best Hotel I Ever Stayed At !”
Reviews.Author: dddd1224
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott for a week over the 4th of July Holiday ! The day we arrived, that evening, the hotel had excellent fireworks . We sat on our balcony and watched them. I had a great view of the pool and golf course. I recommend a balcony outback. I could see three sets of fireworks every night from SeaWorld and Epcot and some other park. The hotel was so clean. Down Comforters on both beds with the softess pillows. The room was immaculate. The room service was great. The housekeeping came 2x a day. Once in the morning to straighten up and once at night to pull your sheets down and give you chocalate on your pillows. My daughter thought that was great. The service was super. Everyone was so friendly. The pool was awesome and the food was great. The hotel is four years old. I would definitely stay there again. Not a compliant in the world. It was 5 mins . from Sea World , Discovery Cove and 10 Mins from Universal and about 20 mins from Epcot . Not a bad drive at all.

Reviews.Title: “Stunner of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: twinadomom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni hotel which was nice but not anywhere near as enjoyable as JW Marriott. The only reason we booked the Marriott is because the Omni was sold out for the extra day we wanted to stay there. We were originally going to stay there but no rooms for the week available at JW. All I can say is WOW! What a beautiful resort! I didn't want to leave. I was so impressed with the friendly staff that was very willing to accomodate us in every way. They did forget to place a crib in our room for our twins BUT when my husband called for the crib they said they would send one right up but decided the sleeper sofa was fine and they brought up linens/blankets for the kids right away. The staff was walking about eager to please to guests and asked if we wanted our picture taken *as a family* which I thought was very nice. I felt very well taken care of there!as did my husband. The very well manicured grounds were impeccable. The room was beautiful. It was a deluxe garden view room with down feather bedding and duvets........beds were turned down in the evening (after a long day out at Disney)and had soft nature type music playing on the radio when we returned to our room. A nice touch was also mints left on the bed with the weather for tomorrow on a small card which was "sweet'. Loved the place. I did rave about it to an Asian girl we encountered at checkout at the desk and told her it was so much better than the Omni.She really had no expression and seemed very hurried and not very customer service oriented. (Sat. morning around 11am.)A simple thank you would have sufficed but everything else was great~!! I am very fussy when it comes to hotels and this was perfect for our family. The lazy river pool was outstanding! We loved it! My twins had a ball in the river!The current could be a tad stronger but other than that it was serene! I didn't get the opportunity to try the Spa but will definitely next visit. We will definitely return come Dec.!We are even considering a time share through the property!We didn't get to eat at the restaurants but will next time.

Reviews.Title: “So Impressed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dsb333
Reviews.Content: This isn't a typical Marriot! We went as a family this past week to attend a friend's wedding at the attached Ritz Carlton. Since we took our 2 boys (9 and 12 years) my husband and I decided that it was silly to spend the extra money on a gorgeous room at the Ritz since we would be rooming with the kids. We decided to be practical and stay at the JW, not realizing that a JW Marriot was very different than your everyday Marriot. We assumed it would be a less luxorious a hotel---WRONG!!! The JW was magnificent! The hotel is as beautiful as the Ritz. The rooms were spacious, spotless and truly luxorious. The bed was so amazing; feathertop mattresses with light and airy duvets---I even loved the pillows! I slept better there than I have anywhere in a long time! The service throughout the hotel really blew us away; a lovely woman, Franciox (sp?) checked us in and then proceeded to walk us around the lobby to show us where everything was from the concierge to the different dining options. and the service did not stop there. Every staff member we encountered was nicer and more helpful than the next. While waiting for the Universal shuttle in the front of the hotel, two different staff members asked us if we needed anything, offering us ice water (with lemon, of course) while we waited. They made us feel like royalty. Our kids even commented how nice everyone was. The property is amazing; the grounds are lush with tropical gardens and plantings and the pool is terrific--- I even played in their "lazy river!" This part of their pool (the deepest is 5 feet) is great for kids and adults, the water is warm and is landscaped beautifully with waterfalls and boulders and there is a light current that gently glides you around. Really terrific! Okay...the food: We ate at Quenches, pool side bar/restaurant, and their casual food is delicious. Their mojitos were good also. The restaurant Citron was excellent. We had dinner there one night and had breakfast there as well every day. Their buffet breakfast is top notch, fresh and classy. Our boys thought they were in heaven with the thick french toast and big waffles which they topped with marshmellows, sprinkles and God knows what else! My family and the staff surprised me Saturday morning with a birthday candle in my yogurt/fruit served in a parfait glass and then this lovely young woman, Bernadette, popped open a bottleof champagne and poured my husband and I complimentary mimosas! We enjoyed talking to Bernadette and hearing about the JW Marriot and her experiences with the company. She is terrific! So here's the bottom line---this hotel is, in my opinion, as beautiful, as catering, as luxorious as any Ritz that we have stayed in. I would stay again at this JW Marriot (or others) in a heartbeat. It was a pleasure all around!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: traveltina
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to this property over the past couple years. We LOVE to go here as a family with teens. It is elegant, luxurious & active. The grounds are just beautiful. The pool is one of the best I have ever seen at a resort...lazy river goes on & on. Service was adequate but not outstanding. I would guess it is very competitive to find outstanding staff in Orlando with so many options for people in the tourism industry. I would expect better service at this hotel though. We ate at the more upscale restaurant (Primo). This was our 2nd time dining here and again, like the 1st, it really was not that impressive. Nice room, good service, but the menu and food seems to be trying to be something it is not. It was around $200 for 2 with a $70 bottle of wine. We had a pasta dish that was very plain and also a swordfish that was a bit dry and tasteless. Definitely did not warrant the price. One thing I really like about the property is that it is adjoined with the Ritz Carlton; it is nice to go there for a cocktail or maybe next time, we'll dine there! Overall, it is an escape from the touristy side of Orlando and you would never know there were theme parks within just a few miles.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: sresendez07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW on 5/19-25/07. It was a combo conference and Disney Vacation for the family. Rooms nice. Request a high floor room facing the pool. You can actually see all the firework shows from the parks. No furniture out in the balcony though, no big deal. Beds comfortable, the comforters were so hot, almost too comfortable. Pool nice and warm. Bring your own float, the resort blew up the kids shark and alligator floats. I bought myself the one at the resort for 5 bucks for the entire stay. Buy all your goodies and snacks prior to entering the resort, wow too pricey! Believe it or not but found a bargain with room service. You can order from the kids menu/appietizers, like quesadillas, gourment pizza, for around 7-10 bucks a plate and includes drinks. Nice treat and impresses the heck out of the kids. Movie rentals were a wopping 16.99. Florida really gave it to us good, everything was terribly expensive. It was worth it. My kids have been talking about Disney and the Resort for weeks. All the parks were comfortably away. 15-20 minute drive, never encountered traffic, getting into the parks a breeze. If going exclusively to Disney would stay on-site. If experiencing the other things Florida has to offer I would definetly stay here again in a heartbeat. Breakfast Buffet was the best around. A whopping 60+ bucks for 2 adults 2 kids(one free), we ate good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facility, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: CarolEu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite at the R W Marriott Grande Lakes for 5 days. The buildings, rooms, grounds, and pool are magnificent. The service for the most part is terrible. The front desk was less than helpful both at arrival and departure. Despite having clerks available on arrival, I waited for 6-7 minutes after approaching the front desk. (She thought I was with someone else, though I had stated we were newly arriving). At departure I asked to place a small sum ($100) on by bank debit card and receive cash (as the ATM machine was broken) and was refused. This was after we had just paid nearly $3000 for the stay. The housekeeping service was excellent, but the pool waitstaff had the wait part down perfectly. The food was ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “My all time favorite resort”
Reviews.Author: starbear999
Reviews.Content: Ahhh, yes, the JW as I like to refer to it. Nothing but great memories, we only stayed one night, but made the most of the two days. My husband and my parents accompanied me on my stay for Easter weekend this year. It has now become a yearly ritual. Between the beautiful grounds, the lazy river, the bars, the dining (must eat at NORMAN's) very expensive and worth every penny. Staying at the JW makes one feel that they are in the lap of luxury every step of the way.... This is the way traveling ought to be.. Down comforters, mints on the pillow, drinks all day, followed by amazing dinner and midnight swimming romps.... absolutely wonderful, every chance I get I think about going back.... ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Plantnum Member with Marriott”
Reviews.Author: JudyWv
Reviews.Content: Front desk very rude and upper management is aware of problem but no action taken. This resort should not be at JW status. Save your money and visit another resort in Orlando. The lazy river was only thing worth our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Above average, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: congress
Reviews.Content: A stayed for a congress at the end of May, 2007, at the sixth floor. This review compares my experience with previous reviews from other guests. Yes, the rooms are good. Not really big but unusually clean. Five pillows per bed: factual nonsense, but Americans consider this "luxury". No flowers, no fruit in the room. The room was indeed (as described earlier by other reviewers) ventilated with kitchen air. My impression was it came out the air shaft near the clothes: clothes will slightly smell for kitchen. The elevators are quick. The Italian restaurant and at the breakfast buffet are both of very good international standard. This is a very good hotel. Overpriced, however. Disadvantages: may be swamped by pompous congress people. A European will find it quite noisy: the public, the reception area, the pool area: everywhere "background music" too noisy to talk and to feel comfortable. And yes, there are shouting and laughing children, but that noise

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and resort”
Reviews.Author: ade_the_hornet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just got back from staying at the JW Marriott,May 18th-26th. What a great hotel and resort this is! The main reason for visiting Orlando was our daughter had chosen it to be the venue for her wedding(which was held at Cypress Grove).Even though we are still young,in our 40's to late 40's the theme parks were of no interest to us,having done them all 5 years previous,so staying at a resort hotel was ideal.The JW Marriott was perfect for us. We arrived quite late and very tired.The bell staff were very polite and courteous,which impressed us straight away.The lobby wasnt very busy and we didnt have to queue to check in.we were greeted with smiles and check was very smooth.we were also given a 10% discount card to use in the resturants(excluding alcohol).our room was exactely as we had wanted,8th floor with views of the pool,golf course,the ritz-carlton and surrounding area. We had 2 queen size beds in the room,as requested,desk ,large tv,usually sort of stuff for this star hotel,still plenty of space to move around in.the bathroom was large by american standards with a tub,vanity top,toilet and a great walk in shower cubicle.There was plenty of towels and hot water whenever we wanted a shower.The room was very clean and the maid service was very good also,leaving a bottle of water every day and a couple of chocolates when they had finished the turn down service in the evening.There was only a small balcony which you could stand in,not big enough for chairs.We never used the air con that much,prefering to leave it off,but when we did it was easy to use and adjust. The actually hotel itself is very impressive and very big.the public areas are very clean and do have nice carpets and fixtures.Being linked to the Ritz-Carlton,it was nice to walk along the wide corridors through the conference centre between the the 2 hotels. There is a good choice of restaurants and a few small shops.We used the gift shop for water,sweets etc.Starbucks for coffee's and cakes on numerous occasions.Breakfast was in the Citron restaurant.Buffet style or A La Carte.We ate buffet breakfasts mainly which were fantastic,as much as you wanted for about $40 for 2(after discount),never needed lunch that often after the breakfasts we had,sometimes never needed dinner either!Citron did get very busy between 10 and 11,but the wait was only about 10 minutes.We only ate in Citron in the evening a couple of times,and then it was only burgers and club sandwiches,which were about $15-$20. We had a lovely meal in Primo,the Jw's Italian restaurant.Very good service and very good food.It was $201 excluding tip for 3 courses,2 bottles of water ,3 glasses of wine between us and a single malt whisky(and that was $18,ouch!).very good value though i think(apart from the whisky). The lobby lounge bar is very nice.It does get very busy in the evening and very noisy.Service can be very slow between 9-11pm.It also has a sushi bar and food can ordered from the citron as well.The alcohol is very expensive in the lounge bar,$6 for a bottle of beer or half a pint of draft beer,$11 for a glass of wine,$13 for a cocktail.You did get free cashew nuts and spicey peas though! We ate in Quench(the poolside restaurant) once and had a burger and a wrap,a beer and a coke for $30 which was very good,big portions as well. The Vineyard Grill at the Ritz-Carlton was very good.They specialise in steaks and they were very good indeed.We had our daughters wedding meal there.The staff were great and the food excellent.Just as a guide starters $12-$16,mains$36-$52 and deserts at about $15. The gym at the ritz-carlton was free for hotel guests and very well equipped.Our daughter used the hair salon for her bridal practice and up do,plus french manicure.she was very impressed with the service they provided. We never used the pool so couldnt comment,but it did look very good. I did use the golf course though,and it was wonderful!A truly great designed course and very challenging.You could choose which ever tee you wanted to play,the practice facilitys were excellant and the staff were very helpful.I was the only golfer in my party,but never played alone which was very good.The rates changed while we were staying there,but at the moment it is $95 before 2pm and $65 after 2pm,it was $195 a round when we arrived. Overall the hotel and resort is excellent and the service provided by all the staff was great.we never had a problem for the 8 days we stayed there.The weather was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Similar to the Omni Orlando Resort”
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: This is one of the very best hotel in Orlando. It is similar to the Omni Resort, but even better standard. Gosh they cant do enough for you. If you need anything, or call room service, you get a call afterwards to ask if everything was okay with your order, or whatever it is you need. My colleague forgot her toothbrush, called to see if she could buy another one, the hotel sent someone up with a tray full of array of, name it, toothbrush, creams, cleansers, buttons, needle, zips, dental floss, shoe polish, painkillers, exfoliators, (just like a mini shop) to pick whatever she needs at no extra price. The room is extra luxurious, the bathroom is gorgeous. The foyer has an amazing atmosphere. The pools are absolutely amazing with the lazy river, jacuzzi, e.t.c There is a sandpit for children and slides, just stunning. The breakfast buffet was amazing. I only wish the hotel is on International Drive or thereabout. I will definitly go back with my family.

Reviews.Title: “elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfkadlec
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is a large hotel with a large nearby partner, the Ritz Carlton. The hotels are set on extremely well groomed grounds. I am not sure of the acreage, but part of the grounds are dedicated to a good sized man-made lake and a golf course. The large hotel has a very spacious lobby, and off the lobby is a well appointed bar where one can also get snacks. The waiters and waitresses are quite congenial. There are two restaurants, and although we only ate in the one on the first floor, people who ate in the lobby level restaurant told us it was quite good. Our experience in the lower level cafe was quite good. The food was well prepared and the service was excellent. There are several shops in the hotel, all overpriced, but very attractive. Our room was a corner room, and we were very pleased with it. The room was generous, and the bath was clean and very well decorated. The hallways are very well illuminated and also struck us as being very clean. The elevators are very fast and there is no long wait when you press the call button. Although we didn't use the pool, it is large, and appears very well kept. The housekeeping service was very good. We have only a single negative thing to say about this hotel. We like the room to be quite cool while we sleep, and the easy to use thermostat was able to be easily set, however, we think it was in error. Even though the thermostat would indicate that the temperature was in the low sixties, we were warm at night. We estimate that it was off probably five degrees. We could have complained about this, but in staying at the hotel four days we learned to compensate for innacurate settings. Perhaps if we were to say anything else negative about this hotel, it would be that there is nothing nearby. We flew in for a meeting, but if there is any option, a guest should have an automobile. You must have access to a car or take a cab. There is no way one can walk to nearby businesses. Although you can walk to the adjacent Ritz Carlton down a very long corridor the facilities are about the same. Although our meeting brochure indicated that the hotel was near the airport, I would argue that point with the author. It was a forty or forty five dollar drive to the airport without a tip. The hotel is pricey, but quite frankly, we didn't feel that we were ripped off as we have felt in a number of other pricey hotels. We have no difficulty in recommending this property to others

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jabula
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two sons ages 6 and 8 for the first two nights of our five night stay in Orlando. My husband had a conference so it was free. The hotel is beautiful - the grounds and pool are lovely. The restaurant on the ground floor, Citroen, was delicious and had awesome breakfasts too with tons of local fruit. The staff was very courteous and kind to our family and we sat outside every night to eat an early dinner. That was lots of fun. The room was a bit small - I think they usually have business travellers not families. We requested a fridge and it was sent right up. For the last three nights (when it was on our dime) we moved to the SpringHill Suites by Marriott Lake Buena Vista which was much cheaper and totally adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious beds, beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: michigantogo
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights while waiting to get into the pool house we rented in Orlando. Nice room and super luxurious bedding, but overpriced for ammenities available. Only one morning and lunch restaurant--Citron. Almost always a long wait, but food was good. Went to Primo, Italian dinner restaurant for birthday dinner--a disaster. Horrible food and pre-ordered birthday cake was forgotten by the waitress. Don't go to this restaurant! I think it was filled with overflow from Citron, people that didn't want to wait to go to Citron, all of whom were sorry they didn't wait. Did not compare to renting a pool house, although pool was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the lazy river”
Reviews.Author: LisaWethersfield
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the pool area are what make the resort better than average. The rooms are typical Marriott rooms, but the pool area and the snack area by the pool were great (if you don't mind going to get the stuff yourself). There was no poolside food/drink service the entire time we were there - if you want that, go to the Ritz and sign it to your room using the shared priviledges. If you don't want to pay the food prices of the Ritz/Marriott onsite restaurants, you'll need a car to eat off property but it could even out for what you could save.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like aking”
Reviews.Author: mommak56
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were there for business. This Marriott property was just as I come to be accustomed to peaceful and friendly. The Grande Lakes is about service and getting it right. I was treated as a queen. There was nothing I or my husband needed that was not there at our finger tips. The staff prides themself on service. Prices for food and drink are high. Bring a large wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: mte22
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the JW Marriott for a business trip. The property is very lovely. The staff was professional and extremely accommodating. It was a very luxuroius place with an elegant yet tropical feel. The only regret I have is I didn't specifically ask for a room with a good view and my room was over the exhaust fans from the resturants...the view itself wasn't bad but going out on the balcony there were definate food smells coming from below. I think the majority of the rooms do not have this problem but it is something to keep in mind. Otherwise it really was a little slice of paradise and I would stay there again. Oh and the spa was magnificent!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: wawazatt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my girlfriend in Feb 2007. This hotel is a great place. I was attracted to this hotel after finding a rate for $189 and decided to give it a visit. The rate included breakfast for two in room or not. We selected room service of course and were not disappointed. The rooms include mini bar, seperate tub and shower, double sinks, small balcony and the beds are incredible!! The room was very clean and we were allowed to check in at 9:30am and check out at 12pm ( since we are marriot rewards elite ) We didnt get the chance to visit the pool area. The hotel lobby is large and the lobby bar was packed due to a business convention that was going on. The hotel is easy to find and only minutes from SeaWorld, Discovery Cove, and Universal Studios. The only downside is that they do charge $12 per day to park.

Reviews.Title: “WDW great, JW not so great”
Reviews.Author: Jawfixer
Reviews.Content: My wife, my daughter and I recently (1/12-1/15/2007) stayed at the JW Marriott at Grand Lakes in Orlando. My wife and I have stayed at the Ritz at the same location before, but recent reviews in Trip Advisor were negative, while all of the reviews for the Marriott were glowing. We however cannot give such a review. Our negative experience was partially beyond the hotel’s control. Our first night we returned from a late dinner to the sound of a screaming baby in the next room—really screaming, ear infection or colic screaming. We heard no adult voices and called the manager who said that security would check it out. This was off and on till about 11:30 pm: screaming baby, called manager, slight pause in screaming and then resumption. Finally we fell asleep to be awakened by the baby at 5:30 am, called manager, who said security would “look into it”. Crying stopped and restarted in time to for us to get up at 6:45 am. On our way out to go to WDW, I spoke to the manager on duty, who assured me they would handle things. We returned, exhausted from visiting the mouse, at 5pm to the sound of the crying baby next door. Gerald, the manager told me that they had been unsuccessful in reaching the people in that room and they had not returned any calls. (Hopefully, a baby was not being left alone.) He told me I would have to move, and when asked, I was told that there would be neither adjustments nor a room upgrade. I asked that they have the other people move. No. So, as the Indianapolis Colts were just ready for kickoff against the Ravens, I had to pack up our suitcases and move to the promised non-smoking room. So, we went from the 9th floor to the 12th floor and switched elevators, rode up to the to the 17th floor where we were led into a room that reeked of cigarette smoke. After another room was found, down we went to 12, switched elevators and to our new smoke free, quiet room on the 11th floor. My wife, who is blind and travels with a guide dog, had to readjust to a second hotel room in as many days, that was the opposite configuration of the first. If you think that is not a big deal, try closing your eyes next time you go to a hotel and walk around without falling or banging your head. No follow up from management--Extremely poor customer service. In addition, except for Heather, the “Concierge” were a joke. My wife wanted to make reservations at Emeril’s and the Concierge asked her, if she had their phone number. And lastly, except for Jordan, a restaurant manager, the waitresses in the various restaurants were better suited for Dennys. We are used to staying at upscale hotels and expect upscale treatment—not this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: MisstheDogs
Reviews.Content: I loved the resort for a wonderful getaway retreat. The Marriott is co-located with the Ritz, meaning you get the benefits of both hotels (for example, you can charge to your room from activities in either hotel). However, if you're planning on staying here, it's important to know what this place is and is not so you won't be disappointed. It is a beautiful, self-contained large property with great amenities (spa, golf, multiple pools and restaurants) that caters primarily to large conventions but does fine with individual travelers. It is NOT a Disney property or particularly close to the Disney parks and offers no shuttle service. No Mickey presence anywhere. You'll need a car to go anywhere off property (nothing in walking distance) although SeaWorld is very close. As for the resort itself, the ROOMs are well appointed but a bit short on floor space, especially with double beds. Could be crowded with more than 2 people. Beds are very comfortable and the bathrobes are much better than average. I don't believe the Marriott (unlike the Ritz next door) offers a Club level. I had a lake view, which is gorgeous. The balconies, however, are too small for chairs and therefore largely unusable. Bathroom is large and modern with separate shower. Amenities are liberally replenished. They also give you a free botter of water daily and replenish it at night. Wired internet (which includes free domestic long-distance) is $13/day. FOOD at the pool was a bit disappointing in quality. Overall, I preferred the restaurants in the Ritz, especially Norman's. Prices are about what you'd expect for a resort of this type. The lazy river POOL is great - water was the perfect temperature. Note that you must pay $5 for a tube (or bring your own). The pool is large enough and there seemed to be enough deck chairs that it didn't feel crowded even when the convention folks were there. Towels were always available and you could take as many as you needed. I don't golf, so can't comment on the course. I realize that SPA experiences are somewhat subjective but I found this to be the single best I've ever had. Some spas try so hard to make you feel relaxed that you end up feeling stressed -- this was just plain relaxing. And, I was able to get the time I wanted with less than 24 hours notice even with a convention in both hotels. I found SERVICE to be uniformly excellent. There were hotel staff specifically assigned to the convention but plenty of staff for those not part of the large group. Many times, staff members went out of their way to be helpful or just plain pleasant. As noted, the resort is somewhat isolated and you will need a car to go anywhere. That said, you could easily spend at least 4 days here and not be bored. However, if you want to go off-site, you can purchase Disney (and other) tickets through the concierge. Overall, if you're looking for a place in Orlando to relax and unwind -- adults or families -- the Marriott is great. If you come here for a convention, you won't be disappointed. If you want the complete Disney experience, you're probably better off at a hotel closer to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: RICHP57
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort from 12/23-12/30 with my family as well as another family. We reserved 4 rooms, 2 sets of 2 rooms attached. Checked in around 11:00 AM on 12/23. All rooms were ready and as requested. Hotel staff was exceptionally nice during stay going out of their way to always greet you. Had a business issue I needed to deal with during stay and Manager went out of her way to help me. Hotel grounds were very well maintained. Hotel interior was gorgeous. Lots of marble, very clean. Restaurants were pretty good. Had breakfast every day at hotel. Had dinner one night at Marriott, 1 night at Ritz-both good. Children had dinner at marriott 3 nights and enjoyed both the experience and food. Wait staff extremely nice. Rooms very nice and clean. Bathrooms large. Pool area very nice. We used the hotel as home base for our trips to Disney and Universal on a daily basis. Depending on the park the trip took in the neighborhood of 15-25 minutes from the hotel until parked inside the Disney lot. Received a great rate of 199 per room with a 300 credit per week per room to use for incidentals. This credit was used towards our food and parking. The same accommodations inside Disney would have cost both families an additonal $5,300 each for this week. I have stayed at 4 Disney resorts previously including the Wilderness Lodge and the Old Key West and the Marriott was definitely nicer. I highly recommend this resort .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!! Pretty much a 5 star resort”
Reviews.Author: aenimnicht
Reviews.Content: I'm spoiled with staying at many 5 star resorts and was super impressed with this resort - so glad we didn't book the Ritz Carlton next door. Loved everything about it - high thread count bedding, plush beds, separate shower & soaking tub, service, pool, balcony....

Reviews.Title: “Will return over and over again”
Reviews.Author: cadave1969
Reviews.Content: Marriott does it again with an absolutely fabulous JW hotel. The hotel at Grande Lakes tops the other local Marriott hotel with pure class. The rooms were phenomenal. The staff was very courteous, and helpful. We've stayed there twice now and each time, the definition of high class in a hotel gets a new meaning. Each of our stays included two rooms, since we have 5 kids, so it got to be pricey. But, you get what you pay for, and our vacation was unforgettable. The pool was a frequent stop for the whole family and had plenty of privacy away from other guests due to its size and layout. It includes a lazy river, a "small childs" play area and a few other features that make it easy to spend a full day by the pool. It is an easy, short trip to any of the amusment parks, whether your talking about Disney, SeaWorld, or Universal Studios. The only thing left to say is you are missing out if you make a trip to Orlando and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort, Top Notch 5-Star”
Reviews.Author: Trip123abc
Reviews.Content: We just took a family vacation to the JW Marriott and loved everything about it. The resort is beautiful, staff extremely friendly and courteous, and the rooms are comfortable, modern and clean. The pool is one of the best we've seen - especially for kids -with a winding "lazy river" connecting a handful of small pools to create a more intimate feeling even when crowded. The hotel shares a Spa/Fitness Center building with the neighboring Ritz Carlton. We only used the fitness center and thought it was great for a hotel. The food at Primo was excellent, and the buffet breakfasts at Citron were also fantastic. Staff at both couldn't have been nicer either. We stay at mainly 4 and 5 star places and have discriminating tastes, and the JW Marriott didn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!!!! Great Diversion from Disney. Sonny is the Best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JSERNA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW from 10/4 to 10/7 prior to renting a home for our annual trip to Disney. I was with my wife and children, 10 and 8. From the moment we pulled in to the time we departed the place was spectacular!! I was using points and was upgraded to a pool view with balcony...beautiful grounds, great view of the fireworks from Disney, SeaWorld and Universal. Room was spacious and of high quality. Very clean and beds were very comfortable. As with other reviewers, it is a conventioneer hotel. Some huge medical association was having meetings there and saw many attendees in the lobby/lounge area after 5:00ish. Otherwise we had the place to ourselves!!! Pool was empty during the day. Great lazy river and poolside service. Plenty of help available to serve. Good food poolside and especially at Brasserie Citron for the breakfast buffet. Chef Sonny was over the top accomadating and made us feel at home. Very nice with the children and meeting their dietary needs. Selection at the buffett was outstanding!! Never ate dinner there, but heard that Primo and Normans are excellent choices. Nighttime activities for families...games, smores and movies. Only downside of the place was the music selection at the pool, 70's and 80's Classic Rock....maybe a some Beach Boys and calypso music would be more appropriate. Overall, Great place. We will go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - One of the best I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: coolspot18
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a conference at the JW Marriott in Orlando. We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights (Sunday - Wednesday). This is perhaps one of the best hotel experience I've had... starting with the doormen. We arrived at the hotel via taxi and were greeted by the hotel doormen. Unlike some other hotels - these doormen were not pushy in grabbing our suitcases from us. In fact, they asked if we liked help or not! That was a nice change from some New York hotels. Check-in was a breeze - the counter was staffed with more than enough customer service representatives. The room itself was gourgeous and was much nicer than I expected. The bathroom was large and had a shower AND tub. Each room has a data port + easy to reach power plugs for laptops. I only have two complaints: 1. The data charges is per stay - the moment you active your internet, it runs for the duration of your stay. If you need 1 day access, you need to call the front desk. In anycase, not a problem, the hotel rectified my bill with a quick phone call. 2. We also had a chance to try the Ritz Carleton spa located on the same property as the Marriott... the service there was not spectacular (in fact it was disappointing)... The staff was not very responsive and not upto the calibre of other higher end hotel spas. Regardless... if I were given another opportunity to stay at the JW Marriott, I would jump at the chance!

Reviews.Title: “I think I will be the only one to slate the place!”
Reviews.Author: daifly
Reviews.Content: It's the second time I've stayed in the JW Orlando. Last year I only stopped one night (arrived late, left early) so didn't really get the chance to sample what it had to offer. This year was different, I arrived on the Monday night for a stay until the following Saturday (yes, I was one of those annoying Conventioners!) but from the moment I arrived I knew I'd done the wrong thing. When I drove up to the hotel (following my trans-Atlantic flight) I was wearing my scruffs (tee and shorts) and driving a mid-range SUV hire car. The valet asked "Are you staying here?" - now maybe I took it personally, but it certainly felt judgemental. The only thing I would say is bear in mind that Bill Gates drives a mid-1990's Porsche 911... so you can't judge a book by its cover. The check-in agent was very sneery. I asked for an upgrade (already in the top of the deluxe range room) and he just said "no" - didn't even give it a second thought (I am a Platinum Marriott cardholder and have never had that kind of a response before). After that I was just annoyed with the place and found fault in everything. The bathroom had a load of hairclips around the sink (which you could see the moment you walked through the door) and which had bits of the previous occupant on them. The mattress protector was covered, and I mean COVERED, in hair (both head and, urgh, others...) and feathers. They showed up through the sheet on top, so why I could see it yet the chambermaid couldn't I don't know. The rooms themselves are very small for the money - have seen larger standard rooms in other hotels (and nothing like the fantastic room I had in the JW in Miami the weekend before) After the first two, the staff were fine and helpful but the fact that you couldn't get a booking in the restaurant or get into the bar because of all the convention attendees just made me give up and move. I am writing this in the Marriott Cypress Harbour Vacation Club. Half the price for about four times the space - the staff here have been great. Maybe I am just not posh enough for the JW Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: dej
Reviews.Content: The JW in Orlando is a very nice resort but it really was no different than a regular Marriott resort. Just the price of everything. First of all we had the executive suite for $319 per nite that included breakfast. The room was very nice but had no refrigerator or hair dryer. The resort itself is beautiful with lots of tropical landscaping. You do feel like you on a an island resort. The breakfast buffet that was included was good but nothing special. Parking is an extra $9.00 per day and food/drinks at the pool grill were on the expensive side. But it is a vacation and you try not to dwell on those things. The pool is fantastic, but be warned this is a family resort with tons of kids. So if this isn't what you are looking for, check out the Ritz right next door. They share the convention center and golf course. One thing that really stood out was how friendly everyone working there was. Over the top !!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Lives-in-paradise
Reviews.Content: The other reviews are correct, the hotel is beautiful and the staff is wonderful. The rooms themselves were very pretty, as was the bathroom and the place was incredibly clean. The only problem that I had with this room was the AC. I really dislike when the AC goes off unless you are in the room as it leaves a slight musty scent to the room. Some of the pillows were wet and when I woke up in the morning my clothes that were out were wet. Ordered breakfast up via room service and though wonderful it was very pricey. All in all it's a great hotel however I won't stay again just because of the air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: fez030303
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long weekend stay at the JW Marriott Grande Lakes. What a beautiful resort! The long winding driveway was very impressive with the golf course on each side and the view of the JW and the Ritz in the distance. The lobby was beautifully decorated with marble floors and a large fountain in the middle. Our room on the 17th floor overlooked the pool and the golf course (see pictures). We decided to stay at this particular hotel for the lazy river pool. Wow, did it live up to it's reputation! The landscaping around the pool was incredible! It felt like you were in a jungle. As for the prices, they can nickel and dime you for various things. Self parking was $9 (+tax) per day, the inner tubes for the pool were $5, and high speed internet was $12.95 per day - just to name a few. The restaurants in the hotel (other than Starbucks)were quite expensive, but there are soo many other places to eat off the property. The concierge and front desk were very helpful. We even asked a lifeguard for some local (non-chain) restaurant recommendations. She gave us some great choices. We took a walk to the Ritz next door to compare. The JW was just as nice, if not more grand, than the Ritz but was 1/2 the price per night. We will definitely come back just for the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place but impersonal”
Reviews.Author: RoyandSuetravelling
Reviews.Content: We booked this as our base for touring Disney and associated Sites and wanted luxury. This we got and the Staff could not do enough for you but it was full of Conventions and you couldn't get to the Bar some evenings. Noise levels were extremely high and at one point we were asked if we wanted to buy a time share!! The golf couse is excellent and Hubby really enjoyed it. I found the lack of choice for food amazing in such an Hotel and what there was was expensive. We did sample room service and if you don't mind paying through the nose it was a luxury we enjoyed once or twice. Superb place but not for the regular holiday maker and shouldnt be marketed as such.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda/Bob
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott, along with my husband and 9 year old son for our 2 week summer holiday from 17 June to 1 July 2006 and I cannot recommend it highly enough. It truly is a first class hotel with excellent facilities and friendly /helpful stafff. This was our first visit to Orlando and the USA from Scotland (Edinburgh)and it has left us with a very good impression of both. This is without doubt the nicest hotel I have stayed in ANYWHERE Let me clarify the points a bit. The location of the hotel is ideal. 5 mins to Seaworld and 15 mins for Universal and Disney. (by car)The setting is tranquil and the hotel grounds are gorgeous and well maintained. However for us it was also far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Interrnational Drive. Upon arrival we were given an upgrade (upon request) and at no extra cost to a lake view room on a high floor so we could see the fireworks displays from the various parks. The room was very comfortable and clean and the bathroom with separate shower excellent. We requested extra coathangers and within 10 minutes we had been given another dozen. The lazy river is relaxing and when we were there never overcrowded and the pool area has some lovely secluded areas for a bit of peace and quiet. My son had a whale of a time playing in and around the pool and the childrens club staff were great for organising smores evenings and poolside games. We visited 6 of the various parks whilst there and felt the days spent at the JW were a relaxing break between them all. So much so, sometimes it was difficult to drag ourselves away!! We ate in the Citron, Primo and Quench Pool Bar at the JW and the Vineyard Grill and lobby bar at the Ritz Carlton. Primo and the Grill were quite expensive, especially with wine but that's what you expect with a hotel of this calibre. All were of a very high standard of food and service with an excellent and very cheap children's menu in Citron and Vineyard Grill. Our particular favourite though, has to be the sushi bar in the lobby of the JW. Very reasonably priced and excellent sushi. The gym at the Ritz is one of the best equipped I have seen in any hotel, with towels, headsets to the personal moniitors and complimentary bottles of water. I used it quite frequently during my stay and it was always clean cool and well staffed. Lastly the staff in particular were a credit to the hotel. They really were polite, accomodating and a pleasure to meet. Ricardo the lobby barman is worth a mention for his excellent cocktails. Our turn down service was prompt with extra chocolates being left for my son!!! We did do the Marriott Vacations Club presentation organised through Bobbi. It was very professional and we didn't feel under any particular pressure to sign up. We didn't , but would certainly consider it in future if the JW is an example of other Marriott properties. The only one negative point I have is the $9 per day parking charge. (which we were charged) Excessive I thought for a 2 week stay - $140.00 (including tax). Would stay at the JW again in a minute, and in fact would find it difficult to stay anywhere else whilst in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Lazy River was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: asiribunrit
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked the hotel and airfare on Jetblue for 5 nights at $1200. It was totally worth it! We had the Sunday brunch which included all you can eat crab claws, shrimp, everything you can imagine. It was a little pricey but the food was excellent. The weekday breakfast was very pricey but still delicious. The hotel grounds are beautiful. We spent every morning to midafternoon floating around the lazy river. The have a great golf course on the grounds. The concierge was very helpful and recommended great restaurants. I was a little surprised of the extra charges. Parking is not included, self park $9/day and the internet is $12.95/day. We had a great vacation and are looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Just Loved the JW Marriott at Grande Lakes”
Reviews.Author: cascadesjn
Reviews.Content: On July 7th my husband, daughter and her boyfriend stayed 5 nights at this great hotel. I must say that our first night was a zinger as my husband had a medical emergency at 3:00 am Saturday. I called the front desk and the overnight desk manager, Michael, quickly arranged for transportation. We did not need an ambulance, however, I was very impressed by their offer to personally drive us to Sand Lakes Hospital in a company car if other transport was not quick enough. Fortunately, a town car came quickly and escorted us to the emergency room. A call to the front desk later that morning was all I had to do to get someone to pick us up and, to my surprise, the desk clerk had asked is all was OK with my husband. Putting that first event behind us, we found the hotel to be first class all the way. Yes, there are major conventions going on but this place is so big everyone blends in. We really enjoyed Citron for meals. Generous portions and reasonable prices. Quench by the pool also offered some great dining choices. Be aware that most drinks from the pool bar at about $10-$12. Soft drinks were about $3 and beers ranged from $3.50 and up. The Starbucks in the lobby is great for morning coffee and danish. The best part of this resort is the lazy river and the grounds. There is plenty of room for guests to lounge by the pool and a walk of the grounds are a must. It is ajoined to the Ritz Carlton and the spa pool and the Ritz pool are beautiful. Our room was very nice with a balcony overlooking the pool. In the evening you could see fireworks from the parks. We were sad the leave but we will definately put this hotel on our "best list" for future vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here just for the pool”
Reviews.Author: Foodiebird
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to what others are saying...it has an amazing pool. So much so that we came just for the pool! We didn't go to any theme parks but enjoyed the pool and the other amenities that the hotel offered. The $9 a day self park was no problem for us and we usually got a fairly close parking spot. The one time cost of $5 for a beach tire tube to float in the pool wasn't an issue either since the hotel never did charge us for the tubes (4 in total) or the parking. Yeah! You do need to have a car so you can go outside of the hotel to get a different choice of food and give yourselves a break from the same wonderful surroundings. Since International Drive is so close by, any and all food types are available. A Walgreen's pharmacy is fairly close by at the corner as is a number of shops just south of the hotel if you are in need of things from a grocery store called Publix. Since we're from Canada, we like to pick up a few things that we can't get back home. We were fortunate enough to get a balcony with a pool view which enabled us to view the fireworks from various parks that go off around 10 in the evening during July. The room was large enough for two adults and two boy's 12 and 10. The bathrooms are quite large with lots of towels. The hotel gives lots of pillows but we did bring some of our clothes already on hangers since hotels are a bit stingy on offering hangers even after you've requested more. The special radio which can play CD's (bring some from home) also has sound effects such as a babbling brook, crickets chirping, waves on a shoreline, a tropical rainforrest and sounds of wind blowing. It was wonderful have these sounds playing all night while you sleep. The service was always friendly and ready to accomodate you with whatever you required of them. We never did call back or go down to get our "free" gift from the people who are trying to sell time shares. The will call you the next morning after you arrive and the day before you leave if you don't contact them which we never did. They never even spoke to us when we passed by so I guess we were lucky or the others who've commented on them being push just didn't have the luck that we had with them. We ate by the pool most of the time and the food and drinks were fantastic! We ate at Citron's for lunch and dinner once each and both times the food was extremely good and the service wonderful. It was great having a Starbuck's coffee shop in the lobby area and the kids enjoyed getting their hotchocolates their or the strawberries and cream drinks which they're now addicted too! Overall this is a very nice hotel with lots of marble in the foyer area making it very grand looking but not cold. The offering of cold water with citrus pieces floating in it for a wee bit of flavour was a nice touch at the front desk. It was my birthday and our 15th anniversary the week we went and they do ask you at the front desk if you're celebrating anything. I don't know why they ask this since nothing was done about both the things we were celebrating. Why ask if you're not going to do anything about it? I thought that funny is all. I hope some of you found this review useful and have a wonderful time at this hotel like my family and I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family lives only an hour away - but we needed a little two day getaway. We found the JW Marriot just perfect for our need. The room was clean - the bed and pillows were most comfortable. The bathroom was almost bigger than the one at home.. We spent a day at Disney and came back to the hotel to escape the crowd. The Marriott is in a great location - away from the tourist crowd. The pool was beautiful! The lazy river was just what we needed to relax after a day with Mickey. We cannot recommend this hotel enough. From the moment we walked in we were impressed. The staff was so accomodating and friendly (you don't find that too much anymore). We are already planning another visit in the Spring of 2007. Can't wait to go back to our oasis in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A Class Resort in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am Winter Park,FL resident who needed a weekend get away with my pregnant wife. Orlando is awash with Tourist Trap Resorts that overpormise and underdeliver routinely. We needed an Oasis and the JW Marriott overdelivered. The JW property shares a golf course and Spa with the Ritz-Carlton, as well as many other facilities and restaurants, and lives up to its neighbor's standards at every turn. From the lobby, to the rooms, restaurants, and amazing pool, you would think you were at a giant Ritz. The Pool and surrounding lush green tropical lanscaping is truly awesome. There is a massive interconnected pool system that is connected by a "lazy river" meandering through lush landscape and waterfalls. There are many secluded lounging areas with pool chairs and hot tubs. It could be super crowded but you can find your own hideaway if you need one. The Hotel itself is awash in marble and wood, very elegant, and feels ritzy. The rooms are upscale Marriott, nicely furnished with great open door balconies. The bathrooms are huge and well appointed. If there was a downside it was the service, something that really sets the Ritz apart. The JW is a huge resort with lots of employees that sometimes seem to be on their own time, in thier own world. Last year we stayed at the Ritz, scaled beck this year in cost, but had as wonderful a time. I would reccommend both hotels (each would be great with kids, JW's Pool though) to anyone locally that needs a close by, but so far away, vacation. Any visitors to Orlando will not get the typical touristy cheese here. Class all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and services were great.”
Reviews.Author: redathena
Reviews.Content: Hotel and service - excellent. I did signup for the Marriott preview vacation voucher. I expressed my concerns that this would be a very high pressure sales pitch.
