I was assured this would not be the case; however, in reading a recent review this is, in fact, what happens and I think this approach leaves a very negative opinion of the JW Marriott Corp.and I am not sure I will follow thru with my plans to preview the property mentioned in the brochure. I will contact the representative, with whom I dealt, and get a very clear understanding about the sales tactics. Initially, he assured me that JW Marriott would not tarnish their reputation by sleazy, high pressure tactics. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: TexasSmiths
Reviews.Content: Outstanding resort, the best Marriott has to offer. Outstand staff, great facilities, and just a dream to stay here. We traveled in May with a family of five and none of us wanted to leave, we even skipped a day at Walt Disney World to hang at the pool, its that awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had kids.”
Reviews.Author: BroomRidesLtd2
Reviews.Content: If my husband and I had kids it would have been a great place to celebrate our Anniversery .There were children everywhere, we love children, but for two people who wanted some quiet we picked the wrong weekend.We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton next door the year before but thought we could get more bang for our buck at the JW Marriott.We should have splurged next door for the $200 dif.The pool was nice but loud and there was this guy singing and playing guitar most of the day which was annoying after 5 min.We could have gone down to the RC pool but once sitting in a chair didn't feel like walking down there. Other then that the staff was nice ,they gave us a nice room,I believe an upgrade.We had a lovely view of the fireworks display that they provided.We enjoyed the food in all the restaurants.The drinks are pricey but this seems to be standard in most upscale resorts. My only real complaint is that our bags took over 30 mins to get to our room it arrived within 5 mins of us calling looking for them.This was only annoying because our bathing suits were in our bags and we wanted to go to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very High Quality Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 10 days while on holiday in Orlando and found the hotel to be first class. On arrival they did,nt have a family room available(even though we had booked 11 months earlier)so we were provided with a lake view suite which was superb and 3 times the size of a normal room. The pool area including the lazy river is great and affords privacy due to the large area it covers. The dining facilities are quality and the prices are similar to what we would pay in 4 star hotels in the UK. Be aware that there is a time share rep in the lobby who will contact you to arrange an appointment for you to visit Marriot Grande Vista resort nearby, by promising you 125 marriot dollars if you attend, We went and were subjected to a very slick high pressure sales pitch by a rep who tried to get us to sign up on no fewer than 5-10 occasions and would not take no for an answer and got annoyed when we said we needed time to think. Overall a great hotel,if they could lose the time share element, it would be even better.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Read Review . . .”
Reviews.Author: dcpjudge
Reviews.Content: First things first, I am giving the JW Marriott an AVERAGE rating b/c it simply can't live up to it's 5 star rating. With a 5 star rating and average cost of $330+ per night, my standards are pretty high. And, with the outstanding selection in Orlando, I expect a lot of bang for my buck. Let me begin with the basics: We were there for a conference (as are the majority of their guest), it was a holiday weekend (i.e. crowded), I am not the type of reviewer that complains about every little thing I can find - if I mention it, it's something that actually changed the quality of my trip. I travel frequently and stay at either 4 or 5 star resorts. I am Marriott Rewards Elite member and therefor could expect that they were as accomodating towards me as they would towards anyone staying there. We were there for 5 days. Here was our experience: Check-in was difficult simply b/c they were full and couldn't honor any of our request (crib or adjoining rooms). We ended up with 3 rooms on 3 different floors. 1 room was serviced by one elevator, the other 2 by another which made for the regular back and forth trips to become pretty annoying after the first few days. In addition, the elevators are not centered in the building and the walk to your room can be extremely lengthy. We enjoyed the pool and many of their daily activities (make sure to do the poolside dive-in movie). The restaurants are good, but don't offer enough variety for a longer stay. Room service was good as well. Sea World is very close (less than 2 miles), but getting to Disney properties was a true pain w/ traffic, driving and parking. The lake views are breathtaking, but the parking lot views are not 5 star. Everything was expensive (as is expected at this level of resort). No park transportation of any kind is provided. The hotel is perfect for a conference and it's attendees, but would never be my choice for an Orland stay that involved kids wanting to go to theme parks, Downtown Disney, etc. To sum it up: You will love: The landscaping, the pool (perfect!), the poolside entertainment, the spacious sized rooms, the activities, incredibly fast elevator service, and the friendly staff. You will hate: It's distance from Orland attractions, the fact they nickle and dime you for everything (poolside drinks are $11 each, $17 parking, and having to purchase a float for the lazy river, etc.), the walk from the elevator to your room (confirm a room with a low number to prevent this significant annoyance), the fact that everyone in our group of 3 rooms couldn't get their room cool enough and the lack of dining options on a longer stay. If you have a conference at this hotel, congratulations - it will be a great experience. If you are looking for a family vacation at a nice Orlando resort, I would suggest one of the choices better geared towards that crowd (Hyatt Grand Cypress remains one of my favorites and is cheaper than the JW Marriott). Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Good but soulless”
Reviews.Author: Barmyblade
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a four day conference. Everything was very well organised and this hotel is clearly driven to provide good service. However I have to say I found the overall experience underwhelming, and could not imagine planning a vacation in this hotel. It just came across as a soulless money making machine, with no real identity. However, my only complaint about the hotel itself is the wafer thin walls (awoken several times) which didn't help me overcome my jetlag! Everything else went very smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: quakerquisp
Reviews.Content: 4/17-4/22 were original at Savona Suites one night(big mistake) Came here and found heaven we were in room 9015 face pool and lake saw kids never heard them. It was me,husband and 17yr old son. Everything was clean and beautiful, but yet never saw anyone doing the cleaning(I like that) anyway we ate at buffet twice at the Citron 19.00 each very good,but we rent a car and find outside places to eat. We used valet 17.00 per day for us weel worth it. Just had a fantastic tiime really felt like we were on vacation. Also on 3rd floor there are 3 washers and dryers 2.00 per load. It may be expensive but for us if we have to worry about the prices we should not be on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is breaktakingly beautiful and the staff amazingly friendly and attentive. Also good value for money given its a luxury hotel. A totally perfect break!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaMatt
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is a very nice hotel. Great rooms, very good service. Stayed for 3 nights in a 2 doubles room with wife and kids. The furnishings are fabulous. The bathroom is fantastic. We were on the 5th floor with a pool-view room. Did not have a balcony. There was a coffee-maker in the room, as well as an honor bar. No microwave. Internet access is wired only and costs $12.95 a day (noon to noon). The pool is very nice (warm, max depth about 4 1/2 feet.). The lazy river is very nice. It doesn't carry you fast at all. Much of it is shaded. You must purchase floats for $5 each. The food at the hotel is $$$ and the pool is no exception. The food is very good and portions are large. I did have some trouble getting service at the pool bar (I hate it when there are several people making themselves look busy without serving the customers). They do have servers coming around the pool and asking if you need anything during most of the day. They had Spanish language music playing on the speakers surrounding the pool. I would have preferred a mix of music types (but that's just me). The pool chairs are not cushioned (like the Ritz). Shade is generally available from the palm trees or umbrellas. Overall it is a fantastic pool. Self parking is available for $9 a day or valet parking is also available. The staff at the front desks was very professional. The hostess at the Citron was a little bit unconcerned. I asked for a seat away from small kids and she made no attempts to do so. After seating, the door to the outside near our table would make a loud shriek when closing (about a dozen times). I asked that something be done about it and received the "can't do anything about it" answer. It was later resolved after I personally took action. When dinner is over $100,I don't expect a screeching door or loud kids. The food was very good and portions were large. A casual lunch was $85. Be advised that food will set you back a lot. There is a Starbucks onsite and several stores. I would highly recommend staying here. Do not follow the Mapquest directions to the hotel. The best and easiest way is to just get off at the "Sea World" exit. It will take you straight to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the JW”
Reviews.Author: RELady
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out we received exceptional service from everyone we encountered. We stayed using our Marriott points, asked for a high floor and we were put on the 25th facing the pool just about center of the hotel. Fantastic views of most of Orlando, were able to watch the Disney fireworks from our balcony. Some of the other reviews had negatives about the room cleanliness, I manage office buildings so I really notice those kind of things but found everything spotless. Also, as far as the timeshare desk - we walked by once and said "no thank you" and never heard another peep from the salesman. The burgers and fries at the poolside bar were fantastic, so was our server Rhadoo. We live in Orlando and quite often spend overnights in local hotels. We were celebrating our anniversary and did so in style. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy a beautiful hotel, sleep in an awesome bed and lounge by an incredible pool.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and 2 year old. It seemed the physical space was fine, but the service was just okay. Here's my opinion: Pros - We got an upgrade to a suite with Marriott rewards, the bathroom was very large, and the bed and decor were nice and comfortable - Location is near Seaworld and not far from Disney - Brunch, although pricey (get the breakfast plan)was excellent - Waitstaff very attentive and friendly to children - Starbucks onsite! Cons - We came back for my son's nap at 3:00 and the room hadn't been made up - I ordered room service and it was delivered 45 minutes later than the 45 they said (they did comp it) - Scheduled a sitter through the concierge, but there was a mix up and we ended up without a sitter.

Reviews.Title: “great family vacation at the jw!”
Reviews.Author: merrytime
Reviews.Content: my family of four had a great time at the jw marriott this summer. Everything was wonderful. we had a package deal with two guaranteed connecting rooms, this included breakfast and parking, game tokens and ice cream for children under 12. the rooms weren't particularly big, but very nice with nice bathrooms. the children did play either nintendo or play station. We absolutely loved the pool, I didn't want to go anywhere else. Unfortuneatly, the pool closed at 11:00 every night. so tropical and beautiful. the lazy river could have been a bit faster, but we had a great time swimming and floating, plenty of noodles and water floating devices, lots of fountains and waterfalls, and quiet hot tubs tucked away in different places, I think there were two. the citron was downstairs on the way to the pool, so you could eat before or after and not change. The breakfast buffet was fantastic. the people were sooo nice, so friendly and professional. We rented a car on site. enjoyed the pool again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “conference city!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireB1
Reviews.Content: There were some very good bits of this hotel: - gardens and pool area with lazy river were excellent (for when the sun actually come out!) - location for attractions good - resturants we tried were very good But to travel all that way to find a pool side full of business men with there lap tops and mobile phones was disappointing. I left all that at home! The weather was poor for the duration of our stay..rain and more rain so perhaps it put us off a little!!!! Not a budget hotel but felt fresh and new!

Reviews.Title: “Nice ambiance, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: cyh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference. Room and service were average for the rate. Some dirt stayed on the bathroom floor the entire stay. Food was very average. Pool and other amenities were extremely nice. One annoyance - you had to pay $10 a day for broadband in the room and another $10 if you wanted wireless in the lobby. That seems excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Pompous staff, wierd shaped rooms, didn't honor military rate!”
Reviews.Author: gatorgurl4
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights on vacation. We were quoted a military rate of $145 which we got since my boyfriend is in the Army and proudly served in Iraq for 14 months. However when we got to the desk to check in they told us they were unable to honor that rate because unknown to us his military ID card had expired 3 days before we checked in. We never realized this until we got to the hotel. So we asked if they could honor that rate if we could fax something from his company commander the next morning. One of the front desk clerks told us yes that shouldn't be a problem. We took down his name and said we would do that the next morning. However we were unable to get ahold of his commander because it was a sunday so we wouldn't be able to fax anything until monday morning, the day we were leaving. I was then informed by the front desk that the person who told us that we could have something faxed on letterhead to honor the rate was misinformed and we would have to pay the regular rack rate of $289. I asked if there was anything we can do to get the military rate honored and was told no. I later called down again and spoke with the front desk manager who said they can give us the $239 corporate rate and take care of our parking for our stay. I told him I thought they should honor the military rate since that was what we were quoted and we obviously weren't aware that my boyfriend's ID had recently expired. He rambled on about how the company has to make a certain rate for all rooms and seemed very unbending to accomodate the military rate so we were stuck paying almost $250 for the room. The only plus side to the room was it had an amazing view on the 9th floor overlooking everything(pools, the Ritz, theme park, etc) with one of the concrete larger balconies compared to the other guests metal ones. The room is also oddly designed in how you don't see the bed when you walk in like most, it is down this narrow passageway after the bathroom, and it is not a large room. We were dissapointed in not being able to get the military rate but we happened to catch a fireworks show right from our balcony before going out one night, so it was romantic and offered some solace for our misery lol. Other than that I wasn't very impressed with this marriott. I think the front desk staff thinks the hotel is better than it really is and acts pompous and arrogant. A lot of hotels have nice public areas and nice lobbies, but they skimp on the room size and quality. That is what I thought of this Marriott. I think if the front desk staff had acted more pleasant and accomodating and the rooms were designed better I would've stayed again. However I think any hotel that can't accomodate a military rate for someone who served in Iraq and could have been verified is just lousy and unexcusable. I have worked in three different hotel chains (Sheraton, Hilton, and Holiday Inn) and I know that the managers had free range to comp and quote different rates at there descretion.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise”
Reviews.Author: trvlnggrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott with a friend and her two children for 3 nights. From the moment we drove up to the door to the time I checked out, it was like being in paradise. Every employee I encountered was pleasant and helpful. My requests were met with a smile and quickly fulfilled. When we requested extra towels etc, they were delivered within minutes. The grounds were immaculate and absolutely beautiful. The kids loved the playscape and pools. Breakfast in the Citron Brasserie was delicious and far exceeded other buffets I've eaten at. On Saturday night, we all enjoyed making smores and drinking hot chocolate by the lake. The beds were comfortable and the room and bathroom were very roomy. I can't say enough good things about the Marriott and I can't wait to return and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fake Luxury”
Reviews.Author: El_Turista
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights over thanksgiving and payed 169 dollars a night. For that price we think that it was very good value for money but this is probably the lowest you will ever be able to pay. Good things: *Nice and big pool area. *Very clean, both room and the rest of the hotel. Bad things: *7 dollars parking fee/night!!! Totally unnecessary and the parking was quite a walk from the room part of the hotel. *NO AIRPORT SHUTTLE although it says it has that on the website which ended up costing us 80 dollars in taxifares as we left our car at the airport the day before we checked out. Would have been cheaper to keep the car one day more. *The staff we had to deal with was not very proffesional. *The representatives for "Marriot vacation club"(time share) pestered us all through the stay. They wouldn't take no for an answer. In the end you just had to ignore them. *Our room was on 16th floor but right above the ground floor kitchen fan i guess because we couldn't have the balcony open because of the smell of cooked food coming from down there. All in all, this is a very nice stay for the price we payed. But for their ordinary prices, you should get a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton service at Ritz Carlton prices”
Reviews.Author: WilliamFS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW for 6 nights and had booked it assuming it was comparable to a Ritz Carlton from information we had read, it's not. We were able to check in early, but was given an inferior room as a result, which considering that we were staying for 6 nights, was not worth the early check-in. The hotel is basically a nice property, but lacks the service relative to the prices it charges. Wired Internet access is $10 per day in the room and/or an additional $10 per day for WiFi, which didn't seem to work in the pool areas and isn't available in your room. I had a wireless broadband laptop card overnighted to me by my cellular dealer to avoid the $20 a day gouging and to be able to work by the pool. My package was delivered at the hotel the next morning and took 4 hours to get to the front desk despite my repeated requests to pick it up. When I finally got the call that they had it and went to the front desk, I had to wait 25 minutes for them to find it. Good thing I didn't need my package for a meeting. The pool areas could be nice but suffer from lack of attention. Pool chaises were kind of downmarket, material-wise, and had mildew on most of them. The pool has a lazy river which is nice, but unfortunately the foliage that surrounds it falls into the pool and the staff doesn't do a very good job of skimming the dead leaves out of the pool. There did not seem to be any poolside service for drinks or food, so you had to go to the restaurant near the pool to get anything and the food served there was not very good. The pool attendants and lifeguards were too busy talking to each other on the bridges that went over the lazy river to provide any service. Food quality was just OK. We walked to the adjoining Ritz Carlton (you can charge to your JW room) for many meals as the food was better there than the JW. When we would leave the Ritz after breakfast and walk by the Ritz pool there would be a bunch of employees primping and cleaning the pool area, there wasn't similar activity at the JW pool. The spa/fitness center is managed by the Ritz and is typical of other Ritz properties. The Marriott Vacation Club (timeshare) reps, that appear to be Concierges when you first arrive, pester you with a "free gift" everytime you walk by and also leave messages on your room phone. This was really annoying and I just started saying "NO" when we walked by before the rep could start her spiel. In summary, stay at the Ritz-Carlton if you are staying at the Grande Lakes and get the service for the money. Both of these hotels have huge conference areas and are oriented to business-meetings more than leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Children”
Reviews.Author: jjcalto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott Orlando Grande Lakes Nov 6th - 10th. We were very disappointed. We booked an executive suite with a connecting room. We arrived and they gave me keys to 2 regular rooms. I asked if it was an executive suite and was told they gave my original room away. I told them this was unacceptable and they moved me to an executive suite overlooking a parking lot. They did not have wireless available in the room, and to connect via cable it costs $9.99 a day, (most hotels we have frequented this was free) The furniture belonged in a motel. The room only looked like the picture on the website (no French doors going to the bedroom like the website reflected). The motor on the air conditioning was overly noisy. However the bed and linens were very nice. The room has no VCR or DVD player and the cable did not have Nickelodeon. I called the front desk and was told they rent a VCRT for $95!. You can rent a movie for $11. We were traveling with two 5 year olds and I called the concierge and inquired about child activities. They told me they were roasting marshmallows by the pool at 7:00. We went down to the pool and the roasting never occurred (kids were disappointed). I went to activities center and they said it the concierge has had problems with the dates of the children’s activities. We tried to tye die t-shirts, however they ran out of children’s t-shirts. We tried to get at the kids tattoos and the airbrush didn’t work. The restaurants food and service was excellent. The lazy river pool is geared to adults, not children. I complained to management about my dissatisfaction and they sent up a wine, fruit and cheese basket with a Marriott bear for my child. This hotel caters to conventions. The next time we travel to Disney we will go back to the Hyatt Grand Cypress or the Portifino; they aremore kid friendly, with a more competent staff members.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Marriott I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Vacation Club Member and have stayed at Marriotts for 10 years. This is the worst excuse for a JW Marriott I have ever seen. The staff were horrendous and less than accommodating. I am glad I wasted 78,000 points on a 3 night stay for service you would get at a Days Inn. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than the JW”
Reviews.Author: Hgate
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW with my wife and 3 year old boy in September for a couple of incredible weeks. Having planned our trip using the information here i thought it only fair i give some information back. Everything about this hotel and its sister (ritz-carlton) make it just perfect. The check-in was quick, smooth and hassle free with an allocation of a great room looking out over the pool and lake. The room itself was fairly typical size but furnised very well with a great bathroom. We even had a fridge delivered at no charge for our two week stay. Seems the JW have an oversupply of chocolate for the evening turn-down service because our boy always had a big pile left on his pillow! The pool has to be one of the best i have ever seen and had a great section for young kids, including a playground alongside. The Ritz also has a lovely pool you can use with kids splash and play area also. They even have a saturday evening movie by the pool usually showing a kids favourite. The restaurants, particularly Citron are child friendly including a big toy box to keep the young ones happy. The service is every bit as good as people have said. The grounds and gardens are very well looked after and perfect for an evening stroll after a rather large steak! The hotel itself is only about 15 minutes drive from the airport, 5 minutes to seaworld and 10 minutes to wdw. There are plenty of shops, bars restaurants and malls within a few minutes drive. This is a fantastic place - a haven of tranquility amongst the madness of theme parks. We are looking to book again for next year which says it all really.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful propery, service could be better”
Reviews.Author: tikaye406
Reviews.Content: property was absolutely beautiful. spa was very nice - service at the spa was excellent and ambiance was superb. food was delicious! executive suite had a good layout with a fantastic bathroom and great views of the property. service was average (with the exception of the spa, which was excellent). i was very disappointed with the service at this hotel. i expected much more. a few examples: calling the operator was terrible - i was always on hold. the operator would try to extend service by referring to my name, but they used the wrong name on 2 different occasions. i tried ordering room service one night and when i called to follow-up over an hour later, they said they didn't have any record of my order. summary: property, spa, and restaurants - 5 star service - 3 star at most

Reviews.Title: “Supreme Experience”
Reviews.Author: amsuma
Reviews.Content: Hands-down, top of the line hotel. Rooms were immaculate and stylish. Grounds were extraordinarily tropical, so much so that I felt like I was in Hawaii periodically. Staff were accommodating and pleasant. Very close to I-Drive and restaurants, yet you feel like you are in a secluded area. Hammocks, pool/river, lake/boats, koi pond, waterfalls: enticing. STAY HERE if you get the opportunity. Business travelers: convention center is excellent, and the location keeps your participants satisfied. Only other consideration...bring your wallet for food/drinks on-site -- although I am not sure it is more expensive than other Orlando resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort at a remote location”
Reviews.Author: 155019tripper
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed at the Grande Lakes Marriot while attending a conference. The hotel is very clean, the staff very friendly and helpful. The pool follows the layout of the lazy river and as a result there are many different areas where you can sit and relax by yourself. I particulary enjoyed the poolside lunch service. The containers of citrus water in the lobby by the front desk is a nice touch. Our group enjoyed the restaurants. But one evening when our conference presentation did not finish till 10pm, the Marriot and the Ritz were not able to accomodate the hundreds of tired hungry attendees. Two of the restaurants closed at 10 and another at the Marriot was opened till 10:30 but unable to fit us all in. We ended up at the restaurant in the lobby of the Ritz and only able to obtain finger food not a true dinner which we all wanted and needed. The location of the hotel is very remote if you do not have a car. Town cars are readily available but costly. A one way trip to the Florida Mall (which is not that far away) was quoted at $30 each way, compared to a Yellow Cab taxi of $13 each way. The draw back to the cab was that we had to wait one hour for one to show up at the hotel and that was after the taxi dispatch was called 3 times to inquire where our cab was. I would recommend this hotel but please note the above drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Definitely a first class resort! I'm a Disney fanatic - and I had park hopper passes - and I DID NOT want to leave my hotel. The rooms are pristine, the property immaculate, the lazy river relaxing, the staff inviting and friendly. The bed, with its down comforter and plush pillows, was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on. The grounds make for a great evening stroll, complete with a hammock by the lake. On Saturday night, they played a movie outside by the pool for kids to watch. I didn't have an opportunity to visit the spa, but what I could see of it was remarkable. Absolutely fantastic!!! Highly recommended for families and for romantic getaways!

Reviews.Title: “Family fun....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are locals in the Central Florida area, and I found this hotel to have so much for locals or visitors alike...The highlight of the hotel is a fantastic pool area with its own lazy river, kids pools, planned poolside activities, and a scrumptious poolside restaurant... the hotel sits on a spectacular golfcourse, and area attractions are all in close proximity as well. The hotel boasts several tantalizing restaurants inside as well, along with gift shops and a Starbucks. Whether you are looking for an overnight getaway or a week-long excursion, this is the hotel to take your family to for a stay to remember....

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: DozzaEngland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and my two children stayed here after reading the description in a holiday brochure. On arrival after a long 9 hour flight we were disappointed that no one came to help us with our luggage. They just stared at us. We had to struggle with our luggage to the main doors before someone helped us. However things got better after this. The service improved, the rooms were very clean and the staff were great. My husband enjoyed the golf whilst my daughters enjoyed the pool. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Going to meet Friends”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Some friends that were staying at JW Marriott had invited us over to have lunch. Being an Orlando resident, I was looking forward to seeing one of the newer Hotels in our fair City. However when I was looking up the info. on J.W Marriott Grande Lakes I saw a parking fee- not a 2 or 3 dollar fee but $11.00!!!. I called the customer service number and asked surely there is a lower fee, or it can be validated for guest just having lunch- Nope! She stated everyone pays that fee- Now mind you- Disney has a parking fee- as well as Universal and SeaWorld , but a hotel?, even a resort hotel! And at $11.00 We had 2 cars for all 8 of us joining our friends- that would have been 22.00 before we entered the lobby door!- This also does not include the tip if valet parked. So be prepared to dish out some crisp dollars just to have the privledge of entering the property.- It was dissapointing and a bit ridiculous! We all agreed to have lunch elsewhere and were happy to do so.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott Staff Is The Best”
Reviews.Author: VisitorFromWI
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 girls stayed at the JW Marriott Orlando in early June. The hotel is beautiful and the staff were among some of the nicest people we have ever met. This is a terrific place to stay. We arrived early and checked in early. No problem. The pool staff was great - the lazy river is a blast. We particularly enjoyed the breakfast buffet with our waiter Alberto. When we told him we were visiting Disney World, he gave my daughters a package of cookies to eat there. Same thing when we left - cookies and pastries for the flight home. When we came back to our room from the pool one day, the turndown staff left stuffed animals on the made beds for the kids. And when we asked what the movie was for the "Drive In Movie Night," the staff asked us what movie we wanted to watch so we saw "The Incredibles" and everyone in the pool enjoyed it. We tried to play lawn chess and since it was awhile since I played, we asked the staff if they had game instructions and 5 minutes later, we had our instructions. The staffer had the instructions printed from the Internet. If we wanted shade at the pool, the staff moved chairs and umbrellas for us. This is simply the best place to stay in Orlando. Thanks to the staff for making us feel so welcome!

Reviews.Title: “True Five Star”
Reviews.Author: dpoli
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at the JW Marriott Orlando Grande Lakes. What a pleasure to stay in a hotel that is advertised as five star and truly is! From the moment we entered the marble lobby, we were greeted by hotel personnel ,inquiring if we needed assistance and offering us citrus flavored cold water. Check in was very fast, and we were assigned rooms on the 22nd floor, overlooking the lake and pool. The room was on the small side , but more than adequate. We had a king size bed as well as a sleeper sofa--perfect for a couple with a child. The room was immaculate, as was the enormous(compared to the room) bathroom, which had a separate tub and shower. The beds were very comfortable, but they had feather pillows and toppers--something that I am allergic to. It would be nice if there were a few rooms that had foam pillows and no feathers, The public areas were gorgeous and spotless. The lounge ,restaurants, and pool area looked new. Hotel staff was always ready to help and although they were many throughout the property, they were very subtle. We had the bountiful buffet breakfast in Citron each morning. Although a little pricey ($18 per person), we had many choices, including made to order omelettes and belgian waffles. The pool is perhaps the nicest we've seen in the US--it has a heated lazy river ( a shame that they charge several dollars to use the floats) and many private areas to swim. As the hotel had low occupancy, it was never crowded and there were always plenty of chaises. A staff member told us that there is a cruise of the lake every half hour that leaves from the dock--you can even take it over to the Ritz-Carlton that adjoins the Marriott. Our stay was absolutely perfect--my only complaint is the $7 per day charge for self parking ( or $12 for valet). We are already planning a return stay.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two children (ages 9 and 12) stayed here during our Orlando visit. The hotel and its nicely landscaped grounds were beautiful. We had scheduled one day to just spend at the hotel...and was glad we did. Our kids enjoyed the pool so much, and all of us enjoyed the lazy river! The hotel was very clean, and our room impeccable. We got the breakfast plan which we would highly recommend. The buffet breakfast at Citron is a good start to the day. With two kids, we wish the room was a little larger, but overall would highly recommend this hotel. It was a nice, relaxing haven.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay at the JW Marriott Grandelakes, Orlando”
Reviews.Author: YvoParadise
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and really enjoyed our visit. The interior of this hotel is beautiful, especially the lobby area. The swimming pool area is nice with several pools to choose from plus a meandering river you can take an intertube down. The grounds are immaculate as well as the entire hotel. The entire staff were exceptionally nice and so professional and helpful.......we were made to feel very welcome. Only downside, the room was small and not decorated very well, which surprised us, especially for a JW. We expected more.....no small sofa or coffee table in our room and the bathroom sink counter was very small. Overall, though a wonderful hotel and would stay again. A wonderful surprise was their restaurant called Primo. The ambience, food and service were first class...........one of the best dining experiences we have ever had. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our kids loved the pool which is the best I can say about this Marriott. The service at the pool was the worst I'd ever had, our server was not friendly at all,he acted as if we were bothering him. When we complained at the bar, same bad attitude. The next day my wife and I tried to have an evening without the kids and have Sushi in the lounge, which was highly recommended, the Sushi was ok but again the service was not good. Our server was young and inexperienced and was more interested in flirting with the bartender then taking care of us. This hotel was so beautiful, too bad we will not return due to just bad service.

Reviews.Title: “great facilities and no hassle service”
Reviews.Author: jah39a
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here, and it’s still a terrific resort. Nice pool complex with a zero entry area for little kids, excellent spa ($15/day to use the lap pool, whirlpool steam, sauna & lockers, but it’s such a nice, relaxing adults-only spot that it’s worth it. This is complimentary if you are having a spa treatment.) The gym is one of the best equipped of any hotel I’ve seen, and is complimentary. Food quality ranged from excellent to so-so in the all day restaurant, Citron. There’s a great breakfast buffet, especially if you get it in the room rate. The wait staff here treated our 3 year old daughter like royalty each morning, and two of them remembered her from our trip here last year. The kid’s playroom doesn’t have organized child care/day care activities, instead its intended for parents to accompany their kids and spend time together playing, with no fee. (No, it’s not dazzling when you are in the land of theme parks, but it is very useful for a rainy morning.) It has toys, games, craft materials, TV and video games. In-room babysitting can be arranged, and for those who want fee based daytime child care, the adjacent kid’s facility at the Ritz Carlton is available to Marriott guests. The only negative about this place is that it isn't near anything. It's about a 20+ minute drive to WDW or Univeral areas, 5-10 minutes to Sea world, 15+ mins to International drive restaraunts. Nothing is walking distance but that's not unusual in the sprawl of Orlando. What sets this resort apart, is that we have found the service here to be completely professional and friendly without exception. No hassles, everything right the first time. It makes for an effortless, low stress vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott July 17-20, 2005. I read the reviews on trip advisor and decided to give it a try. I had a wonderful experience at the resort from the time I pulled up to the entrance and when I checked out. The staff was very friendly and pleasant. The rooms were clean and service was provided twice a day. Overall, I have nothing bad to say about the resort. I would stay again when I return back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “My own waterworld hell...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place looks amazing. The slow lazy river and beautiful foliage are the best. The water flowing out of the bathroom ceiling... not so good. Don't plan on staying in 5001 unless you bring an umbrella and galoshes. After we eventually got another room (repeated calls to housekeeping and maintenance who were all very nice when they finally got there), there was no sheet on the sofa sleeper and it's smells like a smoking room. I'm tired and fed up. My trip in this alleged 5-star is just beginning...

Reviews.Title: “Companies, don't waste the money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, for the great things....wonderful pool area. Now for the bad things. I was there for a large convention and most of my coworkers agree that this was a huge waste of our companies money! We had to go to meetings all day and the hotel did not provide water for the meetings. Come on, how much can that cost? We are trapped in these rooms all day with out water. Can you believe they didn't even bring any for lunch? Secondly, they did not honor the marriott points. When 1000's are mad about not receiving points for their stay I can tell you marriott got a bad reputation within our company. Not only does our company meet several times a year, each employee travels extensively on a regular basis. They lost a lot of future business. Lastly, this hotel has nothing around it. We were basically stuck there with horrible food. I know Orlando has some pretty good restaurants so I advise you stay somewhere you can enjoy them.

Reviews.Title: “Experience Disney the JW Way!”
Reviews.Author: ConnieS
Reviews.Content: We have been to Orlando many times. Have done the Universal/Disney/Epcot too many times to count. But, this was the first trip we just wanted to R&R. The JW did not disappoint. Even if you want to do the Disney thing - stay at the JW. You and your kids will want to stay at the JW every day. Grounds, pool, sevice, food, exercise facilities - exceptional. No disspointments at all. Too much to write that we liked - so just trust us when we say you cannot say you've been to Orlando until you've stayed at this resort. Add this too your list of "to do's" then leave your stress and worries at the door.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great Time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excelent room, outstanding pool, great for kids!

Reviews.Title: “Great Relief In time of Stress”
Reviews.Author: work2travel70
Reviews.Content: From start to finish the choice of this hotel was perfect. Just two days away washed away all problems and worries back at home-we were escaping a hurricane. Enjoyed the hotel immensely. Certainly the deal and just as nice as the Ritz next door. It was fun to have use of both hotels facilities. Brunch at the Ritz-Amazing, use if their pool-Serene and the spa - worth every penny. The pool at the Marriot has to be one of our families favorite. This set up is quite unusual using both hotels facilities, but splendid in function and design. A lot of our "perfect" weekend was due to the bellman Jeff who upon entry in our room said he thought he could pull a few strings to get us a better view and boy did he... At night we were able to see fireworks of all the Central Florida Parks... He supplied the kids tokens for the arcade through the weekend and endeared himself to our family. The lobby bar had great Asian Pear Martini's, however the sushi was just o.k. Bathrooms beautiful and staff helpful and friendly. Just a note of interest.... Upon check in I asked the young lady if we had any options for rooms and she said, "No, that we are fully booked". This was not true, there was hardly anyone in the hotel and although it annoyed me, did not ruin the excellent rating this hotel deserves.

Reviews.Title: “Best JW Marriott in Florida, period!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in mylifetime, but the JW Marriott in Orlando is one of the best hotels I have stayed in Florida. Cost and quality come to mind, and the selection of mini stores is wonderful like the Starbucks area. I went to both Primo and Citron which were great restaurants and you need to try the buffet at Citron. The pools are great since there are three of them: the lazy river at JW, the spa pool, and the Ritz Pool. These are within 2-3 minutes from each other and not 10 minutes like said by others. All of them are beautiful and the ones I like are the spa (privacy) and lazy river (JW) for ultimate fun at a pool. What I like is the mega-luxury look of the JW Marriott. You have to see it to believe it. I decided to just give up a few pictures to just let you see for yourself. As for the room, they are some of the best in town. If you need space, go get yourself a 3-bedroom villa! Nicely decorated. Gold course and the restaurant at the Golf course is excellent. The Golf restaurant is across the lake from the Marriott and you can overlook the Marriott and Ritz from there. If they keep their prices under $200 (USD), the JW Marriott wins hands down as one of the top five hotels in Orlando, Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: Hugues
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great and very personal service. Attention to detail, Couldn't fault anything. Nice quiet rooms - even the a/c is quiet: a rarety I have found in the US - very comfortable beds. nice bathroom ... I could go on Great pool and grounds, I stayed there for 10 days with my 11 year old son and we both loved it. Nice to be able to walk around in the evening in peace in quiet, as opposed to other Orlando locations. I have stayed in a lot of hotels, I'd have to say this is the best I've stayed at. Read other similar reviews before I booked and I have to say they were spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: nld115
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orlando Grand Lakes Marriott for 4 nights in May-June. I was there for a convention and the hotel was rather expensive, but well worth it. The pool and lazy river are beautiful. This place was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 4-5 star hotels in the Uk where the staff look down thier noses at you but on arrival the hotels manager greeted my family and welcomed us to the resort. We were treated really special. The room was standard hotel shape with two queen size beds which were very comfortable with the usual amenities. The service and the choice of food at the restraunts was exellent.You would expect to pay in uk sterling £20-25 for family of 4 breakfast and £40-50 for a family of 4 for dinner at current exchange rates.(The americans think the cost is a little high) The pools offer privacy and are exellent as are the gardens and grounds at the resort. We liked it so much,that we have booked up again.We will be going to florida in may 2006 and staying at the JW as we liked it so much

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resport”
Reviews.Author: jms613
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at the JW before going on a week cruise.... I wanted to stay there longer. Sensational in every respect. Great service with concirges who are looking out for your best inerest. Fantastic pool with good grill. Unreal golf course where you can use driving range for reasonable fee and even borrow some nice clubs. I would definitely go back even if I'm not going to go to Disney or on a cruise. Go just for the pool and golf. Also be sure to check out Orlando Premium Outlets (great deals).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad. Good, Clean Chain Hotel on excellent grounds”
Reviews.Author: gnrd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business conference in January. This was a very nice, very large hotel - connected to the Ritz-Carlton by a long, long corridor where all the conference rooms are. It's probably the biggest hotel I've ever stayed in, I think over 1000 rooms. However, you didn't see tons of people around so they manage to hide everybody very well. The guestrooms were pretty typical for nice places in the US - nothing fantastic but very clean and well maintained. The bathrooms were excellent. There was a small Julienne balcony and the high speed internet access was very affordable - I think it was $5/day but you also got unlimited local & long distance in the 50 US states. The bar in the main lobby was very nice - quite a good social atmosphere and a small patio on the outside. Service was very good, everyone was very friendly. Food was all provided as part of the conference but was very good as was the decaf coffee. The best part of this hotel are the grounds. There is an excellent pool area with bar area which extends over to the Ritz Carlton - unfortunately, January was a bit cool for Florida so I didn't really get to enjoy it. Golf course is also part of the grounds and there was an excellent path around both hotels for running (about 2.5km all the way round). Overall, a very competent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is truely one of the BEST hotels in Florida! I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone. Just like the Ritz Carlton next door, this hotel has excellent service, tons of great amenities, absolutly beautifull grounds and public spaces, etc.. I cant find anything negative to say about this hotel. The Grande Lakes resorts property is truely one of the best amazing developments that has ever taken place in the hospitality industry. The JW Marriott really stands up to its name. Ever since these 2 amazing hotels were built the Grande Lakes resorts has had extremly high ratings and has been incredible success. The Ritz Carlton was even named "Best Orlando hotel on the web 2004" here on TripAdvisor. I strongly recommend both of the Grande Lakes resorts to anyone. Checkout the website at ------ for more info on the Orlando Grande Lakes resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: goldendeal
Reviews.Content: I had a recent week stay at the JW Marriott Orlando Grande Lakes hotel. Just when I just about to lost hope for good customer service at hotels, the JW Marriott comes through above and beyond with excellent customer service. Other hotels should hold JW Marriott Orlando up as an example of what a fine hotel can be. From the moment we walked in the door we were treated to first class customer service and acommadations.This hotel must stress the importance of customer service , the employees were very happy here and it shows with a first rate attitude. The rooms were very spacious, large marble type bathrooms. Robes in the closet to use while staying in the hotel. Mini bar, safe, flat screen TV, cd/clock radio. The hotel staff cleans your room in the afternoon and again for turn down service around 6 pm.The lazy river pools is wonderful and enjoyed by young and old. The inner tubes used to float down the lazy river is not free and is not rented which seemed a bit strange to me, you must buy them at 5.00 each and yours to keep. They let you use a marker to put your name on it if you want to leave it at the pool at night. The pool and the two Jacuzzis close at 11.pm I thought that was a bit early but oh well.... The hotel restaurants are ok,,, some better then others, the buffet breakfast although expensive at 22.00 a person is worth the splurge at least once, the pool restaurant has great food, for a quick snack by the pool. Had two burgers and two soft drinks in the hotel cafe, the bill was 50.00!! This resort is not cheap folks that are just the way it is, to stay here you must accept this. I did however find a very good restaurant named Kahana just 5 minutes from the hotel with very reasonable prices and a wonderful menu of tropical type food, they also have a very good band playing on the weekends. The hotel has self parking at 7.00 a day plus tax and a bit of a walk to the lobby. They do offer valet but it’s more expensive. The hotel is close to Universal and Disney if that’s your thing, about 20 minutes to either park. Im sure kids will love to stay here with the massive pool they have on the property, plus other game rooms that are set up around the hotel. They also have an exleceent kiddy pool, set up just for the little ones. This was by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in. I travel quite at bit on business and pleasure and staying at the JW Marriott Orlando Grande Lakes was nothing but pure pleasure. First class hotel, you won’t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for family”
Reviews.Author: FREEAL
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at JW Marriott in late April 2005 for a week. It was a great hotel. The front desk service was fantastic, we had our room upgraded to a suite for an extra $100/nt but well worth it with 2 kids. Room was clean, definitely get a pool view room, the other side of hotel overlooks a field and neighborhood. The pool was fantastic for kids. We were there after spring break, so it was practically empty. Great toddler playground/sandbox/kiddie pool and zero entry area. The cement is slippery though and I reccomed aqua socks if you have kids. Our three year old fell several times. Also you can use the RITZ pool area, which again is great for toddlers and kids. Food was decent, good breakfast buffet, service at restaurant was not as good at dinner. long waits, forgetting to bring water, giving us our check before asking if we wanted dessert, rookie mistakes. Overall, a great hotel, Alexander at front desk is exceptionally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Quality”
Reviews.Author: pug1309
Reviews.Content: Absolute quality, having returned to Scotland after staying for two glorious weeks at the JW Marriott, i cannot describe how good the service was. The staff were very friendly and nothing seemed to be a problem to them. The service from the concierges actually made our magical holiday some what even more special. My family and I will return to this hotel and would only be to happy to suggest to others to make a trip to this top class hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel resort!”
Reviews.Author: lunautique
Reviews.Content: We had such a great experience here last year, we returned again this year and stayed an extra day! This time I left time for us to lounge around the pool area and enjoy the poolside service. Truly a great place to stay. The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean and just a beautiful establishment, both inside and out. It is a piece of paradise. The landscaping is gorgeous and it is immaculately kept. Family oriented. Customer service is great. Definitely recommended. We will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room, backside of Lake”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Grand Lakes is a good Resort. I readed a review that put this resort down, and all I have to say is that everyone has there own opinion. I visited there back in June of last year and I didn't see roaches all over the place and if there was, well this is florida home of bugs. This web page says it doesn't post threaths or personal insults. I think it did just the opposited. Thanks and use your best judgement.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Marriott Ever”
Reviews.Author: chem_dr
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, great amenities, fabulous restaurants, prompt service! This property is excellently maintained and the grounds are well-manicured. All of the hotel staff were friendly and eager to please. Walking into the lobby was an experience in itself. My room was beautifully appointed and the bathroom boasted a seperate shower and tub. The housekeeping service kept the room ultra-clean. The evening turn down serivce was welcoming after a long day of attending meetings. The conference facility was outstanding with many AV equipped rooms to choose from. The pool was an oasis surrounding by palm trees and tranquil ponds. It is pricey, but well-worth the money. Truly a classy hotel!

Reviews.Title: “WOW FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW in March with my girlfriend for a romantic weekend, hotel was great, great service just wonderful. We will be going back!!!!! Staff was very helpful. Would recommend to anyone who wants an alterantive to the disney properties.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grande Lakes Resort especially the JW Marriott!!”
Reviews.Author: kimbug
Reviews.Content: We just returned from visiting Orlando! Our stay at the JW Marriott was fantastic! We were right in the middle of Spring Break so it was very crowded but the staff at the Marriott handled everything quite well. We usually vacation at the beach but wanted to check out some of the Disney parks. Thank goodness for the beautiful Grande Lakes area as it redeemed our negative opinions of Orlando with the exception of Disney resort/park area. In fact, the resort was so pretty it made leaving for the parks difficult. The lazy river pool is so much fun. The only negative to the pool area is that it is a bit crowded and saving chairs early is necessary especially during the time we were there. The breakfast buffet at Citron is really good; we included it in our rate when we booked. Be advised, it isn't inexpensive. We thought it was well worth the cost. Also, our best meal while visiting Orlando was at Primo. The halibut with crab risotto was out of this world. Everything was so fresh; check out the chef's garden on the grounds outside of the restaurant. The rooms are a little on the small side but not uncomfortable. Request a room with a view of the pool area as you also get a great view of the golf course; it's not as quiet but the view is worth it. Also, if you stay here during a busy time, I recommend the valet parking. You pay for parking either way and the self parking lot was crowded and kind of a long walk every night when we returned from dinner or parks. The price for parking is a little outrageous but not unusual at these types of resorts. Overall, we had an enjoyable stay and would return to this hotel if we visit Orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing -- Loved the art & Lazy river”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the JW and ironically right in the midst of Spring break. Just as nice, if not better than the Ritz Carlton, without the nickle and diming. I sometimes find the Ritz to be too much in your face. I really don't need someone saying "good morning" to me seventy times a day with their hand held out looking for tips. The JW was a beautiful hotel, but had an element of being "laid back" and the staff was wonderful. The kids especially loved the lazy river. I sometimes forgot I was in Orlando, surrounded by the beautiful tropical gardens. Oh, and would highly recommend SeaWorld. It was a very tasteful amusement park. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “excellent breakfast/great pool area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Help I need somebody, no not just anybody-song sung by the beatles. Hello, we just returned from orlando today-4//2/05. It was a british invasion for sure. The exchange rate must be pretty awesome. The J W Marriot was pretty awesome and that is for sure! Just to get it over with the only negative was that the deluxe lakefront room was a tad small for the 400 dollar per night pricetag. Otherwise, the hotel is just fabulous. We had the AAA Sea World package which included 4 tickets to the park and breakfast in Citron. The grande buffet was the most lavish we have ever eaten. Everything from smoked salmon to stickey buns. The choice of fresh and exotic fruit just incredible. The lazy river pool area was just fabulous. The staff throughout the hotel are professional and friendly. I could go on and on but if you are used to 4 or 5 star hotels you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Orlando Lakes”
Reviews.Author: sjberry
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful getaway. I went for R&R and the Ritz Carlton spa that is on the same property in early Feb, 2005. I was there six days. The service and rooms were excellent. The property was very clean and full of opportunities for almost any indoor (gym, spa) or outdoor (golf, boating, biking, swimming, walking) activity you could want. The resort campus was beautifully landscaped and immaculate (I went barefoot). Of course, my favorite was the spa. Great services and staff, I had a different service everyday. I loved every service. My one disappointment was their lack of experience on African American hair, but I found a salon close by. If you want to get away and feel pampered, it's a great place. The food was okay overall, but no real complaints. It's close to all the best shopping in the area. I plan to make it a yearly thing.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott at Grande Lakes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great place to go with or with out the kids. They have great pools and great staff working to keep you happy. The activities for the kids were fun and kept there attention. Right next door you have all the amenities of the Ritz Carlton. Bleu has these great appetizers wings and tasty Kahlua Colada's.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...”
Reviews.Author: SoCalQT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in February for a company meeting. Ate lunch with a colleague at Citron, An American Brasserie. Staff was a little over-eager and in our face constantly. Soup & salad totaled $50 - ridiculous for lunch!! Room was nice but could never get it cool enough. Closet had a vent that pumped in really cool air and lots of stale cigarette odors. From the time I arrived until after I left housekeeping never picked up the Coke can and drinking glass that was left on the balcony by the previous guest. Used towels were left in the bathroom and newspapers were left on the floor. Anything left on the bed when housekeeping arrived (i.e. robe, papers, pj's) was either worked around (read: not touched) or thrown on my roommates suitcase or chair near the desk. Wireless is pricey at $9.95 per 24-hr period but does include unlimited local and long-distance. Found out today that another co-worker returned home to find that 3 necklaces had disappeared between 9 a.m. and noon on our last day while we were at the Ritz for breakfast. Given a choice I would stay at the Ritz in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: cmoye
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 28th wedding anniversary at the JW Marriott, and the hotel and the surrounding property is beautiful. Was most impressed by the employees. Everyone seemed eager to please and always spoke and smiled. They seem to really enjoy their jobs. Our rooms was beautiful with views of both the golf course and the lazy river area, along with a balcony. The weather cooperated somewhat and we were able to enjoy the lazy river. They seemed to have alot of activities for kids. I would definetly recommend for a special get away. We enjoyed a special anniversary dinner in Primo and was most impressed with the meal and the service. The location is not ideal if you are planning on enjoying the various theme parks. There are alot of hotels and resorts much closer. Sea World is the closest theme park. There was a big convention at the hotel, so the last night of our stay it was impossible to enjoy the lobby bar area. They big group had taken over!!! We will probably visit again in the summer time when you can really enjoy the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved JW Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: jinx075
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and excellent service. The pool was wonderful and very warm. We had a family package and the kids had free game tokens, free ice cream, free pool toys and free drinks. We really enjoyed our stay and the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: GooChick
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is certainly a luxury resort-type hotel. It is beautiful, equipped with an open, elegant atmosphere. The marbled floors and pillars, the fountains, candles and bouquets of fresh flowers certainly make this hotel stand out from all the rest. Two factors which stand out most significantly for me are the lazy river pool area and the breakfast buffet at the Citron restaurant. The lazy river is a spectacular change from the routine hotel pool. Not only is it fully heated, it is lavishly landscaped and truly beautiful. My only disappointments were that it was rather difficult as a parent to keep an eye on or follow your child through the maze of water and that only once was someone available to give me a towel from the "hut" located in the pool area. Every other time either no one was working or there were no towels available. As for the breakfast buffet...it is something to behold! Everything imaginable is available from fresh fruit to quiche to oatmeal and everything in between. There are also two chefs on staff who cook up made-to-order omelettes and Belgian waffles. Happily this buffet was included with my room since the bill for two adults and two children came to $99.00! As for the room, it was classically decorated. The beds were comfortable with down bedding and many down pillows, however, for the price, I expected the room to be larger. The marble floored bathroom included a glass shower with separate tub, but it was probably half the size of the entire room. We did request a refrigerator and a small dorm-size one was brought in but the only area it could be placed was at the end of one of the beds, which made it stick out quite a bit and very awkward to get around. As for the staff, I found them to be top-notch--friendly and hardworking. All in all, I'm glad we experienced the JW Marriott, but do not feel the $250/night + parking is worth a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed five times in 2004 and twice in 2005 already! My work regularly takes me around the world staying in many hotels good and bad. This is without doubt the best. The staff are friendly and the service is superb. All of this is delivered in a discreet way that in my view makes it better that the Ritz next door. The rooms are bright and clean, the spa is fantastic and the lazy river is just bone idle.

Reviews.Title: “One word: Perfect”
Reviews.Author: IranianInUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this magnificent hotel just before Christmas and all I can say is wow, what a resort. Everything was perfect. The hotel and rooms where immaculate, the lobby beautiful (better than the ritz if you ask me), the gardens enchanting and the pool area was the best hotel pool I'd ever been (lazy river was so cool, lol). The location was great, not being too far from all the attractions and theme parks, but detached enough to feel like you're in your own private resort away from Orlando. The grounds the whole resort is set in was beautiful and you could easily get lost and just simply be mesmerized by the gardens Spanish architecture and sheer beauty and grandeur of the hotel. There are times when you really feel like you are in a Spanish castle set in paradise ( I recommend on teh first day of your rip to just wander around and get lost in the resort to just explore whats what and where everything is). The spa is world class and has an excellent hi-tech gym. There were several restaurant we visited. We went to Quench which has superbly large portions of food (great caeser salad), Primo which has divine food in very classic surroundings, and Citron which has fabulous breakfast buffets and THE best lunch buffets in the world (didn't have time to go to the dinner) , with incredibly affordable prices (being a Londoner where everything cost at least triple, it was an excellent bonus). The rooms were tastefuly furnished which good entertainment systems. The beds were very comfortable and the turndown service was lovely. The best part of the room was the bathroom. Its very spacious with bath and separate shower and the soap they supply is best smelling soap ever! However, the best thing about the hotel was the amazing service they provided us. Service was very rapid in all circumstances. Every member of staff would greet us without fail which was very nice. There were a few people who really helped us out, and one lady was Sherry, she was very sweet. Also at the concierge there was a lady whos' name I have forgotten, but worked on the left most desk. Not only was she genuinely funny, but she also gave definitive, unparalled advice on what to do and where to go and answered all our questions as best as possible, so if you got any questions go to her! I really do struggle to pick a fault with the hotel, the only problem I encountered was that the beauty of the hotel and its abundance of attractions and facilities distracted me from actually visiting alot of Orlando's attractions lol. There is so much to do here that you could spend your whole vacation without leaving your resort and still having the vacation of a lifetime. All in all a truly fabulous hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: JW Marriott Orlando Grande Lakes
HotelInfo.Address: 4040 Central Florida Parkway, Orlando, FL 32837
